raw: {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Winter Warmer', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Great Lakes Christmas Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1072293611, 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '1576', 'beer/brewerId': '73', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 19, 'min': 20, 'sec': 11, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 358, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Clear, burnished copper-brown topped by a large beige head that displays impressive persistance and leaves a small to moderate amount of lace in sheets when it eventually departs. \t\tThe nose is sweet and spicy and the flavor is malty sweet, accented nicely by honey and by abundant caramel/toffee notes. There's some spiciness (especially cinnamon), but it's not overdone. \t\tThe finish contains a moderate amount of bitterness and a trace of alcohol. The mouthfeel is exemplary; full and rich, very creamy. Mouthfilling with some mouthcoating as well. Drinkability is high.\t\tGreat Lakes Christmas Ale is my first beer from the best brewery in my home state of Ohio and my former residence (3 years) of Cleveland. I'm very impressed. I expected a good, solid Christmas beer and those expectations were met and exceeded by a long shot. I only got a single this year, but you can bet that I'll be getting more of this fine seasonal during my future trips home for the holidays. I would have no trouble at all drinking Christmas Ale year-round.", 'user/profileName': 'BuckeyeNation', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Baltika #8 Wheat', 'review/timeUnix': 1307648874, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '4700', 'beer/brewerId': '401', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 19, 'min': 47, 'sec': 54, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 160, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Picked this up in Totowa since I never tried it before and this is prime season for this type of beer. While it wasn\'t anything bad, this may have been the most "plain jane" Hefe that I\'ve ever had one of most plain beers overall. It\'s by no means a drain pour like the mass-market macros would be for me but there wasn\'t anything memorable about this either. \t\tStandard pour to this with an off-gold hue and lots of cloudiness to it. The head reminded me of soda based on the sound and how long it lasted - lots of fizzle with little substance. There wasn\'t any lacing to be seen and for the most part, that was the taste too. Lots of starch like potato chips or crackers with just a hint of clove, bubble gum, and banana here. Nowhere near as pronounced as its German counterparts and the aftertaste could hardly be detected either. Just a bit of carbonation here too but nothing that detracted from the beer itself. \t\tSure, it\'s a bigger bottle but this was easy to down and if I had another, I might have opened that too afterwards. I came in with no expectations and left feeling the same way - not quite "blah" and not impressed either. I wouldn\'t mind giving other beers from these guys a go, if for no other reason to see if this brewery is middle of the road on all of their offerings. This is only worth a try if nothing else in this style is readily available.', 'user/profileName': 'JerzDevl2000', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': "Walker's Reserve - Porter", 'review/timeUnix': 1231556083, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.8, 'beer/beerId': '6371', 'beer/brewerId': '2210', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 2, 'min': 54, 'sec': 43, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 10, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Very dark beer. Pours a nice finger and a half of creamy foam and stays throughout the beer.\t\tSmells of coffee and roasted malt.\t\tHas a major coffee-like taste with hints of chocolate. If you like black coffee, you will love this Porter.\t\tCreamy smooth mouthfeel and definitely gets smoother on the palate once it warms.\t\tIt's an ok Porter but I feel there are much better one's out there.", 'user/profileName': 'kaseydad', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Sea Monster Imperial Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1320909747, 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '46188', 'beer/brewerId': '199', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 7, 'min': 22, 'sec': 27, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 314, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured into a snifter. Produces a small coffee head that reduces quickly. Black as night. Pretty typical imp. stout. Roasted malts hit on the nose. A little sweet chocolate follows. Big roasty character on the taste. In between I'm getting plenty of dark chocolate and some bitter espresso. It finishes with hop bitterness. Nice smooth mouthfeel with perfect carbonation for the style. Overall a nice stout I would love to have again, maybe with some age on it.", 'user/profileName': 'mikehblack', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Big Eye IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1189496202, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '709', 'beer/brewerId': '199', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 7, 'min': 36, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 254, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "A very underrated IPA. \t\tPours a coppery/burnt orange color with a big head that lasts quite some time. Taste is hoppy, with loads of pine-y bitterness, but also citrus flavors including grapefruit and ... orange? Is that a hint of tropical flavor? Maybe some pineapple. You see some nice malt/hop balance in quite a few of the better DIPAs, but this is one of the few IPAS that's both quite hoppy and well balanced. \t\tSuperb mouthfeel and drinkability.\t\tBallast Point continues to rise in my estimation with every offering I consume.", 'user/profileName': 'Overlord', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Northern Hemisphere Harvest Wet Hop Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1319760344, 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '6549', 'beer/brewerId': '140', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 0, 'min': 5, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 301, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "Poured from a 24oz bottle into a large sniffter \t\tAppearance : this pours a deep bronze amber in color. This beer has some of the best head formation and retention that I have ever seen along with lots and lots of sticky lacing \t\tSmell : tons of piney resinous evergreen aroms abound in this ale. Cant get enough of this beer its the best smelling harvest ale I've ever had the pleasure of enjoying\t\tTaste : huge flavor profile with lots of bitterness and only a little malt sweetness. As this beer warms up the bitterness really dominates the flavor. I'm tasting lot of subtle orange aromas\t\tMouthfeel : full body beer with alot of carbonation\t\tOverall : I love this beer in my opinion its Serria Nevada's best beer overall. The price is unbeatable I bought my bombed for $3.99 . So much flavor and biting bitterness this harvest ale has no equal .", 'user/profileName': 'BUNZILLA', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Saxo', 'review/timeUnix': 1150056747, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '2585', 'beer/brewerId': '753', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 20, 'min': 12, 'sec': 27, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 162, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Poured from a 12oz bottle into a Delirium Tremens glass. This is so hard to find in Columbus for some reason, but I was able to get it in Toledo...\t\tMurky yellow appearance with a very thin white head. The aroma is bready and a little sour.\t\tThe flavor is really complex, with at least the following tastes: wheat, spicy hops, bread, bananas, and a toasty after-taste. It was really outstanding.\t\tI'd recommend this to anyone, go out and try it. I think it's the best so far from this brewery.", 'user/profileName': 'TurdFurgison', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Nelson Sauvin Single Hop IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1254760576, 'beer/ABV': 6.9, 'beer/beerId': '48458', 'beer/brewerId': '13307', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 16, 'min': 36, 'sec': 16, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 278, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Thanks to tenderbranson69 for sharing this bottle, poured chilled into a willybecker. \t\tA - A very hazy dark amber w/ 2.5 fingers of rocky light tan head, thick lace collects on the glass like webbing\t\tS - A strong sweet fruit like candied citrus and honeyed pineapple w/ a hint of mango and papaya w/ a subtle green tea tinge like herbs w/ a gentle grape/lemony acidic nose\t\tM - The feel is delightful and not at all what you would expect considering the fruit filled aroma - not overly sweet. The texture is aided by tingling carbonation and mild juicy fruity notes w/ light sweet and nutty/woody earthy tinges and mild acidity w/ a semi-sweet finish. The astringent aspect is mild w/ alcohol only noted in very slight ways\t\tT - A lot of tropical fruit and white grapeskin flavor like gooseberry w/ a mild pineapple and sweet pine w/ herbs, tea and lychee w/ a hint of mango. The flavor is accented by sweet but not syrupy malt that accompanies a mild pear and pine taste w/ very very light minty clean elements. the taste of citrus is there but enveloped by papaya and passionfruit w/ an alcohol flavor and resinous slightly bitter finish. The finish is semi-dry w/ a refreshing flavor -more than any other single hop ale I have had.\t\tD - I found the taste of this to be like fruit in peculiar fresh hoppy aspects w/ great drinkability and bitter/sweet blend which is intensely packed with Nelson Sauvin hop goodness - juicy and delicious.', 'user/profileName': 'Slatetank', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English India Pale Ale (IPA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': "Samuel Smith's India Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1210377635, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 3, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '573', 'user/birthdayUnix': 397206000, 'beer/brewerId': '113', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 0, 'min': 0, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 131, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1021129447, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a nice golden color with very little head and almost no lacing.\tSmells of caramel malt and a very floral hop nose\tTastes like it smells fairly bitter but well balanced\tM: good carbonation and helps the bitterness take shape.\tD: very good IPA, not the best by far, but a solid example, I keep expecting and recieving great beers from Samuel SMith', 'user/profileName': 'naterock', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Flanders Red Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Kriek', 'review/timeUnix': 1225996855, 'beer/beerId': '42015', 'beer/brewerId': '2642', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 18, 'min': 40, 'sec': 55, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 311, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Well, it's not really a Kriek, and not really a Flander's Red either-- somewhere in between. The beer base is a stanard sour Belgian beer with tart berry notes, hints of vineous and woodiness and a hint of funk. The body lacks the firm malt base for a Flanders, but not candy-sweet enough for a Kriek but does show subtle character of both. A mild malt base struggles to support the sourness and cherry flavors but does keep the beer from complete astringency and thinness. Hops are light, but do show some American citrus notes which I find quite pleasant. Somewhat lemony and berry-like to go along with the added fruits. Still a fine beer that I enjoyed quite well, but it doesn't represent styles well-- let's just call it a Belgian sour beer with cherries added.", 'user/profileName': 'BEERchitect', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'English Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 2.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Boddingtons Pub Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1147213937, 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '1798', 'beer/brewerId': '655', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 22, 'min': 32, 'sec': 17, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 129, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 2.0, 'review/text': "I really did not like this. It just seemed extremely watery. I dont' think this had any carbonation whatsoever. Maybe it was flat, who knows? But even if I got a bad brew I don't see how this would possibly be something I'd get time and time again. I could taste the hops towards the middle, but the beer got pretty nasty towards the bottom. I would never drink this again, unless it was free. I'm kind of upset I bought this.", 'user/profileName': 'Sosh', 'review/aroma': 2.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'German Pilsener', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Pilsner', 'review/timeUnix': 1187377712, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '7386', 'beer/brewerId': '1762', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 19, 'min': 8, 'sec': 32, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 229, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Poured chilled (50 degree F) into a pint glass, it pours the color of honey with a cloudy, honey-like body. About 1 finger thick of eggshell colored head sits atop the body but then dissipates to a surface layer with just a bit of lacing around the edge of the glass.\t\tAroma is quite mild. Some slight malt hits the nose, but by hitting I mean hitting like "a girl". \t\tFlavor is quite sweet malt with a nice hoppiness coming through on the finish to help balance it. HOwever, this is mostly watery and not very flavorful. \t\tBody is a little chewy for a pilsner, but thirst quenching and quite easy to drink. i wouldn\'t drink this if I wanted to drink something with boisterous taste, but I\'d drink it for hours on a hot summer day.', 'user/profileName': 'Fish113d', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Oat (Imperial Oatmeal Stout)', 'review/timeUnix': 1261610738, 'beer/ABV': 11.0, 'beer/beerId': '21100', 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 23, 'min': 25, 'sec': 38, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 357, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Appearance: Why is it characterized as "jet" black? Like, this stuff is black, but how does that equate to a jet. Maybe. "pitch"???!\t\tSmell: Very roasty and a little bit of earthy hops. Coffee, and Chocolate.\t\tTaste: Coffee, Chocolate, and a slightly estery yeast flavour.\t\tMouthfeel: Smooth is such a generic term. This beer is small-bubbled and delicious. There\'s definitely a lot of hops that were thrown in the boil.\t\tDrinkability: Much like their Java, the alcohol is there in intoxication, but almost absent in taste and aroma. This makes it excessively easy to drink. The bitterness makes it a little charcoal-y but holy crap, what an incredible beer.\t\tOverall: I\'m happy with this beer, but way too expensive. Over $10 per bottle, I\'d probably rather have a Brooklyn Black Chocolate Stout. They\'re extremely similar, but this stuff is really nice.', 'user/profileName': 'Hornet2003', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Big Sky IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1192431330, 'beer/ABV': 6.2, 'beer/beerId': '5554', 'beer/brewerId': '751', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 6, 'min': 55, 'sec': 30, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 288, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Clear copper colored brew, medium cream colored head. {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Otter Creek Stovepipe Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1218418618, 'beer/ABV': 4.4, 'beer/beerId': '431', 'beer/brewerId': '119', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 1, 'min': 36, 'sec': 58, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 224, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Pours a dark brown, almost black color. It starts sweets, but ends with the dry espresso taste.\tMouthfeel is thick and chewy like a stout should be, but I prefer a smoother feel.\tDrinkability is nice. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Delirium No\xc3\xabl', 'review/timeUnix': 1229496634, 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '2347', 'beer/brewerId': '180', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 6, 'min': 50, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 352, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Bottle at kerstbier tasting at the Shack.\t\tA - Pours orange-bronze, with a 2 fingered head that dissipates slow. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Vienna Lager', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Squatters Vienna Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1101084897, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 4.0, 'beer/beerId': '3795', 'beer/brewerId': '136', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 0, 'min': 54, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 327, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "This one came off the tap a golden color with hints of amber in there as well with a good coat of head over top. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Hop Henge Experimental IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1239751318, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '47434', 'beer/brewerId': '63', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 23, 'min': 21, 'sec': 58, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 104, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A: a nice ruby color with a 2 finger off white head. with lacing \t\tS: a wonderful, citrusy hop smell along with caramel malt and some piney-ness. \t\tT: it has a nice maltiness, but is still bitter. you can definitely taste the hops. it is bitter and piney, and has some citrus in the middle. there is a nice bitterness in the end. it is sticky and coats the mouth. \t\tM: it has a nice medium mouth feel. and it coats the mouth a little. \t\tD: it is a good DIPA, and I could see myself drinking this again. A great addition to Texas' selection. \t\ton a side note: I dominated a windsor knot while drinking this, so if you cant tie a tie, drink this and you will be able to.", 'user/profileName': 'ottovon', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Czech Pilsener', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Pilsner Urquell', 'review/timeUnix': 1129586999, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Apr 17, 1980', 'beer/ABV': 4.4, 'beer/beerId': '429', 'user/birthdayUnix': 324806400, 'beer/brewerId': '1', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 22, 'min': 9, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 290, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1093529048, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Served on tap in a pint glass, this is an absolutely clear golden straw color with big fomay white head with decent retention and tons of carbonation bubbles. Nose is pretty faint, some grassy hops, a little malt, nothing else. Taste is a sharp spicey hop over a light grainy malt--very melded together, not much going on, but satisfying. As the beer warmed some slight lemony flavors crept in. Bodies on the thin side, but it has a nice carbonation and a great crisp finish. Overall this is a solid pils, nothing to write home about, but definitely a good offering that you can find at a decent number of bars.', 'user/profileName': 'cubedbee', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Munich Dunkel Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Negra Modelo', 'review/timeUnix': 1286747280, 'beer/ABV': 5.4, 'beer/beerId': '667', 'beer/brewerId': '75', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 21, 'min': 48, 'sec': 0, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 283, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'A very solid brew. I did like this one. \tPours a light brown color, minimal head, good lacing.\tSmells like must and roasted grain. \tTastes like roasted grain with some malty goodness. \tMedium mouthfeel that makes you want more.\tDrinkability is very decent, could have a few.', 'user/profileName': 'TheKingofWichita', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Lambic - Unblended', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Cantillon Bruocsella (1900) Grand Cru', 'review/timeUnix': 1156652273, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '2559', 'beer/brewerId': '388', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 4, 'min': 17, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 239, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "I was handed a glass of this unusual beer at a small party this evening and I was told it was something special from Belgium. I put my nose to it right away to ascertain it values after being told it was a lambic. I thought the fragrances of tart apples and fruit were going to knock me out or at least scare me away from enjoying it.\t\tThe first taste was a very spicy and tart flavor that made me question, like many other Belgian beers I had tasted recently, was this made from apples and hard cider. I put the glass down to taste the home brewed version of Poor Richard's I had made with great success. It's smooth sweet flavor contrasted well with the lambic which I thought may have needed more time to settle.\t\tI remarked that while this could be found at Whole Foods, I didn't think it would be served in Shea stadium anytime soon as one needed a lot of time to go over it to find its reason of being.", 'user/profileName': 'bonbright7', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Snake Dog IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1091766903, 'beer/ABV': 7.1, 'beer/beerId': '205', 'beer/brewerId': '68', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 4, 'min': 35, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 219, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'This was light copper in color and had a huge golden foam. It lasted quite awhile. The foam left HUGE...big hunks of lacing all down the glass. It was quite clear..no yeast in bottle. The aroma was rich with malt...and hoppy. The taste was fairly hoppy, but not overbearing. There was a lot of maltiness to balance it. The carbonation was good and it was fairly thin bodied. It was pretty damned drinkable...yummy I might say.', 'user/profileName': 'ClassyLadyJen', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': "Bell's Java Stout", 'review/timeUnix': 1174629902, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 22, 1984', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '2010', 'user/birthdayUnix': 459327600, 'beer/brewerId': '287', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 6, 'min': 5, 'sec': 2, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 82, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 959007847, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Very dark and opaque with a nice light tan head, incredibly foamy and beautiful to look at. Lacing is present, but not very consistent.\t\tSmell is exquisite, extreme coffee grounds, espresso and roasted malts. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Lambic - Fruit', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Wittekerke Framboise', 'review/timeUnix': 1322413345, 'beer/ABV': 4.3, 'beer/beerId': '70791', 'beer/brewerId': '718', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 17, 'min': 2, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 331, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': '11.2 oz bottle split and poured into a New Belgium globe.\t4.3% ABV, 4C - 6C, 40199 on label.\t\tA - Faintly cloudy pink in color with a dense white head. Frilly lace drapes across the glass delicately.\t\tS - Fresh bushels of raspberries just rinsed gives the aroma an inviting nose. Soft wheat and lemonade pull through and "fake-up" the aroma. It almost begins smelling like a Berry Weiss-Sunset Wheat combo. Initially good though...\t\tT - Fruity raspberry is far too syrupy with a lingering corn syrup finish. Light wheat in the background balanced just a bit but it\'s overly fake in it\'s flavor profile. It almost seems as if lemonade is blended in.\t\tM - Sugary sweet and slight with a highly carbonated finish and light body.\t\tO - Overly sweet and fake, it\'s got a good aroma initially but definitely lacking elsewhere. Too syrupy but not awful.', 'user/profileName': 'BeerFMAndy', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'English Bitter', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'English Summer Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1151987856, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '31508', 'beer/brewerId': '3965', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 4, 'min': 37, 'sec': 36, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 185, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Another new one (as of this date) from Anacapa. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Barleywine', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Backburner (Imperial Barley Wine Style Ale)', 'review/timeUnix': 1323917632, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'May 30, 1988', 'beer/ABV': 9.6, 'beer/beerId': '36185', 'user/birthdayUnix': 580978800, 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 2, 'min': 53, 'sec': 52, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 349, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 837356647, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Appearance - Darkish deep amber orange color that is very cloudy. Pours about an inch of off white head when poured violently. Head quickly dissipates into a thin film that leaves hardly any lacing. Not too unexpected with the style and gravity.\t\tSmell - Dark fruits with lots of cherry and plum to start. Alcohol is definitely evident, but so are a moderate amount of sweeter hops. Maybe a bit of caramel/vanilla scent, something sweet.\t\tTaste - There is a big sweetness off the bat with this barleywine, that doesn't really fade too much. Alcohol flavor lasts throughout also, with the same characteristics of the smell here as well. Cherry, plum, and raisin dominate the palate. Kind of one dimensional in terms of flavors. \t\tMouthfeel - Moderate to high carbonation, with a pretty viscous and thick coat left on the tongue. \t\tOverall - I feel like this is a slightly better than average beer. I don't have too much to compare it to stylewise, but I will say that you know how much alcohol you're taking in while drinking this. Southern Tier does not normally disappoint, and they didn't necessarily here either, but they also didn't really excite me either.", 'user/profileName': 'ccarney2', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Black Magick', 'review/timeUnix': 1272424848, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 15.0, 'beer/beerId': '31547', 'beer/brewerId': '13371', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 3, 'min': 20, 'sec': 48, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 118, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '12oz bottle split with onix1agr.\t\tA- Pours black with mahogany edges. Nice small cap of coffee colored dense and creamy head that settles to a faint ring and some small islands of fizz.\t\tS- Goobs of bourbon and dark roasted almost burnt malts. Port and molasses, booze soaked blackberries, brown sugar. \t\tT- Well the bourbon takes the lead and never gives it up, this is not to say that its all booze. Lots of some of the roastiest malts this tongue has ever come across and a blackstrap molasses sweetness. Port soaked dark fruit and bruleed brown sugar on top. The wood plays a nice earthy role and adds some faint vanilla. \t\tM- Medium to light body and about he same in carb. I remember this being thicker and lively but this is a well aged bottle of a huge brew. I really like how the barrel imparts almost a wood grain texture to the mouthfeel. Long linger.\t\tD- Well its not an every day kind of beer, hell its not even a whole bottle kind of beer, but that being said this stuff is super complex and a true whiskey bomb. Not for the faint of heart but if you like em from the barrel this one is for you.', 'user/profileName': 'oglmcdgl', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

The one the thing on the taste that I noted was the strong hints of cherry. The finish is so dry but is very pleasant. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Smuttynose Summer Weizen', 'review/timeUnix': 1282345138, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '22357', 'beer/brewerId': '141', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 22, 'min': 58, 'sec': 58, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 232, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '12 oz bottle poured into Duvel tulip. Bottle reads "Ale brewed with chamomile flowers" - I don\'t think I\'ve ever had chamomile in anything but tea, so I\'m not sure what to expect Pour is a crisp gold color with some haze, 1 finger head quickly dissipates leaving no lacing. Aroma is subdued wheat with some banana and a few other fruits I can\'t place; there isn\'t much to the nose at all.\t\tThere isn\'t a lot going on with the first sip - more than anything else it comes across with a crisp finish. Maybe I don\'t know what to look for with the chamomile, but I can\'t taste it at all. Mouthfeel is much more interesting - it\'s medium-bodied and a bit creamy, but leaves a distinctly clean and refreshing feeling on my palette after each sip. Definitely a good choice for a hot summer afternoon outside.\t\tOverall there isn\'t a lot to this beer, but I think that\'s just fine. I\'d describe this as a lawnmower beer, but one that you wouldn\'t have any qualms about reaching into the cooler for again and again.', 'user/profileName': 'FunkyMacGroovin', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Inebriator Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1065327823, 'beer/ABV': 9.1, 'beer/beerId': '8922', 'beer/brewerId': '1071', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 4, 'min': 23, 'sec': 43, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 278, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Ah...time for dessert. Acquired this at the local Trader Joes for $4.99 a 4-pack. Poured black as tar with a medium brown head that lasted longer than I thought considering the style. The aroma was of chocolate, coffee, cherries and alcohol. The taste was bittersweet. Dark chocolate, roasted malt, a bit of molasses all balanced by a spicy hop aftertaste that lingered rather nicely. This beer got more complex as it warmed with a smokiness and hints of currant and licorice. Finishes dry with a definite alcohol warming. Quite the tasty morsel and exceptional for the price. Get thee down to your local TJ's and stock up!", 'user/profileName': 'rkhaze', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Baltic Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': "Perkuno's Hammer Imperial Porter", 'review/timeUnix': 1090860447, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '1144', 'beer/brewerId': '393', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 16, 'min': 47, 'sec': 27, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 208, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a deep dark black with a firm offwhite head about a half inch thick leaving a tiny lace. Aromas are of chocolate and roasted malts, along with some alcohol and a little dark fruit as well (maybe even some courants). For taste this beer starts off initially with its big strong malts showing off some bittersweet chocolate, and a nice roasty flavor with almost a little smoke intertwined in there. Following some of the dark fruits shine through with almost a bit of tart sourness, but those flavors are quickly overwhelmed by more dark malts and a little coffee. This beer finishes smooth with a nice bitter hop finish that lingers on the tongue. A nice full body to this beer with a like carbonation and full flavor makes this beer a classic.', 'user/profileName': 'bigbeerdrinka', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Kuhnhenn Solar Eclipse', 'review/timeUnix': 1252812959, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 18.0, 'beer/beerId': '40480', 'beer/brewerId': '2097', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 3, 'min': 35, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 256, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Another great beer from hoppymeal, poured into a snifter.\t\tThis one is really dark, pitch black with an aggressive pour producing a short-lived tan head that recedes very quickly to a small ring. There's not much lacing, but there are boozy legs lining the glass after each sip.\t\tAroma is definitely boozy with some heavily roasted dark chocolate malts and dark fruits. Caramelized sugar and licorise lend a bit of sweetness to things. There seems to be a smoked character to the aroma as well\t\tThe taste is sweet with lots of licorice and molasses before the burnt malts take over in the middle. The finish is dry and boozy with a lingering bitterness from the charred malts.\t\tThe mouthfeel is heavy and slick with very little carbonation.\t\tThis is definitely a sipper and a good beer, but it's definitely not in the top tier of impy stouts. The drinkability is always going to be limited with an 18% ABV but it's not completely overpowering on the palate.", 'user/profileName': 'gford217', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Weizenbock', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Plank Bavarian Heller Weizenbock', 'review/timeUnix': 1313123823, 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '36326', 'beer/brewerId': '5943', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 4, 'min': 37, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 224, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "When Wheat Beers and lighter Bock Beers meet, we're given a unique blend of malt depth, fruity esters, and elevated alcoholic strength.\t\tUpon the decant, the beer delivers a beautiful golden-amber color and a magnificent bright appearance. Creamy head character of stark white foam laces with a lot of decorative patterns on the glasss. Impressive appearance overall.\t\tMalty aromas of bread crust, elegant pilsner malt, light toffee, and a rich bready flavor of fresh baked breads along with caramelized grains carry a vibrant and fresh aroma. A contribution of herbal tea-like hops give a light floral note to the rich malt scents.\t\tDelicious and with a lot of finess when considering the malt profile. Though strong in alcoholic taste, the firm maltiness delivers a mild toffee taste along with a lot of melanoidin flavors of bread crust, savory caramelization, and succulent fresh bread flavors. With just enough herbal and floral hop flavor to decorate the peripheries of malt flavor and with the slightest offset from sweetness, the beer shies away from sweetness in favor of true malt flavor in finish. Sweetness is lightly amplified by the fruity/floral flavors of orange blossem, apple pie, and marmelade.\t\tCreamy and a bit oily from the focus of malt richness and wheat, the beer carries a consistent texture from early creaminess through late fullness until the strength of alchol breaks apart the beer and allows for an alcoholic semi-dry finish. A hint of oily feel comes out of the toffee-buttery note and may offer the slightest of distractions.\t\tThe rich and savory melanoidin notes of the beer definately set it appart from other beers of it's type that don't take as much care. But the oily malt character offers just a slight flaw in taste and texture.", 'user/profileName': 'BEERchitect', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 2.0, 'beer/style': 'German Pilsener', 'review/palate': 2.0, 'review/taste': 2.0, 'beer/name': 'Berghoff Classic Pilsner', 'review/timeUnix': 1205002269, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/beerId': '1396', 'beer/brewerId': '435', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 18, 'min': 51, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 68, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 2.0, 'review/text': 'A- Poured to a light yellow color, that had a white head that didnt last long. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Old Wylies IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1313955949, 'beer/beerId': '39798', 'beer/brewerId': '16110', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 19, 'min': 45, 'sec': 49, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 233, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Brought home a bottle of six pack of this when we went down to Pittsburgh to see the Sox. We can thank Ale Street News for the brewpubs locations in PA. Great place for a slight detour on my birthday on the way into Pittsburgh.\t\tAppearance: Hazy orange color with a decent amount of carbonation. Slight head that has remained in the pint glass.\t\tSmell: Slight piney hop profile and bigger caramel malts are the only thing that comes out to me. Also get some slight hints of grapefruit. The beer could use a better hop profile since the malts take over the majority of the aroma.\t\tTaste: piney, malty, and citrus/grapefruit notes on the palate. The ingredients fit the style fine, but could have a cleaner taste that is more noticeable. \t\tMouthfeel: Slightly smooth, a little chewy, and medium carbonation.\t\tOverall: Not a bad IPA and happy that I was able to try this at the brewpub, bring it to the hotel, and have beers make it all the way back up here to lovely Dorchester. If I am ever going to Pitt again, this brewpub and beer will be in the agenda. Only 20 minutes out of town too.', 'user/profileName': 'Flounder57', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Munich Dunkel Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Ayinger Altbairisch Dunkel', 'review/timeUnix': 1120873844, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '134', 'beer/brewerId': '39', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 1, 'min': 50, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 190, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Pours a dark amber color with decent head that does not recede much. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Smuttynose IPA "Finest Kind"', 'review/timeUnix': 1141443240, 'beer/ABV': 6.9, 'beer/beerId': '16403', 'beer/brewerId': '141', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 3, 'min': 34, 'sec': 0, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 63, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Another New England gem courtesy of bkett01. Thanks again, Brian. \t\tPours a hazy, unfiltered looking burnt gold. A little paler than most IPA's, I think.\t\tSmells like a hop field, there's no two ways about it. Fresh grassy green scent with an undercurrent of spiciness.\t\tHop taste starts with a citrusy bite, escalates further into spicy grass notes, and rounds out into brick-solid bitterness. Just when the ride looks over, some malt creeps in to provide a little balance.\t\tVery nice beer here, one I would love to have available on a regular basis. Now I want to try the rest of Smuttynose's line, to see how they compare.", 'user/profileName': 'germaniac', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'The Czar', 'review/timeUnix': 1284935243, 'beer/ABV': 11.03, 'beer/beerId': '7850', 'beer/brewerId': '30', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 22, 'min': 27, 'sec': 23, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 262, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a rich viscous black with a creamy tan head that patiently gives way to a thin, but sticky lacing.\t\tAroma consists of opulent roasted malts and milk chocolate, both of which become more pronounced as the beer warms. There may be some wood-like hop notes buried as well.\t\tTasty flavor of malt, chocolate, and wood with earthy hops and a touch of booziness as the beer warms. The wood aspects re-appear at the finish with more hop bitterness and a hint of the sweet chocolate.\t\tThis beer is thick and palate coating with medium carbonation and quite a kick to it between the alcohol, roasted malt, and wood hops.\t\tThis is one of the heavier beers I have had in a while, and even a bit so stylistically speaking, however the aromas and flavors are quite enjoyable making a a good beer.', 'user/profileName': 'CHADMC3', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Mocha Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1118702131, 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '353', 'beer/brewerId': '132', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 22, 'min': 35, 'sec': 31, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 164, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '650 ml bottle, UK import, trade with maeib. Flavour has strong coffee notes too, some tar and a slight smokiness. Roasty and hoppy bitterness in the long aftertaste. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Arcadia Batch #999', 'review/timeUnix': 1122953012, 'beer/beerId': '19913', 'beer/brewerId': '454', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 3, 'min': 23, 'sec': 32, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 214, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Now Quaffing: Arcadia Batch #999 "Hop Fueled"\t\tMy first offering from Arcadia. Pours a hazed sepia with a good amount of yeast sediment peppered throughout. Carbonation is mild and the doesn\'t stick around long. Lacing is sticky and has no problems remaining after each sip. Aromas are an oily pine with a slight sweet floral character. The taste brings forth a nice dose of the resiny pine hops and sweet grapefruit. Mouthfeel is fairly full and very slick with each sip--nice and smooth. Each sip finishes somewhat sweet and slightly dry with just a touch of bitterness lingering. I would believe you if you told me this was a hybrid of English and American IPA styles, as the hop profile seems to suggest influences from both. I wish I could get more of this one, because its a nice change over some of the sharper domestic IPAs and DIPAs.', 'user/profileName': 'TripelJ', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Witbier', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Alaskan White', 'review/timeUnix': 1304649404, 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '49070', 'beer/brewerId': '429', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 2, 'min': 36, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 126, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "This beer pours a cloudy pale orange color. The taste is a little fuller and more spicy than the aroma. There is coriander, cardamom, and orange. The mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation, and a chewy texture. Overall, this is a decent witbier that I would drink again. I just wish the aroma weren't so airy.", 'user/profileName': 'KarlHungus', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Euro Pale Lager', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': "Monteith's Summer Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1289644113, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '9274', 'beer/brewerId': '627', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 10, 'min': 28, 'sec': 33, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 317, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': 'A - Deep saturated orange Gold. Light carbonation visible.\t\tS - Strong ginger and spiced meet honey-like flavors. Orange peel spiciness and some mild maltiness. Little to no hop aroma.\t\tT - Ginger and orange flavours dominate an underlying maltiness and very very low hop bitterness. \t\tM - Light and fine carbonation, thin but quite smooth. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'English Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Old Engine Oil', 'review/timeUnix': 1205459767, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '875', 'beer/brewerId': '323', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 1, 'min': 56, 'sec': 7, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 74, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "12oz bottle into nonic.\t\tOpaque brown hue with the exception of some ruby edges at the bottom of the glass. The head is tan and thin (typical for the style), and slowly settles to a bubbly rim. Spotty and stringy lacing.\t\tRoasted malts toppped with some sweet chocolate and a little bit of raisin. The raisin is such a typical scent in this style, it's a good indicator. The overall smell is similar to a stout.\t\tThe flavor is very complex, ranging from the bitter malts as a base, along with some creamy chocolate and a very light hop bitterness. Some molasses is in there as well. Full bodied with a slightly high amount of carbonation, giving a bit of a fizz. The finish is the lingering bitter malts.\t\tThree words on the label sum this one up pretty well: viscous, chocolatey, roasty. I can add: delicious, complex, recommended.", 'user/profileName': 'BeerSox', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Hop Whore', 'review/timeUnix': 1262320835, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 10, 1984', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '32757', 'user/birthdayUnix': 460969200, 'beer/brewerId': '784', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 4, 'min': 40, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 1, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 957366247, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A - This beer poured a golden orange color that produced a fluffy white head that had decent retention and left a moderate amount of lacing on the side of the glass\t\tS - The aroma produced by this beer were a little bit of caramel malts followed by a beautiful mix of flowery, citrusy mix of hops\t\tT - The taste of this beer, is well, hoppy, but it is a crazy mix that it is kind of hard to pull one variety of hop from another, but it is a bitter blast, just hoped for more coherence \t\tM - The mouthfeel of this beer had a resiny, medium body and moderate amount of carbonation\t\tD - This beer was, in the words of Andy Reid, "an inch away from greatness," this could be a great beer, with just a little bit more work', 'user/profileName': 'cvfish', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Boddingtons Pub Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1259809699, 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '1798', 'beer/brewerId': '655', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 3, 'min': 8, 'sec': 19, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 337, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A - Pours with typical beautiful nitro-cascade, settles out to crisp clear pale gold with 1 1/2 finger lasting fluffy, creamy head, decent lacing.\t\tS - Very light--clean and slightly metallic with just a trace of sourdough.\t\tT - Fairly lager-like, though a bit more full. Very mild floral hops, biscuit malts, paper pulp, faint sour green apple, and a bit of metallic flavor. Grains make a stronger presence in the finish. Perhaps not as complex as it sounds.\t\tM - Light, too thin, with lots of tiny effervescent carbonation. Sometimes I have experienced a lasting and unpleasant bitter metallic aftertaste, but it wasn't so prevalent in this tasting for whatever reason. \t\tD - Very mild and easy to drink though the aftertaste can be a bit of a turn off. Nothing special really, but not bad by any means. Kind of like a dumbed down English Pale... I suspect it has gone this direction intentionally over the last couple of decades.", 'user/profileName': 'JTahoe', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Foreign / Export Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Fade To Black Volume 1 - Foreign Export Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1267829237, 'beer/ABV': 8.5, 'beer/beerId': '54076', 'beer/brewerId': '418', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 22, 'min': 47, 'sec': 17, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 64, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "The beer pours a pitch black color with a thick frothy tan head that slowly fades to lacing. The aroma is good. It appears to have a near perfect malt scent. It's roasted on one hand. It's dry and earthy on the other. There's also a nice chocolate component as well. The taste is good. It has a very nice black malt flavor up front with a big chocolate malt blast and a bit of roasted malt character in the finish. To call it complex is an understatement. The mouthfeel is fine. It is a full bodied beer with adequate carbonation. This is a good beer. I'm not getting a huge roasted character which is standard with export stouts, but this is a delicious beer that's highly drinkable.", 'user/profileName': 'WesWes', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Hopsickle Imperial India Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1182563769, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 14, 1979', 'beer/ABV': 9.2, 'beer/beerId': '25259', 'user/birthdayUnix': 300783600, 'beer/brewerId': '870', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 1, 'min': 56, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 174, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1117551847, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Wow, quite a beer. {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Pumpkin Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Pumpkinhead Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1221341647, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '1932', 'beer/brewerId': '139', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 21, 'min': 34, 'sec': 7, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 257, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Pours a pale orange with a quickly receding tan head. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Popskull', 'review/timeUnix': 1256249691, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '47530', 'beer/brewerId': '26', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 22, 'min': 14, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 295, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a dark brown color with two fingers of tan head that had good retention. The head eventually settles to a thick cap. Just a little spotty lacing is left on the glass. Has a complex aroma. I smell chocolate, vanilla, roasted nuts, and some dark fruit. I really enjoyed the flavor of this beer as well. For a beer packing 10% ABV, I did not detect any alcohol aroma or flavor. What I did taste is the nutty malt with some chocolate, vanilla, and a little fruitiness in the finish. I also get some ash or charcoal in the aftertaste. This is a really well put together brown ale. The body is on the lighter side of medium. The carbonation is well suited for the body. The only thing that hurts drinkability is the high ABV. I would like to have this again in the future.', 'user/profileName': 'morimech', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Vienna Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Vienna Country Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1204597628, 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '22917', 'beer/brewerId': '2700', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 2, 'min': 27, 'sec': 8, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 64, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Had this to wet my appetite (and for my 400th review), on to the beer:\t\tThe beer is a clear copper in appearance with a head that doesn't last too long. As for flavor, it's quite sweet. It reminded me of Sam Adams Boston Lager at the source, albeit with less hops. Quite enjoyable.", 'user/profileName': 'DoubleJ', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': "Timothy's Fear", 'review/timeUnix': 1067214542, 'beer/beerId': '13783', 'beer/brewerId': '1001', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 0, 'min': 29, 'sec': 2, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 300, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "I was shocked to find such a wonderful beer in a town where the macros seem to advertise everywhere; I was surprised that I did not see a neon sign on the high school. But this is one killer beer and made me come back to the Firehouse for 3 straight days. It pours a deep dark brown with a slim head, but it produced such beautiful lacing you just can not fault it. The aroma reminded me of a nice think hunk of dark bread dunked in a nice mellow bourbon. Having this on the sampler woke me up as everything else while decent, had little character. But once I had it once I could see no reason to order anything else. The flavor was extremely malty with a subtle hoppiness, but the big alcohol punch it packed was what stood up to be noticed. Unlike some high alcohol beers this was perfect in flavor and even though you could tell that it was strong, I felt that I needed to drink as many as I could. Overall, a damn nice beer that I could really only compare to Heavyweight's Purkuno's Hammer, but this might be a little more think and luscious, hard to believe as that is.", 'user/profileName': 'schoolteacher', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English India Pale Ale (IPA)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'India Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1127942471, 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '3968', 'beer/brewerId': '1549', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 21, 'min': 21, 'sec': 11, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 271, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "I slammed this beer before. I think that has alot to do with freshness, as I think this is a solid, tasty everyday beer that doesn't always get what it deserves.\t\tFruity, cascade-packed, then sort of thin and floating away in the mouthfeel but addicting, this beer is a museum of the first wave of IPA's. I think this one still stands up, especially when considered to other examples that just seem sort of boring these days (however valid that sentiment is).\t\tTry it if you haven't. And throw a six of the fresh stuff in the fridge if you have and show your uneducated beer friends that IPA's can be simple and not palate assaulting.", 'user/profileName': 'GreenWBush', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Flanders Oud Bruin', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Goudenband', 'review/timeUnix': 1127499639, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '773', 'beer/brewerId': '283', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 18, 'min': 20, 'sec': 39, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 266, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Stately, mature, characterful and slight eccentric- this is Belgian brewing at its best! With less tartness than Flemish Reds or Lambics but with a rich depth of character that distinguishes it from the typical Belgian Doubles and Triples.\t\tUnderstated yet creamy carbonation allows for a mellow decanting- nearly cask-like. Distinct aromas ar of must, peaty earth, lightly horsey and with a cork-like wodiness. Rich malt flavors push to the forefront, but foregoing the associates sweetness of caramel or sugar. Medium bodied in texture, the mild lemony sourness seems to further lighten the malt-forward ale and usher in a soft lactic dryness. Mildly astringent when the woody notes pronounce, but the finish is a marvelous malty-dry yet crisply tart combination that work in harmony. \t\tA light earthy/briney flavor reminds me Orval except with more body and sweetness. Riding on the side saddle with French Ales but with the sour attitue of the Senne Valley the beer is a new adventure with each sip. Masculine and refines but without pretention.', 'user/profileName': 'BEERchitect', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Rauchbier', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'The Ostemoller', 'review/timeUnix': 1288554554, 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '44622', 'beer/brewerId': '26', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 31, 'hour': 19, 'min': 49, 'sec': 14, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 304, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Served in a pokal at The Firkin.\t\tWhat a nice surprise finding this beer here this night. Yes. It pours a cloudy, really pale straw topped by nearly two fingers of white froth. The nose comprises smokey charcoal and what seems like a nice bit o' sweet pineapple. Didn't see that coming, I can tell you that. The taste holds notes of peppercorns, light smoke, chipotle peppers, cardamom, light lemon zest, wheat, and a stronger layer of char lining the background. The body is light, with a moderate carbonation and a dry finish. Overall, an interesting take on the smoked helles, something I wish I could get more often 'round here.", 'user/profileName': 'TMoney2591', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Wilco Tango Foxtrot', 'review/timeUnix': 1302148652, 'beer/ABV': 7.83, 'beer/beerId': '56613', 'beer/brewerId': '220', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 3, 'min': 57, 'sec': 32, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 97, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 2.0, 'review/text': "Seems to have been bottles mid-February.\t\tPours a brown-amber capped with a 1.5-finger ecru head that leaves a good bit of lacing on my glass.\t\tThe first thing that hits the nose is a grapefruit-y hop aroma. Definitely getting buttered popcorn (diacetyl) and a little alcohol. I'm not really liking this aroma, but I guess it's not all bad.\t\tBright, puckering hops hit the palate up front with citrus and accompanying pith. I at first found the label, touting this as malty and robust, to be really misleading, but as this beer warmed some toasty maltiness comes through; now it's just misleading. The finish is a dry, whole-mouth bitterness that lasts well until the next sip.\t\tMouthfeel is medium-thin with prickly carbonation.\t\tThis isn't bad beer, but I certainly won't be picking it up again, and would probably hold off on recommending it if there are other options.", 'user/profileName': 'Sneers', 'review/aroma': 2.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Terrapin Monk's Revenge", 'review/timeUnix': 1245963565, 'beer/ABV': 9.6, 'beer/beerId': '47152', 'beer/brewerId': '2372', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 20, 'min': 59, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 176, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '22oz bottle pouted into a Goblet:\t\tOpaque orange with a light, white, creamy head that was not all that well retained but full of carbonation, but did settle into a small thin cap.\t\tThe aroma was more Belgian triple than IPA, Sweet and malty. \t\tThe taste is a very nice balance of the two styles. A little more hops, but balanced very nice with the sweetness of the malt and fruit.\t\tThe beer had a medium to full body, perhaps a little too thick for my taste, but still good. The beer had a nice bitter dry aftertaste and was well carbonated. The beer was fairly easy to drink give the ABV, but after the 22oz, I was pretty well done. Overall, a good beer and probably the first one of the side projects that I think the brewery should consider brewing on a regular basis.', 'user/profileName': 'PhillyStyle', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Terrapin Big Hoppy Monster', 'review/timeUnix': 1164497243, 'beer/ABV': 8.3, 'beer/beerId': '20232', 'beer/brewerId': '2372', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 23, 'min': 27, 'sec': 23, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 329, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '12 oz bottle poured into pint glass.\t\tAppearance: Hazy dark amber color with a thin off-white head.\t\tSmell: A great combination of bready, caramel malts and grassy, citrus hops. Neither seems to overpower.\t\tTaste: This is where the hops take over. A pungent hop punch hit you immediately surrounded perfectly by a fruity malt character. Some apples and maybe honey(?) are present. Very complex taste. Finishes very clean with only a slight pleasant bitterness.\t\tMouthfeel: Full-bodied goodness. The dueling hops and malt feel good.\t\tDrinkability: This could be a dangerous beer. It hides the ABV well with a clean finish. The big malt backbone may make this more difficult to drink for some.', 'user/profileName': 'psinderson', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Allagash Tripel Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1081376018, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '448', 'beer/brewerId': '4', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 22, 'min': 13, 'sec': 38, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 98, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "The first careful pour from a long-standing bottle delivers a crystal-clear golden-orange and yellow body that teems with fine, effervescent bubbles beneath a two inch head of densely creamy white froth. The head retention is excellent and it maintains a solid quarter inch of cream as well as leaving almost completely solid walls of lace throughout the glass. The nose delivers a sweetish, candy laced malt that's brightened with a touch of orange, melon, and perhaps vanilla amidst a sprinkling of coriander. In the mouth its tiny bubbles foam-up on the tongue, giving a little tingle before it becomes pillowy soft and lightly creamy. The flavor expresses what the nose suggests, but with more ferver. It's vanilla is much clearer than the nose suggests, and its delicately citrusy orange character balances the candy and vanilla alongside a sublime spiciness of coriander and white pepper. Its bitterness is well heeled; and it's superbly balanced for the style - particularily given it's 9% alcohol which never fully shows! An astounding beer that's rich without being bold enough to hinder its drinkability, and complex enough to remain interesting throughout several glasses. Additionally, this is well worth stocking up on as it should appeal to a wide variety of guests in your home, and works equally well during a cool summer evening on the back porch as it does during the holiday season!", 'user/profileName': 'NeroFiddled', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'M\xc3\xa4rzen / Oktoberfest', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Octoberfest', 'review/timeUnix': 1319221727, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '102', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 18, 'min': 28, 'sec': 47, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 294, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'On tap at Jacktoberfest in a plastic cup\t\tAppearance: amber with a tan one finger head that lingers; decent lacing\t\tSmell: malty, bready; some spiciness\t\tTaste: Very smooth, malts come through with an almost sweet finish. Light hops\t\tMouthfeel: medium, really coats the tongue \t\tOverall: I was never too excited about this one from a bottle. But on tap, the freshness really comes through. Smooth, yet robust. A nice fall beer. A really solid seller at the beer garden I was pouring at.', 'user/profileName': 'brewskifan55', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'English Barleywine', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Samael's Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1129101459, 'beer/ABV': 16.45, 'beer/beerId': '24357', 'beer/brewerId': '30', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 7, 'min': 17, 'sec': 39, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 285, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Auburn-tinted amber under a surprisingly heathly rise of buttercreme. \tFuseled nose of vodka, cherry juice, dark rum, bourbon, biscuits, and caramel. \tInto the mouth, it begins with a dripping caramel and black liquorice hues. And for a moment, this could well be mead, full of honey and sweet alcohol. It gathers thickness, as well as gummi sweet & sour cherry notes. It lingers here a while, sagging under its own girth, with the cherry and oak chip glinting sourness barely offsetting the maple syrup and brown sugar cloy. It rides out with a minced date, apicot, cherry, and blood orange fruitness, still dappled in caramel and cooked sugars. Boil all this into a spiced rum bath. \tHeavy, obese, bodied. To say that this drinks like Mrs Butterworth is no hyperbole, nor is it libel. Honestly, this is probably best served poured unto pancakes. \tThat said, it can be tackled in successive sips, and thus distances itself from Avery's other high proof ventures. Diabetics and other sweet-aversive people beware.", 'user/profileName': 'cokes', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Plaid Bastard', 'review/timeUnix': 1238989324, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'May 30, 1976', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '15959', 'user/birthdayUnix': 202287600, 'beer/brewerId': '4738', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 3, 'min': 42, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 96, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1216047847, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'A=virtually no head, deep amber almost black\t\tS=smoky smell, some fruity notes\t\tT=smoky taste, roasted malts evident, almost chocolate\t\tM=even with no head carbonation is tight though feel is heavy and thick\t\tD=not one of my favorites though i will drink again, probably would not choose as a session beer', 'user/profileName': 'jacobseyb', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Doppelbock', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Samichlaus Bier', 'review/timeUnix': 1280629407, 'beer/ABV': 14.0, 'beer/beerId': '776', 'beer/brewerId': '285', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 2, 'min': 23, 'sec': 27, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 213, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '----2003 Vintage---\t\tI am a pretty big fan of Samichlaus, although it definitely isn\'t my favorite. However, I recently tried a 7 year old bottle, and I realized how wonderfully it can age.\t\tThe appearance was a great, thick looking dark brown. It almost seemed to pour like it was caramel. The taste fit in with the caramel description. It was thick, malty, and delicous. I am glad there aren\'t too many 7 year old "Sammies" around, or this would be a dangerous beer. I was dreading the end of the glass!', 'user/profileName': 'DeutschesBier', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Lambic - Fruit', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Framboise', 'review/timeUnix': 1316134954, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/beerId': '42154', 'beer/brewerId': '11466', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 1, 'min': 2, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 259, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'On-tap at the brewery. Theres no way this beer is 10% by the way. More like half that. \t\tA: Served a dark cranberry juice color with woody highlights and a very thin light pink collar. No lace. \tS: Musty notes of raspberries and slight vinegar. There is definitely a basement must to the odor.\tT: Sweet raspberry flavors with a bit of earthy must, dank basement, a touch of wood, and strong notes of fruit pits and red/dark fruit skins. The finish is cherry skin like, and the light tart/sourness is that of fruit skins. Luckily Im hardly getting any vinegar. \tM: Tingly lively carbonation, medium body with a slick and sticky mouthfeel. Its dryish but barely, and there is just a hint of tartness to the mouth. \tO: Not the worst framboise Ive ever had but its nothing super special. Good for the brewery. I cant knock Lodi for its variety of styles.', 'user/profileName': 'scottfrie', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'AleSmith IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1293242687, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 9, 1987', 'beer/ABV': 7.25, 'beer/beerId': '3916', 'user/birthdayUnix': 552812400, 'beer/brewerId': '396', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 2, 'min': 4, 'sec': 47, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 359, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 865523048, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "22 ounce bottle. Pours hazy amber color with a nice 2 finger white head with very good retention that reduces to a lacing cap that leaves nice lacing. Aromas of caramel, citrus, grapefruit, floral, and pine. Taste of strong grapefruit, with caramel, spice, and pine. Finishes off with a nice clean bitterness and lingering citrus and fruit flavor. Definitely one of the best balanced IPA's I have come across. Very smooth drinking. A little bit of alcohol warming on the finish. Medium body and carbonation. This is phenomenal, will definitely buy again.", 'user/profileName': 'superspak', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Bi\xc3\xa8re de Garde', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Oak Aged Domaine DuPage', 'review/timeUnix': 1280876004, 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '52598', 'beer/brewerId': '689', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 22, 'min': 53, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 215, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Surprisingly there was some of this still around 2 days after the 2 brothers event at Blind Tiger, lucky me.\t\tA- dark coppery brown barely able to peak through. Very little head, just a splotch of some micro bubbles bunched together in the middle with a thin ring around the glass. \t\tS-light malty with a touch of sugary red wine. Pretty sweet.\t\tT- starts off with the sweetness I anticipated, but never really peaks- luckily. There is a sustained maltiness with a touch of red wine-ness in there. I really enjoy the nutty notes in there , with the sweetness it gives me some brittle like flavors \t\tM- light- med bodied with a little viscosity. No carbonation goin on here. \t\tD- tasty beer, a little on the sweet side. I would not have guessed it was oak aged. I like the nuttiness. Reminds me of a sweet nut brown ale.', 'user/profileName': 'm1ked', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Heresy', 'review/timeUnix': 1142483625, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '18198', 'beer/brewerId': '392', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 4, 'min': 33, 'sec': 45, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 75, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'appearance: The pour produces a dark tan, .5" head that gradually recedes back into the liquid from which it came, save for a ring around the glass and a small island of froth. The beer is practically black in color, save for some brown light escaping from the edges.\t\tsmell: Dominant roasted, hazelnut, woody aromas. Definately a considerable aroma of bourbon barrel, with some light vanilla accompanying. Somewhat sharp alcohol sting, but not as bad in my opinion as others have mentioned. Maybe some age mellowed it out. Moderately sweet, with a dark chocolate aroma. A milder RIS aroma, but nice. Low to moderate hop aroma.\t\tmouthfeel: The carbonation is on the light side of the medium range, and the body is just above medium.\t\ttaste: Semisweet chocolate, roasted barley, oak, and some nuttiness up front. Just the slightest alcohol tinge. Finish astringent with just a little hop aroma.\t\tdrinkability: Easy\t\tPurchased from The Caboose in VA with dirtylou on the way back from our Dogfish excursion last summer...cellared since then.', 'user/profileName': 'blackie', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Black Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Hop In The Dark Cascadian Dark Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1280281003, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.9, 'beer/beerId': '58695', 'beer/brewerId': '63', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 1, 'min': 36, 'sec': 43, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 209, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Thanks to wnoble for the chance to try this. 22 oz. bomber into a Duvel tulip. Poured a opaque black with a generous three-finger mocha head which settled to a coating. Lacing was almost non-existent as it warmed. Nose was pine and floral hops, some chocolate, and a little roasted grain. Taste was awesome - well-blalanced but hop-forward. Like most things I enjoy, there was an interesting interplay, in this case between the sweetness of the malt (chocolate and toasted grain) and the great hop prescence - tropical fruits, bitterness, etc. There were some spice notes as well. Mouthfeel was medium with moderate carbonation. All-in-all, this was a VERY nice offering I would have again - if I only could...', 'user/profileName': 'regspeir', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'American Wild Ale', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Temptation', 'review/timeUnix': 1310236393, 'beer/ABV': 7.25, 'beer/beerId': '9474', 'beer/brewerId': '863', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 18, 'min': 33, 'sec': 13, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 190, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "poured from a 375 mL bottle\t\tA: Poured a deep golden color, most comparable to tree sap. Very good carbonation, and again, hits you in the jowls on the finish\t\tOverall, I really like this one. Can't say I've ever had a bad RR beer though. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Bock', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Flensburger Winterbock', 'review/timeUnix': 1261118084, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 17, 1981', 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '21493', 'user/birthdayUnix': 366879600, 'beer/brewerId': '2854', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 6, 'min': 34, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 352, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1051455847, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Appearance: Light amber color, thick head with nice lacing.\t\tSmell: Strong malt aroma with slight alcohol followed.\t\tTaste: Mild malt sweetness, then nice hop bitterness, alcoholic at the finish.\t\tMouthfeel/Drink: Medium bodied, smooth to drink, but not impressed. {'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'California Common / Steam Beer', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Old Scratch Amber Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1107665113, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '204', 'beer/brewerId': '68', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 4, 'min': 45, 'sec': 13, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 37, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "This brew is a clear, almost cherry red colour with nothing for head. Okay, a thin white head formed on an aggressive pour, but it was gone before I could sit down.\t\tThe smell is somewhat sweet, bready and floral. A fairly strong aroma, and not unpleasant.\t\tThe taste is much like the smell up front, but its finish is a bit of a mystery to me. There is a fair burst of flavour over the back of the tongue. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Grottenbier', 'review/timeUnix': 1070337214, 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '12775', 'beer/brewerId': '259', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 3, 'min': 53, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 336, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '750 mL bottle served slightly chilled in a Delirium Noel glass.\t\tAppearance: Clear brown with ruby overtones topped by a nice healthy beige head. Streamers of bubbles keep the head pretty decently replenished and assist in leaving decent amounts of lace on the sides of the glass.\t\tSmell: Strong spicy clove aromas dominate, with some light pepper, bubblegum, yeast, and banana scents kicking around.\t\tTaste: Clovey and peppery with some nice caramel malt and candi sugar sweetness to balance it all out. Not overly complex.\t\tMouthfeel: Great carbonation on a medium bodied beer. Relatively crisp.\t\tDrinkability: Pretty decent, but there are definitely better beers out there in this style: Maudite, Trois Pistoles, and La Terrible to name a few.', 'user/profileName': 'ManekiNeko', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'M\xc3\xa4rzen / Oktoberfest', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Michelob Marzen', 'review/timeUnix': 1227385345, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Apr 23, 1979', 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '2209', 'user/birthdayUnix': 293702400, 'beer/brewerId': '29', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 20, 'min': 22, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 327, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1124633047, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Presentation: It was poured from a brown 12oz bottle into a pint glass.\t\tAppearance: The head is has a slightly off white color and it builds up thick and foamy.
