{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Santa's Little Helper", 'review/timeUnix': 1227678532, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jan 5, 1983', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '34203', 'user/birthdayUnix': 410601600, 'beer/brewerId': '5318', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 5, 'min': 48, 'sec': 52, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 331, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1007733847, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A- this one pours black with a finger of sticky slightly darker than beige colored head. \t\tS- lost of chocolate, licorice, booze and roasted malts.\t\tT- lots of chocolate. some licorice. roasted malts. some raisins and plums that i couldnt smell. great coffee finish\t\tM- thick and full bodied. hard to sense carbonation. warms as it goes down.\t\tD- an easy drinker. the alcohol is well hidden in the taste. trouble some to have more than one, but something im glad this area can finally get.', 'user/profileName': 'jwinship83', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Odyssey Imperial IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1260918079, 'beer/ABV': 8.4, 'beer/beerId': '30470', 'beer/brewerId': '10397', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 23, 'min': 1, 'sec': 19, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 349, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': '2009 version on cask at Hop Project Day\t\tA-Slightly hazed, ruby-red grapefruit tinged copper with a cask driven billowing white head that reduced a bit and left caking lace.\t\tS-Fresh, bright floral, citrus and light spicy hop pop up front with a pleasant underlying light caramel malt sweetness.\t\tT-Initial hop notes of fresh citrus, spicy pine and floral notes with the backing of sweet caramel malt. Quite balanced but does lean towards the hops.\t\tM-Medium bodied quite smooth with only a touch of sharpness. Long lingering hop bitterness.\t\tD-I have always been an Odyssey fan and this beer on cask simply shines. Very well constructed.', 'user/profileName': 'Deuane', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Edelweiss Hefetrub', 'review/timeUnix': 1121784637, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '1258', 'beer/brewerId': '84', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 14, 'min': 50, 'sec': 37, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 200, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '(500 ml bottle). Rerate: This is a beer I come back to all the time, as it is relatively cheap in Norway (available at Vinmonopolet) AND very refreshing. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 2.0, 'beer/name': 'Wooden Shoe Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1289922963, 'beer/ABV': 4.6, 'beer/beerId': '35285', 'beer/brewerId': '24806', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 15, 'min': 56, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 320, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 2.0, 'review/text': "12oz bottle, no dating. Brewed by Elevator in Columbus.\t\tPours a darker golden color with a fizzy white head and soapy lacing which hangs around for the duration of the drink.\tSmell is slightly off-putting; the malt comes off a bit musty and plastic-like.\tThat same plastic-like note is in the flavor as well. Grassy, vegetal notes come through along with some sweetness from the malt, but the plasticity is tough to overcome.\tNice body, particularly for the style, so no complaints there.\t\tQuite simply, the recipe needs to be tweaked. Hopefully it's just a bad batch, because all the other elements are there for a solid pale lager.", 'user/profileName': 'Natural510', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Barleywine', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Kuhnhenn Bourbon Barrel Barley Wine', 'review/timeUnix': 1321673660, 'beer/ABV': 14.5, 'beer/beerId': '8388', 'beer/brewerId': '2097', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 3, 'min': 34, 'sec': 20, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 323, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "12oz. bottle courtesy of Seeswo. 2010 vintage served in my Old Stock snifter. Pours a translucent mahogany with a loose, half-inch off-white head that quickly disperses towards the shoulders, forming a thin, bubbly band. There's also a residual oily slick across the center of the glass. Nose expresses milk chocolate, a trace of dark fruit and a pleasant buttery vanilla character. Only the merest suggestion of bourbon presents itself. Taste expresses toffee, butter candied fruit and a slightly acrid ethanol character that lingers at the back. Mouthfeel is medium-light (but closer to light) with a slightly coarse carbonation and quite a bit of residual heat that lingers on the tongue and at the back of the throat. All and all, a pretty good barleywine that could use some time to allow that alcohol presence to dissipate. That said, if the alcohol does in fact dissipate, the thinness to the body would be more prominent. I'm not sure if a lot of age will improve this beer, but another year in the cellar might reveal a decent balance.", 'user/profileName': 'Jwale73', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Rustwagen Hefeweizen', 'review/timeUnix': 1249107025, 'beer/beerId': '51222', 'beer/brewerId': '12166', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 6, 'min': 10, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 213, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a very hazy orange golden with a thin head that settles to a ring. Smells of lemon and some slightly sweet malt, with a touch of light, earthy bitterness. Lacks some of the exuberant yeastiness of the style, but not bad. Light yeast, very light spiciness with just the barest wisp of clove, slight tang on the finish. Smooth and light rather than crisp in the mouth, Not quite a zingy and flavorful and quenching as I like my hefes.', 'user/profileName': 'Georgiabeer', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Doppelbock', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Ayinger Celebrator Doppelbock', 'review/timeUnix': 1239058254, 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '131', 'beer/brewerId': '39', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 22, 'min': 50, 'sec': 54, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 96, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "This is a very tasty doppelbock that's also very mellow and easy to drink.\t\tAlmost black, it has a very large light brown head very slowly shrinking.\t\tThe aroma is rich prune, raisins, sweet brown bread, bread cruast, hints of dark rum.\t\tThe taste is rich, dark toasted brown bread, molasses cake, prunes, winey prunes and raisins, faintly rummy and with a hint of coffee. It's generally sweet with with very faint bitterness and spiciness. The feel is rich and smooth and it's very smooth and easy to drink.", 'user/profileName': 'Offa', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Cohoho Imperial IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1182620050, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '3500', 'beer/brewerId': '385', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 17, 'min': 34, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 174, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Nicely dark body for this style, its a deep brown with hints of amber on the sides. Hosts a 2 finger head that is a rich tan that leaves nice lace as it fades. Super hoppy nose yields a late season ripe citrus feel with nice balance. Rich and bitter mingle together as you indulge into this one at first sip. Hops come off soft and long but well presented. Bitterness is balanced with a slight malt character. A shockingly bold belly warmer for the style, woams more like an Impy stout. Mouthfeel is a hop induced malt mix richness. Very well made lovely brew for the season. I wish I could find this beer and many others from these guys in Indiana.', 'user/profileName': 'SPLITGRIN', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Saint Arnold Divine Reserve #11', 'review/timeUnix': 1301616217, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.9, 'beer/beerId': '67612', 'beer/brewerId': '337', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 0, 'min': 3, 'sec': 37, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 91, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': '12 oz bottle pours a clear, light copper color with a tall, light tan head. Fades slow and leaves lots of sticky lace. Very nice looking beer.\t\tNose is a very nice blend of hop aromas. Tropical and minty with a bit of alcohol backdrop. Malts are pretty light, as the appearance would suggest, lending a biscuity aspect.\t\tThis one is all about the hop flavors. Bitterness builds from low to high and the lighter, grainier malt backbone lets the multitude of tropical hop flavors to come forth. ABV is hidden well and the body is nice and creamy. I think this is the best beer Saint Arnold has ever made. I actually think it could at least hang with some of the better Cali IPAs/IIPAs.', 'user/profileName': 'twiggamortis420', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'S:t Eriks Sommarlager', 'review/timeUnix': 1276888094, 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '57078', 'beer/brewerId': '13882', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 19, 'min': 8, 'sec': 14, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 169, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'The bottle looks like a small wine-bottle, brown 33 cl longnecked. The small label at the bottom is yellow and has got a picture of S:t Erik (or Erik Jedvardsson, a swedish king from the mid 12th century).\t\tA: Pours pale golden with an airy white, kind of fluffy head. Slow dissipation leaves quite nice lacings. \t\tS: Lots of American hops, piney and citric - there are both grapefruit as well as pineapple. But besides the nice-smelling hops I can\'t smell anything else. \t\tT: The taste is better balanced than the smell - there\'s everything from the smell, but in combination with a slight roasted maltyness. \t\tM: Aftertaste is short, but holds both some sweetness but also bitterness. Body is kind of weak and carbonation is medium.\t\tD: Not a bad beer, but there are lots of other "summerbeers" I rather drink. The good thing about this one is the bold hoppyness. But if you aren\'t into hops this one would do nothing for you.', 'user/profileName': 'Sunnanek', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Pranqster', 'review/timeUnix': 1092679949, 'beer/ABV': 7.6, 'beer/beerId': '411', 'beer/brewerId': '112', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 18, 'min': 12, 'sec': 29, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 229, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': 'Received a 4 pack (nicely aged, I might add) from a friend. Poured into the snifter well and has a nice golden appearance, with a nice light head. A bit hazy, almost like a Heffie type beer. General aroma was nice and fruity. I was excited to sit and watch the thunder storm roll in whilst enjoying this beer. Drank it slightly chilled, but not cold, to savour the true flavours....which were nice and robust. The taste is very good, and not overpowering like some in its style class, but still enough flavour so you take notice. Definately becoming a favourite of mine. Will need to get my hands on more for sure. Not a food beer, but better after dinner sitting with friends on the porch.', 'user/profileName': 'Solomon420', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Bitter', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Sassy Red', 'review/timeUnix': 1184187853, 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '23210', 'beer/brewerId': '626', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 21, 'min': 4, 'sec': 13, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 192, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "I was in New Zealand for an entire month, and on arrival I was quite looking forward to the beers of a former British holding. I was sorely disappointed almost the entire time I was there -- Most beers tended to be sweet, thick, and malty like American malt liquor without the high ABV that justifies them. Until I met Sassy Red...\t\t\tA: Actually, Sassy Red isn't all that red, sort of amber with a suntan.\t\t\tS: The smell is the best part -- it's biscuity and toasty with some nut oil -- brazil nut and almond - in there, all carried out with popping hoppiness right on the front of the nose.\t\t\tT: Unlike most amber/reds with toasty notes in the nose, Sassy Red actually carried those comforting flavors in to the taste. The only reason that this rating doesn't exceed a four is because the beer is marketed as a bitter, but in fact its not as bitter as it might be. It is more hoppy than bitter -- more vegetal than a bitter might normally express.\t\t\tM: Thinner than it could be, and carries just a little too much carbonation for its type of flavor, but still very pleasant and slick.\t\t\tD: It must be drinkable -- I had about 8 in the Auckland airport while my flight was delayed. This is a beer I want as my first and my last of the night -- something I can say about few others. It is flavorful enough to get me going and keep me interested, but not in any way cloying or too heavy.\t\t\tI already miss Sassy Red and I just got back.", 'user/profileName': 'jesmillet', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Organic Hefe-Weizen', 'review/timeUnix': 1023565395, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Dec 29, 1977', 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '82', 'user/birthdayUnix': 252230400, 'beer/brewerId': '31', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 19, 'min': 43, 'sec': 15, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2002, 'yday': 159, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1166105047, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Cloudy yellow in color w/ a thick head that isn't quite as well retained compared to other Hefeweizens.  Tart wheat notes w/ mild banana & bubblegum yeast esters in aroma.  The aroma isn't as complex as other examples of the style, and is akin to a more tart, but less estery Paulaner aroma.  Flavorwise, yeast contributions are subdued for style, but musty and light banana flavors are present.  Grainy, tart wheat flavors assert themselves since they're not overpowered by yeast esters.  The finish consists of residual sweetness and a hint of a grainy note.  Like other Pinkus brews, it's stylistically odd, but flavorful enough to warrant a taste.", 'user/profileName': 'marc77', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': '110K+OT Batch #4 - Imperial Red Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1308018161, 'beer/ABV': 10.2, 'beer/beerId': '68985', 'beer/brewerId': '17981', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 2, 'min': 22, 'sec': 41, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 165, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured on-tap at the Cigar City Brewing tasting room in Tampa. The beer's flavors are wet hops and grapefruit initially, with a tangy, sweet caramel and chocolate blend at the end. Flavors are similar to a Red IPA. Slightly boozey and slick consistency, with an astringent and drying finish.", 'user/profileName': 'GarthDanielson', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Imperial Hefeweizen Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1192330719, 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '38437', 'beer/brewerId': '403', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 2, 'min': 58, 'sec': 39, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 287, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'A- Pours a cloudy and hazy orange-amber hue with a nice amount off craggy white head that is sustaining and leaves a fair amount of lacing on the glass\tS- Aroma is mostly citrus and floral hops along with yeasty wheat malts\tT- Hmmmm, initial taste is of wheat and sweet malts, followed by bread malts and dark citrus in the middle, and finishing with an unassuming touch of dry hops and alcohol\tM- Medium-bodied hefe with an almost oily texture, light carbonation\tD- At 7.5%abv, this is definitely on the strong-side for a hefe, fairly drinkable overall, but lacks any unique characteristics for a repeat buy. I think the biggest knock on this beer is that it tries to be both an IPA and a Hefe but fails at both, sometimes "hybrids" are not the best picks for beers and this shines with this "Imperial Hefeweizen". . . if I want a good IPA, there are plenty of better choices, and the same holds for Hefes, I see no situation in which I would want the hoppiness of an IPA with the wheat/syrupy maltness of a Hefe. . . BUT props to Pyramid for trying something new', 'user/profileName': 'Stoneman78', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Hop Wallop', 'review/timeUnix': 1100999764, 'beer/ABV': 8.5, 'beer/beerId': '14916', 'beer/brewerId': '345', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 1, 'min': 16, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 326, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "I had this out of a 12 oz brown bottle and served in a British imperial pint glass. Enjoy by date clearly marked for April 26 2005. This beer is a freshy.\t\tThe aroma on this beer is phenomenal. Strong whiffs of citrus fruit (grapefruits, oranges, and limes) and balsam fur pine.\t\tClearish yellow, light orange color. Nice sticky lacings cling and stay all over the glass. \t\tMedium bodied with a really smooth mouthful. Again, pine and citrus are blending together to create a sweet and bitter combo. Sweet and crisp with a major hop bite.\t\tIncredibly drinkable at 8.5% ABV. This beer is a treat and one of the best double IPA's I've had. \t\tRecommended. I'm so glad this beer just began working its way into Boston. This is one masterpiece of an IPA.", 'user/profileName': 'Hibernator', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Barleywine', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Stone Old Guardian Barley Wine Style Ale 2009', 'review/timeUnix': 1278987233, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 11.3, 'beer/beerId': '47772', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 2, 'min': 13, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 194, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A testament to aging quality ales, only to be served in a red wine glass or tulip.\t\tA: Hazy shade of bronze, a smallish off-white head with tears of hops and malts abounding.\t\tS: Wonderful balance as the hops have mellowed out enough to let the malts shine through the forest for all the trees. Aromas of pine, caramel, grapefruit, pineapple and charred walnuts.\t\tT: As it warms up, the flavors suggested by the scents begin to emerge. Another year may merge the two perfectly.\t\tM: Medium to full-bodied, a Old Guardian aged some 1.5 years is viscous and luscious. \t\tD: Some claim to be able to drink more than one of these 22oz bombers. OK, but if you're willing to split the second one among three or four, I'd be happy to savor this night cap. Otherwise...\t\tA case of this is well worth procuring. A few during the infant years, a few right about now and the rest over time. To my mind, a beer cellar needs Old Guardian keeping the treasure safe.", 'user/profileName': 'johnnieoz', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Brooklyn Flemish Gold', 'review/timeUnix': 1232033218, 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '45055', 'beer/brewerId': '45', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 15, 'min': 26, 'sec': 58, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 15, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Draft-only Brew Master Reserve beer on tap in my basement. Hops used were German Hallertauer Perle, Czech Saaz, American Glacier which is a relatively new hop in the Fuggle family from the Pacific Northwest. Light to medium bodied. Very easy drinking for a 6.5% beer.', 'user/profileName': 'BeerFan', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Irish Dry Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Guinness Extra Stout (Original)', 'review/timeUnix': 1228517802, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '650', 'beer/brewerId': '209', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 22, 'min': 56, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 340, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "A: poured a nice dark brown with a tan colored head about half an inch thick, nice red/garnet accents when held to the light. little clumps of lacing all around the glass, not too shabby. not terribly impressive though. \t\ts: smells like a more guinness-y guinness really, there are some roasted malts there, signature guinness smells, less burnt though, a little bit of chocolate, and i can't help but notice a distinct smell of chlorine/pool water? glass was clean too...hmmmm. slightly sour guinness smell as well. \t\tt: pretty nice on the chocolate, not too much initially for the roasted/burnt flavor, still it is there, a nice black coffee flavor, not strong coffee, but just coffee. definitely a hop presence in this one that isn't in the draught guinness. clean and earthy, piney. not too bad. slight earthy aftertaste. \t\tm: relatively thick, it isn't an export stout or imperial stout, but still is pretty hefty in the mouth, very smooth, not much carbonation. not too shabby. \t\td: not quite as drinkable as the draught, but still not too bad. i could easily see drinking a few of these.", 'user/profileName': 'pokesbeerdude', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Harvest Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1203520332, 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '4482', 'beer/brewerId': '1396', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 15, 'min': 12, 'sec': 12, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 51, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'I got the sampler tray at the Snipes brewpub/restaurant in Sunnyside, WA. Sample size was approximately 4 ounces.\t\tA- Golden clear color and generous head in spite of the little sampler glass size.\t\tS- Strong florals and citrus from being dry-hopped, I presume. Any aroma from the malts was hidden.\t\tT- I would liken this brew to a dry hopped version of their pale ale. Flavor palate was dominated by the hops, which came through as floral and citrus. Malts were over-dominated.\t\tM- Thin, medium to light body. Bitterness lingers as would be expected. Alcohol is hidden.\t\tD- Decent IPA-like beer. The dry hopping adds a nice floral aroma and flavor. Interesting brew and worthy of a try.', 'user/profileName': 'imacoug', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Altbier', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Double Bag', 'review/timeUnix': 1138149098, 'beer/ABV': 7.2, 'beer/beerId': '273', 'beer/brewerId': '94', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 0, 'min': 31, 'sec': 38, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 25, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "Taste gets better as it warms. I'm not the kind who can pick out every individual yeast ester and give you a real world counterpart. I can tell you that this beer reminds me of a very good ESB. This very much tastes like Fuller's ESB. Not one of those hopped up ambers. The biscuity malt. The fruit flavors. All of that. Some differences, I assume. But I would need to have a Fuller's and this side by side to point them out to you.\t\tBeautiful amber color with nice head. Head goes down. But a nice lacing stays for a while.\t\tTaste lingers. Makes you crave more.", 'user/profileName': 'GeoffFromSJ', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Dubbel', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Abbey Belgian Style Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1283221201, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '1912', 'beer/brewerId': '192', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 31, 'hour': 2, 'min': 20, 'sec': 1, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 243, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'My expectations for an abbey ale from New Belgium were not high. But since brewers and breweries evolve, I thought I should give this a try. \t\tPours clear orange/copper with a modest tan head that dissipates to a fine ring of bubbles around the glass, with some lacing.\t\tAromas of wet hay, some fruit (orange), and some hops way in the background.\t\tTaste follows the nose with sweet malt, orange, lemon, a hint of milk chocolate, then a dry hoppy and somewhat spicy finish. Overall, this is tasting to me like a dubbel light. \t\tBody is light, with good carbonation, it has a moderately creamy mouthfeel. \t\tThis is a drinkable dubbel style beer, but is lighter in substance than most Abbey dubbels. At only 7% ABV, it is more drinkable and also more affordable than most Belgian abbey doubles. Might serve as a good introduction to the style for those who are experimenting in that direction.', 'user/profileName': 'Beerenauslese', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Founders Breakfast Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1139060057, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.3, 'beer/beerId': '11757', 'beer/brewerId': '1199', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 13, 'min': 34, 'sec': 17, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 35, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "I hate to be the guy who disses a top rated brew, but I guess today I am that guy. Maybe I'm just sick of beers like this, but I feel like once you've had one double-imperial-chocolate-coffee-espresso-mocha-java-extravaganza stout you've had 'em all. The coffee and chocolate flavors are too much for beer, or too at least too much for this beer. I love a nice stout that has a more subtle coffee or chocolaty flavor that's imparted by the kind of malt they used, but this straight up infused flavor is too syrupy for me in general. Don't get me wrong, it is delicious, it's just not something I like in my beer I've decided. \tAppears a dark pitch brown color, a wimpy head that dissapears quickly. Smells extremely roasty and sweet, but with a ton of nice bitterness in the form of coffee and bitter chocolate. Maybe even from the hops but I can't really detect any. Taste could be full of complex flavors, and the potential is there, but the palate is really overrun with the intense coffee bean chocolate party that's going on in this beer. I've already talked about that part... The real saving grace of this beer is the mouthfeel. Soft and pillowy, it's so smooth and just velvety on the palate with a slight chewyness. If I had no tastebuds even I would drink this just for the texture. To finish up, it could just be me or a stylistic sort of preference thing, but the strong coffee flavors don't work for this beer I hate to say. Check out the Black Rye from Founders, there's a killer beer for ya.", 'user/profileName': 'twelvsies', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'Japanese Rice Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Sapporo Original Draft Beer', 'review/timeUnix': 1153400811, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 21, 1978', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '827', 'user/birthdayUnix': 272530800, 'beer/brewerId': '284', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 13, 'min': 6, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 201, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1145804647, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Tried this at a Thai place that was out of Tsingtao. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Wild Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Consecration', 'review/timeUnix': 1250990384, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 5, 1955', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '45653', 'user/birthdayUnix': -459968400, 'beer/brewerId': '863', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 1, 'min': 19, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 235, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1878303847, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'On tap at RR in Santa Rosa. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Drake Tail India Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1231913406, 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '33610', 'beer/brewerId': '14952', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 6, 'min': 10, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 14, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Poured from the 12-ounce bottle into a pint glass at room temperature this brew shows a hazy carmel color with an out of control oatmeal colored head and layers of lacing. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'App Gap IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1219250524, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/beerId': '23203', 'beer/brewerId': '7302', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 16, 'min': 42, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 233, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'This beer poured a hypnotically deep amber color almost as though it wanted to be an American brown. Near white head that faded quickly Way darker than I was expecting. Hops nose but not nearly as aggressive as most IPAs. So far not what I think of an IPA. The taste is malty at the very beginning then followed by a punch of hops that hits you right in the back of the jaw. Exactly what it should be. The finish is especially bitter and hoppy. The mouthfeel is good; moderate carbonation and smooth. Poignant and bitter in a notable way. A strange IPA but an outstanding one.', 'user/profileName': 'thekevlarkid', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Choklat', 'review/timeUnix': 1293127888, 'beer/ABV': 11.0, 'beer/beerId': '40058', 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 18, 'min': 11, 'sec': 28, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 357, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "A: Held up to the Florida sun, there isn't a shimmer of light shinning threw this chocolate stout. On top of the black liquid goodness sits a milk chocolate head that happens to be the same color as the label on the bottle.\t\tS: Just as I expected, Choklat is the most chocolate smelling beer in the beer world. Southern Tier always impresses me with these kind of brews, but the lack of complexity is it's only downfall.\t\tT: This brew reminds me of when I was a kid and used to put chocolate syrup on top of chocolate fudge that was on top of chocolate ice cream that was being eaten out of a chocolate cone (with chocolate sprinkles of course). The fact that they managed to brew this stout at 11% without affecting the flavor is amazing.\t\tMF: Mouthfeel is like creamy milk chocolate....just they way it should be.\t\tD: Drinkability is excellent. Southern Tier has some issues in this category for me because some of their brews are just too over the top (see Creme Brulee), but who doesn't love chocolate (especially with a well hidden ABV)", 'user/profileName': 'TKEbeerman', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Au Courant', 'review/timeUnix': 1072202300, 'user/gender': 'Female', 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '14560', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 17, 'min': 58, 'sec': 20, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 357, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'This beer poured a very appealling copper reddish color. It was very clear with an average head. I could immediately smell a sweet aroma, but did not immediately pick up on the currant. The first taste was just some sweetness, but then after a bit (and after eating some mild cheese), the total fruitiness of the currant started to appear. It was a bit slow to develop, but then all of a sudden I could really taste it. The aroma also developed and the fruit was definitely present. I am not sure how much was the cheese acting as a palate neutralizer or simply that as it warmed the fruit came through. The beer just got better as I continued to enjoy it. Of course, when tasting, eating food is not always advised, however, I will definitely say mild cheeses had no ill effect, but do not serve this beer to anyone while they are eating anything spicy or they will really miss out on its beauty.', 'user/profileName': 'gueuzegeek', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1277055788, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.2, 'beer/beerId': '10433', 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 17, 'min': 43, 'sec': 8, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 171, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "pours a very dark brown but shows a lot of red color when held to the light, a surprising amount of which makes shows through. Head is tan, creamy, a little over an inch, and both lasts and laces the glass well. \t\tAroma is a tad lighter than the best examples, but sticking ones nose in reveals ample toasted malt covered with a chocolate, an herbal hop, no alcohol or diacetyl.\t\tFlavor is quite good, full, sweet, balanced by a substantial bitterness - both from hops and a little from charred malt - which builds on the palate. A mild astringency is keeping it from an elite score. The char shows up much more in the flavor than aroma. Body is barely medium but creamy, carbonation soft - more would be too much with the bitterness/astringency of the hop/malt bill. All in all it is a solid porter that I'd have again. Seems to be somewhere between the brown and robust styles. recommended.", 'user/profileName': 'udubdawg', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.0, 'beer/name': 'Saranac High Peaks Series Imperial IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1245769988, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Dec 25, 1973', 'beer/ABV': 8.5, 'beer/beerId': '34409', 'user/birthdayUnix': 125654400, 'beer/brewerId': '99', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 15, 'min': 13, 'sec': 8, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 174, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1292681047, 'review/overall': 2.0, 'review/text': "Poured froma 12 oz bottle into a Sam Adams glass (hey, it was in reach). Poured clean with a nice deep golden straw color with over 2 fingers of crisp head that quickly sunk down. Impressive lacing on the glass, with legs!\t\tAroma was full of grassy hops and caramel, with some alcohol presence on the nose.\t\tTaste was extremely grassy with very little malt character at all, and extremely boozy. Seems like they let this one ferment a bit too long. If they used a bit more malts and stopped fermentation to yield the same 8.5%, this would be a far better beer. This beer is way too boozy for 8.5%. Dogfish Head's 120 Minute tastes and smells less boozy, and that weighs in at 20%!\t\tMouthfeel is thin, dry, and bubbly. As a result, drinkability was not good. I had to switch off with water every so often, and looked for something to munch on to break the boozy grassy flavor from layering too thickly on my tongue.\t\tOverall, this beer looks fantastic but just doesn't live up to the quality expected in a IIPA; other breweries have set the bar fairly high with strong but balanced IIPAs. This one is just way too boozy and grassy to be enjoyable.", 'user/profileName': 'techcommdood', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

So people who don\'t consider themselves a fan of hops can still enjoy this beer, most likely.\t\tIt\'s weird that they call this a "red ale," when it is clearly an amber color. Other amber ales are far more red than this.\t\tCheck out the .alt version of this one too!', 'user/profileName': 'TheRealBigC', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'The Immortal IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1226105129, 'beer/ABV': 6.21, 'beer/beerId': '2018', 'beer/brewerId': '700', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 0, 'min': 45, 'sec': 29, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 313, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '22 oz bottle poured a light amber color with a thin white layer of head. aroma has pine hops, resin, caramel malt, and light citrus underlying. mouth feel is medium with light carbonation and coats the mouth well for a single ipa. flavor is heavily resinous with pines and bitterness. malt is high enough to keep it from being one sided and mixes in with light sweetness. finish is bitter and lingering on the tongue. definitely on the resinous bitter end of the ipa. scale.', 'user/profileName': 'blklab2007', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Schwarzbier', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Xingu Black Beer', 'review/timeUnix': 1285219019, 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '1314', 'beer/brewerId': '434', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 5, 'min': 16, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 266, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Look: inviting, deep darkness.Not entirely black but close. Opaque and not allowing much light in. \t\tNose: nice aroma. Carmelized malts and hops. \t\tTaste: Carmel malts and light coffee notes without going bitter \t\tMouthfeel: pleasing mouthfeel that is creamy without feeling too heavy or grainy. \t\tDrink: Enyirely drinkable; on the order of a Kostringer black lager but with southern hemisphere influences instead of the eastern European traditional notes.', 'user/profileName': 'MikeInIowa', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Scottish Gruit / Ancient Herbed Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Breakside Summer Gruit', 'review/timeUnix': 1311208322, 'beer/ABV': 4.0, 'beer/beerId': '71236', 'beer/brewerId': '22843', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 0, 'min': 32, 'sec': 2, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 202, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "I feel a little bad being the one to add this beer, since it's far from my favorite style and I didn't like it very much. Pours a slightly hazy golden color without much head. Aroma is almost completely herbal - anise, lavender, clove, a touch of honey. Palate is a little more balanced by pale (pilsner?) malt, but still is huge on the herbal notes. Finish is a little chalky and has a distinct bitter herb that I can isolate but am unable to actually identify. This is a light, easy drinking ale, but it's kind of an experiment. Not my bag, but I appreciate the effort to make an obscure style.", 'user/profileName': 'ElGordo', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Oatmeal Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Samuel Smith's Oatmeal Stout", 'review/timeUnix': 1206585550, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '571', 'beer/brewerId': '113', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 2, 'min': 39, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 87, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': '550ml bottle split with my brew buddy Jared.\t\tA: Not jet black but a couple of shades lighter. Dark tan head, excellent retention and beautiful lacing.\t\tS: Mildly sweet with a fair amount of chocolate and a hint of coffee. Quite a bit of roast is present as well, along with a light earthy hop character. Sweet oatmeal is present in the back.\t\tT: Very well balanced, this beer opens with the roasted malt and the mild cocoa and coffee and oatmeal sweetness in perfect harmony. This beer is medium bodied, big enough to hold the flavors together while light enough to be truly refreshing. Mildly bitter on the finish with flavors of oatmeal, chocolate and raisins lingering, this is smooth on the palate with light carbonation. A touch metallic on the finish (iron?), this is the only flaw I can point to here. The oatmeal does take the edge off the roasted malt bitterness. I could drink an awful lot of this.', 'user/profileName': 'dyan', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Saranac Belgian Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1136938009, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '26617', 'beer/brewerId': '99', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 0, 'min': 6, 'sec': 49, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 11, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "hazy orangey amber colored with almost no head.\tthe aroma contains a good amount of fruity clove aromas along with some yeast, grainy and floral qualities. a little brown sugary.\tthe taste is fairly sweet and fruity witha little doughy yeast thrown in for good measure. some bubblegum shows up as it warms. a little spicy at the finish and aftertaste.\tthe mouthfeel is medium with a pleasant coating quality.\tdrinkability is not too bad, reasonably complex with no off flavors to take away. one of saranac's better offerings.", 'user/profileName': 'kmo1030', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Hoppy Trails IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1221943344, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '3827', 'beer/brewerId': '18968', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 20, 'min': 42, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 264, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Poured a deep tangerine colored beer with moderate slightly off-white puffy head.\t\tSmell has some nice notes of citrusy hops.\t\tTaste also has the hops in the forefront, with not enough malt to back it up.\t\tLeaves a nice dry sensation in the mouth.\t\tA good beer, but not quite great.', 'user/profileName': 'tgbljb', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Fuel Cafe (Coffee Flavored Stout)', 'review/timeUnix': 1322100784, 'beer/ABV': 5.93, 'beer/beerId': '2870', 'beer/brewerId': '741', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 2, 'min': 13, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 328, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'dark black with nearly no light at all shining through on this one. Rich tan colored head of about two inches quickly settled down to about a half inch of tan that thoroughly coated the inside of the glass. This was what the style is all about!\t\tThe aroma was just loaded down with coffee. Rich notes of mocha mixes in with a rich, and sweet coffee note. A tiny bit of bitterness and an earthy flare lying down underneath of it, but the majority of this one was hands down, rich brewed coffee. The flavor was more of the same. Rich notes just rolled over the tongue in waves and thoroughly coated the inside of the mouth. Sweet with touches of chocolate and vanilla to highlight the coffee notes,', 'user/profileName': 'mikesgroove', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Storm King Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1053696561, 'beer/ABV': 9.1, 'beer/beerId': '1013', 'beer/brewerId': '345', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 13, 'min': 29, 'sec': 21, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 143, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': 'Pours an almost inky color. It has a small head that is light brown in color. It dissapates quickly. A bit of caramel and coffee to the nose. Very full body to the beer, almost "thick". Somewhat roasty, not as much as some others. A hint of sweetness, chocolate and a good hop bite. The alchohol is not evident at all. This is excellent!', 'user/profileName': 'Boto', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Pecan Harvest Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1173670214, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '35134', 'beer/brewerId': '3', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 3, 'min': 30, 'sec': 14, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 71, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'I\'m back on the air for the first time since Katrina here, and thought it would be appropriate to start up again with a hometown brew (though these days I\'m based in Houston, sigh).\t\tI stopped by the Abita brewpub on a visit to NOLA this weekend, and had a couple of pints of the pecan ale. I picked up a growler and babied it back to Houston (put it on ice in a cooler), and it seems to have made it back unscathed.\t\tColor is a nice deep copper, and the tan head is ample even when it\'s served a little on the cold side, as is the pint in front of me. Even cold, though, the malty nose is prominent and enjoyable. Carbonation is very active on the tongue, and while I generally prefer my brown ales a little more sedate in this respect, you could argue that this keeps it from being syrupy. Taste is all smooth malt, edging onto sweet. Very rich. The pecan presence is most noticeable in the finish, with a crisp, dry flavor precisely like fresh pecans. Very Southern, very lovely-- brews like this make me believe ever more deeply in drinking local. Call it "beer terroir".\t\tThis is one of Abita\'s Select series, meaning it\'s only available on tap-- and only at their brewpub, in my experience, and only when they feel like brewing up a batch. This is one of the better Abitas I\'ve had, and it would make the trek to the North Shore more than worthwhile. Bring ya growler!', 'user/profileName': 'Bierbauch', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Stone Ruination IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1189630437, 'beer/ABV': 7.7, 'beer/beerId': '4083', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 20, 'min': 53, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 255, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Serving Type: A 12 oz bottle poured into a Westmalle Trappist Chalice\t\t A: Apple Juice. done.\t\tS: Sweet purfumey, bread, hops, a wonderful aroma. \t\tT: Complete opposite of the aroma. Tart yet smooth, earthy, pine, a complex beer.\t\tM: Smooth, with a tiny bite. Nice.\t\tD: I would and will order/buy one of these again. A nice brew from Stone....can't wait to try the Imperial Russian Stout I just got....mmm", 'user/profileName': 'ThirdCoast', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Doggie Style Classic Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1315171976, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 26, 1988', 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '1213', 'user/birthdayUnix': 588582000, 'beer/brewerId': '68', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 21, 'min': 32, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 247, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 829753447, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "A: pours a clear amber/orange beer; head pours a white, creamy, 1 finger thickness that remains, dissipating slowly; leaves a thick, creamy lacing that sticks to the glass\t\tS: sharp, astringent aroma up front; bitter hops, with hints of fresh-cut grass, citrusy lemon notes, and biting, sour grapefruit flavors; bouquet closer to IPA than APA in my opinion\t\tT: flavor is strong and full, a bit off-putting to me; the astringent dry-hopped notes hit strong up front; they are followed with a more mellow, lemon/grapefruit aftertaste, with something reminding me of whole-grain wheat bread; not yeasty by any means; pleasant surprises unfold in the flavors as the beer warms, introducing a nice, subtle malt undercurrent, balancing the brew much better than first thought\t\tM: medium-light body; smooth, almost but not quite weak and watery; less carbonation than I would like, but not flat; good drinkability\t\tO: not my favorite APA, seems more like an IPA to me; almost offensively astringent at first, but a very well-balanced and desirable brew as the brew warms and the maltiness comes through; give me 2, maybe 3 at most, but I'd drink it again", 'user/profileName': 'boudreaux', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Pumpkin Ale', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Post Road Pumpkin Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1320003642, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 19, 1986', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '74', 'user/birthdayUnix': 519548400, 'beer/brewerId': '45', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 19, 'min': 40, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 303, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 898787047, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Poured from a bottle into a pint glass\t\tA- pours a slightly hazy shade of amber with a one finger white head. Not really overwhelming with the cinnamon and nutmeg and all that\t\tT- there is little to no spice in this beer, and you're getting mainly the pure pumpkin flavor. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Lambic - Fruit', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Lips Of Faith - Transatlantique Kriek', 'review/timeUnix': 1271726959, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '51019', 'beer/brewerId': '192', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 1, 'min': 29, 'sec': 19, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 110, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '22oz bottle, im pretty sure it said 5.5% abv, not 8%\t\tthis was gifted to me by a friend who assumed all "lips of faith" releases are created equally\t\tappearance: really a fantastic bottle design - very sharp...served in new glarus flute, pale strawberry body, very light white foam - no lace. \t\tsmell: tart cranberry, cherry, vinegar, apple peel\t\ttaste: not a huge fan of the kriek sub-genre...this one provides the vinegar you\'d expect, sourness is downnplayed - tart cherry and cranberry, light oak. nothing really that wrong with this one - just not something i would turn to again\t\tmouthfeel: sourness in an unpleasant way, vinegary\t\tdrinkability: ok', 'user/profileName': 'dirtylou', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Black & Blue', 'review/timeUnix': 1304978446, 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '32437', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 22, 'min': 0, 'sec': 46, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 129, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A - Clear amber body with a large foamy offwhite head.\t\tS - A big bouquet of raspberries and blueberries. Fresh, sweet, tangy fruit aromas. Floral hop notes.\t\tT - Tangy fruit with a buttery back note. Sweet splash of soft fruit liquor and tangy hops. Fruit-like acidity, akin to apple skin. Blueberry and dark fruit present here. Tangy starches and spiced alcohol bring depth to this beers flavors.\t\tM - Warming, drying medium body. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'WychCraft', 'review/timeUnix': 1189988595, 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '27190', 'beer/brewerId': '160', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 0, 'min': 23, 'sec': 15, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 260, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A clear light amber to dark gold colored ale. Good tall white head forms and then falls some but doesn't disappear.\t\tThe smell is sweet with a little musty and earth scent like mushrooms. Little bit of butter mixes in with the malt aroma, which is mostly biscuit. Little bit of wood and leather is also present in the scent. Slight tea, tobacco and wood aroma from the English hops used.\t\tThe taste begins sweet and malty with a stouter than anticipated bitterness. This has a strong pipe tobacco flavor to it that is different and rather nice. This is a nice ale but it could be a little stronger it just seems to mellow out a little too much after a while.\t\tThe mouthfeel is good.\t\tA pricey yet good ale without too much of the butter flavor that you come to expect from a Wychwood beer and Ringwood yeast strains. Worth a try for sure but I can't really see reaching for this beer again because of the cost. For less money I will be reaching for the Lagunitas and Firestone beers for normal consumption.", 'user/profileName': 'Zorro', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Unearthly (Imperial India Pale Ale)', 'review/timeUnix': 1199942187, 'user/gender': 'Female', 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '28577', 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 5, 'min': 16, 'sec': 27, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 10, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Sort of an deeper honey color with a white fluffy head. Aromas of grapefruit tempered by earthy malt. The flavor is much the same, with the addition of a super sweet malt+alcohol taste that also provides a rich and somewhat sticky body. I went in kinda fast, but wound up sipping and savoring modestly at the end. Very strong brew that masks itself well, though this is in the neutral zone of American DIPA and Barley Wine.', 'user/profileName': 'dedrinker', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Uitzet Tripel (1730)', 'review/timeUnix': 1148859576, 'beer/ABV': 6.8, 'beer/beerId': '10535', 'beer/brewerId': '3054', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 23, 'min': 39, 'sec': 36, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 148, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': 'Served from a plain-looking, yellow labled 750, this Tripel pours out bright, lightly clouded apricot yellow with a fantastisly dense and chunky white head that has epic retention and tons of stick. Beautiful.\t\tAroma is so much bigger than I expected from a Tripel that (only) registers at 6.8%. Big, tropical and orchard fruit with funky, yeasty spice and a pepper/coriander bite. Green apple and pear is shadowed by honeyish, Pilsneresque malts, and complex, phenolic undertones featuring banana and buttery croissant.\t\tFlavor registers equally high in my book. So surprising becuase it is relatively low abv% compared to the highest rated Tripels. A complex malt and fruit entry is kicked up by creamy-sweet lemon curd, grated Key lime peel, freshly baked pie crust, grahm cracker, and fluffy cotton candy. The finish is well-hopped with soft nuances of white pepper infused green herbs and Saazy earthyness. Complex and dry, excellent.', 'user/profileName': 'AlexJ', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Brooklyn Brown Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1167608359, 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '146', 'beer/brewerId': '45', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 31, 'hour': 23, 'min': 39, 'sec': 19, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 365, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A: A 12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass yields a brown ale with ruby hues and a 1/2 inch fluffy khaki/tan head. Chunks of lacing cling to the side of the glass as I drink my way down -- certainly looks nice. . . .\t\tS: Sweet malty scents dominate -- caramel malt, hazelnut, some chocolate and brown sugar. Not particularly strong, but not weak or watered-down in the nose either.\t\tT: Like the nose -- malty flavors: caramel, burnt sugar and hazelnut but with a slightly bitter aftertaste providing decent balance.\t\tM: Light-bodied; plenty of carbonation. Could use a little more heft.\t\tD: Very good -- a light body and solid flavors make this one go down easy.\t\tNotes: I had this on tap recently after doing some Christmas shopping -- a big 23 oz draft -- and it was excellent. May have been a little bit better than the bottle, or it could have been that I really needed a break from shopping at that point.', 'user/profileName': 'Kendo', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Oaked Arrogant Bastard Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1189965053, 'beer/ABV': 7.2, 'beer/beerId': '8951', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 17, 'min': 50, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 259, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Finally got my hands on this one.\t\tA beautiful deep scarlet color, with a thick tan head. The head lasted a long time.\t\tLots of pine hop aroma, with a some caramel malt and a touch of oaky alcohol. The taste is thick with malt, big citrusy hops, and a little alcohol. I must say the oak aging really does it's part in mellowing the alcohol and hop bite of the traditional AB. there is a complexity to this beer that is definitely not evident in the original.\t\tNot a heavy beer at all, it easily belies its 7+% ABV. I could drink a few of these.", 'user/profileName': 'ZimZamZoom', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Heavy Seas - Big DIPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1256836570, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 25, 1981', 'beer/ABV': 10.6, 'beer/beerId': '50530', 'user/birthdayUnix': 372841200, 'beer/brewerId': '898', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 17, 'min': 16, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 302, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1045494248, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': "Pours a slightly hazed copper color with a pretty good off-white head on top. Keeps a thin lace but leaves a ton of sticky rings on the sides.\t\tSmells boozy and sweet, with a hot fusel alcohol aroma plus some sweet syrupy caramel, honey, overripe peaches, and booze soaked oranges. Really not loving this nose at all. There is some juicy fruit going on here but it's soaked in booze and it's overly sweet.\t\tTaste is a bit better but this is definitely not a top notch DIPA I'm drinking here. It's quite sweet, with a big candied fruit and honey flavor. There is some fruit, but like the nose, it's not a bright and floral hoppy sort of fruitiness, but instead a sticky sweet concentrated juice sort of fruit flavor. It's also pretty boozy and actually feels out of balance in the malt direction, which is surprising for a DIPA. I don't think the 75 IBUs were enough for the hefty malt bill on this one, and I also don't think they were well spent - the hop flavor is very uninspiring, with a moderate level of bitterness for the style.\t\tMouthfeel is quite hot but does have a redeeming creaminess to it. Still, the alcohol in the back of the throat is too much.\t\tFrankly, this is one of the worst DIPAs I've ever had. It's a boozy, unbalanced mess, completely lacking in redeeming hop character. I don't know that I'd pick up even a reformulated version of this, as this is no easy fix. Avoid.", 'user/profileName': 'number1bum', 'review/aroma': 2.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': "Bell's Amber Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1143255190, 'beer/ABV': 5.8, 'beer/beerId': '794', 'beer/brewerId': '287', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 2, 'min': 53, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 84, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 1.0, 'review/text': 'New penny in color. Im sorry, forgive me, but I just cant get excited about Amber ales with no hop aroma. Subtle malt aroma, with a light hint of caramel and a suggestion of doughy yeast. Youd think malt magician Larry Bell could come up with something a little better smelling than this. Mild, mediocre malt flavor, which is very crisp, but overall husky. Caramel and toasted malt flavors, with herbaceous, weedy hops. Lacking bitterness and a pronounced hop flavor and aroma. This seems like an amber ale from a crappy brewpub.', 'user/profileName': 'Crosling', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English India Pale Ale (IPA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Karl Strauss Stargazer Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1252597439, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 11, 1973', 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '12294', 'user/birthdayUnix': 116578800, 'beer/brewerId': '4146', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 15, 'min': 43, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 253, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1301756647, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '(Served in a small weizen glass)\t\tA- This beer has a slightly dense orange body with a creamy tan head that last for a sip. There is a gentle carbonation of big bubbles that glide to the surface. \t\tS- This beer has a green citrus aroma with a fresh raw malt finish coming through as the beer warms. It was served ice cold.\t\tT- The juicy full citrus hops flavor has a soft grapefruit flavor to it followed by a sweet caramel malt flavor. There is a note of dry toffee to the malt as it warms and the finish is a soft bitter green note that really grows as the beer warms. \t\tM- This beer has a medium mouthfeel with a tight fizz finish and no alcohol heat noticed. \t\tD- This is a well built IPA with cascade hop flavors all the way. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Santa's Private Reserve Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1103927216, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '1173', 'beer/brewerId': '132', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 22, 'min': 26, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 359, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "I've never seen this in Texas before so I had to pick it up. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Butte Creek Organic India Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1197151595, 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '2906', 'beer/brewerId': '762', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 22, 'min': 6, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 342, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Got this bottle at Siciliano's in Michigan-a great store if you are in West Michigan to visit. \t\tPours a nice copper color with a big head that settles down to a light foam within a minute or so. The smell is nice hoppiness, and also a bit yeasty. \t\tThe hops definitely take over in this beer, with some yeastiness & light malt coming through too. There isnt alot of body or dimension to it overall as the hops seem to be the dominant feature-some dryness and bread hints at the end of each sip at the back of my throat. \t\tGoes down a bit bitter with a bit of lacing on the side of the glass and little carbonation. \t\tI dont think that this is my favorite of this style, but I'm glad that I tried it. I wonder actually how much better for me (or the environment) it is since it is organic?", 'user/profileName': 'jspruit', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'M\xc3\xa4rzen / Oktoberfest', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Harpoon Frankenfest (100 Barrel Series #16)', 'review/timeUnix': 1176244275, 'beer/ABV': 6.9, 'beer/beerId': '33147', 'beer/brewerId': '10097', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 22, 'min': 31, 'sec': 15, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 100, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Frankenfest pours a clear amber color with some small bubbles floating slowly up from the bottom of the glass. On top a fluffy white head grows quickly to a 2 finger width. The head slowly dissolves back to the beer leaving behind lots of nets and sheets of lace on the glass. The aroma is a bit faint and has pleasant notes of caramel malt, apple, peach and some grassy hops.\t\tEach sip of this medium bodied beer is somewhat chewy with a firm carbonated fizz on the tip of the tongue. The flavor is mainly malt. Caramel, toast and a hint of chocolate are present. In the middle there's some fruity notes of peach. It finishes with a hoppy taste of lemon citrus. Once gone a caramel malt taste lingers in the palate.\t\tThis is an easy drinking, tasty beer. It would definitely make a great seasonal.", 'user/profileName': 'WanderingFool', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Thomas Hooker Hop Meadow IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1226159536, 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '20389', 'beer/brewerId': '696', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 15, 'min': 52, 'sec': 16, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 313, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Copper body with some lazy carbonation bubbles floating around. Huge, fluffy, rocky head. It fills up your glass and sticks around for a long time. Leaves plenty of nice sticky lacing behind too.\t\tSmell is hops and hops. Citrusy, bitter, earthy.\t\tThis is really tasty. Bitter and lemon flavors mix up front. This has some of the more intense citrus flavored hops I have ever encountered. Next comes some more hops, as it gets through the bitter and has an earthy grassy flavor to it. Rounds out with some biscuity malt. Mouthfeel is a little bit oily, but the finish is a little bit dry and hoppy.\t\tThis is a drinkable beer for sure. A really good IPA that I will definitely buy again.', 'user/profileName': 'Hojaminbag', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Bi\xc3\xa8re de Garde', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Abbaye De Saint Bon-Chien', 'review/timeUnix': 1319769526, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 11.0, 'beer/beerId': '30955', 'beer/brewerId': '2958', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 2, 'min': 38, 'sec': 46, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 301, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'had a firkin of this, 2010 vintage, at Nerax at Novare Res.\t\tPours a hazy amber orange-red colored beer with a light fizzy head as usual for cask.\t\tNose has a nice tart sour fruit aroma, great tart fruits that just dance around the nostrils, berry, lots of grape skin, bit of Brett funk and lactobacillis like acidic fruit, nice funk overall.\t\tTaste brings a great funk and sour/tart fruit, berry, light sour fruit and sour malts, bit of Brett funk as well, lactobacillis again bringing some acidic tastes, bit grainy and bready, and some interesting berry fruit with a bit of grape skin and seed. Finishes with a bready malt, tart flemmy fruit, sour but not puckering, a bit more grape skin and dark red wine, and even a hint of oak and vanilla, hint of booze.\t\tMouth is med bodied, bit of warming booze and acidic feel, good carb esp for cask.\t\tOverall awesome, so tasty, great tart sour fruits, sour malts, a bit bready, not mouth puckering or over the top, very tasty and nice funk to it at the same time.', 'user/profileName': 'jlindros', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'True Blonde Dubbel', 'review/timeUnix': 1278364273, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '19424', 'beer/brewerId': '923', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 21, 'min': 11, 'sec': 13, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 186, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "22 oz. bomber, as seen in the picture. Golden yellow with a slight chill haze and substantial amount of carbonation. A thin white head that dissipates quickly. Not much lace to speak of. Banana and clove aroma along with a honey sweetness. Very smooth up front, despite the carbonation. Not much going up front, except a hint at what I get to be turmeric. The esters make their way out in the middle and end. Cloves predominate. On the sweet side in the end with a hint of bitterness. Reminds me of a less sweet version of Dogfish Head's Chateau Jiahu. Alcohol well disguised, but a bit on the sweet side for me.", 'user/profileName': 'LittleDon', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Winter Warmer', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Holiday Spice Lager Beer', 'review/timeUnix': 1109472651, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 11.0, 'beer/beerId': '3542', 'beer/brewerId': '741', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 2, 'min': 50, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 58, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a light brown with an orange hue. Medium head is white. Generous nose - holiday spice indeed....ginger, cinammon, and the orange mentioned on the lable. Christmas spices in a bottle.\t\tNice velvety mouthfeel. Smooth, but full of flavor. Great balance between the spices and rich malts. The hop bill seems turned up on this years version. Alcohol warmth is also present.\t\tA significant amount of ginger, but not overpowering.\t\tGreat beer for holiday parties or just by a warm fire.\t\tLakefront has always produced a fine beer with this style, this year it is hoppier, a little less spicy - but still well spiced - and significantly higher in alcohol.\t\tA fantastic holiday beer.', 'user/profileName': 'sweethome', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Brown Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1312485737, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 29, 1986', 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '1647', 'user/birthdayUnix': 530956800, 'beer/brewerId': '486', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 19, 'min': 22, 'sec': 17, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 216, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 887378647, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Cheers to Goblinmunkey7 for half of this beer\t\tReview adapted from notes taken 4/2/11\t\tNote: Written in my notes as "Legend of the Brown Ale." Uhhh...\t\tAppearance: Brown with some hints of red, a nice, wispy white head with some lacing \t\tSmell: Mostly uninteresting - baked/toasted biscuits, caramel malts, toasted grains, some earthy hops\t\tTaste: Not bad, not exciting - dry biscuits, caramel malts, some hints of burnt malts, grains - hops seem very English in nature - hints of nuts\t\tMouthfeel: Smooth, a little light but it works, nicely carbonated\t\tOverall: Pretty boring but definitely not bad\t\tAs far as brown ales go, this is a little above average. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Verboten', 'review/timeUnix': 1281839982, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '58482', 'beer/brewerId': '392', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 2, 'min': 39, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 227, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Use to drink this from time to time when it was still called Zoten, but just as good still.\t\tA: Light creamy head that fades quickly, light golden amber pale color with pretty good clarity. \t\tN: Nose has a light Belgian quality with some sweetness maybe candi sugar. \t\tT: Taste is light and ambery but has some Belgian sweet candi sugar and a slight bitter aftertaste, it has a slight tangy quality. \t\tM: A light to medium body that speads over the tongue with decent carbonation.\t\tF: It finishes a little sweet and bitter and lingers, makes you smack your mouth a little, not bad, but could be better I think, the two main flavors, Belgian malts and hops, seem to clash, not enough Belgian and too much hops IMHO.', 'user/profileName': 'jlindros', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Gumballhead', 'review/timeUnix': 1147392919, 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '9478', 'beer/brewerId': '26', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 0, 'min': 15, 'sec': 19, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 132, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'This beer pours a whiskey brown with a touch of gold. The head starts tall, even and egg shell white, but fell to a thin film leaving some spots of lace.\t\tSmells of succulent juicy hops with nectarines and tasty pine. Underneath lies a powdery confectioners sugar. The smells simple, but it has me drooling.\t\tTastes of a biscuit dough and rye crisp malt with a tiny hint of honey that is hidden behind a tingly swarm of bubbles that distribute little pecks of grapefruit and piney hops. Finishes with a bit of dark wheat that goes well with the lingering dryness.\t\tThe mouth feel is really light and creamy smooth with a swarm of bubbles that nip at my mouth dispersing the dryness.\t\tThis ones really easy to drink and a nice change of pace for hoppy beers.', 'user/profileName': 'DarkerTheBetter', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Irish Dry Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Larkin's Irish Stout", 'review/timeUnix': 1079552075, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Apr 4, 1981', 'beer/ABV': 3.5, 'beer/beerId': '16459', 'user/birthdayUnix': 355219200, 'beer/brewerId': '456', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 19, 'min': 34, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 77, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1063116248, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'This beer is very good, but the consistency is not that great.
