It is very thick nad has a rather nice burnt malt taste with a little bit of a chocolate taste. It is one of the brewpubs weakest beers in terms of alcohol content. Overall is a good brew, but they need to work on its consistency. It is offered at different times throughout the year.', 'user/profileName': 'etho1416', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Wild Ale', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Duck Duck Gooze', 'review/timeUnix': 1266290772, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '51116', 'beer/brewerId': '18149', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 3, 'min': 26, 'sec': 12, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 47, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Bottle generously shared by ThirstyBird earlier in January.\t\tPour is bright straw yellow with a thin, fluffy head. Nose is puckeringly sour, lots of citric and lactic notes, good earthiness, a touch of cereal/grain. Taste is a fruit explosion -- pineapple dominates, peach/apricot and citrus follow, much less funk in the taste than the smell would indicate. Mouthfeel is classic gueuze, good body and spot-on carbonation. Will probably age very well.\t\tIncredibly impressive for any American brewery to construct a gueuze like this. Never bet against Lost Abbey sours.', 'user/profileName': 'jedwards', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Sierra Nevada Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1304739181, 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '276', 'beer/brewerId': '140', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 3, 'min': 33, 'sec': 1, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 127, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured from a bottle (1006 = 2011, 6th day) from the beer fridge at 45 degrees into a Spiegelau Stemmed Pilsner (tulip) glass. Poured 3/4 straight, then swirled the remainder to stir up the bottling yeast for the final 1/4 pour.\t\tA: Orangy-gold colored, somewhat cloudy due to the bottling yeast, with nice 1-1/2 finger frothy white head. Gorgeous matrix of lacing on the glass that sticks around quite a while. Maybe the best lacing I've seen from any beer.\t\tS: Citrusy and floral hops hit the nose first (rose petals), with a yeasty biscuit aroma hiding behind. Orange peel, mild grapefruit. Yummy.\t\tT: Follows the aroma, citrusy/grapefruity hops prevail with a fair amount of non-sweet malt to back it up. Hints of orange peel once again with a cleansing bitterness to finish it off.\t\tM: Adequate carbonation to carry the flavors, cleans the palate up nicely and finishes very dry.\t\tO: A true classic. No aftertaste to speak of, the palate is left completely cleansed after each sip and ready for another. The hops dominate with just enough yeasty goodness to balance it out. Everyone should try this at least once in their beerdrinking career.", 'user/profileName': 'DrewV', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Stone Smoked Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1193591468, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '90', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 17, 'min': 11, 'sec': 8, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 301, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': '22 oz. bottle\t\tPours a dark ruby to brown in color with a lacey head.\t\tSmells of coffee, chocolate and a bit of smokey essence.\t\tTaste is very thick and malty, like a porter should taste. \t\tMouthfeel thick and a bit chewy, but that is to be expected.\t\tI could drink these all of the time in the winter months. A very good porter.', 'user/profileName': 'metallistout', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Brewhouse Brown Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1066946745, 'beer/ABV': 5.4, 'beer/beerId': '2299', 'beer/brewerId': '458', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 22, 'min': 5, 'sec': 45, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 296, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Its hazy mahogany body is topped by a light tan head of foam that holds quite well and leaves some jagged and craggy rings of lace at the outset. The nose is yeasty and fruity above a mildly caramelish and nutty malt. The body is medium/light and its very fine, natural carbonation is lightly zesty in the mouth. Chocolate and caramel mingle well together in the flavor along with a slight fruitiness, a light yeast bite, and some leafy hops. It's well balanced by a low-key bitterness and it finishes short and dry with just some residual nutty malt. This is probably quite excellent in cask conditioned form, but it seems to fall a bit short in the bottle.", 'user/profileName': 'NeroFiddled', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Munich Dunkel Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Warsteiner Premium Dunkel', 'review/timeUnix': 1300061782, 'beer/ABV': 4.9, 'beer/beerId': '1611', 'beer/brewerId': '360', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 0, 'min': 16, 'sec': 22, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 73, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Pours out very dark to the point of pitch, a white head bubbles like uncooked pizza dough...\t\tSmells of light coca cola and wheat sweet wet grains and roast\t\tSweet and sour immediately come to tongue with a split wheat flavor. Almost a sourdough afterthought. Not too complicated, but then it is not meant to be. Without that semi sour tinge this would perhaps be a waste of time\t\tMouthfeel is light bodied with champagne bubbles\t\tYou could drink these until you die because the flavor won't slow you down. It is a weak beer and maybe something to give to beginners to cut their palates on", 'user/profileName': 'JoeAmerican77', 'review/aroma': 2.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Dortmunder / Export Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Distelh\xc3\xa4user Landbier', 'review/timeUnix': 1227822389, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '24208', 'beer/brewerId': '6807', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 21, 'min': 46, 'sec': 29, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 332, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '500ml slim brown bottle, BB 10/08, served lightly chilled in a pint-size weizen glass.\t\tA: looking like a Mrzen bier, with an elegant bright reddish amber hue, coming with a well-lasting layer of creamy off-white froth on top of abundant streams of fine carbonation.\tS: a good level of prune-ish sourness (likely due to prolonged lager-ing of the unfiltered product), and caramelised sugary malt dominates the aroma, backed by apple-ly fruits, doughy notes, and a touch of dust like most lager-bier.\tT: a soothing flavour of lightly infused black-tea-ish bitterness precedes a loose-textured swallow of apple-ly fruits and floral hops... turning slightly more bitter in the aftertaste, with plenty of mildly-flavoured herbal hops to linger as well as the prune-ish sour-sweet fruits.\tM&D: the carbonation comes so soothing and not imposing at all, plus the slightly sour and length bitter palate, this Landbier proves a very easy-to-drink example of the style.', 'user/profileName': 'wl0307', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Val-Dieu Triple', 'review/timeUnix': 1064714563, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '2576', 'beer/brewerId': '826', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 2, 'min': 2, 'sec': 43, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 271, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'This triple pours a yellow/amber color with large carbonation and a thick creamy head. The head diminishes quickly but leave a smooth layer of sticky lace. The smell is earthy, but somewhat fruity (cotton candyish)with a hint of cherries. The flavor has stong hints of alcohol, with a sweet start and a very quick dry finish- like a wine. Smoother and sweeter as it warms. The mouth feel is creamy and smooth with a somewhat dry finish.\t\tIMHO: The temperature has a significant impact in the representation of the flavor and consistency. I really felt I had it at the best temp possible when I first tasted it, and was somewhat disappointed. As the beer warmed it became much smoother, sweeter and well balanced. A pretty good Belgian', 'user/profileName': 'SeanChouffe', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Herbed / Spiced Beer', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Juniper Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1135759221, 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '702', 'beer/brewerId': '132', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 8, 'min': 40, 'sec': 21, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 362, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "A decent flavored pale ale, but nothing to write home about.\t\tPours a medium gold/copper in color, slightly hazy with notable carbonation. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Berserker Imperial Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1290018771, 'beer/ABV': 12.7, 'beer/beerId': '27339', 'beer/brewerId': '385', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 18, 'min': 32, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 321, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Thanks to Kan for sharing with us!\t\tA - Pours black, mocha head, some nice lacing and retention left behind after it all settled down. Chocolate, oak, caramel, burnt sugars, some booze. A good amount of complexity between the oak, sweetness, and alcohol notes. Very solid.\t\tM - Full bodied, rich, smooth, light carbonation, creamy yet dry finish.\t\tD - One glass was enough for me. A very big RIS monster. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Samuel Smith's Old Brewery Pale Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1270432271, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '575', 'beer/brewerId': '113', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 1, 'min': 51, 'sec': 11, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 95, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Samuel Smith's Old Brewery Pale Ale. 12 oz. \t\tAppearance:\tPours a deep and lively copper -- similar to but darker than the Samuel Smith's IPA. Wild off white head and sea spray lace.\t\tAroma:\tA rich maltiness coupled with some fresh and inviting fruits -- almost candy-like.\t\tTaste:\tThere's a wonderfully tempered malt sweetness backed by juicy fruity hops. The malts are biscuity and the hops definitely have a nice bitter punch to them.\t\tMouthfeel:\tMedium-bodied and dry --just as an English pale ale should be. It's also a bit grainy, which adds some interesting texture.\t\tDrinkability:\tThis just has such a nice combination of complex but mild flavors that it's hard to stop quaffing.", 'user/profileName': 'BeerNemesis', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Leffe Blonde', 'review/timeUnix': 1319679753, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.6, 'beer/beerId': '2137', 'beer/brewerId': '470', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 1, 'min': 42, 'sec': 33, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 300, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Enjoyed this 12 oz beer out of a pint glass.\t\tA: Pours a clear golden color with a huge 4-finger white head that lasts forever. \t\tS: Spicy phenolic aroma with hints of hops.\t\tT: Smooth heavy malt brew with sweet spices and alcohol in the background. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English India Pale Ale (IPA)', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'ImPaled Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1157345845, 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '331', 'beer/brewerId': '103', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 4, 'min': 57, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 247, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured a clear orange with a big, frothy, white head. Nice retention and impressive lacings.\t\tVery aromatic, with a massive grapefruit smell. Orange rind and sweet pine notes are also abundantly present.\t\tBittersweet grapefruit blends with a nice mixture of hops. The aftertaste is dry and bitter. Not as much bitterness as I would have liked and somewhat one dimensional with the citrus taste. After such a formidable aroma, I was a little disappointed. The flavor is not very different from Middle Age's Wailing Wench.\t\tNicely carbonated with an excellent mouthfeel. This is a very drinkable IPA.\t\tI love Middle Ages marketing scheme but I'm disappointed with the mediocre tastes in so many of their offerings. This is another underachieving beer. It has a great deal of potential but the taste is forgettable.", 'user/profileName': 'Estarrio', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': "Santa's Little Helper", 'review/timeUnix': 1132813750, 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '34203', 'beer/brewerId': '5318', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 6, 'min': 29, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 328, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Yeah, I've been sitting on this one about a year and I finally encountered the right time to crack it open. Thanks to OstrungT for the bottle and three BAs for sharing it at a BA gathering organized by crosling. Pours a one-finger brown head over a pitch black liquid. No edging when held to light. Smells chocolate and toffee with a hint of alcohol sting. Coffee upon further examination. Tastes sour tart black patent, but also sweet caramel and toffee. Coffee is understated compared to the other flavors and I picked up either some falling apart grassy hops or some developing cardboard (ie; oxidation). Dry coffee roasty aftertaste. Md-heavy to heavy body and moderately carbonated.", 'user/profileName': 'mentor', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Portsmouth Retro Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1309825722, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '70533', 'beer/brewerId': '596', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 0, 'min': 28, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 186, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'On tap at the brewpub.\t\tFizzy 1 finger head fades at a med pace, little lacing, clear yellowish slight carrot orange color.\t\tNose has very light malts, some slight earthy and bit herbal UK style bittering hops touch of fruity hops as well.\t\tTaste had a mild grassy slight herbal and touch fruity hop, a bit of bitterness that ramps a bit, bit of grainy malts, semi sweet. Finishes a bit more bitter, light lingering hops, bit of malts as well.\t\tMouth is med to slightly lighter bodied dec carb.\t\tOverall not bad, not quite the pale I was expecting as the hop profile is completely different, but tasty and done well.Fizzy 1 finger head fades at a med pace, little lacing, clear yellowish slight carrot orange color.', 'user/profileName': 'jlindros', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Brownstone', 'review/timeUnix': 1264117741, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 19, 1968', 'beer/ABV': 5.7, 'beer/beerId': '22192', 'user/birthdayUnix': -37904400, 'beer/brewerId': '10607', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 23, 'min': 49, 'sec': 1, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 21, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1456239847, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "On-tap at Sixpoint/Jimmy's No. 43 vegetarian beer dinner\t\tA: Pours a dark amber with a one-finger head that fades to nice lace.\t\tS: Roast malt with strong American hop scent. \t\tT: Although a brown ale, this tastes remarkably much like a stout (which is one of my favorite styles). {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Hennepin (Farmhouse Saison)', 'review/timeUnix': 1102640857, 'beer/ABV': 7.7, 'beer/beerId': '141', 'beer/brewerId': '42', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 1, 'min': 7, 'sec': 37, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 345, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "I'm drinking the first release of cave aged Hennepin from 2001, bottle #2825 of 3360 in celebration of the birth of my beautiful daughter Sadie.\t\tThe cork was very hard to get out, but when it went it went with an audible pop. It pours a golden orange with a huge white head that fades to a 0.5cm coating on the top of the beer. The aroma is floral, spicy (coriander and clove) with strong hints of orange peel. Taste is spicy, slightly sour, hoppy and pergaps a bit of clover honey. Slightly slick mouthfeel, with a warming alcohol finish. Extremely smooth and drinkable, and seems to have mellowed with its time in the cave and the cellar. A great celebratory drink and if you can find the 2001 edition, you'll be happy you did.", 'user/profileName': 'ColForbin', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Immort Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1224894337, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 11.0, 'beer/beerId': '199', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 0, 'min': 25, 'sec': 37, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 299, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "12oz bottle into a pint glass.\t\tA - Deep amber / dark copper with a small head that leaves a tight ring after each sip.\t\tS - Sweet and complex malt up front with a mild spice/hop background.\t\tT - Incredible balance here. Sweet caramels and bread notes finish with citrus bite and pine aftertaste. The 11% ABV is completely unnoticed. Scary.\t\tM - Moderate body and only slightly under-carbonated for my taste. Leaves a mild oil coating.\t\tD - For 11%, this one has a VERY high drinkability. You might even think you'll live forever!", 'user/profileName': 'ectomorph', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Founders Dirty Bastard', 'review/timeUnix': 1201420023, 'beer/ABV': 8.5, 'beer/beerId': '7463', 'beer/brewerId': '1199', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 7, 'min': 47, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 27, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': '12 ounce bottle acquired in a trade with pimpp, thanks for letting me try this beer, split with my roommate tonight\t\tPoured into my Dogifsh Head snifter with a nice deep brown color, a 3/4 inch vanilla colored head that stuck around a minute or so, some rention but not much lacing\t\tSmell had maple syrup, butter, cream, tons of different sweet malts, toffe, caramel, a hint of dark fruit, a tiny amount of hoppiness, mostly candy-like scents that lured you in\t\tTaste was smooth and easy to drink for a scotch ale, tried to pace myself but drank it pretty fast anyways, everything in the aroma is present in its flavor, sweet malt all the way through with a little boozy character thrown in there, vanilla and sugar really stick out, some nice toffee and caramel accents, mild hoppy presence provides some balance, a lot sweeter than I expected overall but was certainly not a bad thing\t\tBody was fairly thick for this beer style with a limited amount of carbonation, creamy mouthfeel that had a long lasting taste that kept me wanting more\t\tCould not drink too much of this solely because of its heaviness and high alcohol percentage, very smooth for how sweet it is, alcohol is hidden pretty well and there is no single overwhelming flavor, a couple bottles would do the trick with this one\t\tAnother good beer from Founders to add to their list of many, wanted to try this one before I popped open its barrel aged version, Backwoods, in a few weeks or so, highly recommended and a damn good beer for its price, think it is available year round to boot, would definitely drink again in the future if I got the opportunity', 'user/profileName': 'Floydster', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'I Hardcore You', 'review/timeUnix': 1304593709, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 9, 1985', 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '61128', 'user/birthdayUnix': 489740400, 'beer/brewerId': '16315', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 11, 'min': 8, 'sec': 29, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 125, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 928595047, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Served from bottle into a Delirium Tremens snifter. Poured burnt orange with a half finger off-white head that subsided to a minimal amount quickly. Maintained nice lacing throughout the glass. The aroma was comprised of sweet malt, citrus, citrus hop, caramel, and sweet alcohol. The flavor was of sweet malt, citrus, caramel, citrus hop, and subtle sweet alcohol. It had a medium feel on the palate with medium-high carbonation. Overall this was a pretty good brew. Very nice flavor and aroma going on in this one. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Smuttynose Star Island Single', 'review/timeUnix': 1302311773, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '43132', 'beer/brewerId': '141', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 1, 'min': 16, 'sec': 13, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 99, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Bottle into a tulip glass. \t\tA - Aggressive pour leads to a big foamy, bubbly head that dissipated pretty quickly and left some lacing on the glass. Its a nice bright yellow color and hazy - I could not see through it at all.\t\tS - Very little smell. Some lemons, some malt. Nothing overpowering in the least. Virtually no hops.\t\tT - Again, lemons. The description on the website claims there are some tropical fruits, but if those aren\'t the lemons then I don\'t know what they are. There is a honey-ness to it, which is kind of pleasant.\t\tD - Drinkable, which I guess is the point because the bottle labels it as a "session ale." It\'s good, but not great. Different from what I usually drink, so I don\'t really know what to compare it to. I could drink a few of these though, no problems or complaints.', 'user/profileName': 'tkelley', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Barleywine', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Sierra Nevada Bigfoot Barleywine Style Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1174959675, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Apr 13, 1983', 'beer/ABV': 9.6, 'beer/beerId': '2671', 'user/birthdayUnix': 419068800, 'beer/brewerId': '140', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 1, 'min': 41, 'sec': 15, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 86, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 999266647, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "2007 vintage - I have come to the conclusion that many American barleywines, especially Bigfoot, do not benefit from long aging. This is a style that emphasize both hops and malt, and if you age it too long, the hops will fade too much.\t\tPours a deep burnished copper color with a big thick head leaving much lace on the glass.\t\tCitrus, pine, lemony, almost spicy hops, with a sweetish caramel-toffee aroma backing it up. Hops dominate, but malt is well represented. Alcohol evident.\t\tIntense resiny hops up front along with a big blast of intense maltiness - kettle caramelization, perhaps...Very piney hoppiness. Ethanol flavor comes in and makes its presence known as it all melds together for a intensely bittersweet hop-flavored finish. Leaves an aftertaste of powerful American C-hops.\t\tMouthfeel: medium-full with medium carbonation. Creamy with a slick feel on the tongue.\t\tDrinkability - I like barleywine. This one is a drinkin' barleywine - well balanced.\t\t\tI have really come to love this beer, and I now always look forward to picking up a case or two when it comes out every year. If Sierra Nevada asked me to pick a single beer for them to brew year round, this would be it - the best of both worlds, intensely malty and hoppy at the same time.", 'user/profileName': 'beertastegood', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Witbier', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'LongShot Cranberry Wit', 'review/timeUnix': 1269377260, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '46903', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 20, 'min': 47, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 82, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'A - Poured a hazy orange color with a white head that leaves lacing behind\t\tS - Is fairly light but has a cranberry juice nose\t\tT - Starts off like your average wit with wheaty malt touch of citrus but the cranberry really comes out in the finish \t\tM - This beer has a light body with high carbonation to it\t\tD - This was a very enjoyable beer I went into this one with some doubts but was pleasantly surprised it has a good taste thats easy to drink worth picking up to try', 'user/profileName': 'armock', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': "Evelyn's Imperial Sunshine", 'review/timeUnix': 1311058797, 'beer/ABV': 7.2, 'beer/beerId': '50845', 'beer/brewerId': '16353', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 6, 'min': 59, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 200, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'On tap at Hopworks in Portland Oregon.\t\tA: 1.8" white head over nearly clear straw liquid.\t\tS: The smell is peppery with hops and yeast.\t\tT: Peppery, citrus, with a nice aftertaste.\t\tM: Medium level of fine carbonation.\t\tO: A smooth and refreshing Imperial IPA.', 'user/profileName': 'DaftCaskBC', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Rare Vos (Amber Ale)', 'review/timeUnix': 1066354977, 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '593', 'beer/brewerId': '42', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 1, 'min': 42, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 290, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A very nice ale from Cooperstown. This good looking brew is a very murky deep red amber with an exquisite and creamy, tightly-formed tan head that retains beautifully and laces with remarkable gusto. Beer rarely looks much better than this one does.\t\tThe nose is very nice and provides hints of yeast, fruit and spice, along with a very strong alcohol sense that seems higher than its rating. A smooth, creamy feel crosses the lips and provides a bready and yeasty sense very quickly. Lighter notes of fruit and spice enter as each sip settles in and hints at a very nice complexity. The body is lighter and thinner than normally noted in this style. This is followed by a less than crisp, but notably clean finish. The drinkability seems quite good and I can imagine a setting with several of these consumed.', 'user/profileName': 'AtLagerHeads', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Witbier', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Hitachino Nest White Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1102298581, 'user/gender': 'Female', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '2013', 'beer/brewerId': '697', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 2, 'min': 3, 'sec': 1, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 341, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "11 oz stubby. Bottle-conditioned. Code on back H.2.11\t\tCloudy apricot glow under creamy white head that billows up and settles into fluffy clumps as it falls. No lace. \t\tEnticing sweet spicy orange scent that takes on a slightly metallic, marmalade tone as the level falls the beer warms. \t\tMore marmalade in the flavor with lots of orange and strong apricot tones. The suggestion of pepper in the chilled beer fades as it warms. Tinny elements emerge with warmth. Prickly carbonation in medium light body.\t\tFaint resiny finish that lingers until after you forget it's there and then it reminds you that it's been a while since you had a sip.\t\tI think I short-changed this beer by pouring too carefully. That left a sticky pad of yeast on the bottom, which turned to be quite tasty. I still got a fair amount of spice, but it would have been much more distinctive if I had swirled up the yeast properly.", 'user/profileName': 'gentlebubbles', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Rye Beer', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Rugbr\xc3\xb8d', 'review/timeUnix': 1272399186, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '53132', 'beer/brewerId': '16866', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 20, 'min': 13, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 117, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "On tap at Brixies in Brookfield IL\t\tIt pours a muddy brown with a quickly dissipating head. A small ring of bubbles line the edge of the glass.\t\tThe nose is very reminiscent of rye bread. It's the most dominating rye smell I've ever had in a rye beer. It's just loaded with spiciness, breadiness and malt. I think this beer is now a benchmark on how much rye smell can be packed into a beer\t\tThe taste has an upfront caramel sweetness to it that then transforms into this rye spicy rye taste in level which are present in the nose. A level of bitterness is there in just enough force to balance the beer from becoming a malt bomb. I'm unsure of the percentage of malt used in this beer but it has to be fairly high since this beer is just dominated by this heavy rye flavor. I'm really liking how aggressive it is and his beer screams rye.\t\tThe carbonation is at a medium level and the mouthfeel is pretty full bodied which helps the beer feel like a liquid loaf of rye bread. It hides the ABV perfectly without even a trace of alcohol smell of taste hitting my nose or mouth. It's really a great beer that defines the style for me currently.", 'user/profileName': 'weatherdog', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'V-Saison', 'review/timeUnix': 1194896095, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Nov 1, 1981', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '24759', 'user/birthdayUnix': 373449600, 'beer/brewerId': '345', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 19, 'min': 34, 'sec': 55, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 316, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1044885847, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured from the caged adn corked bottle an almost dull yellow, cloudy but with a large foamy head. \tSweet citrus and malt, floral and herbal notes in the nose. Yeast and bread also. Very pleasant.\tThe taste was dominated by the sweet and citrus, with a good balance of bready/yeasty taste. Not very subtle, the taste of this saision can definitely be described as 'big'.\tMedium to light bodied, the sweet seemed to outweigh any other feel and faded too quickly. \tDrinkable for sure but not a fantastic farmhouse; a good sharing beer and a great effort on Victory's part.", 'user/profileName': 'sinistrsam', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Witbier', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Celis White', 'review/timeUnix': 1213662377, 'beer/ABV': 3.9, 'beer/beerId': '5222', 'beer/brewerId': '565', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 0, 'min': 26, 'sec': 17, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 169, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': '12-oz bottle poured into a pilsner.\t\tA = Slightly hazy golden liquid, very small white head with no retention, no lacing.\t\tS = Light spices, rough grain mustard smells with just a touch of tart vinegar, light notes of plastic though detract from an otherwise good smell.\t\tT = Light banana, white pepper, lemon zest, coriander. Quite a bit going on and all very well balanced. Long dry finish.\t\tM = Medium-light body, good mouthcoating, nice carbonation level.\t\tD = Good drinkability, I found the sight and smell substandard but the taste made up for it and I could see drinking this one as a session ber on a hot day.', 'user/profileName': 'Traquairlover', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'English Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Black Creek Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1321300586, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Nov 28, 1983', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '51412', 'user/birthdayUnix': 438854400, 'beer/brewerId': '20220', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 19, 'min': 56, 'sec': 26, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 318, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 979481047, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Pours deep brown with one finger of tan head and a little lace. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Matilda', 'review/timeUnix': 1311448132, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '4318', 'beer/brewerId': '1549', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 19, 'min': 8, 'sec': 52, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 204, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Friend of mine is cleaning out his beer fridge and is taking random beers to random get togethers....I was lucky to score a six that contained a 2010 Matilda. Poured the beer into a tulip glass and so far like what I am drinking. The appearance is orangish/copper with white head that is lacing nicely. The smell is typical of Belgium beers...clove and spice. The taste follows suite....not much banana as i would have expected, but nice clove and spice that wasn't tooo overpowering. The mouthfeel is down graded slightly cuz I do taste alcohol. Overall this is a good beer.", 'user/profileName': 'WoodBrew', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Moose Drool Brown Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1108723502, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '2296', 'beer/brewerId': '751', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 10, 'min': 45, 'sec': 2, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 49, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Got this one on tap at Kelly's Olympian in Portland. Lighting made the colour difficult to ascertain, but I would be surprised if it weren't a very dark brown. Came with a good head which stuck around, adding to the feel of the pint.\t\tI'm useless on the sniff test in these smoky bars, so all I could distinguish was a malty cherry whiff.\t\tFelt very smooth and went down very easily. Was sweeter and more syrupy than I would expect an English Brown Ale to be. The smell did prove indicative of the initial taste, although where I expected it to give way to a somewhat hoppy finish, a thankfully subtle coffee flavour kicked in instead. I detest coffee, but this was subtle enough to be tolerable.", 'user/profileName': 'charlatan', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Pecan Harvest Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1255921063, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '35134', 'beer/brewerId': '3', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 2, 'min': 57, 'sec': 43, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 292, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': 'Hmm... Not really what I was hoping for after a lovely Brooklyn Local 2 from the brewery, but its not bad at all. Nutty and oily, as promised, but also possesses a wonderful toastiness that really makes the brew. The problem with this beer is it has no backbone, no malty structure to expand upon. Its a half-assed pale ale brewed with toasted pecans, which do instill a very nice flavor, but it is frankly not worth opening more than one.\t\tOther than that, the beer pours a clearish cloudy orange with a thick, retentive head and some sweet, light brown sugar, light hops, and an oily sesame taste. Balance is a bit off, with the backbone and nut flavors battling it out for supremacy. Decent drinkability, but nothing special.', 'user/profileName': 'TLove', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Cranberry Lambic', 'review/timeUnix': 1077491258, 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '1903', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 23, 'min': 7, 'sec': 38, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 53, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Very nice frothy head; great lace; the color is light amber with a slight red tinge.\t\tThe aroma reminds me of tart cherries (not cranberries). {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'De Koninck', 'review/timeUnix': 1141605671, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 3, 1985', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '677', 'user/birthdayUnix': 494578800, 'beer/brewerId': '218', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 0, 'min': 41, 'sec': 11, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 65, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 923756647, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "Appearence: Pours a crystal clear amber with a thin, bubbly white head that dies to a collar.\t\tSmell: Solid Belgian pale ale malt and hop characteristics throughout, with that perfect yeast tinge.\t\tTaste and Mouthfeel: Rich, full, thirst-quenching, and smooth. Very balanced and tasty, with the perfect mouthfeel. Barnyard malt characteristics with almost pilsener type hops. \t\tDrinkability and Overall: A classic. The perfect, easy drinking yet full flavored and full bodied Belgian ale. Definitly one that's perfect for a session.", 'user/profileName': 'santoslhalper', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Munich Helles Lager', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Victory Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1211645944, 'beer/ABV': 4.8, 'beer/beerId': '1002', 'beer/brewerId': '345', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 16, 'min': 19, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 145, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Color: Bright yellow color with a very thin head. \t\tAroma: Malt sweetness upfront with a tinge of hops in the nose. The hops balance out the sweetness. I'm not much for describing lagers but I like this one.\t\tDrinkability: Decent lawnmower beer. You should drink this instead of PBR. {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Punk IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1251494030, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '39435', 'beer/brewerId': '16315', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 21, 'min': 13, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 240, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '08/26/09- Purchased at Bottle Barn in Santa Rosa, CA.\t\tPresentation- Not sure what size bottle this was....maybe an even 20oz? Does have a best by date on the back label. Poured into a standard pint glass.\t\tAppearance- Dirty yellow-orange colored pour. The slightest of head (less than 1/4 inch for sure). Leaves some ultra light watery lace behind.\t\tSmell- A touch or cardboard, some sweetend tropical fruit notes and some toasted caramel malts.\t\tTaste- Thankfully the cardboard is gone. Pretty heavy on the tropical fruit flavored hops...a bit overly sweet. A light grainy toasted malt flavor. Gets better as you work through the beer.\t\tMouthfeel- Very lightly carbonated...not really cask-like, I think just bad bottle conditioning..just enough to make it decent.\t\tDrinkability- Was hoping for better...glad I paid only $5.99 for this bottle than the regualr almost $10 that I see it for everywhere else. Hopefully their DIPA is better.', 'user/profileName': 'GClarkage', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': "Bell's Oberon Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1098675618, 'beer/ABV': 5.8, 'beer/beerId': '1094', 'beer/brewerId': '287', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 3, 'min': 40, 'sec': 18, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 299, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'there is a joke that goes around western michigan that says dont drink too much oberon u will regret it the next day... not necessarily because of the hangover but because of your stupid actions the night before due to being so hammered. oberon has to be one of the strongest summer beers ive ever tried thus deserving it some due respect... however bells brewery in general is another story.. apparently the market in the michigan area is weak enough that bells can be so arrogant as to state on the bottom of their six pack that they dont care about peoples criticism of their beers.. well being from the great northwest, land of microbrews, i must say that oberon is the only beer bells produces that even comes close to par with our local brews.. bells reminds me of a small version of redhook... their product line is mediocre in general. in my humble opinion oberon is the only exception to this statement... it is definately worth a try if you like heavy strong beers, especially for something different during the summer. cheers!!!!', 'user/profileName': 'iheartsheafstout', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Quadrupel (Quad)', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Three Philosophers Belgian Style Blend (Quadrupel)', 'review/timeUnix': 1209263099, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.8, 'beer/beerId': '3457', 'beer/brewerId': '42', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 2, 'min': 24, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 118, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A- Pours out a nice brown color- like the color of black cherry wood. Not much head, and not much lacing.\t\tS- Warm bready notes, like freshly baked puffy whole wheat bread. A touch of fruitiness, and a touch of alcohol.\t\tT- Quite a complex taste which is greatly appealing to my tongue. There's a strong malt presence. And then some fruit swoops in from the wings- cherry, like kirsch. Very well blended. And then the aftertaste lingers on as the malt subsides, and the cherries take over, using the power of alcohols.\t\tM- Too sharp for my taste, and though the bitterness in the aftertaste is okay, I would prefer more while I'm tasting.\t\tD- Delicious tasting and I would happily have another.", 'user/profileName': 'zdk9', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Altbier', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Snowstorm 2005', 'review/timeUnix': 1146770706, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '26656', 'beer/brewerId': '417', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 19, 'min': 25, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 124, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Dont eat yellow snow. Snowstorm pours a very crystal copper color with slight brown and red hues. A good foam that remains throughout but limited lacing overall.\t\tThe smell is toasted with a touch of bready and toffee undertones. Some bubblegum sweet hops mixes nicely with a warmer spice such as cinnamon and cloves.\t\tThe taste has lighter malt tasting then the nose would kick up. A more roasted and astringent taste but a light taste that isnt quiet watery, but close. Some caramel and toffee finishes the malt taste but fails to mask the heavier roasted flavors. The hops are not very noticeable. I would have also like to see more of the yeast flavor come out more.\t\tThis isnt as smooth as an altbeer should be. The yeast is not really noticeable and the malt leaves too much aftertaste kick. Very easy to drink but missed the mark for style. It has the advantage of not being yellow so drink away.', 'user/profileName': 'Oxymoron', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Pumpkin Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Punkin Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1231648086, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '6260', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 4, 'min': 28, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 11, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "I'm not sure where this appeared from in January, but I'm not complaining. I had a pint (low-head) with my soup and pizza at Liberty St. Tavern. The hops have died down a bit since October, but this is still about the hoppiest pumpkin ale you can find. It starts with big, pulpy pumpkin meat in the aroma and flavor which is followed by a bitter burst of citrus. This isn't the most complexx pumpkin beer, the malts never really came out. But I'd say it's the most balanced and certainly one of the more pleasant to drink.", 'user/profileName': 'tempest', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Weizenbock', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Schneider Weisse Tap X Mein Nelson Sauvin', 'review/timeUnix': 1320439538, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.3, 'beer/beerId': '74625', 'beer/brewerId': '72', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 20, 'min': 45, 'sec': 38, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 308, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "I had this on-tap at Max's. Pours into a tasting glass.\t\tAppearance: Pours a very cloudy, almost opaque, orangish color with a finger of thick off white head. There is some really great lacing and wonderful retention.\t\tSmell: Tons of banana up front with some malt and mild herbal flavors. Reminds me a bit of banana runts.\t\tTaste: Very sweet with tons of banana, just like the smell. Mild amount of alcohol and a sweet finish. I'm not getting a whole lot from the Nelson hops.\t\tMouthfeel: Medium body with extremely smooth carbonation. The finish starts out slick, and then there is a slight dryness as well. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'New World Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1204158757, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '5722', 'beer/brewerId': '30', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 0, 'min': 32, 'sec': 37, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 59, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'A: Poured a near opaque mahogany red with a thin sudsy dark khaki head. \t\tS: Chinook hopping provided pungent dry grapefruit and pine hopping. \t\tT: malty, dark roasted coffee backed with a huge grapefruit and pine hopping. The flavor was clean, fading quickly after the swallow. There was a dry pungent grapefruit lacing on the finish. \t\tD: very good, a nice coffee roasted lacing provides for a outstanding flavor and great experience.', 'user/profileName': 'beerthulhu', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Orkney Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1279699524, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 12, 1976', 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '60269', 'user/birthdayUnix': 213951600, 'beer/brewerId': '16324', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 8, 'min': 5, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 202, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1204383847, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '275ml "nip" bottle bought from Beerritz.co.uk... 2009 vintage\t\tPoured a deep dark brown / almost black colour. Burnt brown head poured pretty thick, foamy and meringue like then faded to light covering with thick edging... some light lines of lacing cling to the glass...\t\tAroma - Toasted bread and lightly roasted malts, black coffee, some dark brown sugar sweetness, roasted nuttiness, some blackcurrant, raisin and black grape fruitiness, very light oatiness, some faint smokiness coming through, leathery hints, faint whiff of alcohol...\t\tTaste - Nice lightly roasted dark chocolate maltiness mixed with molasses sweetness, toasted malt loaf, definite coffee notes, caramel sweetness, again some dark fruits (prunes, plums), light nutmeg traces, quite a lot of sweet nutty hints, some pepperiness...\t\tFeel - Smooth initially then a little sharpness comes through... pretty full bodied... dangerously drinkable as the alcohol is pretty well hidden...\t\tOverall - A very enjoyable porter - perfect for a cold evening. May be a little sweet for some though ... recommended...', 'user/profileName': 'mdagnew', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Blonde Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Bobcat Blonde', 'review/timeUnix': 1313582695, 'beer/ABV': 4.0, 'beer/beerId': '63758', 'beer/brewerId': '7216', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 12, 'min': 4, 'sec': 55, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 229, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "A: Pours a brillant golden straw body with a good size bubbly white head, long lasting, spotty lacing.\t\tS: Pretty simple nose of sweet grainy malts, some saaz hops maybe, but a standard blonde ale smell. \t\tT: Sweet pale malts upfront with some light citrus hop bitterness, kind of spicy in the finish. Tastes like a standard lager.\t\tM: Light body; medium carbonation; smooth and crisp mouthfeel.\t\tO: This is another one of the good ones at Adirondack. Low ABV makes it sessionable, and the standard and simple flavor pairs well with almost anything there. I would definitely get it again, but even though it's a good ale, it's nothing life-changing.", 'user/profileName': 'BrewCrew2010', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Doppelbock', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Double Bock (Imperial Series)', 'review/timeUnix': 1061787515, 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '47785', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 4, 'min': 58, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 237, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'THe first thing you notice in your mouth is that this beer is thick. MUCH thicker than most, almost like cough syurp. The taste is of carmel and of lots of malt. It had 8.45% ABV so this is no "sissy" beer. When enjoying it, remember that drinking 1 is nearly like drinking 2 regular beers. The flavor takes a slight bit of getting used to. Once you do, however, you will look forward to January-March each year when it is brewed. This beer is EXECELENT with a fine Maduro (darker wraper for you non-cigar smokers out there) cigar, like a Macanudo Maduro Prince Philip Cafe or an Onyx. Hell, even a Phillie Black tastes better with this brew. Cigars and beer should be enjoyed more often IMHO. And don\'t say cigars are bad for you, your drinking beer aren\'t you?', 'user/profileName': 'Caligula', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Old Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Jasperilla Old Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1257986926, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.3, 'beer/beerId': '28143', 'beer/brewerId': '10284', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 0, 'min': 48, 'sec': 46, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 316, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': "2008 Vintage\t\tA - Poured a light copper color with an off white head that leaves some lacing behind\t\tS - Is of fruits upfront then some malt and alcohol\t\tT - I don't know its not good but its still drinkable has a fermented fruit taste with a touch of malt getting by the fruit and alcohol\t\tM - This beer has fuller body with medium carbonation to it\t\tD - I think this would be easier to drink if I was in the mood for it rather than seeing it in the fridge and saying why the hell not this beer isn't anything to go out of your way to get", 'user/profileName': 'armock', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': "Samuel Smith's Imperial Stout", 'review/timeUnix': 1162342900, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '782', 'beer/brewerId': '113', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 1, 'min': 1, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 305, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "The pour into my snifter raises a half-finger head (spread over a very wide surface, mind you) that quickly dissipates to a lot of light tan surface bubbles and a thin glass ring. The lacing manages to be pretty thick and entrenched. The body is truly opaque. I'd allow less head retention, if the ABV were comparable to most impys. The aroma is filled with an intense burnt caramel and molasses scent, accompanied by a blast of sweetness. The fruity vinousness is reminiscent slightly of shiraz, but also of the flavors found in chocolate over 70 percent. The taste, which I didn't get to until the glass spent some time warming, is vinous, molasses-filled, very roasted, and excellent. Sweet in the start, but leaves a coffee aftertaste, very dry. The mouth is quite thick, and the carbonation is low, but still noticeable. An easy drinking and rich impy.", 'user/profileName': 'mjc410', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Cream Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Wexford Irish Cream Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1142127775, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '2635', 'beer/brewerId': '203', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 1, 'min': 42, 'sec': 55, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 71, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'From a 1pt. nitro can with a blurb about the cream ale on the side of can, no freshness date. Made your generic nitro can appearance, poured a bubbly red amber with a pale tannish nitro creamy head that reduced to a creamy, thin lacing. Had a buttery caramel aroma with a little fruity hops in the background. Nitro carbonation which leads to a creamy light bodied mouth feel, average drinkability. Had a watery caramel and slightly grainy taste with a fruity, light hop bitterness showing up towards the end, then a dry, semi-bitter finish.\tDrinkable in a pinch, not something I would normally buy, unless left with no other choices.', 'user/profileName': 'jpm30', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Apple Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1321941894, 'beer/ABV': 4.0, 'beer/beerId': '20014', 'beer/brewerId': '590', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 6, 'min': 4, 'sec': 54, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 326, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Acquired from SamuelJackson45 via LOKO4Locals so a big THANK YOU goes out to him!\tPoured into a pint glass\t\tA: This beer pours a beautiful deep, translucent copper, with an off white head. Head recedes quickly leaving spotty lacing on the glass.\t\tS: Nose is completely apple cider... nothing but apple and on a good dau, apple cider.\t\tT: Taste is.... I'm sorry apple cider. It's fabulous and wonderful and I would drink it constantly but it's just apple beer that doesn't taste like beer. It literally tastes like apple juice,.\t\tM: Lighter side of medium body, low carbonation, crisp and clean.\t\tO: Goes down very easy, tasty, not filling, low kick, decent representation of style. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Gueuze', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Drie Fonteinen Oude Geuze', 'review/timeUnix': 1277433093, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '6305', 'beer/brewerId': '2216', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 2, 'min': 31, 'sec': 33, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 176, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Thanks Kevin for the opportunity to try this brew!\t\tA- Pours with a crazy, foamy, 3 finger+ white head which eventually settles to 1 finger and some lacing left behind. Body is a nearly transparent golden yellow hue.\t\tS- Vinegar, lemon, acidic tartness, vanilla, and oak. Nose overall is very balanced between these characters and very good.\t\tT- Taste is the epitome of a gueze. Hints of sour lemon, acidic tartness and nice backbone of oak and vanilla. Finish is conistent with initial flavor but slightly more tart and slightly dry. \t\tM- Very good. Smooth with soft carbonation. Body is lightweight and slightly yeasty.\t\tD- This is an awsesome beer overall and pretty much what I think of when I think of a great classic gueze. I see why this is the example to compare the rest of the style too. I am looking forward to having this again!', 'user/profileName': 'PittBeerGirl', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'German Pilsener', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Bavik Pils / Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1160320140, 'beer/ABV': 5.2, 'beer/beerId': '2480', 'beer/brewerId': '718', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 15, 'min': 9, 'sec': 0, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 281, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "From an 11.2oz bottle with no freshness date, it pour a pale straw color. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Altbier', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Stickenjab Alt Bier', 'review/timeUnix': 1055258915, 'beer/ABV': 6.4, 'beer/beerId': '4198', 'beer/brewerId': '393', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 15, 'min': 28, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 161, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'This one pours a nice almond brown with zip for a head. The aroma is almost entirely malt, but I can also discern some sort of smokiness or herbal smell as well. This is a big lager beer, and I am surprised that I like it. But the flavor is a little too sweet and burbonish for me to drink regularly. I would love for Heavyweight to do a regular lager as I am trying this style more and more and finding that it really can have as much taste as an ale if done right. And Heavyweight does this right, but its flavors are a bit too strong for regular tasting.', 'user/profileName': 'schoolteacher', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

One the end there's a slight sweetness and a hint of alcohol. You can tell this spent some time in the cask and it adds another depth to the already great taste.\t\tModerate/light bodied and low carbonation.\t\tI could easily drink a few of these despite the higher ABV.\t\tThis beer was a big surprise for me as I picked it up out of the reduced section at my local store. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.0, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Summer Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1283229549, 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '103', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 31, 'hour': 4, 'min': 39, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 243, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': 'Decided on a whim to have this with lunch today. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Moor Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1234324591, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Mar 29, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '901', 'user/birthdayUnix': 386236800, 'beer/brewerId': '261', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 3, 'min': 56, 'sec': 31, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 42, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1032098647, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "very dark and frothy -- no light escapes here at all. smell of molasses and alcohol. harsh, spicy taste at first... think bugspray. it mellows though, to a slightly sour, chocolatey brew. mouthfeel is very lively/fizzy, kind of acidic, yet creamy and smooth. interesting, but i don't know that i would search it out.", 'user/profileName': 'joshsbeerblog', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Lager', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Saranac Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1030107665, 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '320', 'beer/brewerId': '99', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 13, 'min': 1, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2002, 'yday': 235, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "I thought clear bottle, strike one - but that was the only thing I found wrong here. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Czech Pilsener', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Creemore Springs Traditional Pilsner', 'review/timeUnix': 1193008542, 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '36960', 'beer/brewerId': '455', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 23, 'min': 15, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 294, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'I really like the Creemore traditional lager so looked forward to sampling this offering from the same brewery after a friend brought back a tall can from Canada. Unfortunately, this one was a disappointment.\t\tPours with a bright golden hue, clear, with a thin head that dissipates fairly quickly. Most of the aroma features malt sweetness, hop character is subdued. That carries over to the flavor, malt sweetness dominates, with the hop flavor and bitterness are lacking for this style. A bready, sweetish flavor features a medium body and lager smoothness.\t\tThe descriptor on the can says their brewmaster visited Czechlosovakia to study and replicate the true Czech pilsners. Sorry to say he missed the mark. This one needs lots more hop character and depth to make a true Czech pils. Not recommended.', 'user/profileName': 'marksto', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Brooklyn Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1247959851, 'beer/ABV': 5.2, 'beer/beerId': '148', 'beer/brewerId': '45', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 23, 'min': 30, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 199, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a cloudy amber color with large off white head and some lacing.\t\tSmells of hops and lightly roasted malts.\t\tNice balance of malty up front and a piney hoppy clean finish. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Winter Warmer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Harveys Christmas Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1044646733, 'beer/ABV': 8.1, 'beer/beerId': '2307', 'beer/brewerId': '164', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 19, 'min': 38, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 38, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Presentation: 9.3 oz bottle. Harvey's Christmas Ale 2000. 8.6% abv.\t\tAppearance: Cloudy, light, coppery caramel color with thin tan foam.\t\tSmell: A slight whiff of lactic acid (perhaps a slightly off bottle) was the only negative about this beer. Otherwise, a sweet, malty and yeasty aroma with a hint of fruit.\t\tTaste: Rich caramel and toffee malt flavors with a touch of oak and spice, with a bit of hop bitterness in the finish. The hops carried over to the aftertaste as well.\t\tMouthfeel: Rich and smooth. Low carbonation.\t\tDrinkability: Very good. Other than the slight hint of lactic acid, this was a very tasty brew.", 'user/profileName': 'UncleJimbo', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Fat Scotch Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1115680269, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '14431', 'beer/brewerId': '959', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 23, 'min': 11, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 129, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Do yourself a favor and shine the beam of a very strong flashlight through a glass of Fat Bastard. The color will surprise and astonish you. Fat Bastard is very clear and pours the color of walnut. But in bright light the color is blood; deep, lustrous blood, like something gushing from Steven Kings elevator. As a beer, its compellingly beautiful. \t\t\tA fruit-laden smell escapes the contours of the glass with a dark puree of plum, apricot, fig, melon, and a hint of cola nut. No peat is found here though this will make a late appearance in the taste. \t\t\tThe flavor likewise reflects this fruited complexity and is comparable to a sedate barleywine. A slight syrupy taste and aroma are present though nothing sugary lingers at the lip. As the name might suggest, Fat Bastard is a heavy beer with a dense body, low CO2, and no head or lace to speak of. Great to drink now, but some cellaring or cask conditioning might yield even greater polish.', 'user/profileName': 'RedDiamond', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'King Crimson', 'review/timeUnix': 1317769788, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '55115', 'beer/brewerId': '13884', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 23, 'min': 9, 'sec': 48, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 277, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A: A hazy reddish brown with a tall thick orange/brown head. The head sat about a half inch above the rim of the glass for a good 3 minutes.\t\tS: A very nice herbal, pine and earthy hop aroma.\t\tT: The hop starts right up front with some pine flavors and then the bitterness kicks in and fades to reveal an oak-like toasted and carmel malt flavor. Alcohol flavor and feel throughout.\t\tM: medium-heavy body. Carbonation is right on. A little oily, but the bitterness leaves the mouth somewhat dry.\t\tO: A nice imperial red ale. Maybe a little hop heavy at first, but I like how there is a nice toasted/caramel malt flavor in the end.', 'user/profileName': 'Kromes', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Oaked Arrogant Bastard Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1196442723, 'beer/ABV': 7.2, 'beer/beerId': '8951', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 17, 'min': 12, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 334, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "A slight disappointment. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "A Little Sumpin' Sumpin' Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1243960840, 'user/gender': 'Female', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '49789', 'beer/brewerId': '220', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 16, 'min': 40, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 153, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'OOOoo hello citrus hops! I picked up a few bottles for a mix pack of new brews last week and, not gonna lie, returned the next day and bought a fully qualified sixer of this gem.\t\tI got a face full of grapefruit and piney hops the second I poured this pale golden, ever so slightly hazed beer into my pint. Nice. The taste surely did not disappoint either! The body itself was light and crisp, perfect for a summer day, and the hops are not lacking at all in this one. The carbonation was spot on as well IMO. I normally do not go for american wheats, however given all the hoppy goodness Lagunitas pumps out I gave it a shot. I recommend this beer!\t\tThe hardest part right now is finding it at other beer stores in my area. When I ask for Lagunitas "Sumpin Sumpin" i get the "ok yeah if you don\'t know the name how can I find it" response, no matter how hard I try to preface my request with a warning.', 'user/profileName': 'naproxen', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Gueuze', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Girardin Gueuze 1882 (Black Label)', 'review/timeUnix': 1176601338, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '6317', 'beer/brewerId': '2541', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 1, 'min': 42, 'sec': 18, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 105, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A - Golden body with some oranginess to it. Nice full off-white head at first that settles down to a consistent foam covering. Good lacing.\tS - Vague vinegar, an apparition of apple, hint of mint and just a little gin.\tT - Sour, yes, but not overwhelmingly so. It's a concentrated sourness that feels like it's sticking mainly to the middle of the mouth before sliding down the throat. The vinegar flavor and slight sweetness brings to mind a combination of a white wine mix with an apple cider. Later the sweet & sour mix covers the entire tongue.\tM - It hits just about every part of the mouth in the end. Tart, but not tongue-curlingly tart. Fuzzy carbonation tingles the nose a bit.\tD - The style makes for an acquired taste. It's not really for me, but I can sip this one as well as any of the other top-notch tongue twisting styles.", 'user/profileName': 'JayTheFinn', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

Bottle 0079\t\tA: Huge pop on cork. Pours dark golden to light brown. Huge thick foamy,  inch bright white head. \t\tS: Tangy, champagne nose with a honey and citrus under tone. \t\tM/T: Extremely light and watery body. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Baltic Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Baltic Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1072986301, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '14682', 'beer/brewerId': '2391', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 19, 'min': 45, 'sec': 1, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 1, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': 'Had a freshly poured pint of this at the Raccoon Lodge. This one came to me with a large creamy root beer foam-colored head. The brew was a very dark tawny-brown color. It looked great. The aroma contained resiny hops and roastiness. Not too complex. The taste was were it was at however....flavors of smokiness and licorice danced around my palate, while an assertive hop level pulled it all together. Very well balanced. Hop and licorice flavors lingered in my mouth eons after I took a sip. Midway through my pint, I noticed sheets of clingy foam coating most of the inside of the glass. Mouthfeel was full, velvety, and flirty. The drinkability was excellent. The alcohol was fully enveloped by the flavors. A very enjoyable and well-done brew...I will be going back for more!', 'user/profileName': 'HiroProtagonist', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Old Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Barrel Aged Hibernation Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1323183461, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 9, 1985', 'beer/ABV': 11.1, 'beer/beerId': '54177', 'user/birthdayUnix': 489740400, 'beer/brewerId': '158', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 14, 'min': 57, 'sec': 41, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 340, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 928595047, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Big thanks goes out to the individual (can't remember who it was as I don't have my spreadsheet in front of me) who sent me this one in a past trade! 2009 Vintage! Served from bottle into a Mikkeller taster flute. Poured reddish brown with a half finger light tan head that subsided to a minimal amount very quickly. The aroma was comprised of sweet malt, wood, very sweet alcohol, toffee, subtle brown sugar, and a touch of caramel. The flavor was of sweet malt, sweet alcohol, wood, toffee, caramel, and subtle brown sugar. It had a medium feel on the palate with mild carbonation. Overall this was a fairly solid brew. The barrels really shined through on this one and made their presence known. I wasn't expecting this as the brew had been aging in my cellar for this long, but was pleasantly surprised what I did find. A solid offering from Great Divide and I look forward to trying the bottle of BA Old Ruffian I have in my cellar to conplete the set.", 'user/profileName': 'thagr81us', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'Euro Strong Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Baltika #9 Extra (Strong)', 'review/timeUnix': 1138763271, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Feb 24, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '1967', 'user/birthdayUnix': 383385600, 'beer/brewerId': '401', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 3, 'min': 7, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 32, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1034949848, 'review/overall': 1.5, 'review/text': "16.9 ounce bottle. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Lagunitas Imperial Red Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1295654756, 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '22387', 'beer/brewerId': '220', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 0, 'min': 5, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 22, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Dark amber colored hazy body, with a tightly forming and sticky one finger thick head. \t\tIn the aroma there is a massive cherry, woody, and caramel presence.\t\tIn the taste there is a toasted bread quality, along with vanilla, cherry, and oak.\t\tPrickly with carbonation, a bit chewy and surely full in body with a warm alcohol finish.\t\tAltogether a great beer, and I'm glad I found some of this.
