{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Berliner Weissbier', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Festina P\xc3\xaache', 'review/timeUnix': 1184023855, 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '35720', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 23, 'min': 30, 'sec': 55, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 190, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "12 oz. bottle poured into a nonic.\t\tPours a hazy golden straw color with a nice one finger fluffy white head that quickly dies down to a thin lacing. Stickiness is ok at first but pretty weak towards the end. Smell is a sugary apricot/peach with a crisp lemongrass blended in. Taste, wow, very tart and sour on the tongue at first...almost like a lemon or orange sour patch kid. Very different, not much alcohol taste at all which is just about the only good thing the taste has going. A nice pale malt in the aftertaste takes a while to surface, but it is enjoyable. Mouthfeel is very light bodied with a whole buncha carbonation. Drinkability lacks a bit just because of how tart it is, but it picks its self up with the lack of alcohol on the nose and tongue. Give it a try, but I wouldn't go out of your way to get one.", 'user/profileName': 'BeerTruth', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Kennebunkport IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1205970978, 'beer/ABV': 6.2, 'beer/beerId': '39872', 'beer/brewerId': '663', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 23, 'min': 56, 'sec': 18, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 79, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': 'Amber color with decent head. A little light, not too much retention.\t\tAroma is fairly hoppy, but a little unpleasant. Almost like old hops.\t\tFlavor was most disappointing - decent pale malt backbone but a sour, unpleasant hop flavor dominated. No citrus, spiciness or floral, earthy hops - just sour bitterness.\t\tMouthfeel was fine. Not too drinkable due to the poor flavor, though. Finish was perhaps the best part, as the flavors faded to a decent, clean bitterness. I would not recommend this beer.', 'user/profileName': 'AaronHomoya', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Shastafarian Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1163616016, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '18942', 'beer/brewerId': '9916', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 18, 'min': 40, 'sec': 16, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 319, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Aroma is a nice mix of hops and dark chocolate aromas with some subtler fruity aromas mixed in. Body is flat black and holds a creamy mocha colored head that is thumb thick and diminishes slowly. Lace clings to the glass. Fore is bittersweet chocolate with very lucious dark cherry notes in the middle. Finishes with a roasty bitterness that reminds me of a scaled down version of Gonzo Imperial Porter. I figured this would be decent, but its actually very damn good. Definitely more aggresively hopped than most porters. That works well here and amplifies the latent coffee notes in the aftertaste. Tastes much bigger than youd expect from a 6% abv beer. Excellent porter!', 'user/profileName': 'Jredner', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Cream Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Terrapin Golden Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1302502032, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 20, 1987', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '9777', 'user/birthdayUnix': 559119600, 'beer/brewerId': '2372', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 6, 'min': 7, 'sec': 12, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 101, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 859215848, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '12 oz. bottle poured into a shaker pint.\t\tAppearance-Yellow gold with brilliant clarity and a moderately large white head with decent retention. \t\tAroma-Sweet Pils malt, light grassy hops, and a very faint fruit aroma of apples and pears. \t\tFlavor-Flavor follows the aroma-light pils malt up front with slight orchard fruit esters. Well attenuated-dry in the finish, with low hop bitterness but a rising hay/grass hop flavor. Its growing on me as I drink it. \t\tMouthfeel-Medium body, moderate carbonation, and exceptionally smooth. \t\tThough this isnt my favorite style, its a good example. It is incredibly easy drinking, and I liked it more the more I drank it.', 'user/profileName': 'plfahey', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': '1488 Strong Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1244008752, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '50248', 'beer/brewerId': '16881', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 5, 'min': 59, 'sec': 12, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 154, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'This one seems to skirt the fence a bit, not quite a high enough abv% to comfortably sit as a strong ale, however nowhere in the ballpark appearance-wise to remotely be confused for a pale ale. At first the flavour seems more like a brown, but in the end enough complexity to nod back to the "strong ale" listing on the label.\t\tFrom a 500ml brown bottle, it pours out a deep translucent ruby brown with bright garnet highlights. Tall creamy beige head that settles to a thick tight cap.\t\tToasted, nutty, waferish malt on the nose, subtle wood notes, very light crisp grassy hops.\t\tPleasant nutty, toasted caramel flavour, faint sourness in the middle from aging in the whiskey cask, with a smooth warm nutty and woody finish, slight dry caramel, with a lingering aftertaste of peat and smoke. The intensity is rather contained, yet this was still more complex than I had anticipated based on sampling the original 1488.\t\tMouthfeel is on the lighter side, yet with a silky smooth texture that does the whole experience justice, and can easily turn this "strong ale" into a session beer.\t\tMy lasting impression is that of a brown ale with more personality and complexity than they usually come, or that of a lightweight strong ale that nonetheless has some merits and is completely and utterly inoffensive. To step outside the boundaries of style this is a mild yet enjoyable dark ale, and one that I look forward to visiting again from time to time.', 'user/profileName': 'IronDjinn', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Lambic - Fruit', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Oudbeitje Lambic', 'review/timeUnix': 1301263569, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '5586', 'beer/brewerId': '636', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 22, 'min': 6, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 86, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'A: Golden color.\tS: Barnyard funk\tT: Quite sour. Strawberry grassiness vaguely in background. Astringent bitter aftertaste (tannins?). Lemons. Oak. \tM: Carbonation low to nonexistant. Acidity means that body is not thin.\tO: Too intense for my palate. The sourness and tannins are overwhelming. No body or sweetness to balance. And considering the price ($11/375mL) makes it a horrible value. Sorry guys, I appreciate the attempt to make natural products in traditional style, but this does not mean that balance of flavour can be overlooked.', 'user/profileName': 'jibbyvonjibb', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1125805125, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '14314', 'beer/brewerId': '7730', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 3, 'min': 38, 'sec': 45, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 247, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Intense yet smooth roast flavour with some coffee, black colour. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Barleywine', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Brooklyn Monster Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1120265931, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Apr 17, 1980', 'beer/ABV': 10.8, 'beer/beerId': '2231', 'user/birthdayUnix': 324806400, 'beer/brewerId': '45', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 0, 'min': 58, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 183, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1093529048, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Bottled in 2004. Pours a brilliant amber-red with a thin white head that quickly fades to lasting ring. Sweet malty smell infused with dark raisins, rasberries, port, and a slight floral hops. Taste is full and malty, with a strong alcohol presence, some fruity cherry and berry notes, a nice hop bitterness at the end. The alcohol is present in every sip, which I don't usually like, but it stays smooth and tasty throughout. Mouthfeel is full, smooth, and sweet, but doesn't become syrupy at all. This is a very good barleywine, I'm going to age my other bottle for another 6 months and see how it improves.", 'user/profileName': 'cubedbee', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Life & Limb', 'review/timeUnix': 1268016830, 'beer/ABV': 10.2, 'beer/beerId': '54089', 'beer/brewerId': '140', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 2, 'min': 53, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 67, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': 'A- Pours a deep opaque mahogany almost black color, with an off white head the quickly resides to a thin ring around the edge of the glass \tS- Smells very sweet, has toasted malt aromas and strong smells of maple syrup\tT- Bold maple taste on the front and after tastes, has a great malty sweetness that is similar to brown sugar\tM- The mouthfeel is great, very thick and heavily carbonated which delivers the taste so well\tD- I could easily devour this whole bottle on my own. \t\tDaniel', 'user/profileName': 'pourmeup', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Farmhouse Gueuze', 'review/timeUnix': 1280730947, 'beer/beerId': '60608', 'beer/brewerId': '220', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 6, 'min': 35, 'sec': 47, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 214, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "On-tap at Lagunitas\t\tA: The pour is a hazy straw color with an initially fluffy white head that slowly dies down to a thin layer.\t\tS: An amazingly funky and tart aroma is present immediately. Lots of sour apples, lemons, and maybe some green grapes along with a subtle wood character and a bit of grass.\t\tT: The tartness is bright and green, lots of lemons and apples. The oak, grass, wet straw, and mild earthiness give this beer a great funky balance to the sourness.\t\tM: The body is somewhat light and crisp, with a great level of effervescence and slight dryness.\t\tD: This is an absolutely fantastic beer. I would drink this like nobody's business if it was more readily available and/or Lagunitas wasn't such a drive.", 'user/profileName': 'womencantsail', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "A Little Sumpin' Sumpin' Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1283631695, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 31, 1981', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '49789', 'user/birthdayUnix': 368089200, 'beer/brewerId': '220', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 20, 'min': 21, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 247, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1050246247, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Poured from 12oz bottle into a pint glass.\t\tAppearance: light golden yellow hue with a touch of haze and a thin finger of fluffy white foam. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Porter', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Honey Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1231864353, 'beer/ABV': 5.45, 'beer/beerId': '2684', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 16, 'min': 32, 'sec': 33, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 13, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Dark brown/ruby red, definitely see-through, with a two finger fluffy tan colored head and very nice lacing. Aroma is nice mixture of sweet honey, chocolate and roasty toasty malts. Body is medium bordering on thin, almost too crisp with a high amount of carbonation. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "He'Brew Bittersweet Lenny's R.I.P.A.", 'review/timeUnix': 1306797565, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '30970', 'beer/brewerId': '262', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 23, 'min': 19, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 150, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Poured into a snifter with a generous pour and it produced a creamy off white two inch head that settled but stayed a long time. really good lacing. This is what what a beer is supposed to look like! Smell is hoppy at first then melds to semi sweet malts with some fruit in there as well. Very aromatic with the rye coming thru as well. Taste is a hoppy maltness all at once then the rye and a little bitterness at the end. Got better as it warmed. Mouthfeel was creamy and heavy. It coated the entire mouth. Overal a very good example of a Rye DIPA. I wish I would have bought more. Worhty of a try.', 'user/profileName': 'bayougutter', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Bock', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Amstel Bock', 'review/timeUnix': 1258805686, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '1418', 'beer/brewerId': '163', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 12, 'min': 14, 'sec': 46, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 325, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Had this beer on tap at a small pancake house in Amsterdam, it was served in an Amstel Bock snifter, .25L...\t\tA: Nice amber dark orange color with a nicely lacing head...\t\tS: Smells of strong and sweet malt and a touch of caramel and grass...\t\tT: Wow, a very nice beer out of amstel. {'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Ten FIDY', 'review/timeUnix': 1210298419, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 10.5, 'beer/beerId': '34483', 'beer/brewerId': '2681', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 2, 'min': 0, 'sec': 19, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 130, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': 'Appearance: Pours like motor oil, with a pitch black color and a thick brown head that leaves plenty of lace\t\tSmell: Espresso and licorice, somewhat charcoalish\t\tTaste: Opens with a rich coffee and licorice flavor, with a powdered Dutch chocolate flavor and a build up of smoke and hops by mid-palate; after the swallow, the chocolate flavors become prominent and then fade into the smoke and hops again\t\tMouthfeel: Thick and viscous, with moderate carbonation; creamy\t\tDrinkability: A really fine RIS, with plenty of complex flavors', 'user/profileName': 'brentk56', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Maibock / Helles Bock', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Dead Guy Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1228000010, 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '355', 'beer/brewerId': '132', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 23, 'min': 6, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 334, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Poured from a 12oz brown bottle into a pint glass, two-finger light tan head with excellent retention. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Bi\xc3\xa8re de Champagne / Bi\xc3\xa8re Brut', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'DeuS (Brut Des Flandres)', 'review/timeUnix': 1238106351, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 11.5, 'beer/beerId': '7661', 'beer/brewerId': '202', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 22, 'min': 25, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 85, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a clear golden color with a large white head that quickly settles to a whisp of foam. A lot of carbonation bubbles makes this an exciting looking ale. Patches of sticky lacing is left on the glass. The aroma is very subdued. I detect some sweet fruit and maybe a little funk and malt. Has an intriging taste. Slightly sweet and vinous at the start but a definate tartness in the finish. Notes of apple, pears, and cinnamon. Alcohol is barely detectable but there is a subtle warming affect. Light body with a fizzy carbonation. An effervescent beer if there ever was one. A beer for special occasions. Is it more enjoyable than a comparably priced sparkling wine? I would say it would be an excellant alternative.', 'user/profileName': 'morimech', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Old Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Ola Dubh Special Reserve 12', 'review/timeUnix': 1312753939, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '41037', 'beer/brewerId': '323', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 21, 'min': 52, 'sec': 19, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 219, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': '33cl bottled poured into a Grimbergen chalice\t\tBottle number 03897 Nov 2008\t\tBest before Jan 2012\t\tA- Jet black body with no light penetration. Tan 2 finger head that reduces quickly to a crown but this is persistent. Lacing is average.\t\tS- Light dark fruit sweet malt, peatiness of the whisky casks comes through subtlely too.\t\tT- Delicate sweet malt quality which makes way for the peatiness of the whisky cask. Neither flavours outdo each other. It has a single cream note - not sweet, just a savoury thickness, hard to describe.No suggestion of alcohol hot, very smooth.\t\tM- Low to medium carbonation, perhaps a little chalky in the finish. I think this comes from this single cream consistency quality im getting.\t\tD- Very nice, nice malt quality of a Scottish ale combining with the peatiness of Scotlands national drink (not Irn-Bru). Neither qualities overpowering. A lovely sipper.', 'user/profileName': 'seanyfo', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'De Ranke Guldenberg', 'review/timeUnix': 1308784285, 'beer/ABV': 8.5, 'beer/beerId': '3442', 'beer/brewerId': '739', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 23, 'min': 11, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 173, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Forms mid-sized frothy white head with good retention atop of clear (gets hazed with the consecutive pourings), golden body with uprising streams of bubbles. The head leaves only little short-lived lacing as it fades. The aroma is marriage of peppery spiciness with citrusy, pear and apple-like esters, and candy sugar sweetness. The flavor of medium bodied beer is governed by substantial alcohol warmth acting in sinergy with prominent peppery spiciness; esters are lesser than in the aroma section and citrusy in character. Moderate carbonation and relatively high bitterness induced by generous usage of Hallertau hops with spicy and grassy character (the later indicating dry-hopping) lend dry finish followed by bitter aftertaste. (330 ml, freshness date November 2015, into tulip.)', 'user/profileName': 'crnipeter', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Dubbel', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Abbey Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1314218084, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '45583', 'beer/brewerId': '3', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 20, 'min': 34, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 236, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Poured from 22 oz to tulip, nice clear reddish brown with a large light brown head that left nice lacing. \t\tSmell is of sweet malt, spice, clove, brown sugar. well blended nice aroma.\t\tTaste pretty much follows smell with the spices lasting on the finish. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Coffee Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1039206663, 'beer/ABV': 5.75, 'beer/beerId': '2810', 'beer/brewerId': '590', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 20, 'min': 31, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2002, 'yday': 340, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'New Glarus Coffee Stout: In the traditional twelve ounce bottle, with the plain paper label, with a blurb about the beer on the side. Not too much head, but what there is a light tan, with some stickiness. The color is pure black, with not even the slightest bit of light penetrating the brew. The aroma is a light, sweet coffee with a hint of molasses. The taste is very nice, with a very dominant malt flavor. Despite the name, this beer is not dominated by a coffee/ espresso taste, but rather those flavors simply serve to round out, and give some bite to the roasted malts. Very nice, smooth and easy to sip. A great cold weather brew.', 'user/profileName': 'jackndan', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Barleywine', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Sierra Nevada Bigfoot Barleywine Style Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1268626583, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.6, 'beer/beerId': '2671', 'beer/brewerId': '140', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 4, 'min': 16, 'sec': 23, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 74, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured into a 13oz. tulip glass, mahogany to deep amber in color with over a fingers worth of a creamy head. lots of lacing in the glass.\t\tAn intense floral boquet of hops bursts out immediately in the nose. \t\tA strong hop presence carries over into the taste, quickly complemented by a sweet caramel, roasted malt backbone, very brilliant and complex taste. There is a crispness and warming in the mouth, medium bodied with a slightly syrupy profile. The alcohol is definitely there, but it isn't blatant for a 9.6% alc. beer.\t\tIn terms of drinkability, this is definitely a sipper for me, I don't think i'd have more than 2 in a sitting. This intense brew is meant to be savored and cherished, rather than quickly consumed.\t\tAmazingly vibrant beer, one of my personal favorites.", 'user/profileName': 'wolfinthemirror', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Winter Warmer', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Winterhook Winter Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1073336188, 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '13906', 'beer/brewerId': '18134', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 20, 'min': 56, 'sec': 28, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 5, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': "Pretty auburn with a cream colored small head, strong lacing. Aroma is a large lump of leafy late hops, big caramel malt and cherries. Taste is a little pine-solish with some metallic notes that I get from many mass-produced beers(saaz?tettnang?) Rather dry. Boring yeast. Fine carbonation level, but what is there seems kinda harsh. Finish isn't very good, just graininess, pinesol, and cheezy hops. I am guessing that there was dry-hopping that didn't mesh well.\t\tStarts off great. Change the yeast and get rid of the harsh finish and it would be a really good beer. As it is, it is unpolished. My guess is that they were going after a more marketable SNCA and just missed the mark by a bit.", 'user/profileName': 'waughbrew', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'LongShot Double IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1242523575, 'beer/ABV': 9.6, 'beer/beerId': '49016', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 1, 'min': 26, 'sec': 15, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 137, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '12oz bottle, best before 9/09, sampled 5/16/09. Poured into a shaker pint - a deep rust colored beer, very cloudy - creating a bit of a subdued, hazy orange glow. It also has an explosive ecru head that grows to well over 2 fingers, then leaves a foamy fossilized lace pattern after the once proud head has settled. Nothing short of impressive, and a bit of an intimidating battle call.\t\tSmell is a boom of grapefruity hop to the nose, delivered in a malted sugary package, some undertones of earth, and a warming silky alcohol that blends well with the hops to create a sharp punch.\t\tA taste that is involved and grows more intense as it warms. I let several sips sit and swish on the tongue for an extended time, and as the seconds go by, the taste grows more intensely hoppy. Crisp and grassy up front. Supremely sweetened malt lets the beer become full in the mouth. Bitter, wild grasses show up again at some point in the middle and are almost overwhelming. Biting, but this sensation is enveloped in that huge malt backbone to keep things enjoyable. Some dry grains pop towards the end, then are buried by the final punch of oily earthy hop resin. The alcohol has combined again with the hop oils to provide some warm bitter pooling which coats my throat. \tMouthfeel is thick, and heavy on the tongue, a product of the excessive hop oil and the heavy malt presence; it has just enough sharp carbonation on the tongue to lighten it up, but still remains a bit of a chewy chore. A good beer to sip, a beast.', 'user/profileName': 'Philabeerphia', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Great Lakes Blackout Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1267405411, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 21, 1973', 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '15813', 'user/birthdayUnix': 112086000, 'beer/brewerId': '73', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 1, 'min': 3, 'sec': 31, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 60, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1306249447, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Poured into a pint glass, btw this is from 2009.\t\tA - Pours heavy on the black side with shades of black, with a huge amount of fluffy light beige head, kinda looks like the top of an ice cream soda.\t\tS - Big whiff of dark molasses, maybe some spice, dark chocolate, coffee, and a tiny bit of sugary sweetness.\t\tT - Big combination of dark roasted malts, hops, chocolate, coffee, and molasses. A lot of complexity. \t\tM - Medium bodied stout and coats my toungue with a light oil consistency.\t\tD - This is a very good RIS from a great brewering company, I highly recommend this and would love to try the BA version of this.', 'user/profileName': 'semibaked', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Stone 07.07.07 Vertical Epic Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1204506597, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 25, 1979', 'beer/ABV': 8.4, 'beer/beerId': '37326', 'user/birthdayUnix': 307090800, 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 1, 'min': 9, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 63, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1111244647, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'My first in the "Epic" series. Pours somewhat hazy orange. Head was not too impressive nor was the retention, no lacing. Smell is dead-on for what a Belgian should smell like. Apple, pear, bread, yeast, and a touch of citrus (Stones signature I think). Smell is great. Taste is very good as well thoough I should note I\'m partial to Belgians. Sweetness hits you up front then you notice fruity characteristics on the sides of your tounge followed by a warm, slightly bitter sensation on the back of your tounge. Carbonation is moderate and mouthfeel is medium, not too thick or thin. Overall a great beer, alcohol content is well masked and a great Belgian from the boys in Escondido.', 'user/profileName': 'bunnyhustle', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Alimony Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1299802714, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.8, 'beer/beerId': '158', 'beer/brewerId': '205', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 0, 'min': 18, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 70, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Poured into a perfect pint glass.\t\tA: Nice, 2.5 finger off white head on a golden-orange, very clear body with good active carbonation. This is a very attractive beer.\t\tS: Smells of fresh, floral and citrusy hops. Not overwhelming with just a touch of malt under it. Very nice, but not mind blowing.\t\tT: Hmm, not enough maltyness here for me, the hops come across a good bit sharper, thinning out the beer, making it much less nice. It's still ok, the hops still taste fresh and good, but still too strong and sharp.\t\tM: Ok, not great, but enough body to keep me happy.", 'user/profileName': 'mdwalsh', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Fire Road Red Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1242868916, 'beer/ABV': 7.1, 'beer/beerId': '49305', 'beer/brewerId': '16289', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 1, 'min': 21, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 141, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Laurelwood has long made the best red ales anywhere. Perhaps it's for this reason that Fire Road seemed somewhat disappointing compared to Free Range or Bridgid's Irish - this one has a lot to live up to. Fire Road is certainly a worthy ale, but it's far more gruff than Laurelwood's other reds. Instead of the plush fruitiness that I enjoy in a red ale, Fire Road has an excess of bittering and lacks malt body. The 68 IBU puts more fire in Fire Road than I'd care for. \t\t\tStill, I shouldn't complain. This is a spicy beer as if brewed with noble hops and tastes a bit like an overhopped ESB. It delivers a spicy-floral aroma and abstract lace above a body of clear dark bronze. But it's also a bit tannic and takes a little attitude adjustment to appreciate.", 'user/profileName': 'RedDiamond', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Bock', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Chocolate Bock', 'review/timeUnix': 1135397496, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.8, 'beer/beerId': '14309', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 4, 'min': 11, 'sec': 36, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 358, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': '750 ml bottle dated best-before 06-31-2006. \t\tPoured a slightly-transluscent red-edged dark brown. Fairly big light tan head quickly subsided to thin foam and moderate lace. Big powdery cocoa in the nose, but nothing else happening. Sugary sweet cocoa and thin malts up front, extremely sweet and a bit dusty in the middle, slightly drier and very weak hop finish. Quit thin and highly carbonated in the mouth.\t\tNot bad, but awfully sweet and lacking in depth for such a high-priced special offering.', 'user/profileName': 'dgallina', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Schwarzbier', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Black Bavarian', 'review/timeUnix': 1305195779, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '96', 'beer/brewerId': '144', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 10, 'min': 22, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 132, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Poured from 16oz bottle.\t\tA- Pours a deep, dark brown, with red tinges. 1 1/2 finger head that is fairly persistent with little to no lacing\t\tS- Lovely roasted coffee aroma. Sweetness and mild hops are also present.\t\tT- Bittersweet, roasted malts on the front end. Long, lingering dark chocolate and bitter finish.\t\tM- Smooth, medium light, with medium carbonation\t\tD- The porter fan in me really enjoyed this. Not quite as much roasted malt or mouthfeel as a porter, but enough to trick my mind a bit. Makes me want to explore the style more, especially as Blackened Voodoo was my craft beer gateway drug almost 20 years ago.\t\tMay the schwarzbier with you...', 'user/profileName': 'tchaos', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Jack D'or", 'review/timeUnix': 1267989721, 'beer/ABV': 6.4, 'beer/beerId': '46290', 'beer/brewerId': '18371', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 19, 'min': 22, 'sec': 1, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 66, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Picked this up at the Foodery in Northern Liberties\tBatch Ten\tPours a deep gold color almost amber with a thick white head.\tAroma is a nice coriander and orange peel with some subtle hints of fruity esters. Very clean no off aromas.\tVery spicy flavor i get a nice hoppy bittereness that segues into a soft malt background. The spices seem to be coriander, orange peel and some ligt pepper notes, although the pepper could be some of the yeast characteristics and carbonic acid.\tMouthfeel is good yet it could be dryer for the style. Maybe they should try kraeusening a batch to get that dry dupont bite. \tNonetheless for a brewer with no brewery this is an excellent beer, it must be hard to brew on someone else's system and produce exactly what you are looking for, still I would drink this again as it is a solid belgo-american.", 'user/profileName': 'RenoZymurgist', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': "He'Brew Genesis Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1240770291, 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '726', 'beer/brewerId': '262', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 18, 'min': 24, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 116, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Overall, this is another average offering from an average contract brewery. \tHazy amber color with a thin tan head. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English India Pale Ale (IPA)', 'review/palate': 2.0, 'review/taste': 1.0, 'beer/name': 'India Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1262314869, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 6, 1977', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '25231', 'user/birthdayUnix': 237020400, 'beer/brewerId': '5062', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 3, 'min': 1, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 1, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1181315047, 'review/overall': 1.0, 'review/text': 'I was recommended this beer by a Cost Plus stock clerk in Palm Springs, CA. He claimed "this is the best IPA I\'ve ever had." "Better than Stone\'s Ruination IPA?," I asked. "Better."\t\tHe lied. Either that or this beer has gone bad. The color was promising. The smell was acceptable, although awfully malty for an IPA. But the taste...I don\'t even know where to begin. It tasted like a chemical spilled into it. Was that clerk being a dick? I\'m ready to pour this out.\t\tI hope this is just a terrible mistake and the beer has simply turned, but the store I got it from rotates their stock often enough to make me believe this is just what this beer is. Sad.', 'user/profileName': 'unclemeat9', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Saranac Summer Brew', 'review/timeUnix': 1243050940, 'beer/ABV': 3.5, 'beer/beerId': '49614', 'beer/brewerId': '99', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 3, 'min': 55, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 143, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Poured from a 12-ounce bottle into a clear plastic cup at Mt. View in Naugatuck.\t\tA: Poured a very light, golden yellow color with a slight chilled haze. A thin layer of wispy white carbonation forms on top.\t\tS: Smells fairly grainy with a lot of fruity, lemon zest and juice aromas and little to no floral hops.\t\tT: Taste is straight up sparkling wine; like a chardonnay or pinot grigio with more of a malty, flat beer flavor. Very sweet and citusy, not sour, but sweet and malty and sort of gross ... for the moment.\t\tM: Mouthfeel is super light, a little chewy from he fermentables and citrus sugars used here.\t\tD: It would have to be a super hot day and very specific company to put this "brew" down. The Saranac rep told me this "chamblay" style brew is made with lemonade and a golden lager. Part of that is correct, anyway. Sip and see for yourself.', 'user/profileName': 'Gambrinus1184', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Rauchbier', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Terrapin RoggenRauchBier', 'review/timeUnix': 1270431951, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.7, 'beer/beerId': '43216', 'beer/brewerId': '2372', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 1, 'min': 45, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 95, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'I got this one from the always generous BA everetends (thanks Gilly!). Poured from a 22oz brown bomber bottle into an imperial pint glass. \t\tA= This beer poured a hazed reddish cola color with a 3/4" cream colored head. The head dropped to a skim in minutes and eventually disappeared altogether. Only a few spots of lace.\t\tS= This had a bit of age on it at this point, and the aroma was a nice meld of smoked malt, sweet malt, spice, and rye.\t\tT= Big and rich flavors here. The smoked malt gave this a nice Virginia ham flavor without overdoing things, and the spicy rye kicked in to complete the ham on rye allusion. Very nicely done. No hops to speak of. The finish was pretty clean but leaning toward richness. \t\tMF= Heavy side of medium bodied with a tongue coating viscosity that made the flavors linger long into the aftertaste. Modest carbonation.\t\tD= Pretty drinkable, but the viscosity and the richness would stop me at one bottle every time. Still, a very enjoyable and tasty treat of a beer.', 'user/profileName': 'spointon', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': '10', 'review/timeUnix': 1275718014, 'beer/ABV': 6.9, 'beer/beerId': '58493', 'beer/brewerId': '13307', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 6, 'min': 6, 'sec': 54, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 156, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '11.2 oz. bottle,\t\tA: Pours a dark amber red with a finger of white head, very good lace.\t\tS: Floral hops, very green, pink grapefruit.\t\tT: Crystal malt initially, not overly bitter. Juicy, almost wet hop feel. Cantaloupe and melon rind, honeydew.\t\tM: Tad overcarbonated, medium long aftertaste. Medium-bodied.\t\tD: A good beer, I like the idea to meld all these different hops together. Still looking for a Mikkeller IPA to be worth the price tag ($7), but I clearly liked this brew.', 'user/profileName': 'Halcyondays', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': '75 Minute IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1308432240, 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '15758', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 21, 'min': 24, 'sec': 0, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 169, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Cask conditioned (at Dogfish Head in rehoboth!) into a pint glass. \t\tAppears A dark golden with a finger of foamy head. \t\tSmells of bitter hops with little malt. \t\tTastes Great. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'P\xc3\xa9ch\xc3\xa9 Mortel (Imperial Stout Au Cafe)', 'review/timeUnix': 1266123531, 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '10325', 'beer/brewerId': '1141', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 4, 'min': 58, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 45, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '12oz bottle poured into a Chouffe tulip\t\tSits a near pitch black with some cola colored edges. A dark khaki head rose two fingers and fell quickly to form a thin collar. Some minor, delicate lace.\t\tWhen I first leaned in, port wine and dark fruit hit me hard. Fresh roasted coffee and bakers chocolate hold their own along with black strap molasses. \t\tThis beer grew on me the more it warmed. It opened up considerably. Plums and cherries, port wine, fresh roasted coffee grounds, and semi sweet chocolate. Well-rounded, not overly broad but very deep and rich.\t\tCreamy, lush medium mouthfeel that feels a lot lighter than it really is. A moderate amount of booze lingers and mixes with coffee oils for a unique finish.\t\tA pleasure to drink. Robust and rich but never overbearing. There is a reason why this beer is held in high regard.', 'user/profileName': 'ColForbinBC', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Vienna Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'FireBrick', 'review/timeUnix': 1169610314, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '2032', 'beer/brewerId': '417', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 3, 'min': 45, 'sec': 14, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 24, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Found this at a local grocery store that has a great selection of beers of all types. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Storm King Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1113440700, 'beer/ABV': 9.1, 'beer/beerId': '1013', 'beer/brewerId': '345', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 1, 'min': 5, 'sec': 0, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 104, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Bottled November 4th, 2004. Aged and consumed today, five months later. Served cool from storage in my garage but not cold. Hops now take a backseat to the roasted malts. The beer is as black as I've seen them. Brown head began about half an inch and has dissipated quite a bit and it now clings to the side of my glass. Smells of licorice, tobacco, chocolate, and smoke. Taste is more of the same, but with a more noticeable dark chocolate presence. Age has not withered this strong stout. Mouthfeel is solid as a beer this size should be. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Baltic Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Sinebrychoff Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1063034327, 'beer/ABV': 7.2, 'beer/beerId': '2758', 'beer/brewerId': '264', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 15, 'min': 18, 'sec': 47, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 251, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'How is this not a top-ranked beer?\t\tPoured black with edges fading to light brown. Had a highly brown head that was pocky, cavernous, and popping and reshaping all over the place. Left dots and fingers of stain. \t\tSmelled of captivating dark chocolate, calm and high quality roasty wood tone, some dark and roasted sort of spice, and faint molasses notes. Smelled subtle and refined and well-done like a good wine. Tasted of roasted barley, black and other dark malts, some thin fruit juice-like flavors, and great charred wood chip tones. Nascently spicy, it had a finish of dark coffee but not too bitter and dry. Also a fairly thin mouthfeel.\t\tDon’t know what to make of it: a porter with stout notes and complexity. Flavorful and fairly balanced amongst its many flavors, not sure it gets much better than this. A stupendous match with dark chocolate. Buy one.', 'user/profileName': 'nomad', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Pumpkin Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Spinal Pumpkin', 'review/timeUnix': 1226786128, 'beer/ABV': 11.0, 'beer/beerId': '45743', 'beer/brewerId': '14', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 21, 'min': 55, 'sec': 28, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 320, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a hazy, amber brown with a thin, wispy head that fades to a few stray bubbles. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Witbier', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'White Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1279596135, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '59123', 'beer/brewerId': '14952', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 3, 'min': 22, 'sec': 15, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 201, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Appearance is a slightly cloudy orange with barely any foam..with little retention. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Saranac Rye IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1257191410, 'beer/ABV': 5.95, 'beer/beerId': '53201', 'beer/brewerId': '99', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 19, 'min': 50, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 306, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "12oz bottle purchased as part of a seasonal 12-pack at Shaw's in Windham, NH. Pours a crystal-clear yellow-amber body with a good inch of off-white head. Smells piney herbal hoppy with some rye to balance. Herbal minty citrus hops play equal parts with a fair bit of rye and nuttiness. Light to medium bodied with moderate to ample carbonation. Fairly drinkable. I thought this beer would be less drinkable and more astringent, but this actually turns out to be a super IPA with just enough rye flavor to make it interesting. Well-done!", 'user/profileName': 'MrHurmateeowish', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Blonde Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'White Wolf Golden Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1233947407, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '43124', 'beer/brewerId': '17206', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 19, 'min': 10, 'sec': 7, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 37, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'My first time giving this new "brewery" a try. This is actually contract-brewed by none other than, Duck Rabbit! Good choice Wolf Beer Co...\t\tPours much darker than anticipated, a deep orange with only about a half-inch head on it. Disappears to a just a ring around edge. Leaves decent lacing/webbing. Smells of lemon zest, butterscotch, flowers, and slight piney hops. \t\tWell, being brewed by DR, it brings with it that annoying quality that I find in all the other DR brews, the taste of metal. This doesn\'t overpower the brew, but it\'s there. Tastes of bread and just a hint of hoppy bitterness. Mouthfeel is decent. Good aftertaste, like buttered bread. I could drink a few of these for sure. Looking forward to this brewery making a go of it in the future. Recommend.', 'user/profileName': 'Onenote81', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Warhawk Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1185477306, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 11, 1973', 'beer/ABV': 7.3, 'beer/beerId': '36418', 'user/birthdayUnix': 116578800, 'beer/brewerId': '10673', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 19, 'min': 15, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 207, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1301756647, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '(Served in a Sam Adams Boston Lager Glass)\t\tA- This beer has a warm golden orange clear body with a gentle carbonation of big bubbles. There is a sticky cream-colored head that bubbles like pancake batter. \t\tS- This beer has a smooth pine and orange rind hop nose that is fresh but a bit light. \t\tT- This beer has a flavor of pine and citrus hops with a light pungent green hop finish. There is a bright orange Hi-C flavor to the hops that is pretty strong. There are notes of dry pale malt with a hint of light toast in the background. The note of light caramel comes through as the beer warms a bit. The hop bitterness hangs on a bit after the finish. \t\tM- This beer has a medium-light mouthfeel with a slight watery texture. \t\tD- This beer has a good flavor and bold hops while still very drinkable. The orange note in the hops is a bit strong and chemical in nature.', 'user/profileName': 'rhoadsrage', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Munich Helles Lager', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Wilkenburger Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1041611435, 'beer/ABV': 4.3, 'beer/beerId': '7810', 'beer/brewerId': '1068', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 16, 'min': 30, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 3, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '"Das Leichte Helles". Pours a crystal clear golden body with a foamy white head that drops shortly but keeps a good collar and leaves exceptional lace throughout the glass. The bouquet expresses a bright combination of sweetly grainy malt and fresh grassy and floral hops. The body is light with a gently crisp carbonation that caresses the tongue. The flavor offers a softly sweet grainy maltiness that\'s gently balanced by moderate bitterness and a touch of floral hop flavor. It finishes short and dry. A lighter style lager that\'s surprisingly full of character and quite refreshing. It offers all of the characteristics of a fine Bohemian pilsner, but on a smaller scale. Very nice! This beer proves that a lighter, less filling beer really can taste great as well!', 'user/profileName': 'NeroFiddled', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Founders Devil Dancer', 'review/timeUnix': 1178593060, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 12.0, 'beer/beerId': '17538', 'beer/brewerId': '1199', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 2, 'min': 57, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 128, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Poured from a 22 oz. bomber into a Sam Adams tasting glass.\t\tThe aroma is biscuits, mustiness, alcohol, and a weak grapefruit scent.\t\tThe appearance is a slightly hazy, dingy, amber color with a very thin off-white head.\t\tThe taste is biscuits, butterscotch life-savers, and bitterness. The alcohol is not as prominent as I was expecting.\t\tThe mouthfeel is full, with a bitter (but not too dry) finish.\t\tThe drinkability is good. The strong bitterness lingers on the tongue. I don't think I could enjoy more than one per session.", 'user/profileName': 'westweasel', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'M\xc3\xa4rzen / Oktoberfest', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Special Edition - Oktoberfest Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1222410116, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.1, 'beer/beerId': '39547', 'beer/brewerId': '200', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 6, 'min': 21, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 270, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "A - Deep ruddy orange with a one finger head that sticks around for a while. Some good lace graces the glass, and the amber-orange brew keeps grabbing my attention since it's much darker than most Oktoberfests.\t\tS - Heavy pumpkin pie and thick scone malt notes, with an overlaying spicy sweetness that balances the pumpkin pie notes.\t\tT - Super malty, but never overly sweet or cloying due to the tight alcohol attenuation and a lovely autumn hop note. Some Tootsie Roll flavors are in there with a really nice almost chocolate taste. Damn good stuff. Really unique, but still identifiable as an O-Fest.\t\tM - Medium bodied with a hint of apparent alcohol, but as always....I appreciate a little warmth in my beers (being a scotch and bourbon lover, after all). The carbonation is graceful and understated, giving this one a refined and classy finish that leaves lingering notes of pumpkin pie, cinnamon, and autumn leaf hops (in the background, playing an award wining supporting role) on the palate.\t\tD - I think everything I've said above pretty much says it: this is GOOD beer.\t\tNote: After reading other, less generous reviews, I must say that I am a full time malt-head (the scotch thing again) in addition to my role as a part-time hop head....so I may be slightly partial to malt-heavy brews like this one.", 'user/profileName': 'pmcadamis', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Oatmeal Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': "Wolaver's Oatmeal Stout", 'review/timeUnix': 1111619964, 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '14172', 'beer/brewerId': '119', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 23, 'min': 19, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 82, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Poured this into a regular pint glass and my first impression is that it looks lighter than the usual stout. A dark amber color generally, but it allows more light through it than many stouts I've had. The head is light brown with nice cavities and settles into a thin, but complete layer atop the beer. Lacing on the sides of the glass.\t\tRoasted caramel with hints of chocolate in the nose. \t\tA tang of carbination gives way to a nice smooth and slippery mouthfeel. Robust enough to warrent the Stout name. \t\tNice roasted character with a malty, sweet start gives way to a hop bitterness that lingers almost too long, eventually followed by quick hint of alcohol and a warm full finish. My only complaint is a lingering bitterness that may just be a problem because of personal preference.\t\tNot the best or most complex stout I've had, but certainly drinkable and worth a try.", 'user/profileName': 'FirstMan', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 1.0, 'beer/style': 'Light Lager', 'review/palate': 1.0, 'review/taste': 1.0, 'beer/name': 'Coors Light', 'review/timeUnix': 1232157154, 'beer/ABV': 4.2, 'beer/beerId': '837', 'beer/brewerId': '306', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 1, 'min': 52, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 17, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 1.0, 'review/text': 'appearance: light yellow to almost clear\t\tsmell: slight hops, but barely smelled like beer\t\ttaste: Little to none, like a rice lager, zero taste\t\tmouthfeel: watery and tasteless\t\tdrinkability: very easy, goes down easier than water. good for drinking games', 'user/profileName': 'CampusCrew', 'review/aroma': 1.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Arcadia London Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1310849333, 'beer/ABV': 7.2, 'beer/beerId': '4017', 'beer/brewerId': '454', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 20, 'min': 48, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 197, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'London Porter pours out a dark brown, nearly black, color. A thick head accompanied the pour, but quickly disappeared and stuck around as very light lacing. The aroma is full of roasted malts and chocolate with fruity notes peaking through. This beer is highly carbonated and unfortunately that makes it difficult to pick out flavors. A somewhat bitter chocolate hits your tongue right away, but give way to a roasted, smokiness. Dark fruits surface when the chocolate flavor fades, and hints of alcohol pop up at the very end.', 'user/profileName': 'jmvecchio1', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Mocha Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1151548741, 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '353', 'beer/brewerId': '132', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 2, 'min': 39, 'sec': 1, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 180, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '12 oz bottle for $1.49 at World Market \t\tA: Pours black in the glass, but when held up its really just a deep brown. Lots of creamy tan head that leaves big lacing on the glass. \t\tS: Smells mostly of roasted malts and some hints of dark chocolate. \t\tT: Not enough coffee for it to be called "Mocha." The taste is the malts first, then the chocolate comes through, and it finishes bitter. Very bitter. \t\tM: What you\'d expect from a porter.\t\tD: I would be able to drink a few of these at a time, which is a good quality for a porter. \t\tNice try by Rogue, but it doesn\'t measure up to Bell\'s or GLBCs Edmund.', 'user/profileName': 'mjd83goblue', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Censored', 'review/timeUnix': 1260758152, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.75, 'beer/beerId': '3711', 'beer/brewerId': '220', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 2, 'min': 35, 'sec': 52, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 348, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Great look to the beer with an orange copper body topped with a light tan creamy cap. Lots of sweet malt and citrusy hop character in the aroma. The taste is toasty sweetened caramel malt, a hit of ripe orange preserves, and a subtle bitterness form the hops. Not too complex and it doesn't need to be. It is fantastic the way it is, great mouthfeel, just fills every tastebuds with sweet, hoppy goodness, heavy for the style and while very crisp, it isn't dry or over carbonated. You know when you drink an ice cold Coca Cola in the burning hot sun after mowing your yard, that feeling you get like: WOW! That was wonderful! {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'German Pilsener', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Josephs Brau Hopfest German Style Pilsner', 'review/timeUnix': 1213845990, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Nov 11, 1975', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '39382', 'user/birthdayUnix': 184924800, 'beer/brewerId': '10707', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 3, 'min': 26, 'sec': 30, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 171, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1233410647, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Picked up this week at TJ's in Cary, I thought it would be good in the hot weather. Of course, that was before my wife set the AC at 66 so she can walk around in one of my sweatsuits. But I digress.\t\tPours a classic golden lager coor with plenty of isible carbonation ands a mighty head tthat quickly cowers to a thin cap. Nose is yeasty with fresh, perky noble hops. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Quadrupel (Quad)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'St. Bernardus Abt 12', 'review/timeUnix': 1263777683, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '1708', 'beer/brewerId': '259', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 1, 'min': 21, 'sec': 23, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 18, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Serving type- 11.6 ounce bottle poured into a St. Bernardus chalice.\t\tA- Pours a deep amber color with no visible carbonation activity after the pour. A nice two finger white lace that sticks around pretty much throughout. A nice cling to the glass after the pour as well.\t\tS- Sweet malty smell.\t\tT- The sweet malty flavor comes out again in the taste. The malty flavor hides the strength of this beer, the only hints you get that this has a double digit ABV is the subtle alcohol taste you get at the very end of the. That combination could be a problem if someone where to drink too many of these. Overall a very easy drinking beer.\t\tThis is my final beer that I bought in a St. Bernardus gift pack. I am not a huge fan of the malt bomb beers but this is not that bad. Something that I would have again as a change up from the hoppy IPA's that I usually favor.", 'user/profileName': 'cbros', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Claymore Scotch Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1275850301, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.7, 'beer/beerId': '47440', 'beer/brewerId': '158', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 18, 'min': 51, 'sec': 41, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 157, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a dark chestnut brown with a creamy light tan head. \t\tSmell of scotch ale yeast, nutty and roasted malts with caramel and a light butterscotch. \t\tTaste of roasted malts, butterscotch, caramel, faint toffee, some malt sweetness but pretty dry for a scotch ale, especially after having Big Sound Scotch Ale recently from CCB. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Black Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Hop Strike Black IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1309479063, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '58876', 'beer/brewerId': '156', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 0, 'min': 11, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 182, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Pours a deep dark brown to almost black with a one finger head with a light caramel/brown color. Overall this is a decent beer and my first sample of any beer by TommyKnocker - not bad at all if you're in to dark RyePAs.\t\tEnjoy!", 'user/profileName': 'antlerwrestler19', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Big Stone Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1132953282, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '11696', 'beer/brewerId': '1838', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 21, 'min': 14, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 329, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Overall a very nice beer. Served on the nitro tap but the head seemed to be a bit depleted compared to other nitros Ive had. Great anyway. Nice and opaque with a creamy tan head.\t\tTons of coffee malts and chocolate malts as well. Great coffee aroma. Hints of caramel and toastiness. Overall a great smell as well.\t\tTastes a lot like Guiness. Coffee, small bit of chocolate, a bit grainy and pungent at times. Nice hop bitterness as well. I think the best beer at this establishment.\t\tA nice beer overall. I think this would be my first choice if I were to return here again next Thanksgiving.\t\t\tPart of the Indiana Thanksgiving pub crawl.', 'user/profileName': 'SaCkErZ9', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Stout', 'review/palate': 2.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Grafton Brewhaus Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1320557896, 'beer/beerId': '65585', 'beer/brewerId': '24707', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 5, 'min': 38, 'sec': 16, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 310, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'we decided this one tasted a bit like "guiness light", poured a thing brown color with an impressive frothy head. nose was spot on, all dark and bold, with notes of dark chocolate. flavor wasnt bad, but the mouthfeel left a lot to be desired. watery through and through with a very forgettable slightly bitter aftertaste. recognizing that this is a fairly new operation, i will give this one a little slack, but just doesnt measure up to what ive come to expect from a microbrewed stout. the good news is that it was very sessionable, as it doesnt sit in the gut. so so', 'user/profileName': 'StonedTrippin', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Oaked Arrogant Bastard Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1314500454, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.2, 'beer/beerId': '8951', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 3, 'min': 0, 'sec': 54, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 240, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Poured roughly into a tulipish glass, garnet, ruby rudy brown hugh. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Baltic Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Smoked Baltic Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1318558849, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 30, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '60846', 'user/birthdayUnix': 396860400, 'beer/brewerId': '158', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 2, 'min': 20, 'sec': 49, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 287, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1021475047, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Picked up from K&L Wine Merchants in Redwood City, CA.\t\tPours a pleasantly thick and pleasantly opaque black-brown colour, just giving hints of copper-brown at the edges. Head is large-bubbled, but frothy and firm. Lacing is excellent, leaving rivulets of foam down the edge of the glass, much in the lager style. Looks great.\t\tNose is equal parts smoky, sulphury and roasted. The sulphur character comes no doubt from the heavy fermentation with lager yeast, but it blends rather smoothly and pleasantly with the smoke and dark characters to give a complete picture. It doesn't have the deep sweetness I might expect from a Baltic Porter, but it has depth nonetheless. Very nice.\t\tTaste is similar, with a big dose of smoke from the rauchmalz, which almost overpowers the rest of the characters. But, no, there are more subtle roasted characters, and even the hint of high-cocoa chocolate giving a vague sweetness, and a smoothness to the feel. Indeed, the body is a little light and crisp, but this is perfectly to style, and the smoothness of flavour gives it a sheen to work around these things.\t\tThis is certainly a smoky beer. In fact, the smoke is so dominant it almost makes it truly a smoked beer first, and a Baltic porter (a very distant) second. I actually genuinely love the smoke character, but I appreciate the style on which it is based as well.", 'user/profileName': 'lacqueredmouse', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Heavy Seas - Loose Cannon (Hop3 Ale)', 'review/timeUnix': 1231641174, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.25, 'beer/beerId': '25755', 'beer/brewerId': '898', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 2, 'min': 32, 'sec': 54, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 11, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "A - Pours one finger of sticky off-white head. Some bitter hops round up the end leaving a nice finish. A slight fruity flavor lingers in the aftertaste as the bitterness dies down.\t\tA very delicious IPA it goes down easy and is pretty drinkable for it's abv. {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Portsmouth St Danmon Abbey Style Tripel', 'review/timeUnix': 1305060038, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '21629', 'beer/brewerId': '596', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 20, 'min': 40, 'sec': 38, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 130, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Bomber poured into my Duvel Tulip, not sure of the vintage as the bottle was undated, the name of the beer was stenciled on the label rather than hand written (maybe that helps).\t\tAppearance: Amber in color, little to no head even after a hard-pour, what little head there was quickly recedes to a thin ring.\t\tSmell: Sweetness on the nose, maybe some spice; however, it is the honey like sweetness that is dominant.\t\tTaste: Again, this is a sweet beer and unlike most tripels it remains sweet with very little bitterness on the finish. This has a honey-like flavor mostly. The hops manage to introduce enough balance to keep the beer from becoming cloying. This is an enjoyable beer (especially if you like a sweeter beer) but it really would be an odd fit for the tripel style. You do get hints of spice (and maybe some citrus notes) as you continue drinking. \t\tMouthfeel: There is enough carbonation to keep the beer from becoming syrupy and that adds to the overall enjoyment.\t\tOverall: Different for a triple, not bad, but not great. An above average beer for sure. Id definitely try it again if they had it on tap when I was in for a visit. ABV is well masked.', 'user/profileName': 'BobZ', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Ancho Chili Bourbon County Brand Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1313858121, 'beer/ABV': 13.0, 'beer/beerId': '67159', 'beer/brewerId': '1549', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 16, 'min': 35, 'sec': 21, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 232, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'From notes. Tasted on draft at Sheffields. Pours oily black with a thin brown lace head. Aromas are vanilla, bourbon, caramel, milk chocolate, molasses, and a hint of smoke. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'English Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Geary's Hampshire Special Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1082237303, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '1630', 'beer/brewerId': '62', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 21, 'min': 28, 'sec': 23, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 108, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "I took a gamble on a case of this HSA (as a 2002-2003 the store had it in the discounted out-of-date section). It poured A clear dark orangy gold with a minimal head. The initial aroma was of sharp spices and maple malts. There's also a touch bitter of hops back there somewhere as well. The mouthfeel is luscious--a medium thickness offset by modest carbonation. The taste is reasonably well balanced; there a syrupy cherry and pear sweetness at the start, but it fades quickly as the hops kick in, and the finish is rather tart. The alcohol is more evident in the taste than I expected for a 7% brew; I think it's more potent than reported.", 'user/profileName': 'longpondbeerman', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Barleywine', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Old Blarney Barleywine', 'review/timeUnix': 1301411227, 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '2874', 'beer/brewerId': '870', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 15, 'min': 7, 'sec': 7, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 88, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "APPEARANCE: Split a bomber at Poppy's Pizza in Estas Park, Colorado after a fantastic meal. I'm not generally a huge fan of Moylan's labels, but I really liked the brown label on the Old Blarney. It seemed to fit the style and the beer itself very well. More importantly, though, once it left the bottle, the Old Blarney poured a deep, copper-red with a thick, foamy and off-white head. Good looking.\t\tSMELL: Dynamite smell with some strong chocolate flavors and a some sweet malty notes as well.\t\tTASTE: Quite hoppy for a Barleywine with as much malt as I smelled in it, which is a good thing. Again, there was plenty of chocolate present along with some sweet notes, but it finished much more dry than most Barleywines I've had.\t\tMOUTHFEEL: Silky and smooth on the way down, this had a nice, warming mouthcoating feel. \t\tOVERALL: After debating between two Barleywines for dessert I am very happy we went this direction. It was an excellent choice to finish off a fantastic meal.", 'user/profileName': 'StoneTSR', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Newport Storm - Isabel (Cyclone Series)', 'review/timeUnix': 1226251865, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '43998', 'beer/brewerId': '688', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 17, 'min': 31, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 314, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "This beer pours a fairly cloudy mahogany orange color with a bubbly little head that retains a bit and laces. The aroma is liqueur like with lots of ABV presence, lots of biting hops, some raisiny notes, maybe some clove. The smell is quite pungent and a pretty good indication of what is to come.\t\tThe beer is strong, and doesn't hide its alcohol presence all that much. There is a good balance between some bittering hops and sweet malts. There are florals in this beer, some heavy fruit presence, and maybe some orange. This beer is just too strong for its own good. The consistency is quite full bodied, a bit syrupy in consistency, slightly carbonated, and did I mention strong. There is a slight throaty burn to this beer because of its ABV. If this were toned down a few notches, it would be more enticing for my tastes.", 'user/profileName': 'albern', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Drikkeriget DIPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1251877459, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 30, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 10.1, 'beer/beerId': '49143', 'user/birthdayUnix': 396860400, 'beer/brewerId': '13307', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 7, 'min': 44, 'sec': 19, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 245, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1021475047, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Pours a slightly hazy amber-gold, not particularly bright, but the head is an excellent fine-bubbled frothy head. Lacing is truly excellent. Truly an excellent looking brew.\t\tLots of American hoppiness on the nose, lots of luscious fruit, citrus and a bit of pine or pepper. There's a vaguely undermining diacetyl character, but not huge, but it is really quite reminiscent of a west coast US IPA. Very nice.\t\tTaste is also pretty true to style. An initial pepper/fruit/sweet hybridisation, which wells through a light acidic note before descending to a raw and very robust bitterness. Quite a high level of bitterness - I have to say it's one of the few beers I've yet had from outside the US that has the balls to bitter hop so heavily. Something for the Danish hopheads, and those of us outside who are lucky enough to get a hold of it. Mouthfeel is a big and sparkling adventure.\t\tBig, bold and exciting - it doesn't quite have the freshness, and the balanced complexity of hop characters as some of my favourite American examples, but this is certainly one to savour and rejoice that we can get here in Australia. Nice.", 'user/profileName': 'lacqueredmouse', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Schwarzbier', 'review/palate': 2.0, 'review/taste': 2.0, 'beer/name': 'Saranac Black Forest', 'review/timeUnix': 1170540989, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '321', 'beer/brewerId': '99', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 22, 'min': 16, 'sec': 29, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 34, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': "Serving 12oz bottle\t\tInitially shows a dark mahogany color but reveals a transparent deep ruby color when held up to natural light. Half a finger worth of frothy hot chocolate colored head quickly dissapates leaving a paper-thin ring of froth encircled a patchy layer of fine suds. A few small pillars of fine bubbles channel carbonation to the beer's surface.\t\tNutty oil, burnt caramel malt, grassy hop and earthy aromas with hints of bitter citrus peel play on a slightly closed nose. \t\tMalty, burnt caramel and nougat mix with flat, austere bitter and grassy flavors on the entry though the mid palate evolving into a slightly tannic, dry and bittery nutty finish with a zing of citrus zest. A mediocre attempt at a balanced brew, this doesn't have the malt nor hop backbone and structure to support the odd off-flavors. Sadly, it does not have much substance to offer beyond the austere bitterness, grassy flavors and bitter, nutty finish in effect lowering the flavor score.\t\tLight to medium bodied for a schwarzbier, this leaves only an unpleasant bitter flavor behind with little malt presence and it doesn't coat the palate like others in the style. A thin body aids drinkability though just enough to earn it a slightly below average score.\t\tI remember this beer being much better in the past, perhaps this was an old bottle? No freshness date is present on th bottle; I will have to revisit this one in the near future.", 'user/profileName': 'Jwaks', 'review/aroma': 2.5}
