{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Masala Mama India Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1081220458, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '6368', 'beer/brewerId': '1177', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 3, 'min': 0, 'sec': 58, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 97, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "Oh Mama...Mama I'm Comin' Home...Yo Mama Didn't Raise no Ugly beers...too many euphemisms to apply to this one. I received a super fresh growler of the Masala Mama courtesy of a trade with Tavernjef, and I am certainly glad to have tried it, and given that I'm most of the way through the growler, I must have liked it...OK enough banter, on to the beer.\t Mama poured herself into my glass a scintillating orange copper/color piled high with two fat fingers of persistent off white foam...and we're not talking lacing here, we're talking full length curtains. Aroma is dripping with fresh hops, I picture myself wading through a fresh mown field on the verge of an evergreen forest...was that pine sap I just felt dripping on my shoulder? Taste is a stealthy assault of bitterness at first before blossoming into true hop glory, with myriad flavors of grapefruit, pine, and green grass. All that hop flavor is packed in without being overpowering or astringent. After getting over the hop blitzkrieg imparted in the first wave, a good sweet maltiness becomes apparent with just a hint of biscuit/Victory malt flavor. Finish brings back the bitterness and stays with you as a silent reminder that Mama's always watching. Body is medium to a bit thick for an IPA but the mouthfeel is smooth enough to make you cry for Mama. Flavors and complexity build as the Mama warms a bit, bringing out orchard peaches and other fruity esters. This stuff would be great on a hot summer day or, well any other time you can get it....damn good stuff.", 'user/profileName': 'mikeys01', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': "Merry Monks' Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1091846945, 'beer/ABV': 9.3, 'beer/beerId': '6073', 'beer/brewerId': '392', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 2, 'min': 49, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 220, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 2.0, 'review/text': '(Would the unbroken streak of sublime liquids from packages featuring images of smiling monks with vessles of frothy liquid held aloft be continued? I\'m thinking of St. Bernardus products and Dr. Loosen Erdener Praelat Rieslings.) \t\tMute, orange and caramel aromatics occur beneath adequately fizzy, orange-colored liquid. On the palate it is a bit wild, dry and aggressive, with metallic, electric orange peel and over-fermented bread flavors. Gassy, with robot-fart metal belches replete with ripped, stripped sugars and hot grease nuances. Thin where it counts, hot where it shouldn\'t be, this is a careless, industrial "craft" beer. Aggressively alcoholic and lacking texture. A shame. Not worthy of the description "tripel."', 'user/profileName': 'putnam', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Pumpkin Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Schlafly Pumpkin Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1318615928, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '32767', 'beer/brewerId': '583', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 18, 'min': 12, 'sec': 8, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 287, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Served in a pint glass from a 12oz bottle. Small little head forms in a white color that creates a nice lacing as its enjoyed. \t\tS  Lots of spice, specifically cinnamon, nutmeg and something else that is hard to pinpoint. There is the pumpkin and a little nice sweet malt overlay. \t\tT  If Grandma could put a pumpkin pie into a bottle this would be the beer, I felt like I was drinking a pumpkin pie. Great pumpkin character, some nice spice flavors of cinnamon and nutmeg, some brown sugar. \t\tM  The balance of carbonation and thickness of this beer is indescribable. \t\tO  I never seek out Pumpkin beers, because I dont love the style, but this is the best I have even had. For those people looking for Southern Tier Pumking, pass look for this!', 'user/profileName': 'MrTopher', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'English Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Celebration', 'review/timeUnix': 1262225210, 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '55105', 'beer/brewerId': '587', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 31, 'hour': 2, 'min': 6, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 365, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'This the Seasonal offering by Long Valley Pub; it is listed as a Strong English Ale that is "intensely hopped" and does not use spices.\t\tFrom the tap it is poured into a pint glass: a nice medium amber with a brownish tinge. It has a lingering thick head and substantial lacing that hangs on the glass.\t\tThe aroma is strongly hopped and definitely has more notes of American hops than English style strong ale. There is some bread and toast aroma beneath the grapefruit like hops. I personally would have preferred more depth and balance.\t\tThe flavor follows this and is hoppy upfront; there is a caramel and sweet toastiness but it doesn\'t seem as well balanced. The flavor overall seems a bit thin for a beer that ranks in between 6.5-7 percent according do the bartender. It is certainly not a bad flavor, but also nothing that I thought was exceptional.\t\tThe mouthfeel is good and has some body which helps lend more smoothness. In fact I think the mouthfeel is one of the stronger points of this particular beer. I found it to be very drinkable, just not particularly memorable.', 'user/profileName': 'Minotaur', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Lager', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Moosehead Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1165287337, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Apr 8, 1986', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '1053', 'user/birthdayUnix': 513331200, 'beer/brewerId': '379', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 2, 'min': 55, 'sec': 37, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 339, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 905004248, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Clean eggshell white that drops a full peg although its imprints remain stitched into the glass. Processions of bubbles parade top to bottom. A lusterless cider complexion. It looks about as standard a macro lager as there is. \t\tThe smell is trademark macro lager stink: corn, chemicals, and stale water. My nose can detect some malted grain that is spoiled by the aforementioned. The fact that I can still manage to extract some sense of straw says a little something; at least it is not completely ridden with corn. \t\tThe taste is ripe with sweet yellow corn with a quenching finish of straw malt. A flavour saturated with damp grains give it some weight on the palate, the \'damp\' far more responsible than the grain bill. It is a little watery, which is better than adjunct-y. The aftertaste and unpleasantness is minimal, although a complete absence of bitterness allows a lot of sweetness to go unwelcomely unchecked. \t\tI\'ve seen these green bottles in open six packs as far West as California and as far East as Poland. I\'ve never had an issue with it, but I\'d advise a change because "Canada\'s oldest independent brewery" does in fact offer a lager a little cleaner drinking than its now foreign owned counterparts. Drink it cold, and expect what is to be expected.', 'user/profileName': 'biegaman', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Retro Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1067825968, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/beerId': '13877', 'beer/brewerId': '2381', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 2, 'min': 19, 'sec': 28, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 307, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Sampled at the 2003 Maine Brewers\' Fest.\t\t"Retro Porter" produced a nice foamy head but it was bashful-- after a few minutes, where the head lingered and grew turned into a dark dialated pupil with an iris of what remained of the foamy head.\t\tThe flavor came on with a rather earthy character- reminding me of the "black gold" of the forest floor and conjuring images of the dark wild woods. In fact, I\'d use this flavor note to characterize this porter. After the initial earthy notes pass, a hops bitterness remains; subtle malt hints continued on my palate to taper down to a long lasting flavor and a clean finish. Hints of toasted malt way down on the finish profile lingered... \t\tIn conclusion, primarily an interesting porter because of the earthy like flavor start. I\'d like a little more flavor body with a heavier mouthfeel, but as it is, it\'s perfectly permissible for a porter.', 'user/profileName': 'gueuzeonhigh', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Adjunct Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Schlitz', 'review/timeUnix': 1272347877, 'beer/ABV': 4.6, 'beer/beerId': '263', 'beer/brewerId': '106', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 5, 'min': 57, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 117, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Great for the price. No complaints there. \t\tThis is a light clear straw color with a thin head. As for the smell, it is similar to the typical adjunct lager. Lightly hoppy, but pretty watered down. There isn't much to it.\t\tThe taste is grainy and bready. The bready isn't like a Belgian, but almost stale tasting. I don't mean this in a negative way, but just as a means of distinguishing the two. It isn't as watered down as I expected. Not too bad for the price. \t\tThis is an easy drinker. I enjoyed it. I wouldn't classify it with the best of the best, but for what it is it is pretty decent.", 'user/profileName': 'VWBuggirl', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Doppelbock', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Ayinger Celebrator Doppelbock', 'review/timeUnix': 1293414334, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '131', 'beer/brewerId': '39', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 1, 'min': 45, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 361, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "A great big 3 finger tan head with uniform small bubbles on the poor with good retention. Slightly dry and bread like toast as well but hard to detect. Even some faint milk chocolate after quaffing. Great smelling beer lots going on here.\t\tGreat mouthfeel and a nice sweet banana at first with mild carbonation, turning into a good simple brown bread. Light milkshake wet/viscosity feel and some light faint milk chocolate as well. This is a great finishing drink and a fantastic tasting beer. I'd have another in a heartbeat.", 'user/profileName': 'smakawhat', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Sea Dog Old Gollywobbler Brown Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1033931807, 'beer/beerId': '2700', 'beer/brewerId': '137', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 19, 'min': 16, 'sec': 47, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2002, 'yday': 279, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Copper brown in color with a fair but fast fading head. Medium smooth mouthfeel with a clean finish.\tA nice brown with good drinkability, nice example of the style, just not one of my favorite styles.', 'user/profileName': 'MaineBeerMan', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Blonde Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Molson Golden', 'review/timeUnix': 1173468245, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '1313', 'beer/brewerId': '433', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 19, 'min': 24, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 68, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'I\'ve always heard of the quality of Canadian beer, especially when I was a kid, so when I saw that a local store began carrying a variety of widely available brews, I decided to pick this up, knowing full well of the more than recent Molson Coors merger as of late.\t\tPoured into a glass from a standard 12 oz. bottle; the medium hardness pour produced less than 1/4" head, which quickly dissipated. When brought up against the light, this beer shines through with gold.\t\tWhen I put my nose deep in the glass, I smelled little scent at all. "Light" nose taste doesn\'t even put it. This is the chiefest disappointment of this brew, seeing as other characteristics of it are quite good.\t\tThe taste is quite good for a light, N. American brew that is in wide distribution. However, amongst hoppy ales, others take the cake when compared to Molson\'s Golden. A better brew which mimics this style would be Founder\'s Dry Hopped, an immensly hoppy, especially fantastic American Craft.\t\tAll in all, I could drink a couple of these, however, I probably won\'t pick up another case of these, unless I am looking for something in the price range and no other suitable alternatives exist.', 'user/profileName': 'RedRocker5152', 'review/aroma': 2.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'New Holland Mad Hatter India Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1110857462, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.25, 'beer/beerId': '2904', 'beer/brewerId': '335', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 3, 'min': 31, 'sec': 2, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 74, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Pours a nice deep copper/amber color, with a fluffy, irregular head. Aroma is resionus, almost piney. Lacing on this is great. Taste is rip-roaring hops. I kind of like it, as it's not the common grapefruity laden hops of most American IPAs. It's slightly different, like I said in aroma, Piney. There's also a touch of sweet malt on the foretaste to balance it, but this one is hop driven. Mouthfeel is full, nice. Nicely carbonated, without being overcarbonated.", 'user/profileName': 'deejaydan', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Cream Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Spotted Cow', 'review/timeUnix': 1149899602, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Nov 22, 1964', 'beer/ABV': 4.8, 'beer/beerId': '1963', 'user/birthdayUnix': -161193600, 'beer/brewerId': '590', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 0, 'min': 33, 'sec': 22, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 161, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1579529047, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Poured from a bottle with no freshness date. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Yeti Imperial Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1258882925, 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '12013', 'beer/brewerId': '158', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 9, 'min': 42, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 326, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "12 oz. bottle poured into a pint glass. Beer is black with a dark mocha head. Very appealing. \t\tSmells of roasted malts, coffee, and lots of chocolate. Plenty of hops for an RIS.\t\tTaste is more of the same. I find it leaning more towards chocolate than anything else. Hops can definitely be detected behind the malt backbone.\t\tThe mouthfeel is thick and a bit rough around the edges, which I don't mind. Drinkability is pretty good since I much prefer a thicker RIS. I find thinner versions are actually more difficult to drink in any quantity. All around a very good beer.", 'user/profileName': 'carwreCk', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Honey Raspberry Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1173646102, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Nov 24, 1974', 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '4080', 'user/birthdayUnix': 154512000, 'beer/brewerId': '419', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 20, 'min': 48, 'sec': 22, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 70, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1263823447, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Poured a light orange color with a thin white head, little retention or lacing.\t\tSmells like Raspberry cool aid.\t\tTaste has a light malt profile with a strong bit of raspberry flavoring, not overpoweringly sweet, but very artificial tasting. No hop flavors to speak of.\t\tMouthfeel is light and oily.\t\tOk, but not something I will be looking for again.', 'user/profileName': 'bashiba', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Witbier', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Dominus Vobiscum Blanche', 'review/timeUnix': 1315176765, 'user/gender': 'Female', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '15866', 'beer/brewerId': '2807', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 22, 'min': 52, 'sec': 45, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 247, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A good example of a Belgian-style white beer.\t\tHazy, thin golden with little head and few visible bubbles, but a definite effervescence in the mouthfeel. Aroma is typical of the style, wheaty with coriander notes. Flavours are also typical of the witbier style, but this is a sweet and well balanced example. There are fruit tones in the palate that I don't pick up in the aroma.\t\tNot personally my favourite type of beer, but I believe this is very true to style and would compare well against anything in Belgium.", 'user/profileName': 'hopsolutely', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Mirror Pond Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1229216855, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '195', 'beer/brewerId': '63', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 1, 'min': 7, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 349, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "This beer has a golden appearance with a nice white head. Looks like every other pale ale out there, but somewhat above average. Nothing else really sets it apart as far as looks went.\t\tSmell was nice - piney and that's about all I could get but that isn't a bad thing. Rather pleasant and above average.\t\tTaste was very clean and had a piney hopped finish. Really can't ask for more from an APA except for something distinctive to set it apart from the rest of them. Well executed though.\t\tMouthfeel was crisp and clear. No aftertaste.\t\tDrinkability was excellent. If it wasn't so hard to acquire, I'd definitely drink a lot more of this brew.\t\tEither that or make more trips down to the Grand Canyon as I had this on tap at the El Tovar Cocktail Room. It's well worth drinking, especially if you can find it and enjoy a simple but well-done APA.", 'user/profileName': 'xare', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Jai Alai IPA - Papaya', 'review/timeUnix': 1301777002, 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '55278', 'beer/brewerId': '17981', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 20, 'min': 43, 'sec': 22, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 92, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Thanks to Dave for this bottle. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Brasserie Des Rocs Triple Imp\xc3\xa9riale', 'review/timeUnix': 1249858425, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 4, 1984', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '20714', 'user/birthdayUnix': 460450800, 'beer/brewerId': '681', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 22, 'min': 53, 'sec': 45, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 221, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 957884647, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "33cl bottle with a BBD of July '11. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Wisby Vinter Weiss', 'review/timeUnix': 1104837610, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '21421', 'beer/brewerId': '10523', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 11, 'min': 20, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 4, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Pours out in a opaque dark yellow colour, topped with a large, thick white foam.\t\tVery cotton-like but fruity and strong aroma of of oranges, peaches and banana with undertones of coriander. It also has some weak vinous accents. \t\tThick and wheaty flavour of cloves, banana, apricots and oranges. Thick, full and round mouthfeel. Quite tart in the back of the throat. \t\tBananas in the long velvetly soft finish with hoppy note from orange-peels.\t\tA wonderfull Winter Wheat, too bad it was only 5000 bottles made!', 'user/profileName': 'lakevalley', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Flanders Red Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Rodenbach Grand Cru', 'review/timeUnix': 1273640163, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '673', 'beer/brewerId': '216', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 4, 'min': 56, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 132, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Served into a small tulip glass and shared from a 750 ml. bottle. A firm pour yields one finger of bubbly off white foam atop a light brown body, clear and crimson in the light. Offers some artsy lacing after settling to a light film.\t\tTart cherry and some and light plum on the nose after a light hop presence dissipates with the foam. Some vinous grape notes initially, though lessening with air and exposing a bit of light wood and spice. Black currant adds some depth, along with a subtle hint of vanilla and carob, then more dark cherry. Nicely tart yet not really sour.\t\tMostly tart cherry in flavor and with a firm bite of carbonation that tingles the palate. A bit of smoke and wood appear briefly then a moderate fruit sense returns. Just a bit rich in viscosity through the finish to truly grab my attention. Carbonation holds up well over an hour yet drink is kept in check as the tartness numbs the palate somewhat, though paired with food this would surely not be a concern..', 'user/profileName': 'HalfFull', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Sierra Nevada Celebration Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1321558034, 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Feb 18, 1981', 'beer/ABV': 6.8, 'beer/beerId': '1904', 'user/birthdayUnix': 351331200, 'beer/brewerId': '140', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 19, 'min': 27, 'sec': 14, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 321, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1067004247, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Reviewed Nov 2nd 2011\t\tA: Barely hazy reddish orange, 1.5 finger head random rising carbonation.\tS: Piney hops, christmas spices, slight alcohol.\tT: Quite bitter, piney, but not overly so, mediated by an earth savoryness, very hoppy.\tM: Tart from bitterness, soft, sting, barely astringent.\tO: Nice, like drinking a fresh forest.', 'user/profileName': 'sfprint', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Gouden Carolus Hopsinjoor', 'review/timeUnix': 1325180397, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '42079', 'beer/brewerId': '1534', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 17, 'min': 39, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 363, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Excellent looking beer. Perfectly golden, cloudy and supporting a puffy cream-colored head with great retention.\t\tBready aroma with classic Belgian yeast smells. Nothing overly complex.\t\tRich flavor, nearly no hopping as far as I can tell despite the name. Maybe this is the English-style IPA rather than the American style. Bready, a little banana. Again, not complex but tasty.\t\tHighly carbonated and it seems like it just keeps evolving CO2. Definitely a sipper, and a meaty beer.\t\tClassic Belgian golden ale, well done.', 'user/profileName': 'Chizoad', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'Rye Beer', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Righteous Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1295281287, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Feb 25, 1965', 'beer/ABV': 6.4, 'beer/beerId': '23453', 'user/birthdayUnix': -152985600, 'beer/brewerId': '10607', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 16, 'min': 21, 'sec': 27, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 17, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1571321047, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': 'Transcribed from notes dated F, 30 July 2010.\t\tThis was presented to me directly off of the handpump and the soapy head quickly fell away to wisps. Color was a deep coppery-amber with NE-quality clarity. BUPGOO! Nose had a caramel malt sweetness along with a slight spiciness, kind of peppery. Mouthfeel was full, just less than creamy, with notes of caramel and black pepper on the tongue. The "Cheat Sheet" mentioned Belgian Dubbel and IPA yeast with chocolate malt as well as flake rye. Whew! I got a mild chocolate sweetness on the immediate finish, followed by a lingering rye spiciness. I began to sweat at that point, having been subjected to so much swill in CANs. No wonder this beer has a following attributed to it - phenomenal!\t\tBTW, the most current issue of "Imbibe" magazine had an article dedicated to the rye beer resurgence. It makes for a good read.', 'user/profileName': 'woodychandler', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Cream Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': "Frog Island Cousin's Creme Ale (brewed By Stoney Creek)", 'review/timeUnix': 1091487076, 'beer/beerId': '19101', 'beer/brewerId': '411', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 22, 'min': 51, 'sec': 16, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 215, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Pours to a clear straw golden, forming a small white head which recedes quickly but has good staying power, and the retention is minimal. Aroma is inoccuous generic american style brewpub pils...little bit of hops, little bit of malt, touch of rice. Mouthfeel is spritzy and very light. Carbonation is moderate. Taste...I'd swear this was a Budweiser. Same degree of carbonation, same rice taste, same bitterness level, same yeast character...everything is the same. This is identical. Clean finish. No perceptable alcohol. I'd guess this is in the 3.5-4.5% ABV. No metals or other perceptable off-flavors. Hard to believe this is an ale like the bottle says. \t\tNot half bad for a really light hot summer day cookout kinda beer, but I wouldn't pay anymore for this than Budweiser. Try it and see if you agree.", 'user/profileName': 'Mitchster', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Stoudts American Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1231805645, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '1550', 'beer/brewerId': '394', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 0, 'min': 14, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 13, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '12oz bottle poured into a shaker pint.\t\tA - Amber color topped with one finger of soft off-white head.\t\tS - Bready malt, somewhat doughy, floral, spicy hop aroma.\t\tT - More bitter than indicated by the smell. Nice malt backbone with a rather dry, cracker-like flavor. Citrusy hop flavor reminiscent of orange zest. Assertive bitterness that gradually fades into a balanced finish.\t\tM - Medium body, somewhat coarse on the palate.\t\tD - A decent pale ale, but not one of the more exciting of the style.', 'user/profileName': 'trbergman', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Blind Pig IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1263283658, 'beer/ABV': 6.1, 'beer/beerId': '22790', 'beer/brewerId': '863', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 8, 'min': 7, 'sec': 38, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 12, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': 'A- orange tinge with exceptional carbonation\t\tT- very well balanced and hopped with a nice citrus perhaps even tropical appeal to the flavor. the hop flavor is floral at the end and doesnt linger or coat the palate excessivly\t\tS- sweet and citus notes that are enticing and complement that flavor profile\t\tM- rounded and smooth followed by a slight bite that blends nicely\t\toverall an amazing ipa that isnt too strong, maybe a similar style with a little maltiness wwould be nice but i can appreciate this beer all around, i will be buying more tomorrow!', 'user/profileName': 'PhiGDeltaBrewman', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Traquair House Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1089358816, 'beer/ABV': 7.2, 'beer/beerId': '36', 'beer/brewerId': '24', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 7, 'min': 40, 'sec': 16, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 191, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'A very regular head fades into a thin collar on a very dark amber-red color body. The smell shows a very round maltiness, some caramel, some dark fruits, sweetness, wood and notes of scotch. The taste is of a rich maltiness, showing dark chocolate and coffee with sweet notes of nuts, giving the brew a moccha like flavor. A warming but not overwhelming alcohol aspect appears at the time when hops usually get noticeable. The dark chocolate aspect persists and the finish is a bit sweeter than the body. The mouthfeel is excellent, very round and full, smooth, creamy, almost buttery. Thick and chewy, with a low to medium carbonation. A very good beer.', 'user/profileName': 'Bourre', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Highland Oatmeal Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1243471813, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.8, 'beer/beerId': '6088', 'beer/brewerId': '811', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 0, 'min': 50, 'sec': 13, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 148, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'pours deep black with thich cream head, great retention and great lacing.\t\tlight scents with roasted malts and light hints of chocolate. maybe a hint an vanilla in there.\t\tlight vanilla mixed with like roasted malts. light hints of coffee and cocoa. i even taste sweet bourbon. kind of sweet and candy like.\t\tvery full bodied. kind of wet up front and dry in the finish\t\ta good porter overall. unlike MANY i try, there is not much dry charcoal and there is more sweetness. easy to drink.', 'user/profileName': 'hooliganlife', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Great Lakes Nosferatu', 'review/timeUnix': 1290047358, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '1792', 'beer/brewerId': '73', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 2, 'min': 29, 'sec': 18, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 322, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Pours a deep reddish amber with a finger of off white head that slowly fades, leaving some nice lacing.\t\tAroma is sweet caramel malts and some piney and grassy hops, but they\'re not particularly fragrant like in an IPA or something like that. I also get some hints of dough, but the sweet malt is dominant.\t\tTaste is loaded with sweet caramel offset nicely by the advertised "hop bite." I also get some tea in the finish, but I think that could just be an effect of the hops.\t\tVery full in body with moderate carbonation. Smooth for an 8% strong ale, the hops and malt are so nicely melded, I could easily drink a couple more of these.', 'user/profileName': '321jeff', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Bud Light Chelada', 'review/timeUnix': 1321220036, 'beer/ABV': 4.2, 'beer/beerId': '37424', 'beer/brewerId': '29', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 21, 'min': 33, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 317, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Bud Light & Clamato Chelada has a medium, pink head, which instantly fizzes away and an opaque red appearance, with golden splotches left on the side of the glass. The aroma is of tomato juice and a slight whiff of clam broth. Taste is of tomato juice, clam broth, lime flavor, and maybe some Bud Light. The body is medium to thick, and Bud Light Chelada finishes soupy, like a watery clam chowder. Overall, for what it is (an odd concoction), its pretty enjoyable. I recommend it for someone who would like to try something different. \t\tRJT', 'user/profileName': 'RonaldTheriot', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Dunkelweizen', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Tabernash Dunkel Weiss', 'review/timeUnix': 1035918667, 'beer/ABV': 4.75, 'beer/beerId': '1526', 'beer/brewerId': '418', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 19, 'min': 11, 'sec': 7, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2002, 'yday': 302, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Cloudy brownish amber glass with an unmoving mass of a beige head.  \tAttractive aroma of dark malts (chocolate) and the standard clove and banana weiss trait. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Belzebuth', 'review/timeUnix': 1074981592, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Nov 1, 1973', 'beer/ABV': 13.0, 'beer/beerId': '114', 'user/birthdayUnix': 120988800, 'beer/brewerId': '36', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 21, 'min': 59, 'sec': 52, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 24, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1297346648, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "13%er. Pours an amberish golden color with a spritzy off white head that dissipates quickly. Alcohol very noticable in the nose. Some lighter fruit notes and husky grain and yeast, too. Initially sweeter, then moving towards a drier, alcohol-laden finish. Alcohol burn at the end. Pretty wine-like. The French government imposed a triple tax on beers (Belzebuth was the only French beer at) 15% and over, so the brewery revamped the recipe and rereleased it. Can't say I could have these back-to-back, but a quality warmer anyhow.", 'user/profileName': 'crookedhalo', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'English India Pale Ale (IPA)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1232768637, 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '270', 'beer/brewerId': '94', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 3, 'min': 43, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 24, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Serving notes: Hefe glass, cellar temp\tAroma: sweet floral hoppy aroma.\tAppearance: Almost no head but a thin persistent white film remains. Orange-yellow, slightly cloudy, but mostly clear.\tMouthfeel: light to medium body. Extremely light carbonation that dances on the roof of your mouth.\tTaste: floral hops across the tongue. Smooth bitterness is almost refreshing. Malty sweetness present but in a nice supporting role to the hops.\tDrinkability: I could easily drink this IPA all night without tying my stomach in knots.', 'user/profileName': 'Yeastcakes', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Stiegl Weizen Gold Hefefein', 'review/timeUnix': 1141804926, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Nov 25, 1983', 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '13283', 'user/birthdayUnix': 438595200, 'beer/brewerId': '817', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 8, 'min': 2, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 67, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 979740247, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Serving Type: 500 mL bottle, no freshness date, poured into a Tuecher weizen glass\t\tAppearance: Pours a hazy dark yellow, but still lighter than most hefe-weizens. Huge initial head that tightened up to a still-impressive half-inch of foam.\t\tSmell: Not unpleasant, but not very assertive, either. Lacks that banana bread flavor to which I have grown accustomed with hefeweizens and is reminiscent of a lager.\t\tTaste: Tastes more like an american wheat beer than a hefeweizen. Malt flavor is not satisfyingly present. This beer has some of the spiciness typical of the style, but nothing to prop it up. Is this the beer that austrian frat boys drink at their parties?\t\tMouthfeel: Lively, refreshing carbonation. Thin consistency would wash food down well, but at $3.29 a bottle, I'll stick to the high life for this function.\t\tDrinkability: This isn't a terrible brew, but isn't really sufficient as a hefeweizen. It's light and goes down easily, but there are considerably better hefe-weizens widely available. \t\tI've got to say, Stiegl beers have never really done it for me. They tend to be too light-bodied and lack the complexity appropriate to their styles.", 'user/profileName': 'styrene', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Herbed / Spiced Beer', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Ros\xc3\xa9e D'hibiscus", 'review/timeUnix': 1220814569, 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '30947', 'beer/brewerId': '1141', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 19, 'min': 9, 'sec': 29, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 251, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Clear, brassy reddish orange colour with a collar of white foam and a skim of fine bubbles covering the surface of the beer. Floral aroma, perfume, tangerines, vaguely spicy, crackers and oranges. Nice flavour. Bitterness fit well with the floral flavour and the citrus notes added some depth mid-palate. Spices appeared towards the end, melding with lingering floral character. Sweetness was more sugary than malty. Medium to light bodied with average carbonation, decent texture. A very interesting beer that doesn't sacrifice drinkability for uniqueness.", 'user/profileName': 'DrJay', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'St. Sebastiaan Grande Reserve', 'review/timeUnix': 1089811480, 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '2326', 'beer/brewerId': '183', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 13, 'min': 24, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 196, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'The pour a clear deep amber, the head is mediorce, the lace spare, the color off white. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'M\xc3\xa4rzen / Oktoberfest', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Paulaner Oktoberfest-M\xc3\xa4rzen', 'review/timeUnix': 1318087550, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '386', 'beer/brewerId': '124', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 15, 'min': 25, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 281, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Paulaner Oktoberfest is much like the description. It has a thin-to-medium, off-white, root-beer-like head and a clear, copper appearance, with a few bubbles streaming up. Some lacing is left behind. The aroma is of sweet malts and slightly turned fruit (from the alcohol?). Taste is a combination of malt, sweetness, slightly turned fruit, a tinge of bitterness, and a touch of sourness. Mouthfeel is light to medium, and Paulaner Oktoberfest finishes fairly crisp, clean, and refreshing. Drinkability is medium. Overall, this is a very good and interesting Marzen beer, and I think youll like it. \t\tRJT', 'user/profileName': 'RonaldTheriot', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Flanders Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Rodenbach Vin De C\xc3\xa9r\xc3\xa9ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1284049810, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '40113', 'beer/brewerId': '216', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 16, 'min': 30, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 252, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "12.7 oz. numbered bottle vintage 2004 generously shared by Todd Hannon from his most awesome cellar for BA bottle share at The Beer Mongers 9.5.2010.\t\tLight gold/straw colored body, no visible carbonation, minimal head and lacing. Dope funk nose, some characterized as vinegar, I got more of a fermented apple/peach juice aroma, no hops to speak of in the nose. Taste is quintessential Rodenbach, deep wood aromas, big Brett presence, a bit of fruitiness, but overall huge funk, though no horseblanket or leather, overall very very smooth, more sour than tart. This is probably attributable to the unblended 'old' lambic character of this beer. Mouthfeel is medium-light, good effervescence, not sticky. I wish there was more of this to drink, in any case many thanks to Todd for sharing this gem.", 'user/profileName': 'jdense', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Purple Haze', 'review/timeUnix': 1053966510, 'beer/ABV': 4.2, 'beer/beerId': '7', 'beer/brewerId': '3', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 16, 'min': 28, 'sec': 30, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 146, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': 'This Purple Haze pours a nice light golden yellow. A fat head gave away to a thin lace. The aroma is raspberries, nothing else. The aroma is not overpowering like most fruit beers. The taste is a touch of wheat with the raspberries and a bitter finish with hops. The raspberry flavor washed away to nothing after the swallow. It started out nice but ended up watery. I was hoping for a bit more fruit in the taste. The watery finish doesnt make me want to drink more so it is low in drinkability. Overall not bad, average or a bit above.', 'user/profileName': 'Stubbie1', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Cucap\xc3\xa1 Obscura', 'review/timeUnix': 1287964447, 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '36269', 'beer/brewerId': '10541', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 23, 'min': 54, 'sec': 7, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 297, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Let me start by saying it\'s exciting to see beers from Mexico which have color and substance and flavor. In fact this is the first craft beer I\'ve ever had from Mexico.\t\tPoured a meager 1" head which quickly dissipated to lace. Dark in color almost like a stout and flavor likewise was similar to a mild stout but with a lighter body. Smell and taste both had touch of sour almost like a drop of Flemish sour.\t\tAnyway, a big step up from forgettable weak Mexican beers, but nowhere close to the craft beers from the States or from European classics.\t\tBut keep up the good work Cucapa.', 'user/profileName': 'MoreThanWine', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Wachusett Larry', 'review/timeUnix': 1312753735, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'May 24, 1969', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '51428', 'user/birthdayUnix': -19155600, 'beer/brewerId': '20', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 21, 'min': 48, 'sec': 55, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 219, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1437491047, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Received this in a recent trade with Dnuggs as an extra. Thanks Doug!\t\tI\'ve had a couple of Wachusett beers in the past few years so I was looking forward to trying this.\t\tA- Great, clear bright orange/yellow with a 1" head that stuck around for a while.\t\tS- Nice floral hops but not very strong. I can tell that this beer may be a little old, not too far gone, but not fresh.\t\tT- Yeah, that confirms it. It tastes good, I imagine at one point is was VERY good but I am getting the thicker syrupy taste that happens to the IPA\'s and DIPA\'s as they get a little older. Fresh would have been good\t\tO- Would like to try it fresh, it stills tastes good, but thicker and syrupy....hence why all IPA and DIPA should have a FREAKING DATE ON THEM!', 'user/profileName': 'sendsilk', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Porter', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'London Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1088484078, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '4595', 'beer/brewerId': '666', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 4, 'min': 41, 'sec': 18, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 181, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Time for a re-review, as last review was done at a pub whilst on holidays in NZ back in Jan/Feb:\t\tDark brown in colour with low head that disappears quick. low bubbles and some hard lacing\t\tA nice a complex mixture of dark chocolate, dark fruits, caramel and nicely roasted coffee. \t\tPalate is nicely bittered and full flavoured with fantastic texture. The flavours are heavy on the chocolate side, with some really intense roast flavours coming on through. Really nice bitter chocolate aftertaste.\t\tGood strong porter from a damn good producer. Try also the whisky porter, same stuff just aged in barrel. Don't drink this bad boy too cold!", 'user/profileName': 'koolk', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Double Chocolate Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1322188433, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 23, 1984', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '60694', 'user/birthdayUnix': 459414000, 'beer/brewerId': '132', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 2, 'min': 33, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 329, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 958921447, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'pours blacker than sin and twice as dark. huge tan head with lots of foam and a few bubbles.\t\tsmells like chocolate and roast with a some slight aromas of caramel.\t\tchocolate all over the palette and a bit of roast but nowhere near as much chocolate. chocolate!\t\tvery creamy and effervescent. overall medium bodied.\t\tdrinkable.\t\tchocolate!!!', 'user/profileName': 'ryanonline', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Full Sail IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1148364718, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '942', 'beer/brewerId': '5316', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 6, 'min': 11, 'sec': 58, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 143, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Clear, pale amber hue, bone white head, smallish but staying.\t\tAroma: soft, and slightly hoppy, mostly soapy. Minor citrus, but any hoppy kick is muted, at best. \t\tTasting it: nice hop attack on the palate, dry and brittle in the mouthfeel, before slowly fading back. Returns with each sip. Medium bodied, lingering hoppy finish. \t\tGets juicier and brighter toward the end. Enjoyable texture. Nice taste. Feels dry-hopped, and I imagined if it weren't, it wouldn't be quite so enjoyable. Not bad, though, not bad at all.", 'user/profileName': 'feloniousmonk', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Summit Horizon Red Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1281928311, 'beer/ABV': 5.7, 'beer/beerId': '49279', 'beer/brewerId': '467', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 3, 'min': 11, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 228, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Poured into a pint glass. \t\t3.5 A: Depending on the lighting, this is orange amber or amber brown in color. About one finger of frothy off-white head dies down quickly, but leaves a decent amount of lacing.\t\t3.5 S: Pungent floral and citrus hops with emphasis on pineapple and grapefruit. Not much going on malt-wise except for a touch of the standard crystal malt presence. Still, reasonably pleasant.\t\t3.0 T: Moderate, or maybe more, hop bitterness. Crystal malts with a very slight nuttiness. Touch of citrusy hops. None of the flavors are very strong other than the bitterness and they don't go together that well.\t\t3.0 M: Medium body. Carbonation is a bit too high and is very bity, giving a not very smooth journey down.\t\t3.0 D: This isn't a terrible brew, but it's hard to figure out what is good about it.", 'user/profileName': 'DavoleBomb', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'New Holland Black Tulip Trippel Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1036876169, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '6157', 'beer/brewerId': '335', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 21, 'min': 9, 'sec': 29, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2002, 'yday': 313, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'From a 12 oz. bottle.  Label says," We have combined the finest Belgian malt, rare European hops, and an authentic Belgian yeast and finally, the brew is dusted with tulip petals."\t\tGold to orange in color.  Chill haze present.  Aroma is of pineapple and orange juice.  Little evidence of maltiness or cloves in araoma.  First sip reveals sweetness with some hops bitterness.  I don\'t pick up much spiciness that would lend to more complexity. Tastes like drinking pineapple juice with some bitterness.  Not very high in carbonation that I believe is desirable in this style.  Candi sugar is evident.  Beer reveals a little more after allowing to warm.   Still the sweetness seems to mask any spiciness.', 'user/profileName': 'mjohn27603', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Barleywine', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Anchor Old Foghorn', 'review/timeUnix': 1227592452, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.2, 'beer/beerId': '1445', 'beer/brewerId': '28', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 5, 'min': 54, 'sec': 12, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 330, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': "A - This one is a semi-transparent chestnut brown with a big fluffy three finer head. There is a reddish tint to this brew, as if the smallest amount of rhubarb or strawberry color shines through. A decent amount of lace is left on the glass, and head retention is awesome.\t\tS - I can smell malty scotch notes wafting off this like on of Speyside's finest. Up close, this is malty as all get out, with chocolate cake, scotch whisky, flaky pie crust, pound cake, almond puree, and a hint of something darkly fruity. Raisins, but only just. There is also something there that is like an old guy's cologne....musty, but distantly floral. Like old dead flowers.\t\tT - Mushrooms, earthy vegetation, sweet malty cake batter, and cashews. Soy sauce and Thai peanut sauce. Oddly lacking in hoppage, but interesting and complex nonetheless.\t\tM - Medium bodied with almost non-existent carbonation and a slick sugary mouthfeel. This is sort of bland in the mouth, but is redeemed a bit with the nice dry finish.\t\tD - Too sweet and severely under-hopped. This is sort of a poor stab at a barley wine.", 'user/profileName': 'pmcadamis', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Extra Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1109035488, 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '1958', 'beer/brewerId': '339', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 1, 'min': 24, 'sec': 48, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 53, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Basically this is an average beer that would seem good at a party. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Barrel Aged Claymore Scotch Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1318383434, 'beer/ABV': 7.7, 'beer/beerId': '52734', 'beer/brewerId': '158', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 1, 'min': 37, 'sec': 14, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 285, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'First of a few Great Divide Brews i picked up. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Pumpkin Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Oak Jacked Imperial Pumpkin Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1319909547, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 10.31, 'beer/beerId': '72838', 'beer/brewerId': '1416', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 17, 'min': 32, 'sec': 27, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 302, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': '750mL corked and caged bottle poured into a tulip.\t\t(A)- Pours an almost crimson/ruby color with a nice tan frothy head. Some lace.\t\t(S)- Great spices and a creamy pumpkin aroma with the slightest hint at some dry oaky vanilla. Smells amazing!\t\t(T)- Not as awesome as the smell, but still very good. Nice spice and pumpkin characters. The oak aging definitely added a nice dryness and an oakier, almost sherry-like finish to it that is quite nice.\t\t(M)- A nice carbonation level and balance. Spicy, but with awesome creamy pumpkin and dry oak.\t\t(D)- A great pumpkin beer amidst some rather disappointing ones I have tried over the years. Smooth, but tastes dynamic and very enjoyable. The oak aging really created some unique nuances in this.', 'user/profileName': 'sweemzander', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Scottish Ale', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Kilt Lifter Scottish Style Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1153841421, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '6218', 'beer/brewerId': '2171', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 15, 'min': 30, 'sec': 21, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 206, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'A clear, light molasses pour, almost amber  topped by a thinnish lite brown head. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Venom', 'review/timeUnix': 1131853036, 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '13871', 'beer/brewerId': '1924', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 3, 'min': 37, 'sec': 16, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 317, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "On tap at the BelAir location\t\tPours a nice light amber with an off-white head that fades, but not completely.\t\tSmells of mildly citrusy hops, but not a strong aroma. Not bad, just nothing to get me very excited.\t\tTaste is just ok. Some nice citrusy hop flavors up front, with an unexpectedly bitter bite in the aftertaste. Hints of malt help make up some ground, but it's just a little unbalanced. \t\tSolid body for the style.\t\tNot a bad brew, and I could drink more than 1 if I'm bellied up to the bar. But, there are much better APAs to be had.", 'user/profileName': 'MaltyGoodness', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Stone Levitation Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1135670949, 'beer/ABV': 4.4, 'beer/beerId': '6301', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 8, 'min': 9, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 361, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Poured from a 12oz bottle into my nonic glass. It pours a proper deep, very clear amber with a thick, rising, fluffy, pouty off-white head that sits there for ages and only recedes to a thin but complete covering of the beer after a lot of sips. Lacing is phenominal, lots of sticky head bubbles clinging to the glass that mark the beer's progress. An extremely well-presented ale.\t\tSmell a little bland; a little sweet oaty malt smell.\t\tTaste is a little hoppier than a lot of ales, but it's a Stone brew, and they do hops well. The front half of the tongue is tingled with caramel flavors that are quickly overcome with the acidity of the hops on the way down; The bitterness hangs around a lot longer than I'd like, which brings the taste numbers down.\t\tMouthfeel is pretty good, a lot of sparse, tight bubbles come together to fizz across the palate, leaving sticky, chewy reminders of the hops for a long time. Nothing to write home about.\t\tDrinkability gets a lower score because of the aftertaste; It kind of becomes a chore just to finish one of these, much less to reach for another.", 'user/profileName': 'Tupperwolf', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Quadrupel (Quad)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Quadzilla (Cherry Quad)', 'review/timeUnix': 1301263805, 'beer/ABV': 10.3, 'beer/beerId': '16988', 'beer/brewerId': '603', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 22, 'min': 10, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 86, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Church Brew Works - Quadzilla (cherry) a blend of white topped and silver topped bottles.\t\tAppearance: Appears a reddish amber in color, small fizzy head forms and retention is low.\t\tSmell: A not so good aroma on this one, smells alittle funky and not so much in a good way. As it warms the cherry comes into play and redeems it somewhat. \t\tTaste: Belgian yeast, brown sugar and a complimentary cherry presence making this bottle conditioned ale quite a delight. Nice depth of flavor, the whole range of cherry and belgian notes.\t\tMouthfeel is adequate, good carbonation on a light to medium body. \t\tOverall I thought this was quite good and worthy of revisiting somewhat often. I feel that the overall effect of this beer is greater than the sum of its parts, and was the best Belgian style cherry beer Ive encountered thus far.\t\tAs other tasters have noted, this shares the style with Troegs Mad Elf, but I give credit to the Church Brew Works take on the style, as the alcohol was hidden alot more gracefully. Good beer.', 'user/profileName': 'Stinkypuss', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Old Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Old Stock Cellar Reserve (Aged In Bourbon Barrels)', 'review/timeUnix': 1306473612, 'beer/ABV': 13.16, 'beer/beerId': '37113', 'beer/brewerId': '112', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 5, 'min': 20, 'sec': 12, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 147, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Half liter 2009 bottle split between two Portsmouth snifters and shared with TulipSnifter. Bought at Beaumont Market for $22. \t\tA: Dark murky amber with voluminous white head that diminishes to a wisp ring. No lacing but none were expected. Great legs. 4.5/5\t\tS: Nice smooth and mellow barrel character with minimal heat. No harshness at all with a lot of vanilla. The wood on this is pretty special. Outstanding. 4.5/5\t\tT: Again with the sweet vanilla and limited booze. Peppery alcohol, butterscotch, toffee, and loads of other sweet bourbon characteristics come through on the palate. Damn is this smooth. 4.5/5\t\tM: Moderate body with appropriate carbonation. Sticky finish. Good. 4/5\t\tO: Good stuff but not worth the price tag. It's a solid four, but it you could score a half liter bottle for a better price it would be more appropriate. 4/5", 'user/profileName': 'hopsbreath', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Gueuze', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Boon Oude Geuze Mariage Parfait Single Cask #17B', 'review/timeUnix': 1190777125, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.9, 'beer/beerId': '38201', 'beer/brewerId': '47', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 3, 'min': 25, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 269, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "On-tap at The Brew Kettle, Strongsville, OH - 9/25/07\t\tA: Served in a 5 oz. white wine glass. Pours a mostly clear golden with a small bubbly head. Little lacing.\t\tS: Slightly funky with a citrusy aroma.\t\tT: Much like the smell. It's got the characteristic lambic funk, but it seems subdued - apologetic almost. I was expecting more, and to be honest, quite disapointed. Complimented by a lemon zest flavor. Overall, the taste was light, subtle, and a bit watery.\t\tM: Light in body with very light and smooth carbonation. {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Anchor Summer Beer', 'review/timeUnix': 1213914020, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 4.6, 'beer/beerId': '2550', 'beer/brewerId': '28', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 22, 'min': 20, 'sec': 20, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 171, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a dark golden/straw color with a prolific amount of persistent bubbly carbonation that results in an off-white 3-finger head that recedes at a slow pace and leaves no lacing behind. Swish it around a bit to open up the aromas. Smells malty and buttery with some banana and orange fruitiness in the background. Tastes malty up front with some very slight fruitiness and a bit of bitterness to round things out. Mouth-feel is light to medium-bodied and very drinkable. Anchor is very proud of this brew, and it does have the history to make them feel proud of it, but it does not compare to some of their other standards.', 'user/profileName': 'stephens101', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Mustang Washita Wheat', 'review/timeUnix': 1307577768, 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '58245', 'beer/brewerId': '20708', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 0, 'min': 2, 'sec': 48, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 160, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "I wasn't impressed at all by the bottled version of this, but after a week straight of upper 90s temperatures I thought it might deserve another evaluation.\t\tPours up with a thick, clouded, banana peel color and an inch of creamy head that falls to a small dusting of bubbles about halfway through. The cloudiness is about on par with a German Hefeweizen after the yeast has been dumped.\t\tSome lemongrass and ripened apple accent the bready, wheaty base. This one is definitely balanced away from the hop bitterness at 14 BUs. Clean, with a nice level of carbonation. The high percentage of wheat gives the perception of a hefty body.\t\tI don't necessarily care for Mustang's approach to brewing, but it's hard to deny that two or three of these go down pretty easy on a hot summer night.", 'user/profileName': 'bump8628', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Irish Dry Stout', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Old #38 Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1304288907, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '408', 'beer/brewerId': '112', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 22, 'min': 28, 'sec': 27, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 121, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Appearance: Pours a slightly translucent dark brown color with a rather unimpressive head that reveals the brown liquid beneath with rapidity\t\tSmell: Roasted malt and chocolate\t\tTaste: Chocolate, up front, with a developing roasty taste that adds some hop elements by mid-palate; after the swallow, the chocolate comes back to the front; the finish is dry and somewhat crisp\t\tMouthfeel: Light to medium body with moderate carbonation; rather thin for the style\t\tOverall: A pleasant enough beer but the mouthfeel and flavor need to be bigger to get better marks from me', 'user/profileName': 'brentk56', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Choklat', 'review/timeUnix': 1299560447, 'beer/ABV': 11.0, 'beer/beerId': '40058', 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 5, 'min': 0, 'sec': 47, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 67, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A - Deep dark almost black body. Thick medium brown head.\t\tS - The nose is huge chocolate. The chocolate aroma is intense, sweet, roasty and spicy.\t\tT - Chocolate is foremost and it's thick, rich, semi sweet chocolate. This is an imperial and the chocolate is almost in semi sweet chocolate syrup form. Not many other flavors present except some toasty pumpernickel, warming alcohol and a bitter background.\t\tM - Thick bodied, viscious and syruppy. Its not overwhelming but you can really chew on this beer and it's great.\t\tD - Not highly drinkable by most standards, I could still take down a bomber bottle no problem. The flavors are ricvh and intense and its high abv but would consider it more of a savoring sipper.\t\tNotes - If you're into huge flavors and intense chocolate than you will love this one. Southern Tier is a great brewery and this one marks another fine creation.", 'user/profileName': 'BeerForMuscle', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Munich Dunkel Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Warsteiner Premium Dunkel', 'review/timeUnix': 1293166222, 'beer/ABV': 4.9, 'beer/beerId': '1611', 'beer/brewerId': '360', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 4, 'min': 50, 'sec': 22, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 358, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Drinking Date: 12/18/10\tExpiration Date: Not listed\t\tGlassware: Large Mug\t\tAppearance: Deep Brown in color; Thick cream-colored head that retained fairly well, thinned out about halfway through; a little lacing.\t\tSmell: like white bread. not a lot to go on in the aroma, but what was there did not remind me of other past beer smells.\t\tTaste: immediate roasted malt taste, that drifts away as it passes through. not much happening after that. Finishes as it began with a lingering roasted flavor. First taste of the beer is pretty good, but, as I drank, there were no surprises and no complexity to keep me interested. \t\tMouthfeel: has a little more body whch makes it feel a little larger than your average lager. good bit of carbonation.\t\tDrinkability: You could drink a few of these no problem, but the average taste and slightly heavier feel make it a less than good choice for steady drinking.\t\tNotes: Not a bad beer, but nothing special. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'English Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Fat Squirrel Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1131331575, 'beer/ABV': 5.8, 'beer/beerId': '9900', 'beer/brewerId': '590', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 2, 'min': 46, 'sec': 15, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 311, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Like having a bowl of Honey Nut Bunches of Malt for breakfast, this beer makes me as happy as a hurly-pearly squirrel going all hippidy hoppidy from tree to tree.\t\tThe Fat Squirrel is actually pretty interesting especially when compared to most brown ales. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Dubbel', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'St. Bernardus Prior 8', 'review/timeUnix': 1296447864, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '1855', 'beer/brewerId': '259', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 31, 'hour': 4, 'min': 24, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 31, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'best by 07.29.15\t\tpours cloudy amber brown with a 2 finger head that faded fast an left no lacing\t\tsmell has lots of banana with lightly toasted malt spice from the yeast\t\ttaste - still get some banana with kicks of booze but i pick up more dark fruit and caramel malt - plenty of spice from the yeast - not very sugary sweet which i like - nice and dry\t\tmouthfeel is light/medium with tons of carbonation whcih is very fitting for this style\t\tdrinkability - i had this after a chimay red tonight and this was the hands down winner no contest', 'user/profileName': 'jsh420', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Black Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Stone Sublimely Self-Righteous Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1302328053, 'beer/ABV': 8.7, 'beer/beerId': '38470', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 5, 'min': 47, 'sec': 33, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 99, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Pours very dark brown, with reddish at the edges, and a substantial tan-colored head that leaves good lacing.\t\tSmell is mostly citrus hops, and a bit weak. Grapefruit is the dominant fruit, but I have to reach a bit to get it.\t\tTaste is smooth rich malts, rather subdued, leading into a nice citrus hop punch, that finishes out without much lingering bitterness. The hops are the central character, but they're backed up well by some malty richness and sweetness. Looking at it, I was definitely expecting more roasted malt character than I got.\t\tMedium-bodied, decent carbonation, not bad, but nothing special.\t\tThis beer was a bit of a surprise for me. Didn't know what to expect, but the dark color without a ton of malt flavor, and the strong citrus hop presence, are just right for a black IPA. Quite tasty, better balanced than many beers like it, and one I'm quite likely to drink again.", 'user/profileName': 'zeledonia', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Saison Deluxe', 'review/timeUnix': 1180365129, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Apr 8, 1986', 'beer/ABV': 7.4, 'beer/beerId': '32903', 'user/birthdayUnix': 513331200, 'beer/brewerId': '1628', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 15, 'min': 12, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 148, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 905004248, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Enjoyed at the first annual Summer Saison Tasting!\tA huge thanks to a most generous beer trader - BeerBeing. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Irish Dry Stout', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Snake Chaser', 'review/timeUnix': 1252791091, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '15884', 'beer/brewerId': '741', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 21, 'min': 31, 'sec': 31, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 255, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Pours deep black with a thin, off color head. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Winter Warmer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': "Santa's Beered '10", 'review/timeUnix': 1297560352, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 25, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '63802', 'user/birthdayUnix': 399106800, 'beer/brewerId': '261', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 1, 'min': 25, 'sec': 52, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 44, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1019228647, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'not much head here. oh well, the liquid is a very nice gernet hue. purdy\t\tbutterscotch and nutmeg and Pac NW hops are what i smell out of the gate\t\tooh...not so butterscotchy tasting, but welcomingly sweet and dry at the finish with nutty roasting. not bitter. lemon, woody, piney', 'user/profileName': 'bruachan', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Simcoe Single Hop IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1250293033, 'beer/ABV': 6.9, 'beer/beerId': '28793', 'beer/brewerId': '13307', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 23, 'min': 37, 'sec': 13, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 226, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Let's pit the Simcoe Single Hop versus the Nugget, Warrior, and Cascade versions.\t\tAppearance: Pours out cloudy, burnt orange body with a full inch of lasting, off-white foam.\t\tSmell: Delicately toasted malts with notes of cookies and grains with a rich scent of sugar-flecked citrus wedges spritzed with pine.\t\tTaste: Lightly toasted base maltiness with a touch of dry caramel and crumbled cookies, though with only a light, restrained amount of sweetness. The Simcoe hops serve up a fresh taste of citrus, particularly grapefruit, and a nice, spicy 'pop' of white pine. Moderate bitterness. Finishes dry, crisp, and with some continued bitterness into the aftertaste.\t\tMouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-plus carbonation.\t\tDrinkability: I certainly enjoy the concept of a single hop series to really enjoy all the various vibrant nuances and characteristics of the particular hop varieties utilized. While this was previously done by Bison, I had no love for the base beer used, so I quickly abandoned the idea of following that series. I'm diggin' this though!", 'user/profileName': 'ChainGangGuy', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Pipers Scotch-Style Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1195182513, 'beer/ABV': 8.27, 'beer/beerId': '25258', 'beer/brewerId': '144', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 3, 'min': 8, 'sec': 33, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 320, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': "This beer pours a cloudy brown color. The head is half an inch in height, and recedes slowly into a thin cap of foam. The aroma is of caramel with a lot of butterscotch. I like a little diacetyl in a Scotch ale, but this is way too much. It isn't an unpleasant, but it certainly covers up other nuances. The taste is like the aroma. The mouthfeel is medium-full bodied, with nice carbonation. Overall, this is a Scotch ale that I would rather not drink again.", 'user/profileName': 'KarlHungus', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1280341284, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '412', 'beer/brewerId': '112', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 18, 'min': 21, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 209, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'A: Poured from 12-oz. bottle into tulip glass; dark, almost black body with thick 2-cm mocha colored head that recedes 1-cm leaving a nice lace at edge.\t\tN: Coffee & Chocolate with a warming alcohol sent.... almost reminiscent of amaretto.\t\tT/D: Tastes of coffee with a heavy mixing of chocolate. The bitter & chocolate flavors compliment and play off each other as the flavors spread over the tongue. As expected, the alcohol remains subdued but becomes slightly more noticeable as the beer warms.\tDecent amount of carbonation for a stout, but overall it is smooth and creamy. It looks more syrupy during the pour than it feels to taste, but it is unmistakably thick. A world-class Imperial Stout!', 'user/profileName': 'peacebone116', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Herbed / Spiced Beer', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Midas Touch Golden Elixir', 'review/timeUnix': 1265339374, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 30, 1987', 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '1587', 'user/birthdayUnix': 559983600, 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 3, 'min': 9, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 36, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 858351847, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Poured into a sniffer glass from a 12 ounce bottle. \t\tPours a moderate-sized head. Color is a dark yellow/bronze.\t\tSmells starkly bitter, almost to the tune of some very dry wines. \t\tTaste is almost like that of mead, with a definite honey presence. It's taste is strong and very unique. I haven't had a beer quite like it. As it warms, the complexities become more apparent, which add to the flavor immensely. You have to give it to the sheer flavor of this beer, it's very in your face, which is amazing if you like its style. However, I fear it may be too much for those who are on the fence about trying it for the first time. \t\tMy advise: if you're into the extreme, this is definitely a beer for you. If you're skiddish, I may suggest some easier brews.", 'user/profileName': 'techfed87', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': '#9', 'review/timeUnix': 1160504428, 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '299', 'beer/brewerId': '96', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 18, 'min': 20, 'sec': 28, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 283, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "This is a pretty decent brew. Ignore it's recent trendiness, and just enjoy it for what it is: A clean, tasty, well made pale ale.\t\tPours a light amber/orange color, with a decent 2 fingers of head and some lacing Aroma is a bit lacking, with notes of chemicals, subtle hops and raspberry iced tea.\t\tThe flavor is initially steely and similar to your average lager, but then some hops join in and you get a decent bitter kick. Aftert that, some honey joins in and some fruitiness and more hops on the finish. Well balanced, but lacking in flavor.\t\tMouthfeel is slick and creamy, with decent carbonation. I would have no problem with this as a sesher.\tOverall, pretty good, but it seems like Magic Hat could truly make something spectacular out of this instead of dumbing it down for a mass audience.", 'user/profileName': 'HossMcGraw', 'review/aroma': 3.0}
