{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Oak Aged Yeti Imperial Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1324442662, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 14, 1979', 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '19216', 'user/birthdayUnix': 298191600, 'beer/brewerId': '158', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 4, 'min': 44, 'sec': 22, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 355, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1120143847, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Serving Type - 22oz bottle\t\tAppearance - Dark as night, black oil, creamy thick 2 inch head, tons of lacing, o yes!\t\tSmell - Roasted malts, oak, wood, chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, whiskey, cocoa, a little vanilla and alcohol also.\t\tTaste - Strong malty chocolate and oaked/whiskey start this beer out. Lots of coffee flavors add the typical bitterness of ris's. The oaked flavor is a mix of bourbon, vanilla and dark fruits like plum and rasin. Alcohol warm in each drink, as is cocoa and roasted malts. \t\tMouthfeel - Big beer, mouth wrecker. Tounge gets coated with malts, chocolate and alcohol. Palette gets more malts, whiskey and some hop flavored dark fruits. Aftertaste is a little bitter and alcohol warmth is still there.\t\tOverall - Just like every other yeti, this is fantastic. Oaked flavor shines with the classic yeti chocolate/coffee flavor we all love. Treat this session beer as it is, once a year crack it open and enjoy the special barrel aged goodness. Must try for yeti, ris and oaked beer fans.", 'user/profileName': 'wvsabbath', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Hoppus Maximus', 'review/timeUnix': 1137534390, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 11, 1973', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '27842', 'user/birthdayUnix': 116578800, 'beer/brewerId': '12516', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 21, 'min': 46, 'sec': 30, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 17, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1301756647, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "(Served in an American pint glass)\t\tA- This beer pours a hazy golden orange body with a white head of big rocky bubbles. The carbonation is lots of big bubbles similar to soda pop. \t\tS- The smell fresh green pine hops is strong with a note of caramel malt in the background. As it warms there is notes of citrus and more orange in the hops. \t\tT-The initial taste is nice juicy green hops with hints of pine and very faint watermelon. This is followed by a nice malt flavor of caramel, biscuit and honey flavors. The finish has a nice hop bitterness that hangs on your breath. The finish has a slight dryness to it. \t\tM- This beer has a medium-full mouthfeel with a slight creaminess from the fizz. The fizz is noticed more in the finish. \t\tD- The hops were a big player but not punishingly big. There was good complexity in the malt, lots of nice soft layers give this beer good depth. I've never tasted watermelon as a hop quality before but it is a positive one in this beer.", 'user/profileName': 'rhoadsrage', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Wheatwine', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Bare Tree Weiss Wine Vintage 2010', 'review/timeUnix': 1315059734, 'beer/ABV': 11.3, 'beer/beerId': '64485', 'beer/brewerId': '689', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 14, 'min': 22, 'sec': 14, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 246, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Thanks to edbeer for bringing this one out. 500ml corked and caged bottle. Pours a semi-hazy burnt orange with no head, just a thin, tight white band around the bowl. Nose expresses citrus rind, cork, a hint of spice and a trace of something sweet; perhaps candi sugar. Taste is much more muted than suggested by the nose. Citrus prevails, as well as a medicinal quality. There's also light fruit and toasted malt presence in the flavor profile. Mouthfeel is light-medium with a slight acidity and minimal carbonation - not quite still, but close to it. Overall, not a bad brew - a little dull for the style and definitely lacking in sweetness. Alcohol is dangerously well-hidden. That said, I don't see this beer improving much with age, so drink up.", 'user/profileName': 'Jwale73', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 2.0, 'beer/name': 'Frambozen Raspberry Brown Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1163202239, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 2, 1964', 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '1910', 'user/birthdayUnix': -170874000, 'beer/brewerId': '192', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 23, 'min': 43, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 314, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1589209447, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Pours a beautiful dark reddish brown with thin off-white head and copious sticky lace.\t\tSmells bready and yeasty with just a hint of caramel malt and faint chocolate. Surprisingly, little in the way of raspberry aroma.\t\tSmooth and creamy mouthfeel with prominent late carbonation. \t\tTaste is complex with typical brown ale caramel sweetness giving way quickly to overpowering tart raspberry and ending with a clean dry finish. Alcohol is well masked by the tartness, but sneaks up on you quick. Tartness is a bit out of balance and tarnishes other good flavors.\t\tA fine winter seasonal, sure to please beer afficionados and family members who like fruity concoctions as well. One by the fire is great, but I don't think it would make a good session beer for me.", 'user/profileName': 'mghotbi', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Tucher Helles Hefe Weizen', 'review/timeUnix': 1239851864, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'May 5, 1987', 'beer/ABV': 5.35, 'beer/beerId': '371', 'user/birthdayUnix': 547196400, 'beer/brewerId': '129', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 3, 'min': 17, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 106, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 871139047, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Poured into a .3 liter weizen glass. The taste is very nice, smooth yet not bland, phenolic flavor. Compared to other bavarian weizens, this is not too far from the crowd but it doesnt get mistaken for something else. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Redeye Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1254352524, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '4743', 'beer/brewerId': '487', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 23, 'min': 15, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 273, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "On tap at the pub, 5 September 2009.\t\tBrought to the table with a good head still on it. Standard deep amber colored body beneath an off-white head. Slightly hazy. Good head retention and lacing.\t\tThe aroma delivers yeasty fruitiness, a wide caramelish-malt base, and mild English hops.\t\tAhh! Pleasantly surprising, the red eye is a malty English-style ale with a medium to slightly dark caramel malt base, a berry-like fruitiness from the yeast, and minty and leafy hops. A firm bitterness acts as ballast, and it's tightly tied together and balanced. \t\tI found it readily drinkable, and quite enjoyable. Quite nice!", 'user/profileName': 'NeroFiddled', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Schwarzbier', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Kidd Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1253157859, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '22809', 'beer/brewerId': '6372', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 3, 'min': 24, 'sec': 19, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 260, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Bottle from a mixed 12-pack from Green's on Ponce in Atlanta.\t\tPours one shade away from black with light brown highlights and a one-finger tan head. The head recedes into a wispy layer on top leaving light lacing.\t\tSmells of roasted and black malts with good hints of unsweetened chocolate. As it warms the black malt aromas come out a bit more.\t\tTastes similar to how it smells. Black and roasted malt flavors up front are joined by hints of cocoa midway through the sip that disappear before a mildly bitter ending.\t\tMouthfeel is good. It has a solid thickness with moderate carbonation.\t\tDrinkability is good. I didn't have a problem finishing the bottle and could have another.\t\tOverall this was a solid schwarzbier and one that I would visit again. The flavors aren't as dark as others I've had in the style and the flavors integrate well. Worth a shot.", 'user/profileName': 'glid02', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Two Hearted Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1307241112, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '1093', 'beer/brewerId': '287', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 2, 'min': 31, 'sec': 52, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 156, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Review #2,500 for Bell's Two Hearted Ale!\t\t12oz bottle dated 5/11/11 poured into a pint glass.\t\tA - Pours a hazy, copper-orange with a 1.5-2 finger fluffy off-white head. Good head retention with a little lacing.\t\tS - Floral and piney hops largely make up the nose. Lots of fruits - grapefruits, light peaches, and a zesty citrus. Nice pale malt backbone.\t\tT - Soft, smooth pale malts with a caramel sweetness bring way to a well-balanced and fresh hop profile. The hops bring piney, citrusy, and light fruity flavors to your tastebuds. Extremely well balanced beer. Only a moderate bitterness with a dry finish.\t\tM - Medium bodied with a fine carbonation.\t\tO - This is a very drinkable beer and priced quite nicely too. Very refreshing during the hot summer months, but it's a nice go-to during the winter months too when you're lacking that IPA kick. Great all around example of the style.", 'user/profileName': 'kevinv', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'American Adjunct Lager', 'review/palate': 2.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Bud Ice', 'review/timeUnix': 1033930644, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '1642', 'beer/brewerId': '29', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 18, 'min': 57, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2002, 'yday': 279, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'This is my father\'s version of a "heavy" beer, so he usually has some around when I go visit him. It does have an attractive pale yellow color, unlike some other macros that look too yellow for my tastes because they remind me of urine. It did have a slight aroma that was pleasant but faint. The taste is barely drinkable after it warms even a touch, so drink it cold if you must drink it. Feels like carbonated water and the aftertaste prevents me from drinking very many of them. Often times I pass on them when dad offers. In college we used to say "any beer is better than no beer." I\'m not sure I can say that today.', 'user/profileName': 'aaronh', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'La Gasp\xc3\xa9sienne', 'review/timeUnix': 1309236281, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 16, 1977', 'beer/ABV': 6.2, 'beer/beerId': '63880', 'user/birthdayUnix': 235292400, 'beer/brewerId': '16996', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 4, 'min': 44, 'sec': 41, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 179, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1183043047, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Pours extremely dark, very close to black with brown head that disappears fairly quick. At initial pour roasted aroma pleasantly filled the air. Roasted notes mix with a touch of chocolate and coffee. Taste is similar to aroma. A touch of roasted dryness at first sip follows sweet aftertaste. A bit sticky mouthfeel, but overall it's medium body. Very smooth and I find it extremely drinkable. \t\tHonestly, I am not that familiar with porters to debate whether it fits the style. Looking over BJCP guidelines, it seems to certainly fit the description for robust porter. Now perhaps it's the name of the style that misleading because certainly I do not find this beer robust (the term creates an expectation of extreme roasted character for me). However, regardless of style or name, I find it drinkable and enjoyable.", 'user/profileName': 'ikats', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Euro Pale Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Astika', 'review/timeUnix': 1287254106, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '49359', 'beer/brewerId': '2181', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 18, 'min': 35, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 289, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Coming in a 500ml bottle, BB 27/01/11, served chilled in a pint-size weizen glass.\t\tA: dark yellow-ish straw in colour, pillowy white froth, high level of carbonation.\tS: lightly sweet grainy, lightly grassy, plus a hint of sour dough. A swirl manages to bring out a bit more of malt sweetness. Understated overall but not unpleasant or "cheap".\tT: clean palate, the flavour balance gears towards lager malts plus a little sourness of most lager beer, but the residual grassy taste, "plastic" undertone of dry, Northern German Pilsener, and a lightly dry palate in the aftertaste do ring a bell of hops. Not much unpleasant grainy or cheap-adjunct flavour is left in the end - rather, it\'s quite clean and neutral in taste.\tM&D: quite fizzy but not over the top, the body is light but not really thin, and the overall performance tells the story of an easy-drinking lager beer that is neither attractive nor below quality. An OK beer, I\'d say.', 'user/profileName': 'wl0307', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

Hints of brown sugar and molasses add some good sweetness to the aroma as well. \t\tThe beer provided a great conundrum for me, sweet black coffee. Thick citrus is plentiful and biting. The strength of the nose makes the ale seem like its been aged for a spell.\t\tT: As in the nose, the ale is very thick, treacly with hops. The smell was fantastic, but the taste really didn't stand out. Perhaps I should have had this when it was fresher and the coffee was more prevalent. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Fant\xc3\xb4me BBB Dark White', 'review/timeUnix': 1304116026, 'beer/ABV': 4.0, 'beer/beerId': '32708', 'beer/brewerId': '738', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 22, 'min': 27, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 119, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Looks like swamp water, the head is white and short lived.\t\tSpice and citrus zest on the nose.\t\tPitch perfect acidity is the calling card of Dark White. It sneaks in on the entry, but builds strength in route to the finish. Its not funky or bretty or sour, this is the kind of acidity you get from a nice Sauvignon Blanc or Champagne. It makes the mouth water. Beyond the crisp acidity and beautiful finish. It has a light metallic note with good citrus character and lingering earthy notes. The finish is crisp and satisfying.\t\tSharp on the tongue. Bright, refreshing, but full bodied.\t\tWow, talk about looks being decieving. No darker flavor notes at all, no real malt character. Just a tremendous Saison with a zip of acidity. Fantome continues its excellence with this one.', 'user/profileName': 'BradLikesBrew', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Russian River IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1222368429, 'beer/ABV': 6.75, 'beer/beerId': '39705', 'beer/brewerId': '863', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 18, 'min': 47, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 269, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Tried this at the San Diego Festival of Beer. The floral piney hops dominate.\t\tVery solid IPA. Not quite up to par with Blind Pig but very good nonetheless.', 'user/profileName': 'RodBurg', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Palo Santo Marron', 'review/timeUnix': 1262554755, 'beer/ABV': 12.0, 'beer/beerId': '33832', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 21, 'min': 39, 'sec': 15, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 3, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Hello to my beer advocate family! this is my 1st review and i gotta tell you from the gate...I am an enjoyer ...not a reviewer; but i will give it a wirl! picked up a 4 pack from beverage world today @16.99 DFH glass included...woohoo...love those free glasses! put it in my kegerator for several hours to reach optimum temp. before cracking open. anyway since i am a lover of most big beers vs normal beers;is there such a thing? this one did not disappoint. enjoying now with some goodies i picked up from arthur ave. in da bronx...bottled on 05/27/09; gotta love dfh for that info. the nose is full of fresh malt and rum. the creamy light chocolate looking head was a little on the small side probably due to the lower carbonation mouthfeel of this brew,but it did leave nice sticky lace on my new beer clean DFH glass. my taste buds picked up raisins,lots of malt and a hint of vanilla.the AC came in midway...well hidden for 12% in taste but not the buzz. overall another tasty treat from one of my favorite brewerys!', 'user/profileName': 'brewboat', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Bink Winterkoninkske', 'review/timeUnix': 1076023389, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.3, 'beer/beerId': '7715', 'beer/brewerId': '3313', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 23, 'min': 23, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 36, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Pours with a light brown, one-fingered head, fades quickly, leaves hardly any lace. Pricey, $4.30 for a 330ml bottle.', 'user/profileName': 'jdhilt', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Hop Wallop', 'review/timeUnix': 1290307743, 'beer/ABV': 8.5, 'beer/beerId': '14916', 'beer/brewerId': '345', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 2, 'min': 49, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 325, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'A- Very small one-fingered white head on top of a mid-golden body. German malts make their presence known for sure.\t\tM- Medium to thicker mouthfeel. Nice carbonation sting...might be my favorite part about this beer.\t\tD/O- Very different than the "usual" DIPA I was expecting. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Old Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Olde Suffolk English (Strong Suffolk Vintage) Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1253918044, 'user/gender': 'Female', 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '2774', 'beer/brewerId': '203', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 22, 'min': 34, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 268, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Appearance: Poured with nice very creamy tan head that dissipated leaving nice lacing down my glass. The beer is clear with a very dark reddish-brown color that lets a little light through. \t\tSmell: Sweet toasted malt, biscuit, sweet ripe berries and plums, woody oak, a little alcohol, and a very small dry peppery/earthy spice toward the end. \t\tTaste: Sweet roasted malt, sweet plums and cherries, very small hoppy character, strong oak flavor, and a small metallic flavor. The flavors are a little bit light toward the end. \t\tMouthfeel: Medium-light body, a little bit watery for the style, nicely carbonated, a bit of a dry feeling, then leaves mouth pretty clean. \t\tOverall: Great drinkability, very nice flavors. Sweet dark fruit, roasted malt, and oak flavors are all very well balanced. It is a little thinner than I would like and there is a small metallic flavor but other than that this is a GREAT beer! Wonderful character throughout.', 'user/profileName': 'natasharai', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Blonde Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Summer Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1249422673, 'beer/beerId': '51489', 'beer/brewerId': '9020', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 21, 'min': 51, 'sec': 13, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 216, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'On tap at the Sounds game\t\tA- Bright orange with a two finger head\t\tS- Malt and spices. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Munich Dunkel Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'St. Pauli Girl Special Dark', 'review/timeUnix': 1217528715, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 11, 1976', 'beer/ABV': 4.8, 'beer/beerId': '698', 'user/birthdayUnix': 208594800, 'beer/brewerId': '224', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 31, 'hour': 18, 'min': 25, 'sec': 15, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 213, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1209740647, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "To be perfectly honest this is an average dunkel, fairly solid in all categories but average for the style. I have enjoyed this beer in the past and I continue to enjoy drinking some of these from time to time. Pours very dark for a dunkel and produces a thick foamy head that ultimately turns to a thin film. Minimal lacing slowly creeps down the glass and I am not able to determine the carbonation since I can not see through my glass. The aroma is malty, sweet, and bitter. I gave it a below average rating only because the aroma is very hard to detect, I'm forced to shove my nose down into my glass in order to pick up any scent. The flavor is definitely based on the original lager, but it appears to be altered with some sweet malts. The combination is very good and I sure do enjoy the overall taste of this one. The mouthfeel is decent not too thin and the finish is clean and smooth. All in all a well rounded beer for this style.", 'user/profileName': 'kinger', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Samuel Smith's Old Brewery Pale Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1201633385, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 15, 1981', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '575', 'user/birthdayUnix': 366706800, 'beer/brewerId': '113', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 19, 'min': 3, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 29, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1051628647, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Poured into a pint glass and received a one-finger head that stuck around due to carbonation. A mix between between copper and oragne is how I would describe the light, seethru body. A strong smell eminates, giving off a strong hop presence but also underlined by a small malt and bread presence with a hint og citrus. The beer has a ryeish, dry hop taste that contains earthy tones and is not very complex but good. Balanced out by the malts for a refreshing, smooth ale that keeps you wanting more. I wouldn't session this beer, one or two is fine and perhaps I was a overly critical since I know Samuel Smith makes better beers.", 'user/profileName': 'clayrock81', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Penn Weizen', 'review/timeUnix': 1206988370, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Feb 7, 1974', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '382', 'user/birthdayUnix': 129452400, 'beer/brewerId': '125', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 31, 'hour': 18, 'min': 32, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 91, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1288883047, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured from a 12oz bottle into a pint glass.\tI aquired this beer in a trade with Hyland24. \t\tA - Looked like a glass of murky swamp water. It was a cloudy light yellow color with a finger or two of off-white head. Not much light getting through at all.\t\tS - Very yeasty, like country bread. I also got hints of ripe fruit (banana)and some citrus.\t\tT - Lots of yeast up front, followed by a sweet almost banana-lke flavor. It wasn't like real bananna though, it was more like banana candy, like bananna Now & Laters, or Laffy Taffy. I also detected a tiny bit of citric bitterness in the finish.\t\tMF&D - The sweetness was good, but not overpowering and the flavor coated my mouth well. This beer came to me very highly touted, I would have to say it lived up to its billing. My only regreat is having only 1 bottle to sample, I think this one would have gotten even better after a few more.", 'user/profileName': 'nasty15108', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Terrapin Dos Cocoas Chocolate Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1235605525, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.8, 'beer/beerId': '46840', 'beer/brewerId': '2372', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 23, 'min': 45, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 56, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Making itself at home in my Terrapin pint glass, "Dos Cocoas" Chocolate Porter is the color of oil-stained ebony and is trimmed with mahogany-tinted garnet highlights at the periphery. A grainy-bubbled cap of soft khaki foam relaxes quickly into a soapy sheet too soft to leave more than token freckling of lacing on the glass.\t\tThe smell is dark and chocolatey, with mild, smoky, near-burnt caramel and a lightly acrid whiff of charred grain. A tang of fruity, cocoa-dusted malt becomes stronger as the drink warms a bit.\t\tThe taste is mild and milky with a touch of sweetly-bland roasted gourdfruit, dilute unsweetened hot cocoa mix, and a dusting of bakers\' chocolate. The mild lactic sweetness is nicely accented in the finish by mellow, coffee-like bitterness, and a silky note of cream-heavy mocha drizzled in dark caramel lingers in the aftertaste. Earthy, powdery-dry cocoa becomes much more prominent as the drink progresses.\t\tThe drink is light-bodied and mildly carbonated and is really quite easy to drink. A nice, subtle beer that is very well-made and quite delicious.', 'user/profileName': 'cvstrickland', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Scotch Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1280847187, 'beer/ABV': 7.3, 'beer/beerId': '35851', 'beer/brewerId': '14967', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 14, 'min': 53, 'sec': 7, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 215, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Reviewed on 7-28-10\tReviewed cold from a bottle to a glass\t\tA - 1 finger of foam, good layer of froth after the foam dissipated, cloudy tan copper color but can see that there is carbonation bubbles present\t\tS - Sweet roasted malts, some hops, slight caramel notes but lots of orange peel and apricot\t\tT/M - Medium bodied, smooth taste to this brew\t\tD - Pretty drinkable brew. Not one of my favorite styles but this brew helped turn my head. I would for sure have this brew again and I recommend it!', 'user/profileName': 'FreshmanPour77', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Adjunct Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'San Miguel Premium Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1243834541, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '922', 'beer/brewerId': '355', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 5, 'min': 35, 'sec': 41, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 152, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "This beer is average in all respescts with the exception of taste. The mouthfeel is as expected to style, but nothing to write home about. The drinkability is decent, a pretty nice, drinkable adjunct lager. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Irish Dry Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': "Murphy's Irish Stout", 'review/timeUnix': 1268874707, 'beer/ABV': 4.0, 'beer/beerId': '703', 'beer/brewerId': '240', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 1, 'min': 11, 'sec': 47, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 77, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "In honor of St. Patrick's Day - 16 fl. oz. nitro-can served in my Sam Smith Nonic. Poured with a cascading, creamy/frothy head that eventually coalesces into a two inch dense, tan-colored cap. Head eventually settles into a solid one inch cap with thick sheets of lacing coating the sides of the glass and exhibiting excellent adherence. Appearance is a dark brown with ruby highlights around the edges and when backlit. Nose is subtle - dry with a hint of roast. Taste follows nose, with the addition of an expression of light, toasted malt, a slightly watery quality and a metallic flavor that peaks out at the finish. Mouthfeel is light-bodied, with the consistency of watery milk. Pretty good drinkability for the style and really quite easy to session, although my preference is for Guinness Draught.", 'user/profileName': 'Jwale73', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'K\xc3\xb6lsch', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Harpoon Summer Beer', 'review/timeUnix': 1218593984, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Nov 6, 1984', 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '307', 'user/birthdayUnix': 468576000, 'beer/brewerId': '10097', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 2, 'min': 19, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 226, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 949759448, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'The beer poured with a clear, golden color with somewhat creamy lacing on the sides but a generally thin head. Aromas were a bit thin but had a nice touch of summery aromas including some apple, peach, pear mixed with hops. Taste had that typical dry bitterness, but it was light and watery enough to make this a relaxing summer drink. A slight carbonated punch at the end of every sip, I could picture myself out on the deck of some restaurant drinking this with a nice meal. If only this New England summer did not suck. Ah well. Overall, a refreshing drink from Harpoon.', 'user/profileName': 'fitzy84', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 2.0, 'beer/style': 'Light Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.0, 'beer/name': 'Miller Lite', 'review/timeUnix': 1114743255, 'beer/ABV': 4.17, 'beer/beerId': '332', 'beer/brewerId': '105', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 2, 'min': 54, 'sec': 15, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 119, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'this is my first review so i figured id review my most popular session beer. \t\tAppearance: 12 oz bottle, it bsically looks like yellow water, urine like.\t\tTaste: taste of cereal, water an a hint of metal of some sort, not over powering but deffinitly detectable on the palate. goes down smooth as a glass of water\t\tmouthfeel: kind of fuzzy feel on the tongue \t\tdrinkability: exceptionalin my opinion, i mean its like drinking water, if you just want to get drunk i suggest this beer, not much on taste though\t\tp.s. ladies love miller lite', 'user/profileName': 'DERTY1', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Raging Bitch Belgian-Style IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1264153960, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.3, 'beer/beerId': '52855', 'beer/brewerId': '68', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 9, 'min': 52, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 22, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Pours amber with a thick foam that has good retention with decent lacing all the way down.\t\tHoppy, some pine and citrus going for it.\t\tTaste is similar, hoppy upfront with the citrus then going into a malt backing to balance it out\t\tMouthfeel is medium and creamy. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Witbier', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Point Belgian White', 'review/timeUnix': 1041424603, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.38, 'beer/beerId': '40941', 'beer/brewerId': '786', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 12, 'min': 36, 'sec': 43, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 1, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "A nice lighter, somewhat sweet aroma with phenol present, with some spiciness. Pleasant overall. Pours with a big full chalk white head that laces alright. Light gold to yellow and mildly cloudy. Light overall flavor, lacking the dominace of flavors one would expect, such as citrus or coriander. Wheat is a little light too. Quite a bit more hop dryness than I noted in others of style. A little too sour. Has a refreshing quality to it. Average body. Higher carbonation. Not a great example of style, but if in Point, worth a try. Actually, it's being promoted strongly, as it wasn't that difficult to find in several areas of Wisconsin. Appreciate the brewery's willingness to try something new and different.", 'user/profileName': 'garymuchow', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Dubbel', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Smuttynose Winter Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1144886871, 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '26667', 'beer/brewerId': '141', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 0, 'min': 7, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 103, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Picked this up at Keag Market in So. Thomaston, they had a few six packs of this sitting in the fridge so why not try one. Pours a beautiful dark brown. though the smell is a bit odd, not sure how to nail it until I tasted it. This is different, a bit like dried fruit, sweet malt and licorice. mouthfeel is allright. Overall drinkability? Well very different, not appealing at first although it seems like something I could like as I have five more of these. I am willing to try this again.", 'user/profileName': 'Manosbeeroffate', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Smoke (Smoked Porter)', 'review/timeUnix': 1208441038, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '7675', 'beer/brewerId': '3268', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 14, 'min': 3, 'sec': 58, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 108, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Poured this 22 oz. brown bottle into a becker. A heavy pour created over three fingers of creamy tan head. The body is dark brown/ruby in color and no light shines through. No date on the bottle, but I have had this for more than six months. \t\tSmell was lightly smoky. Chocolate. Mild.\t\tTaste was toasted malts. There was a lingering pleasant bitterness. This one demonstrated a well balanced gentle tanginess I expect from a good porter.\t\tMouthfeel was medium to thin. The carbonation level was mild to medium. Seems to be a solid porter, although not too complex. Although this one may be a tad elderly.', 'user/profileName': 'Cresant', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Brooklyn Brown Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1149923314, 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '146', 'beer/brewerId': '45', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 7, 'min': 8, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 161, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Pours a mahogany brown with copper hues by the rim. Light head subsides to a nice film and a rather thick collar. Slight lacings a pleasant surprise.\t\tFull chocolate malt nose, hearty with nicely toasted scents and a slight fruitiness (raisin and date). Reminds me of some simple dark sherries I've enjoyed recently. Light orangy hop notes.\t\tMedium bodied with light carbonation. Thick palate of milk chocolate, cocoa, toasted cocoa nibs, small amounts of cafe au lait, and a touch of tangerine hop influence. Clean yeast profile with a slight mustiness inn the aftertaste.\t\tIf there's a coffee crusted filet with vanilla sauce somewhere in the world, this would work wonders to match.\t\tMy thanks to HimerMan who sent me three bottles to enjoy! Bro, they went way to fast.", 'user/profileName': 'Shades', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Kelso Amber Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1226078689, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 14, 1975', 'beer/beerId': '45783', 'user/birthdayUnix': 182502000, 'beer/brewerId': '8768', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 17, 'min': 24, 'sec': 49, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 312, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1235833447, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'On cask at The Brazen Head.\t\tPoured a pale copper hue with a one finger foamy white head. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'English India Pale Ale (IPA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'HopFish IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1137578301, 'beer/ABV': 6.2, 'beer/beerId': '21538', 'beer/brewerId': '339', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 9, 'min': 58, 'sec': 21, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 18, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "I was not very impressed with the ESB so I'm a little hesitant of this one. I do like the dubbel though, so who knows.\tAppearance - Looks really good going into the glass. An amber colored beer that is brilliantly clear and very nicely carbonated which is feeding a nice constant head and gobs of lacing.\tAroma - Some pine hops with a light touch of citrus.\tTaste - A little harsh and piney up-front that fades into a nice malty wash. Good bitterness in the finish that lingers. Each sip is a flavorful transition from harsh and flavorful, to sweet and soothing, to bitter and anticipating.\tMouthfeel & Drinkability - I think the body on this is really good for style, maybe a hair on the light side that keeps me hungry for the next sip.\tI am very impressed with this beer. This is definitely one of the easiest beers for me to drink.\tBTW - The lacing just never gives up!", 'user/profileName': 'Chadbrew', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'English Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Castlemaine XXXX Sparkling Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1098602938, 'beer/beerId': '14097', 'beer/brewerId': '572', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 7, 'min': 28, 'sec': 58, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 298, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Had this at the end of the humourous and uninformative Castlemaine-Perkins brewery tour. Fresh hops and caramel.\t\tT: Good, especially compared to XXXX's other offerings. Well-balanced hops and malt.\t\tM: Maybe slightly thin and over-carbonated.\t\tD: I downed it.", 'user/profileName': 'landonh', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Double Bastard Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1165208197, 'beer/ABV': 10.5, 'beer/beerId': '1056', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 4, 'min': 56, 'sec': 37, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 338, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': '2006 vintage 22oz bottle, poured into a Maudite snifter\t\t Pours an amber-brown color with bright orange highlights when held up to the light. Appealing aroma of sweet dark and caramel malts, dark fruit, and some brown sugar, along with a noticeable alcohol presence. Palate is a rich and complex blend of malty sweetness, dark fruit, and brown sugar up front. A subtle hoppy bitterness emerges before the swallow and lingers long into the aftertaste, balancing things out a bit. Notes of figs and prunes come through on the finish. Body is velvety smooth, a great complement to the rich intermingling of flavors in the palate. Very drinkable for such a strong beer, and the perfect accompaniment to a bowl of mushroom barley soup on a cold night. As usual, a wonderful offering from Stone.', 'user/profileName': 'ElGordo', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Cream Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Summer Solstice Cerveza Crema', 'review/timeUnix': 1211423100, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Dec 28, 1970', 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '23506', 'user/birthdayUnix': 31219200, 'beer/brewerId': '193', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 2, 'min': 25, 'sec': 0, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 143, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1387116247, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "From a fresh sixer of the 2008 offering. Served at just over fridge temperature in an English imperial pint glass, and paired with sweet Italian chicken sausages for dinner.\t\tAppearance- Pours a rich, deep clear copper with a terrific three finger head that remains like soapsuds atop the beer. This is a malty brew on the eyes alone... reminds me of Fuller's ESB with its depth of hue. \t\tSmell- Sweet and malty, with a nose of cream soda (subtle and vanillalike, bordering on root beer). Soft aromas that waft gracefully in the air.\t\tTaste- Sweet and bready, the malts carry this experience from start to almost the very finish... it's a consistent, and eventually predictable journey over the tongue. Props for balance and elegance, as the final hop bitterness gently rounds out the malts and dries the palate. \t\tMouthfeel/Drinkability- The velvety texture is punctuated by a crisp, slightly aggressive introduction that livens the tip of the tongue. Slick as it is in the mouth, the swallow isn't magical as it might seem. It's an easy, drinkable beer that could absolutely be enjoyed one after another at the poker table.", 'user/profileName': 'yelterdow', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'La Trappe Tripel (Koningshoeven / Dominus)', 'review/timeUnix': 1310761491, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '658', 'beer/brewerId': '184', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 20, 'min': 24, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 196, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "A: A hazy gold color with a huge pillowy off-white colored head.\t\tS: Bready yeast aroma with some very strong alcohol, tropical fruit, and candy sugar.\t\tT: Some bready, caramel malts with a strong alcohol flavor. Tropical fruits and a faint concord grape in the background. A rather wickedly bitter aftertaste that shocks at first, but as you sip the initial shock wears off and mellows.\t\tM: peppery and high carbonation. A very dry/bitter aftertaste that mellows out after the beer warms.\t\tO: It's a very good Tripel. Maybe a little too strong and dry for my tastes, but I served it too cold at first. When this beer warms it is fantastic, it opens up the flavors and they are excellent.", 'user/profileName': 'Kromes', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Bock', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Winter Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1104398800, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '101', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 9, 'min': 26, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 365, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Has a nice brown hue with a decent head that leaves good lacing. Smell is inviting with a hint of caramel and spice, more subdued than other winter warmers I\'ve sampled.\t\tTaste is also lighter than expected but nice nonetheless. No real trace of alcohol but a good amount of hop is used to complement the spice and darker malt.\t\tMouth was smooth and retained good carbonation.\t\tNot such a bad winter warmer but definately less complex than most. Doesn\'t have that "piney" or "sprucy" character that some may like, but i find this more drinkable than most as I\'m not a big tree taste fan... unless its maple.', 'user/profileName': 'KoG', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Old Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Hibernation Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1133931395, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.7, 'beer/beerId': '1446', 'beer/brewerId': '158', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 4, 'min': 56, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 341, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "2004 vintage: Pours a murky mahogany with some ruby tint, and a thick, creamy tan head...very nice especially for a cellared beer. The aroma is quite hoppy with big citrus (tangerine, orange and lemon rind, grapefruit) character, caramel sweetness, alcohol, toasted bread, and some esters. The flavor is quite hoppy initially with citrus and floral character, followed by some sweet caramel malt, fruity esters, alcohol and some toasted bread. While i enjoyed this beer, honestly it seemed too similar to their barleywine (which is fantastic) but i was expecting a much different beast than old ruffian and that is what this beer most resembles to me. The mouthfeel is chewy and rich and drinkability is good but the alcohol is somewhat warming.\t\t2009 vintage:\tBottled on 11/19/2009, ever so slightly less than a year old. Pours a slightly hazy mahogany color with a thin tan head that retains OK. The aroma has a ton of sweet malts initially (notes of caramel, bourbon, toffee, turbinado sugar) along with some piney and citrusy hops in the background, along with some cocoa, pecans and almonds, dark fruits and some alcohol. The flavor has some citrusy and piney hops upfront (but more muted compared to when fresh), along with caramel and toffee, rum cake, dark fruits, caramelized pecans, and some alcohol The mouthfeel is really smooth and drinkability is much improved. I'm really digging this with a year on it, the hops have faded and the malts come to the forefront and the alcohol has really mellowed...I've got another bottle I'll leave alone for a year or so to see how this one matures further.", 'user/profileName': 'silver0rlead', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Southampton IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1305178753, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 23, 1988', 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '8312', 'user/birthdayUnix': 583052400, 'beer/brewerId': '1628', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 5, 'min': 39, 'sec': 13, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 132, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 835283048, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A - Pours a clear copper-orange color with a finger of white head. The head fades down to a thin right around the outside leaving behind some lacing in the process.\t\tS - Aroma is a mix of piney and citrus hops and sweet caramel malts. There is also some more background fruits mixed in as well.\t\tT - Starts off with sweet caramel malt and some citrus hop in the background. There is some other fruity flavors mixing around. Through the middle, some stronger citrus hops some though with a bit of bitterness. The finish is a mix of some stronger hop flavor and caramel malts that linger nicely.\t\tM - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth and crisp. The finish is a touch dry and bitter and kinda nice.\t\tD - Very drinkable. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Doppelbock', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Thomas Hooker Liberator Doppelbock', 'review/timeUnix': 1145642172, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '15589', 'beer/brewerId': '696', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 17, 'min': 56, 'sec': 12, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 111, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "1 liter, poured in Aventinus glass, then poured again, and again....\tdeep mahogany with a massive head demonstrating gradations of tan, slowly fell but left audacious, chunky clumps of lacing. sharp attack, nicely subdued chocalety sweet with dark bready smells. delicious rich blend of roasted dark coffee, faint chocolate, and hazlenut tastes---molasses. palate has fine carbonation full big malty richness like heaven. delicious.easy to delight in. i'm very happy.", 'user/profileName': 'villainchiwwin', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Rye Beer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Scratch Beer 25 - 2009 (Magical Moustache Rye)', 'review/timeUnix': 1261692055, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 11, 1986', 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '54495', 'user/birthdayUnix': 521449200, 'beer/brewerId': '694', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 22, 'min': 0, 'sec': 55, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 358, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 896886247, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'A: Nice amber color with a quarter inch of off white head that does not retain all that well. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Dubbel', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Blue Label Grand Reserve', 'review/timeUnix': 1190133890, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '26280', 'beer/brewerId': '1169', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 16, 'min': 44, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 261, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Found at Fitger's, August '07.\t\tThis one looks a lot like coke with some cherry highlights. When held to the light, this baby glows. The head was but a little collar.\t\tSmells of prunes and then some more prunes. This is accompanied by a slight astringent alcohol with a light raisin and a bunch of other dark fruits. The dark fruit emphasis seems to be lacking balance.\t\tTastes of sweet brown sugar, maple syrup and huge prunes again. A light roasted coffee fades in to finish it off.\t\tFeels light and dense that amplifies the sweetness. \t\tA good intro to Belgian flavors, but way to sweet and fruity for my liking.", 'user/profileName': 'DarkerTheBetter', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'California Common / Steam Beer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Best Of Beer Camp: California Common - Beer Camp #8', 'review/timeUnix': 1308802085, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '68960', 'beer/brewerId': '140', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 4, 'min': 8, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 174, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '2011, beer camp #8.\t\tPours a clear golden orange color with a one finger foamy white head that quickly settles into a thin ring. Minimal spots of lace left behind.\t\tSlightly earthy aroma with hints of pine and grassy hops along with some sweet pale malt notes. Hints of biscuit and light caramel along with some light fruit, especially apricot.\t\tFuller boded than expected and the hop presence is much stronger than the aroma suggests. Earthy, floral and dry up front but only slightly bitter with hints of grass, pine and soil. This is countered by a sweet malt presence with hints of caramel, toffee, biscuit and faint nuttiness. Crisp, well balanced and easy to drink with a dry, spicy hop finish.', 'user/profileName': 'corby112', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Dunkelweizen', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Dunkel Sam', 'review/timeUnix': 1156107642, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.4, 'beer/beerId': '32294', 'beer/brewerId': '747', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 21, 'min': 0, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 232, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "This is a pint glass of the new seasonal dunkel weizen served chilled.\t\tA: The ale is a hazy light brown color with a small head and no lacing.\t\tS: The ale has a bubblegum clove aroma that is quite sweet.\t\tT: The ale has the requisite clove and banana flavors that I'd expect from a dunkel weizen but the beer seems to come just shy of being great. The flavors are too sweet.\t\tM: The mouthfeel is hurt a bit by the over-cloving.\t\tD: Very drinkable, but I'll stick to the vintage list thanks.", 'user/profileName': 'akorsak', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Witbier', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Hitachino Nest White Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1305670710, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '2013', 'beer/brewerId': '697', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 22, 'min': 18, 'sec': 30, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 137, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "11.2 oz. bottle poured into my Hoegaarden glass.\t\tA: A really nice color. A unfiltered golden that poured pretty flat without much carbonation. Stills looks pretty darn good though. Suspended yeast towards the bottom of the glass.\t\tS: Wonderful aromas of orange peel & spice. Much more aromatic then most Wit's I've come across.\t\tT: A slightly tangy taste. The spices (coriander, clove) definately come through. The citrus flavor is also quite detectable.\t\tM: A refreshing mouthfeel! {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Mugshot IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1275943781, 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '57004', 'beer/brewerId': '21635', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 20, 'min': 49, 'sec': 41, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 158, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Appearance: Dispensed a light copper body, lightly hazed and capped with a finely-textured, white head.\t\tSmell: Aroma of pale malts with a hint of sugary caramel. The hops (Chinook, Sterling, and Cascade) throw off notes of fresh florals, citrus fruits, and (lightly) pine.\t\tTaste: Pale malts with a modest amount of supporting caramel sweetness. Hop flavors present fresh orange peelings, white pine, and humble meadow flowers. Medium bitterness. A bit more maltiness prior to the bittersweet finish.\t\tMouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel.\t\tDrinkability: A decent India Pale Ale out of Jailhouse. Any hopheads looking to receive a curb-kicking of hop character and bitterness will be left wanting, but those seeking a balanced IPA should be pleased.', 'user/profileName': 'ChainGangGuy', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Amber Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1205172545, 'beer/beerId': '41497', 'beer/brewerId': '1318', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 18, 'min': 9, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 70, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "This might be another one of Basil T's year round brews. They didn't list this one in their beer menu, but the bartender told me that they had this one and it's different from thier Red Ale. On tap on 3/8/08 and it was served to me in a Pilsner glass.\t\tIt poured a light clear amber that had a thin head of white foam that quickly dissipated into a handful of white foamy rings, one streak of white lace, and a few spots of lace. It had an unusual smoky aroma that contained green olives, wood, toasted malts, and a hint of caramel. Then toward the bottom, the aroma started to get sour. What an odd aroma! The taste started off faint with toasted malts and caramel. Then halfway through, the taste all of a sudden became crispy with citrus hops and a slice of grapefruit. It was a light bodied beer that had a slightly malty and crispy aftertaste of toasted malts and citrus hops. It was just an average beer. I wouldn't mind ordering this beer again if it was the only thing they had.", 'user/profileName': 'AltBock', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Ground Break', 'review/timeUnix': 1270329820, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.2, 'beer/beerId': '55838', 'beer/brewerId': '651', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 21, 'min': 23, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 93, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "On-tap at Clark's Ale House. While the flavor focuses on crisp malt and herbal spices while the aroma is filled with smooth floral hops that make a great compliment to the grassy and citrus yeast character. Like hops and saisons? Give this a try.", 'user/profileName': 'tempest', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'German Pilsener', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Ptarmigan Pilsner', 'review/timeUnix': 1167105509, 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '11044', 'beer/brewerId': '2877', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 3, 'min': 58, 'sec': 29, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 360, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Bottle was a 2006 GABF left-over that was given to me as a reward for my volunteer efforts. Smells a little bit orange and hay. Very mild and a touch metallic.\t\tTastes wet sweet. A touch grassy and some oranges. Some sour tang. The sweet becomes a bit much. Aftertaste show a mild and drying hop bitter.\t\tMd body for the style and modest carbonation.', 'user/profileName': 'mentor', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Just Outstanding IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1307250816, 'beer/ABV': 6.8, 'beer/beerId': '35608', 'beer/brewerId': '14064', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 5, 'min': 13, 'sec': 36, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 156, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Thanks to mikesgroove for this extra!\t\tThis brew pours a light straw color and settles a haze infused yellow orange. 2 fingers of a chunky off white head sits forever..\t\tThe nose is clean and hoppy. Fresh citrus, light pine, and a bit of caramel lingers.\t\tThe taste is quite the same. Some crisp, bitter offerings akin to grapefruit and pine. The malt bill is quite large but finishes with hop offerings easily applied. A sweet, buttered biscuit taste sits briefly and translates into a caramel taste.\t\tThe mouthfeel is rich and creamy given the style. Comes on flavorful and bold and ends crsip and a little dry. Enjoyable.\t\tOverall, bomb ass IPA. Full of flavor with a great nose and a smooth mouthfeel. Pretty spot-on.', 'user/profileName': 'ChugginOil', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Dubbel', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Pays Du Soleil', 'review/timeUnix': 1272844267, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '52493', 'beer/brewerId': '16205', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 23, 'min': 51, 'sec': 7, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 122, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Amber-red with a thin white head that remains. Good lacing.\tSmell is tart, fruity funk with some spicey notes. Grapes, cherry, figs, and other fruity notes. Curious metallic note in there as well.\tTaste is strong Belgian yeast and malts, with more tart funkiness, though less so than on the nose. Peach, banana, figs, as well as green grapes are some of the fruits I can discern. Peppery finish from the wild yeast.\tMouthfeel is crisp with a dry finish. Nice bite on the tonue. Medium-light body.\tDrinkability is good. Alcohol is well-hidden.', 'user/profileName': 'Parrotbeak', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': '60 Minute IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1182576555, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '6108', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 5, 'min': 29, 'sec': 15, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 174, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Golden amber in color, smell is of malt, and hops. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Flanders Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Verhaeghe Echte Kriek / Echte Kriekenbier', 'review/timeUnix': 1235448070, 'beer/ABV': 6.8, 'beer/beerId': '7183', 'beer/brewerId': '641', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 4, 'min': 1, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 55, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "I love the deep dark red of this beer, a near black cherry color with a tinge of mahogany. Served in a tulip glass, it has a constant head and a champagne-like stream of co2 coming from its depth. This is a nice looking glass of Red Flemish Ale.\t\tThe aroma is sharp. The cherry is there up front, and underneath the malt. But there is also a small bit of acrid aroma that I can't quite place.\t\tSour cherry hits the palate first, with enough sweetness to keep it interesting.As that fades away it becomes a little too sour. However, after about a minute or so, the finish is nice and malty. A strong start, a good finish, but an iffy middle.\t\tA good zip of carbonation keeps the mouthfeel lively, and a strong head gives a bit of a creamy texture. Very nice indeed.\t\tIf you're a fan of Flemish Ale, this is a very nice beer. There are some things holding it back, but overall, a fine notch to put on one's belt, so to speak.", 'user/profileName': 'AccidentalKate', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Milk / Sweet Stout', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Milk Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1214484515, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '3960', 'beer/brewerId': '743', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 12, 'min': 48, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 178, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Bottle into pint glass\t\tA- Black with no light passing thru and a light oatmeal head that remains strong.\t\tS- Sweet roast malts.\t\tT- Burnt malt with sweet milk on the backend.\t\tM- Medium. very smooth and siky. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Bock', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Winter Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1170139913, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '101', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 6, 'min': 51, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 30, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "pours a reddish copper. nice and clear, good off-white head.\t\tsmells very spicy. i can smell the cinnamon for sure, some gingery smells also. very malty aroma.\t\ttaste is malty and full. nice creaminess to it. the spices mellow out the finish. it's pretty good. better than i expected as i'm not big on the spiced beers, but this isn't overdone.\t\tmouthfeel is almost creamy with a crisp finish to it. overall i'm impressed.", 'user/profileName': 'JasonCoop', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Bourbon Fred From The Wood', 'review/timeUnix': 1325402484, 'beer/ABV': 12.0, 'beer/beerId': '51422', 'beer/brewerId': '173', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 7, 'min': 21, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2012, 'yday': 1, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "poured into a tulip. \t\tpours a slightly murky copper/brownish. rumors of undercarbed are greatly exaggerated; this baby is flat as a fritter. nose - holy oak bombs batman! some bourbon and alcohol coming in behind.\ttaste - very sweet front end. caramel, maybe brown sugar. it'd almost be too much if the oak finish didn't clean things up with a dry burst at the end. \tlack of carbonation is so disappointing. this beer would be epic with even a hint of body. i've force-carbed it at home and it moves from good to great.\texcellent beer, in spite of the carb issue, glad i've got some to lay down and age.", 'user/profileName': 'robbrandes', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Red Barn Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1224274701, 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '32423', 'beer/brewerId': '18149', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 20, 'min': 18, 'sec': 21, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 291, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "I feel lost Abbey's beers range from the sublime to the mundane. This beer had elements of both.\t\tThe mouthfeel was incredible - had the velvet smoothness of an oatmeal stout, but also the effervescent acidity of a Saison.\t\tBright golden sunlight in your eyeball - it was tantalizing.\t\tThe aroma was lacking, almost nonexistent. Wonder why?\t\tEither way this beer was very drinkable, and definitely would go quite well with some fried eggs or pommes frites.", 'user/profileName': 'Sixpoint', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Siberian Night Imperial Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1190067210, 'beer/ABV': 9.7, 'beer/beerId': '8023', 'beer/brewerId': '12516', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 22, 'min': 13, 'sec': 30, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 260, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured straight out of the refrigerator for a solid one inch tawny head that dissipated after 10 minutes or so. Obsidian in color, and not giving light a bit of passage even when drawn out across the glass. INTENSE, HUGE nose of Sweet Malty Grains, like when my dad used to take me to the Grain Elevator as a kid as well as slight licorice notes and alcohol at the edges as well as caramelized sugar. In my haste, I sipped too soon and was rewarded with flat black coffee, anise, and some burnt notes (my fault, not the beer's). After patiently waiting for it to warm, I noticed my first impression was that the mouthfeel was somewhat lighter than I had expected, adding to it's drinkability, but when I drink an imperial stout, I'm generally happy after one and don't mind a little extra viscosity. On the tongue it has a lot of heavily roasted (burnt?) coffee and a tiny bit of sweetness giving way to some caramel notes and then back to the bitterness of baker's cocoa that produces a drying effect on the palate-I wish the sweetness would linger somewhat as well. I wouldn't say I was dissapointed, as this is a quaffable stout to be sure-I just wish that some of the tremendous characteristics on the nose had carried through to the overall impression in the mouth.", 'user/profileName': 'sb305198', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Gulden Draak (Dark Triple)', 'review/timeUnix': 1248835146, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 7, 1977', 'beer/ABV': 10.5, 'beer/beerId': '155', 'user/birthdayUnix': 245055600, 'beer/brewerId': '48', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 2, 'min': 39, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 210, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1173279847, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "A - deep burgundy, clear, low tan head, still leaves a bit of lace\t\tS - very fruity nose, plums, cherry, not overly spicy, but some there\t\tT - ripe dark fruit soaked in alcohol, rich maltiness, delightful spice notes, aftertaste is more lingering fruit\t\tM - low carbonation, but still light and creamy, doesn't detract at all, noticable alcohol warmth, but quite welcoming\t\tD - excellent fruit flavours, perfect balance of malt and spice, very tasty\t\tThe somewhat lifeless look and aroma are very deceiving, the taste and mouthfeel are superb. There is a little roastyness and sweetness, but the hops still make their presence known.\t\tSo, it's not a traditional IPA. It is still a great beer.", 'user/profileName': 'aeminter', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Spring Fever Belgian Style Grand Cru Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1019681692, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '3362', 'beer/brewerId': '859', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 20, 'min': 54, 'sec': 52, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2002, 'yday': 114, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Presentation: 22 oz brown bomber, “unfiltered and unpasteurized, please refrigerate” on the label. No freshness date.\t\tAppearance: Bold orange amber colour with a mild chill haze, big frothy cream coloured head nearly over flows and seems to stick all over the glass.\t\tSmell: Big time coriander with a floral hop in the back, fresh oranges with a hint of ester.\t\tTaste: Very creamy medium body with a luscious and smooth carbonation. A full and rounded sweetness with flavours of coriander and citric rind riding out its wake. Hop bitterness is quite noticeable but not harsh, more of a pungent flavour that tries to meld with the fruitiness. Estery alcohol flares a bit with fruity and mild solvent flavours. A tight spiciness opens up in the middle with a quick peppery note and a bite from the hops as well as a meek medicinal phenol that rounds the brew out. An underlying nuttiness from the yeast adds an other complex bite to the every growing hop flavour that is bothersome and oddly attractive at the same time.\t\tNotes: This brew reminds me of some of the new upstarts in Belgium and their generous use of hops in traditional styles as well as their own. A good paring would be with a plate of assorted pungent soft cheeses with whole grain rye crackers and fresh orange wedges to break up the flavours.', 'user/profileName': 'Jason', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Munich Dunkel Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Flensburger Dunkel', 'review/timeUnix': 1284272011, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'May 25, 1972', 'beer/ABV': 4.8, 'beer/beerId': '6711', 'user/birthdayUnix': 75625200, 'beer/brewerId': '2854', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 6, 'min': 13, 'sec': 31, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 255, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1342710247, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Had a bottle recently at a friends house.\t\tAppearance: Poured into a 1/2 mass glass krug. Came out with a nice deep red with a bit of lighter (orangy?) tones. 2 finger head that quickly disappeared with minimal lacing.\t\tSmell: Slightly sweet with a hint of grains. Overall a quite pleasant aroma.\t\tTaste: Light taste with a decent sweetness. The taste seemed to match the smell as it wasn't too sweet and had a decent grain aftertaste.\t\tMouthfeel: Slightly thick with perhaps a bit too much carbonation.\t\tDrinkability: Good beer... not great, I liked it fine but thought it might have needed a bit more of a roasted taste.\t\tI would not go out of my way to find this but also wouldn't turn one down if offered again.", 'user/profileName': 'bueschen', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Curly', 'review/timeUnix': 1126197166, 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '25747', 'beer/brewerId': '10012', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 16, 'min': 32, 'sec': 46, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 251, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "This brew is the Ladera Ranch entry into the Backstreet Brewing 'Carpool Experiment' in which the three brewers we given matching quantities of fermentables, hops & spices, and the same White Labs Belgian yeast strain.\t\tThis one pours a deep copper capped with a dense collar of tan foam with outstanding clarity.\t\tEntry is smooth with a subdued level of carbonation allowing orange peel and the Belgian yeast to shine. Mid-taste begins with a deep malt presence combined with complex spiciness.\t\tThe finish is dry and ping-pongs between the distinct yeast and malty spices. Mouthfeel is full without chalkiness and finishes dry.\t\tWithout a doubt, my favorite of the three experimental beers.", 'user/profileName': 'IceAce', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1322659891, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '58319', 'beer/brewerId': '22829', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 13, 'min': 31, 'sec': 31, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 334, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "A couple days with Grecian wines proved satisfactory enough, however for the eve before the wedding of yours truly I was delighted to find some semblance of hops at the Wine Restaurant in Fira, Santorini in this finely crafted ale.\t\tA deep amber hue with a modest haze gives the impression of rich Pale Ales or English Mild Ale. Light lace was a sight for sore eyes after looking for the same with their famed white wines and desert digestives.\t\tAn British-like demeanor chases this beer from the early nose of yeast fruits, hearty caramel malts, and spicy hops until its earthy linger of lupulin, nutty grain, and mild attenuation in finish. Apples, pecans, toffee, biscuit all weave into an ester-malty culmination that's balanced by the earthy bitterness of grass and spice from Noble English hops- slight fruity with orange zest and grapefruit carry a Challenger hop character that might remind me of citrusy American hops. Well melded sweetness takes the shape of mild ripe tobacco as the floral character of hops complement the bold malts. Thirst quenching and satisfying, this was a great find on the Greek Isles.", 'user/profileName': 'BEERchitect', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Wild Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Deviation - Bottleworks 9th Anniversary', 'review/timeUnix': 1235446774, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.83, 'beer/beerId': '41928', 'beer/brewerId': '863', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 3, 'min': 39, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 55, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'A - Crystal clear golden orange body with a little bit of white head and lacing\t\tS - Sour, acidic, peaches, citrus and a little funk. Pretty damn awesome smell\t\tT - Pretty intense and complex taste that evolves as it warms up. Sweet melon upfront with some nice acidic sourness as well. Some funk throughout but stronger towards the end. Definite citrus notes leaning more tends lemon.\t\tM - Medium body with light carbonation a little dry almost like a cider.\t\tD - Very good stuff. A little intense for most people but for the style not to bad. Also very enjoyable and good to see the changes as it warms up.', 'user/profileName': 'midaszero', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Herbed / Spiced Beer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Mysterium', 'review/timeUnix': 1278798234, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 16, 1901', 'beer/ABV': 4.8, 'beer/beerId': '44369', 'user/birthdayUnix': -2163081600, 'beer/brewerId': '1924', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 21, 'min': 43, 'sec': 54, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 191, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 3581417047, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "On tap at the Bel Air location the other day.\t\tThe beer pours a honey amber color with pretty good head retention and lacing. The nose is sweet and spicey, focusing on clove and brown sugar in abundance. Given the fairly intense aroma profile, I was a bit surprised and disappointed by the modest amount of flavor I got on this moderately (at most) sweet frame. I thought it was still pretty nice beer, but given how it smelled, I just expected more. Mouthfeel is medium bodied and fairly smooth (almost all the beers I sampled at DuClaw were a bit under carbonated, which I'm sure affected the mouthfeel), and drinkability is pretty decent. \t\tNothing mind blowing here, but this was a decent enough beer, especially considering the low abv. I wouldn't mind seeing a bit more spice and hoppiness on the palate, but other than that, this wasn't bad at all.", 'user/profileName': 'johnmichaelsen', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'La Seigneuriale', 'review/timeUnix': 1256089296, 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '22555', 'beer/brewerId': '22', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 1, 'min': 41, 'sec': 36, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 294, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'This is a great Belgian Pale, and is a bit surprising.\t\tHas a cloudy rust color with a head that keeps itself a live for some time.\t\tSmells surprised me the most, with a major citrus scent and some follow up of Belgian yeast strains.\t\tIt has the taste that I can really enjoy however, with just a bit of the hops and sweetness but major Belgian yeast flavor mixed with a citrus flavor. \t\tI love Unibroue and their brews, and this is second in line to the Trois Pistols.
