{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Smuttynose Big A IPA (Big Beer Series)', 'review/timeUnix': 1183979639, 'beer/ABV': 9.6, 'beer/beerId': '4394', 'beer/brewerId': '141', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 11, 'min': 13, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 190, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'One-off 22floz bottle review from notes taken the 8th of June 2007. The label indicates that this was "bottled conditioned in 2006." \t\tAppearance: The modest head develops holds up alright, and sticks along the glass\'s side. Murky body is a shade darker than school bus yellow-orange.\t\tSmell: A hop concoction of fruity esters (pineapple and grapefruit) and floral attributes (a light touch of wild flower aroma). \t\tTaste/Mouthfeel/Drinkability: This will be done through a list of desribing words---chewy, tangy, mouthpuckering, full-bodied, tart citrus, grapefruit bitterness, and honey nectar. Dunno if that simplifies things...but for me it works. Mighty tasty! Probably would go well with certain foods and smelly cheeses. Smutty doesn\'t dissappoint as it does a good job at brewing a DIPA.', 'user/profileName': 'Dertbert', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Piraat Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1290456347, 'beer/ABV': 10.5, 'beer/beerId': '156', 'beer/brewerId': '48', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 20, 'min': 5, 'sec': 47, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 326, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "33cl bottle, pours a crystal clear burnished orange which flickers in between apple juice ruby and sunset brilliance, three fingers of foam pile on top and simmer down to a thin layer that leaves gobs of lacing down the glass. Lazy spirals of bubbles surface to maintain a solid layer of fine bubbles. Spectacular looking.\t\tNose is ripe with fruity esters, loads of apples, strawberries, a hint of spice. Alcohol comes out initially and gives it a boozy feel but easily dies down as it warms to give the smell a warm fullness.\t\tFirst sip you're struck by the thick boozy esters but after an acclimatization and a warming minute or two, the full glory of this beer comes out. Appley esters, full graininess, light cloves almost peppery spiciness, grassy and lemony bitter finish, a thin candy sweetness winds its way. The best thing about this beer is the mouthfeel. Thick without being syrupy, beautiful carbonation - it just rolls around your mouth.\t\tPerhaps not a Belgian IPA and perhaps a little on the boozy side, especially initially, but at 10.5% we can be a little forgiving. This is a finely crafted beer that, despite my overall hesitancy with tripels, I would enjoy having regular access to.", 'user/profileName': 'ritzkiss', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': "Dale's Pale Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1199845514, 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '6518', 'beer/brewerId': '2681', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 2, 'min': 25, 'sec': 14, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 9, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "My opinion is unfortunately tainted because of my love for all things bitter. With that said, I don't know why there are a certain few that can't stand this beer. I would think it could harbor a mediocre review on style compatibility alone- this is an APA and tastes/drinks as such. I, of course, think that it's the best thing in a can that is out there, and one of my favorite hoppy brews overall. If you like hops, then this will double the size of your hop head. Sure it's unbalanced, but that is the appeal of the APA- an overhopped IPA. Am I right? And to validate my opinion, I had this beer on a non-hyped recomendation of a liquor store owner on my visit to the Carolina's- I'd never even heard of it before then. So, hyped or not, from a one hop lover to the next, buy a six and enjoy.", 'user/profileName': 'mckajd03', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Smuttynose Imperial Stout (Big Beer Series)', 'review/timeUnix': 1270236272, 'beer/ABV': 9.8, 'beer/beerId': '185', 'beer/brewerId': '141', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 19, 'min': 24, 'sec': 32, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 92, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "A-Deep black/brown with a large dark tan head that reduced to a thin cap and left nice lace. \t\tS-Spicy hop notes up front backed up by a healthy dose of roasted malt, chocolate and a hint of raisin. \t\tT-Roasted malt up front with backing notes of coffee, chocolate and dark fruit. Not as big and robust as some RIS can be but it holds it's own.\t\tD-Plenty of flavour and not too heavy. For a RIS a relatively easy drinker. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Summer Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1151903336, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Dec 7, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '103', 'user/birthdayUnix': 408096000, 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 5, 'min': 8, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 184, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1010239447, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Had a bottle of this yesterday at a family gathering. Not a bad beer at all. In fact if was pretty good. Pours the standard cloudy, medium golden color of all other wheat beers I have seen. Has an initially very nice thick white head that sticks around for a bit, but not too long. Left some nice lacing in my glass though. Smells are primarily of citrus, perhaps a touch of lemon, some wheat/grains, and a bit of spice. Not very strong aromas overall. Tastes fairly sweet with citrus, lemon and some mild spiciness hitting the palate first, followed by some wheats and malts. Moderate carbonation makes for a nice crisp mouthfeel. Very easy to drink. Now that I had one of these for free I think this may indeed be worth buying. A very good, solid offering here from the Boston Beer Company indeed!\t\tEric', 'user/profileName': 'neenerzig', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Tr\xc3\xb6egs Nugget Nectar', 'review/timeUnix': 1239252320, 'user/gender': 'Female', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '15881', 'beer/brewerId': '694', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 4, 'min': 45, 'sec': 20, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 99, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Appearance: Poured with a nice light tan foamy and bubbly head that dissipated over a couple minutes leaving lacing at the top of my glass. The beer is very clear orange gold color. \t\tSmell: Sweet caramel malt, citrus hops, sweet flowers\t\tTaste: Sweet caramel, sweet citrus orange and grapefruit hops, flowery flavor, small hop bitterness, and roasted malt. Pretty nice balance of sweet and bitter, a bit on the sweet side though. \t\tMouthfeel: Medium bodied, slightly syrupy, with nice carbonation, ending with a small bitter bite on the tongue. \t\tOverall: Pretty easy to drink, a bit sweet, gets slightly boring since it is just sweet and hoppy... not much subtleties. Alcohol not noticeable.', 'user/profileName': 'natasharai', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Doggie Style Classic Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1232335885, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '1213', 'beer/brewerId': '68', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 3, 'min': 31, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 19, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Flying Dog Doggie Style, on tap at Mellow Mushroom, Charlottesville, VA, 01/11/09. Served in a traditional American pint glass.\t\tAppearance: Comes a transparent orange amber with sparse, infrequent carbonation.. Arrived without a head, though there was a thick sheen of snow atop with some thin, delicate solid sheets of lace. The sheet-like nature of it all doesn't remain long, but there's still plenty of sticky, clingy, stained glass-esque lacing.\t\tAroma: Very biscuity, crisp, caramelized malts and a handful of herbal hoppyness. Simplistic, but pleasant.\t\tTaste: Very neutral, with herbal, lightly minty, faintly tobacco-y hops resting atop a sea of dry, well-attenuated, roasted malts. Bitterness is mild to moderate. It's just a largely mild, inoffensive, nondescript brew.\t\tMouthfeel: Medium bodied, with a slight, dry, subtle crispness that results from a mild and fine-bubbled effervescence.\t\tDrinkability: Similar to the last brew I tried (the Brooklyn Pennant), this one's a straightforward, inoffensive, not-too-terribly flavorful pale ale. There's nothing wrong with it, it's just not terribly impressive or bold. The alcohol's right though, and at Mellow Mushroom the price is always right, so I don't regret buying it at all.", 'user/profileName': 'CrellMoset', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'English India Pale Ale (IPA)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Mountain Goat India Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1278424808, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '8899', 'beer/brewerId': '1540', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 14, 'min': 0, 'sec': 8, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 187, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Beer review from BA Mag Aug 2007.\t\tReleased in 2002, this was apparently Australia\'s first 100 percent certified organic beer and boasts that it is "generously hopped."\t\tUnfiltered, we opt to decant carefully and allow it to pour a bright, very clear pale golden brew topped with a rocky white foam head that shows great head retention. Pale malts, rhubarb and floral, fruity esters, with suggestions of caramel sweetness. Incredibly smooth on the palate, surprisingly medium-bodied and round--almost a bit chewy, with a kickass foundation of fresh pale malts. Sweet, but not overboard, with toasty, caramel malts providing depth. The carbonation emerges from the body and provides a gentle crisp edge, with a semi-floral hop character and fruitiness that follows. Residual caramel notes and a toasty sweet linger in the finish.\t\tBy today\'s standards, this leans more toward being a full and malt Pale Ale as opposed to an IPA; but as it stands, it\'s a tasty organic offering from down under--it\'s just not an IPA. Not even close. More hops, please.', 'user/profileName': 'BeerAdvocate', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Evil Twin Soft Dookie', 'review/timeUnix': 1305774088, 'beer/ABV': 10.4, 'beer/beerId': '63867', 'beer/brewerId': '24300', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 3, 'min': 1, 'sec': 28, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 139, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Cloying sweet cookie. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Cherry Wheat', 'review/timeUnix': 1171606632, 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '108', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 6, 'min': 17, 'sec': 12, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 47, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "This beer is and was amazing. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Just Outstanding IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1270066357, 'beer/ABV': 6.8, 'beer/beerId': '35608', 'beer/brewerId': '14064', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 31, 'hour': 20, 'min': 12, 'sec': 37, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 90, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'This is, indeed, an outstanding IPA.\t\tPours a burnt orange with a two inch off-white foam head.\t\tSmells enticingly like sweet citrus and gushing grapefruit, tropical pineapple/papaya, and a bit of pine. ooo .... juicy. Very nice aroma.\t\tTaste is similarly nice. The malt/caramel is very understated, this is a hops showcase. Bursting pine and sweet pink grapefruit, a touch of earthy pine bittering, and the nuances of tropical pineapple/papaya/exotic citrus carry through in the form of a lingering nuanced aftertaste.\t\tExtremely quaffable and enjoyable. Good mouthfeel, if a bit light ... could use maybe a touch more body.', 'user/profileName': 'Overlord', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Racer X', 'review/timeUnix': 1216434536, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '8037', 'beer/brewerId': '610', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 2, 'min': 28, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 201, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "I had this on tap at Naja's in Redondo Beach (served in a pint, $7). The beer was murky copper color with very little head. The smell was very west coast hops, lots of grapefruit and some pine needle resin mixed together. The taste is aggressive with afore-mentioned hops while having a serious amount of malt thrown in for balance. This is comfortably a DIPA, but it rides the line close to barley wine territory. The body is fairly thick making this seem a significant beer, easy for me to finish the pint but it forced some nursing.", 'user/profileName': 'TurdFurgison', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': "Leinenkugel's Berry Weiss", 'review/timeUnix': 1133728948, 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '2967', 'beer/brewerId': '710', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 20, 'min': 42, 'sec': 28, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 338, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Served from a can, brought back from trip to the brewery in Wisconsin. Reminded me of drinking a cream soda (the carbonation felt like a soda pop). If you don't like typical grainy beer flavor, this would be a good one to try. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Osiris Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1280617553, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 12, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '52041', 'user/birthdayUnix': 400662000, 'beer/brewerId': '20672', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 31, 'hour': 23, 'min': 5, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 212, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1017673448, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A tasty brew courtesy of number1bum. Cheers Josh!\t\tAppearance: An easy pour from the can into my new Shorts glass (thanks Stef!), the beer is a clean, clear golden bronze color. There's plenty of white, foamy head on this bad boy, at least an inch and a half. The lacing is most impressive, heaps of thick sticky foam clinging to the sides of the glass.\t\tSmell: Fresh and surprisingly bitter and hoppy with just a little bit of sweetness balancing everything out.\t\tTaste: Not as hoppy as the smell would indicate, but the hops are still there. The hops are a bit peppery and remind me of grapefruit that ain't quite ripe yet. The bitterness really likes to hang on too, not really leaving a clean finish.\t\tMouthfeel: Nice medium body, plenty of carbonation, pretty much what you would expect for the style.\t\tDrinkability: Not a bad drinking pale ale. It has some nice hops to it, and a sessionable ABV. This beer is really at home on a cool summer night. I'd definitely recommend it, thanks again Josh!", 'user/profileName': 'krisandajt', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'M\xc3\xa4rzen / Oktoberfest', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Oster-Festbier', 'review/timeUnix': 1219519485, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '41199', 'beer/brewerId': '8913', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 19, 'min': 24, 'sec': 45, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 236, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'BB 30/11/2008, served chilled in a pilsner glass.\t\tA: pours a dark straw hue, lively carbonation full of tiny bubbles, topped with a cottony white foamy head with ok retention.\tS: a pretty decent level of lager-maltiness comes before a mildly floral-hoppy note and the decent sweet starfruity/lemony note of a well-lagered beer, while a swirl wakes up a mildly doughy touch. Alas, apart from these the aroma has nothing else to show.\tT: rather tart-fruity upfront, a bit like starfruits, with a syrupy touch of malts, then being taken over by a rich flavour of bitter-sweet, honey-ish and faintly peanut-y lager malts that has a semi-chewy toasty element to it. Finish is decently bitter-sweet, added with a touch of dried grass in the hop bitterness.\tM&D: quite refreshing, somewhat lacking the weight for a 6%abv. beer and also a tad watery in the finish, but overall easy drinking. IMO, this beer needs a slightly heavier maltiness for a decent gravity, but the soothing aftertaste of bitter-sweet hops seems to elevate the whole performance a bit. Not bad, albeit simplistic.', 'user/profileName': 'wl0307', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Barleywine', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Backburner (Imperial Barley Wine Style Ale)', 'review/timeUnix': 1229043432, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.6, 'beer/beerId': '36185', 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 0, 'min': 57, 'sec': 12, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 347, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Served in a brandy snifter.\t\tMurky chestnut colored with an inch high light brown thick head that slowly recedes leaving a ring of large bubbles around the inside edges of the glass.\t\tInviting and rich aroma of baked rhubarb, honey, ripe fruit and hoppy bitters.\t\tBig flavor of fig and prune, some tangy cherry. Balance of caramel and hops upfront. Some molasses and roasty malt, punctuated by alcohol warmth, finishes with a flourish of hops. Mildly sweet. More prune in the finish.\t\tFull mouthfeel, not too carbonated, thick. Just this side of syrupy. Pretty drinkable, but it's a sipper with all that vapor rising up.", 'user/profileName': 'far333', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Saison D'etre", 'review/timeUnix': 1145308285, 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '29714', 'beer/brewerId': '11269', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 21, 'min': 11, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 107, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Canary gold with suspended yeasties. Served way too cold; warmed to room temperature over an hour or so. Slow upward-streaming bubbles. Modest head, fantastic lace.\t\tNose is full of cracked pepper and tart and spicy yeast phenols. Buttered bread lurks underneath. Powdery malt. Open yeast packets.\t\tTaste is much better than nose, fulfilling many requirements of the style; dry, tart, semi-sweet, with a lingering bitterness. Coriander, near-buttery malts. Grain flavor lingers.\t\tLove this beer except for the lingering nutrisweet flavor that pops in and out. Goes down pretty well, though there is a slight orange-rind astringency I don't particularly care for. Drinks well - you could stick with this one your meal and beyond.", 'user/profileName': 'GreenWBush', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

The taste isn't quite as nice, though the chocolate notes really still stand out. The feel was quite nice with a full body. Pretty viscous for what it is. Drinks quite well. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Munich Dunkel Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Negra Modelo', 'review/timeUnix': 1081377148, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 25, 1979', 'beer/ABV': 5.4, 'beer/beerId': '667', 'user/birthdayUnix': 307090800, 'beer/brewerId': '75', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 22, 'min': 32, 'sec': 28, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 98, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1111244647, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Poured a ruddy brown, no haze at all. The taste hits with chocolate malts at the beginning, then a bit of sweetness, and fades with a decent noble hop finish. Something isn't quite right with the hops, but I cannot put my finger on it. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'La Fin Du Monde', 'review/timeUnix': 1282014205, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '34', 'beer/brewerId': '22', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 3, 'min': 3, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 229, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a Chimay goblet. Best by date 09-24-12.\t\tAppearance: Pours an opaque golden orange with a 1/4 finger foamy white head which dissipates almost instantly. No lacing at all.\t\tSmell: Quite sweet with banana, yeast and citrus dominating with just a hint of phenols.\t\tTaste: Yeast and malt up front followed by a burst of banana and citrus esters in the middle then finishes with malt and dry phenols. Aftertaste is a mixture of sour citrus and phenols. The high alcohol is well hidden by the tremendous flavor of the beer.\t\tMouthfeel: Medium-bodied with a high amount of carbonation. The carbonation bursts through from the get go.\t\tDrinkability: Excellent drinkability. {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Munich Dunkel Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Negra Modelo', 'review/timeUnix': 1140223615, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.4, 'beer/beerId': '667', 'beer/brewerId': '75', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 0, 'min': 46, 'sec': 55, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 49, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Appearance: Pours a clear copper color with a fizzy head that quickly disappears to a ringlet and milky way; virtually no lacing\t\tSmell: Vague odor of caramel malt and noble hops, but very vague\t\tTaste: Starts out rather toasty and the sweet malt builds into the finish; the finish is dry and chalky with some residual sweetness\t\tMouthfeel: Medium to light bodied with moderate carbonation\t\tDrinkability: Not offensive but nothing special', 'user/profileName': 'brentk56', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Scottish Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Lia Fail', 'review/timeUnix': 1136336759, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '3264', 'beer/brewerId': '1108', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 1, 'min': 5, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 4, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Appearance: Pours a slightly murky ice tea brown color with a frothy head and some lacing\t\tSmell: Malted milk chocolate and hazelnuts; rather bready\t\tTaste: Starts with a very clean malty base which turns a bit earthy and coarse in the aftertaste\t\tMouthfeel: Very smooth but a tad below medium bodied; moderate carbonation\t\tDrinkability: A very pleasant Scottish that is marked down a bit for its mediocre finish', 'user/profileName': 'brentk56', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Munich Helles Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Spaten M\xc3\xbcnchner Hell (Premium Lager)', 'review/timeUnix': 1206581859, 'beer/ABV': 5.2, 'beer/beerId': '1944', 'beer/brewerId': '142', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 1, 'min': 37, 'sec': 39, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 87, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'poured from a bottle into a pint glass. came out with a nice clean clear look with a good size head that did not last long. it has little to no lacing. was at first really smooth with a slightly bitter finish. it also has some good carbonation. the smell was great and probably was my favorite part of this beer. all around good beer.', 'user/profileName': 'hoeferweisen', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Ten FIDY', 'review/timeUnix': 1250652292, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 10.5, 'beer/beerId': '34483', 'beer/brewerId': '2681', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 3, 'min': 24, 'sec': 52, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 231, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "So maybe waiting to try my first Ten FIDY on te hottest day of the year in Massachusetts wasn't the best way to experience this beer. That being said, if this beer is as good in the dead of winter as it was tonight, that means something.\t\tIt pours black, with a chocolate head. Malty, bitter, chocolate smell. Not overpowering but impressive. Nicely balanced beer that definitely lives up to the hype. \t\tStill can't believe this beer comes out of a can, I will be picking more up soon.", 'user/profileName': 'mirish72', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Dark Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.0, 'beer/name': 'Winter Wheat', 'review/timeUnix': 1292519448, 'beer/beerId': '46633', 'beer/brewerId': '17033', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 17, 'min': 10, 'sec': 48, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 350, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 2.0, 'review/text': 'The beer looks great--a nice, deep brown with a fine head. The aroma screams Dunkelweizen; the banana, clove, and sweet malt notes are all at the fore.\t\tA sip of this beer, however, reveals some big problems. The main one is the level of sweetness. To be sure, German wheat beers typically have a sweet, fruity element to them. But Franconia Winter Wheat has a heavy, overwhelming sweetness that sets into the tongue and obscures its other facets. It isn\'t that the beer isn\'t "to style"--I don\'t really care about that--but rather that it has none of the balance and craftsmanship that I detect in Franconia\'s three flagship brews. The modest hop bitterness--which, in a well-made beer, would suffice--here collapse under the unwieldy syrupy-sweet mess. Those last four ounces were tough to finish.\t\tI want to be a fan of every beer from this brewery; my heart is open, so to speak. That\'s probably why I was so disappointed. Franconia can do better than this, and in a year\'s time, I\'ll revisit this beer to see if any improvements were made.', 'user/profileName': 'Randyweizen', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Blaecorn Unidragon', 'review/timeUnix': 1318804248, 'beer/ABV': 12.5, 'beer/beerId': '73427', 'beer/brewerId': '22951', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 22, 'min': 30, 'sec': 48, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 289, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Clown Shoes Blaecorn Unidragon\t\t22 oz Bottle into Snifter\t\tPour is opaque with a massive mocha colored head that took its time to sink into a wisp atop. Some nice lacing around the sides of the glass.\t\tAroma has hints of licorice, brown sugar and molasses with enough espresso and cocoa to go around. Some pine-like hops balance things out nicely.\t\tNicely hopped, somewhat agressive with lots of pine and some grapefruit rind. Coffee and dark chocolate are present in the flavor with some anise lingering about. No trace of the 12.5% ABV which is very surprising.\t\tExcellent offering. Reminds me a bit of Goose Island's Nighstalker with the abundant hopping. Can't believe it clocks in at 12.5% ABV, hardly a trace of it in the flavor. Well done.", 'user/profileName': 'mduncan', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Heavy Seas - Siren Noire Imperial Chocolate Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1290192794, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '56270', 'beer/brewerId': '898', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 18, 'min': 53, 'sec': 14, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 323, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "22oz bottle into a snifter. This was an extra from a kind trader, and something I've never tried before.\t\tThe beer pours a black with off-white head. There are touches of brown and red in the mix. The head quickly subsides and doesn't leave much lace.\t\tThe beer smells strongly of bakers chocolate with a touch of coffee and even some dark fruit. There's also some noticeable booze, but it's nothing horrible. I'm also getting a touch of sourness, but this isn't infected - more of an acidity from the roast.\t\tThe taste is really strong roast with some nuanced complimentary flavors and a bit of booze. There's a nice touch of hop bitterness as well. But the focus is on the chocolate and coffee flavors, backed up with a sweet malt base. There are some notes of fig and prune, plus some licorice that give this depth. \t\tThe beer has a thick body and low carb, resuling in it coming across as a touch syrupy. There is some lingering roast in the finish and some sweetness. This beer is decent and enjoyable, but Southern Tier Choklat blows it out of the water.", 'user/profileName': 'jampics2', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Stone Imperial Russian Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1172299106, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 27, 1983', 'beer/ABV': 10.5, 'beer/beerId': '1160', 'user/birthdayUnix': 433494000, 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 6, 'min': 38, 'sec': 26, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 55, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 984841447, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Received in trade with cooperrip thanks again. Bottle states limited spring 2006 release Served a bit below room right into a nonic. Tan head rose and fell and lingers on the surface. The body is black oily and completely opaque. Smells is robust, salty, smoky, earthy, maybe some brown sugar, dirty coffee hints of caramel and that slight anise character typical in some RIS, but subtle and perfectly executed. Taste is big, chewy, meaty, yet immediately approachable. I get an excellent roasted flavor, colored by a nutty character that makes it sort of pop in my mouth. Bitterness is perfectly balanced definitely not as aggressive as some, but provides tasteful ballast. Mouthfeel is wonderful, well balanced, surly and big, yet so tasty and easy to drink. This great offering starts aromatic and tasty and ends in very welcome alcohol warmth. I am very pleased to have had this wanderful brew. Great companion on a cold night, a simply great brew from a great brewery. God I wish I could get a case and do as they suggest', 'user/profileName': 'mmcave', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Brewer's Reserve Bourbon Barrel Stout", 'review/timeUnix': 1198524773, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 11, 1981', 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '16062', 'user/birthdayUnix': 366361200, 'beer/brewerId': '652', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 19, 'min': 32, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 358, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1051974247, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "12 oz bottle.\t\tThanks to SPLITGRIN for hooking me up with this one.\t\tEnjoyed mostly at approx. cellar temp..don't even attempt to drink this straight out of the fridge. The first couple sips I had were too cold for this to show it's true character.\tPours a very dark, muddy reddish-brown..beige head.\tOak, vanilla & burnt cocoa aromas surge from the glass.\tFlavor has it's share of dark chocolate (a ton of it actually), vanilla, and coffee..with the noticeable oaky bourbon flair of course. The alcohol is not shy in this brew, and you can definitely pick it up with every sip.\tMedium-bodied..could be a bit more thick and not hurt my feelings much.\tIf you're a sucker for dark chocolate and/or like bourbon-aged beers, then you need to find this somewhere.", 'user/profileName': 'hero27', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Bock', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Winter Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1227145622, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '101', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 1, 'min': 47, 'sec': 2, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 325, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours dark amber with almost white head.\t\tNose is caramel sweet, with a suggestion of black tea aromas.\t\tPalate is caramelly sweet but not heavily sweet, and light in flavors of cinnamon, nutmeg, and overall malty sweetness.\t\tThis is a very light version of a winter beer, as far as winter beers go, normally. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Bass Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1184176779, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Nov 29, 1969', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '811', 'user/birthdayUnix': -2822400, 'beer/brewerId': '293', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 17, 'min': 59, 'sec': 39, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 192, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1421157847, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "When I began homebrewing about 15 years ago, I needed bottles. Bass was my beer of choice to accomplish the mission. No need to buy bottles with nothing in them, right?\t\tLight honey/caramel, orange-yellow color. Head is very dense, very thick, and keeps going until the end of the beer. Smell is a nice blend of sweet and hop-sharp with the hops edging out by a bit. taste was a bit mild-mannered. I'll give the drinkability just over average, because it's not unpleasant, nor bad, just not awesome.", 'user/profileName': 'wcdoyle', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English India Pale Ale (IPA)', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'India Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1194927902, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '4948', 'beer/brewerId': '1762', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 4, 'min': 25, 'sec': 2, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 317, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'An orange tea colored brew with a goodly foamy head and decent bits of lacing throughout. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Sockeye Red IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1230075308, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Mar 26, 1974', 'beer/ABV': 5.7, 'beer/beerId': '1089', 'user/birthdayUnix': 133513200, 'beer/brewerId': '385', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 23, 'min': 35, 'sec': 8, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 358, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1284822247, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "22oz. bomber into goblet on 12/19/08, courtesy of Deuane. \t\tA - Medium amber/light copper-colored body with half a finger of off-white head and modest carbonation. Head flared up to a fluffy cap with each swirl of the glass.\t\tS - Huge West Coast nose with piney and grapefruit hops supported by caramel malt. Big pungent hop nose.\t\tT - Extremely aggressive hoppy character for a plain old IPA with plenty of pine, resin and citrus hop bitterness. There's also a bit of sweet caramel malt present, but the hops definitely reign supreme here. \t\tM - Medium body with oily texture and a dry, bitter finish that lingers on the palate for quite a while. \t\tD - Man, this was hoppier than some IPAs I've had in the past. This one's bitter, so pucker up!", 'user/profileName': 'ffejherb', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Delirium No\xc3\xabl', 'review/timeUnix': 1323146965, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 26, 1987', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '2347', 'user/birthdayUnix': 556959600, 'beer/brewerId': '180', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 4, 'min': 49, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 340, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 861375847, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Split w/ Steve Andrews.\t\tA: A nice reddish-amber with a finger-width head that dissipates quickly and completely. An unexpected color and pour.\t\tS: Mostly Belgian yeast, a bit of dark fruit, and slightly sour peaches. It sounds awkward, but it works.\t\tT: Definitely sweet, but not overwhelmingly so. The slightly sour notes hold up, and the dark fruit is delicious. \t\tM: A nice body on this beer actually. A good balance between the carb typical of Delirium and the heft required of a BDSA.\t\tO: A good beer. Not quite as good as Tremens, but tasty.', 'user/profileName': 'mjyoung', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Irish Dry Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Guinness Draught', 'review/timeUnix': 1067199213, 'beer/ABV': 4.2, 'beer/beerId': '754', 'beer/brewerId': '209', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 20, 'min': 13, 'sec': 33, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 299, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Pous out of the rocket widget bottle with a vengance. A lovely dark, dark brown head, that lovely smell that is Guiness. It really is an old friend. Strange to review it really 'cause I'be been drinking it for 30 years. Still sometimes the review is simply a way of expressing oneself. From the bitter to the coffee; with that creamy smooth feel in the mouth. Why can some macros do it and others can't? I have often said aftertaste is my big thing. Well, Guinness has good aftertaste.\t\tGuinness draught is one of the reliable ones when it comes to beer. In those airport bars, chain hotels, etc. you can always be sure with this brew. There may be better beers out there but never forget your old friend or you'll grow old alone.", 'user/profileName': 'PiratePete', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Summit Hefe Weizen', 'review/timeUnix': 1181281916, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Mar 3, 1987', 'beer/ABV': 4.9, 'beer/beerId': '3952', 'user/birthdayUnix': 541756800, 'beer/brewerId': '467', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 5, 'min': 51, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 159, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 876578647, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'a: straw yellow with usuall hefe cloudiness, about a half inch of head that does not dissapear fast and leaves a good amount of lacing\ts: sweet bannana aroma, yeasty smell that all hefes have is very present and very nice\tt: the bannana flavor that the aroma hinted at deffinatly comes out, theres a nice lemony tart flavor and the wheat flavor really compliments the other flavors well\tm: medium bodied with above average carbonation\t\toverall this is my favorite hefe, very enjoyable and very refreshing', 'user/profileName': 'happygnome', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': '\xc3\x89dition 2005', 'review/timeUnix': 1154623436, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'May 31, 1976', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '20600', 'user/birthdayUnix': 202374000, 'beer/brewerId': '22', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 16, 'min': 43, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 215, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1215961447, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': '4/13/2005\t$7.99\t750 mL\t10.00%\tProduction Date 11-23-2004. \t\tAppearance:\t\tPours a dark brown with hints of red intermingled. Fine bubbles line the glass and lead to a medium tan/white head that settles rapidly leaving no lace.\t\t\tAroma:\t\tMildly piquant with scents of ripe fig and tropical fruits. An assertive sweetness from candied sugar presents itself as well, slightly masking a healthy dose of alcohol.\t\t\tTaste/Mouthfeel:\t\tRich ripe fruit swirls on the tongue, brining with it plum, cherry and a touch of sweetness. Fairly reminiscent of Quelque Chose, but with a touch more alcohol presence. Mouthfeel is viscous and sticky, with a slight mouth puckering tartness in the finish. This is an excellent offering yet again from Unibroue. Alcohol is expertly masked, making this deceptively drinkable.', 'user/profileName': 'cbl2', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Piraat Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1067125744, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 23, 1963', 'beer/ABV': 10.5, 'beer/beerId': '156', 'user/birthdayUnix': -198003600, 'beer/brewerId': '48', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 23, 'min': 49, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 298, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1616339048, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A nice showing from the get go here. Super fluffy beige head with gloriously artistic lacing-hey nice legs on this one eh! Deep in the nose with an over-abundance of malt syrup and caramalized pear. The mouthfeel continues in the malt syrup direction, yet proves to be more enjoyably rich than flabby. More malt and sweet pear in the mouth. Man this is a real fun beer to warm up to! The concentration of malt,and the subtle entrance of fruit in the way of roasted pear, tart cherry and red berry make for a complex taste experience. Pretty to the end with washes of vanilla and bittersweet hop. I'd love to be on this pirate ship-cept during a storm maybe! Finishes moderately candied and warm-check your reviews for spelling to see if your not quite buzzed and beginning to make errors!", 'user/profileName': 'moulefrite', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Raison D'etre", 'review/timeUnix': 1219814675, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '1180', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 5, 'min': 24, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 240, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'A good, sweet, dark beer\t\tA- A dark mahogany that is quite transparent. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Irish Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Riptide Red Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1299209190, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Mar 8, 1989', 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '22778', 'user/birthdayUnix': 605347200, 'beer/brewerId': '1304', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 3, 'min': 26, 'sec': 30, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 63, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 812988247, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': '22oz bottle into tulip pint.\t\tA - Pours a clear, but fairly dark amber with an off-white head that has fair retention and some light rising carbonation.\t\tS - Very strong bread upfront with some faint hop bitterness to the finish.\t\tT - More fresh baked bread with some very lightly roasted malt as well as more light almost herbal hop bitterness in the finish.\t\tM - Medium to full body, with good carbonation.\t\tD - A nice change of pace with a very bready backing and unique flavor, though still very approachable and easy to enjoy. This is my first of this style, though I was able to pick up the tea-like hop flavor mentioned in the style description.', 'user/profileName': 'vkv822', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Maharaja', 'review/timeUnix': 1206238469, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 10.3, 'beer/beerId': '22352', 'beer/brewerId': '30', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 2, 'min': 14, 'sec': 29, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 83, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Being a relative rookie when it comes to Imperial IPA and quality beer in general, I can't help but think that maybe Maharaja has spoiled me.\t\tLooks beautiful served on draft in a small brandy snifter. Looks like a burnt orange to me. The smell is amazing - a wonderful combination of citrus hops and some other fruity sweetness that I can't really place. The taste is probably even better than the smell. It's a perfect balance of hops and malt. \t\tI lack the beer vocab to truly do Maharaja justice, but I'll just say it's a fantastic beer and the best IPA I've ever had to date. My only complaint is that I didn't discover this beer years ago. I could drink way too many of these.", 'user/profileName': 'bretseeley', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Brooklyn Local 2', 'review/timeUnix': 1260385962, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '47678', 'beer/brewerId': '45', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 19, 'min': 12, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 343, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Produces a great three finger sized crown of light tan cranium that dwindles down and stays about a finger thick through the whole serving in a Chimay chalice. Awesome lacing, and has a dark ruby reddish copper colored body that is pretty hazy.\t\tThe aroma is yeasty and grape upfront, then floral, sweet molasses and fig. This does finish up with an herbal/metallic characteristic.\t\tUpfront in the taste are figs and cherry, and the honey is detectable. This beer also reminds me of a German lebkuchen as well.\t\tThis has feelings of a chewy/sticky/warming appeal.\t\tLocal 2 has all the traits to make it a great beer in its style category.', 'user/profileName': 'TheSarge', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Poleeko Gold Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1237675114, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '608', 'beer/brewerId': '193', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 22, 'min': 38, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 80, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '12 oz. bottle with no freshness date; the cap states this is a solar powered brewery.\t\tThe ale poured a yellow, goldish color with a very slight haze. The head was nice and white, about 1/4 inch. It dissipated rather quickly leaving very little lacing. It has a looks a lot like anchor liberty ale.\t\tA very fruity, tangerine like odor gave the impression of beer freshness. \t\tThe initial taste is of slight bitterness and carbonation followed by a fruity backbone. It appearance gives one the impression that this may be a light pale ale version; it is not. It is rather substantial in flavor.\t\tIt is little too carbonated for me, though the sweet aftertaste on the tongue is welcoming. \t\tThis one is better than I thought and more flavorful. The ale was quite expensive and really should have a freshness date. At 5.5 ABV and its balanced flavor, it would make a decent session ale.', 'user/profileName': 'jkrich', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Hoptical Illusion', 'review/timeUnix': 1217551135, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.8, 'beer/beerId': '20168', 'beer/brewerId': '764', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 0, 'min': 38, 'sec': 55, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 214, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Bonus bottle from KpLynch..Thanks bro!\t\tPours dark gold with a heavy chill haze, and a half-inch head of white foam.\tRetention is moderate and a few streaks of lacework appear for the duration.\t\tAromatics are a blend of biscuity malt, pine sap, citrus fruit, and pineapple skin.\tNot incredibly pungent or floral, but square on and crisp for a standard IPA.\t\tMedium bodied, drying and minerally crisp.\t\tDried citrus fruits and spruce on the pallet. Some lightly toasted malt follows through and a smidge of warming alcohol.\tDrying and firmly bitter with a chaulky nod.\t\tFinishes with pineapple skins, biscuit malt, and mild grapefruit with apricots.\t\tTasty enough, and this ones seeming pretty fresh. I'd have another one!", 'user/profileName': 'brewandbbq', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Cottrell Old Yankee Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1287867297, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '179', 'beer/brewerId': '61', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 20, 'min': 54, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 296, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Cottrell "Old Yankee Ale"\tBottle Pour into a pint glass.\t\tAppearance- Cloudy brown pour with a thick two-finger head. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Shark Attack Double Red Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1205296290, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '41421', 'beer/brewerId': '5318', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 4, 'min': 31, 'sec': 30, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 72, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "A- Very dark read, almost NO HEAD and minimal lacing.\t\tS - Bready, some hops, dense fruit\t\tT - Carmel, solid malt base, booze, washed over with pretty decent hop flavor.\t\tM - Carbonation could be higher, as well as possibly a thicker body. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': "Jefferson's Reserve Bourbon Barrel Stout", 'review/timeUnix': 1290307400, 'beer/ABV': 8.5, 'beer/beerId': '29687', 'beer/brewerId': '395', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 2, 'min': 43, 'sec': 20, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 325, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'My buddy brought this back from a trip with his brother down south. I enjoyed it a lot even though I am not a regular Stout drinker.\t\tA - Huge tan creamy head on top of a super black viscous liquid.\t\tS - Lots of roasted malt - coffee, chocolate, some caramel. Some bourbon and oak in the back of my nose.\t\tT - A lot of bourbon up front with coffee bitterness on swallow - the bourbon completely overwhelmed any more subtle flavors on the first sip. As you adjust to the bourbon, the roasted malt flavors appear.\t\tM - Thin with high carbonation - probably my least favorite part of the beer. \t\tD- Nice sipping beer. I picture drinking this on a warm summer evening at a pig roast eating pulled pork. The bourbon finish is tasteful, the burnt faint background brings depth to the beer. Very enjoyable beer.\t\tSlainte!', 'user/profileName': 'BeerConnoiseur', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'German Pilsener', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Prima Pils', 'review/timeUnix': 1238284662, 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '1010', 'beer/brewerId': '345', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 23, 'min': 57, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 87, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a straw colored, hazy golden yellow with a vibrant foamy white head of big carbonation quickly dissipating leaving little lacing in the glass.\t\tThe fresh, pleasant hop aroma wafts from the glass featuring floral scents and citrus zest. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Dubbel', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Trappistes Rochefort 8', 'review/timeUnix': 1300414932, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Apr 17, 1973', 'beer/ABV': 9.2, 'beer/beerId': '1696', 'user/birthdayUnix': 103881600, 'beer/brewerId': '207', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 2, 'min': 22, 'sec': 12, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 77, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1314453848, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '2010 bottle, served cool in a St. B goblet. The taste followed the nose closely - figs and plums, sugary sweet malts and a slight spiciness with a light alcohol finish.\t\tThe mouthfeel was pleasant. It was full bodied, with medium (but pronounced) carbonation. Overall it was a very satisfying beer to sit and slowly enjoy.', 'user/profileName': 'surlytheduff', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'The Devil Made Me Do It! Coffee Imperial Oatmeal Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1241147556, 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '35201', 'beer/brewerId': '784', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 3, 'min': 12, 'sec': 36, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 121, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Thanks to natasharai for giving me an opportunity to try this huge beer!\t\tA: Almost a finger of tan head with a very aggressive pour. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': "Fisherman's IPA", 'review/timeUnix': 1241484717, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Mar 7, 1977', 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '26501', 'user/birthdayUnix': 226569600, 'beer/brewerId': '8325', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 0, 'min': 51, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 125, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1191765847, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Received as part of April shipment of my Beer of the Month club.\t\tServing glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint.\t\tAppearance: Slightly hazy reddish amber with very thin head.\t\tSmell: Very mild malt smell, kind of English. Where is the hop smell?\t\tTaste: Light English malts with nice hop presence that leaves a grapefruit bitter aftertaste that slowly builds. For an IPA, it really isn't all that bitter - more balanced.\t\tFeel: Low carbonation and relatively light body. Dry finish. Once again, very English.\t\tDrinkability: Pleasant, easy drinking ale. Nothing stands out too much, but I like it and could easily enjoy another.\t\tThis is an English IPA, not an American IPA. It amazes me how many beers have been incorrectly categorized.", 'user/profileName': 'bsp77', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Kirin Ichiban', 'review/timeUnix': 1082591773, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '1249', 'beer/brewerId': '292', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 23, 'min': 56, 'sec': 13, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 112, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': "Pale golden very clear brew with lots of carbonation, off white head with large bubbles among smaller ones, decent retention and good lace.\tVery faint in the nose, some grass and hay but very faint. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Scottish Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Left Coast's Scottish Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1238835173, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 16, 1977', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '44011', 'user/birthdayUnix': 235292400, 'beer/brewerId': '10046', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 8, 'min': 52, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 94, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1183043047, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Pours fairly dark, clear burgundy color with a nice tan head. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Sexual Chocolate', 'review/timeUnix': 1267385688, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.75, 'beer/beerId': '35284', 'beer/brewerId': '11036', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 19, 'min': 34, 'sec': 48, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 59, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "2010 bottle thanks to Mike. Thanks Mike! 09 and 10 bottles. Pours pitch black with tan head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, and dark fruit. The 09 had more toffee caramel and butterscotch notes. The 10 had more malt roastiness and hops. Heavy mouthfeel. Flavors followed the nose with both bottles. There were complex layers of roast, chocolate, caramel, and molasses. It reminded me a lot of Cigar City Marshal Zhukov's Imperial Stout. Great beer.", 'user/profileName': 'fiver29', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Ron's Pale Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1218953225, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '44361', 'beer/brewerId': '15327', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 6, 'min': 7, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 230, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A-Clear, light copper hued with a medium off-white head that hung on and left decent lacing behind.\t\tS-Sweet malt blending well with a fairly pungent peppery hop aroma.\t\tT-Good solid peppery hop flavour up front. This is balanced well with an ample dose of sweet caramel malt. A well balanced and flavourful APA.\t\tM-Medium-light body, just a tad thin. Hop bitterness lasts through the pint.\t\tD-A solid beer, the second best beer of the night here....and the best on the regular line up. This one easily out performs the house IPA.', 'user/profileName': 'Deuane', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Lager', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': "Killian's Irish Red", 'review/timeUnix': 1170524881, 'beer/ABV': 4.9, 'beer/beerId': '909', 'beer/brewerId': '306', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 17, 'min': 48, 'sec': 1, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 34, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 2.0, 'review/text': 'A: Poured into a tall pilsner glass, it yields a clear, light amber body with a big, airy, off-white head that disappears quickly.\t\tS: Not sure what that smell is -- first thing that comes to mind is corn syrup and maybe sweet malt; no, make that over-sweet malt.\t\tT: Bland and non-offensive at first. Like the nose, it\'s sweet -- molasses, corn syrup and maybe some caramel malt. A slight metallic aftertaste appears deep at the end of the sip, but mainly this is all about sweetness.\t\tM: Light in body, slightly slick in feel.\t\tD: Like I said above, the first few sips weren\'t so bad. Towards the end, however, it became a chore to drink this overly sweet beer and eventually I drained the last few ounces.\t\tNotes: A Bud Light-drinking neighbor brought this over, knowing I like "microbrews." I suppose Coors deserves kudos for being able to convince some folks that this fits the bill as a craft-brewed beer. It clearly is not. Funny thing is, about 15 years ago, I would sometimes get this in pitchers at certain bars, as it was (1) darker than your average macro lager; and (2) relatively cheap. Back then I thought it wasn\'t half bad for what it was. Either my tastes have evolved or this brew has gotten significantly worse, because nowadays I am not able to drink this.', 'user/profileName': 'Kendo', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Big Red IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1263016227, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 2, 1980', 'beer/beerId': '32425', 'user/birthdayUnix': 331369200, 'beer/brewerId': '3258', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 5, 'min': 50, 'sec': 27, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 9, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1086966247, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'For the first time I purchased a growler. Have tried a number of the big horn beers in the past and they are certainly drinkable. The beer certainly fits the name well and the color of this beer is very red for a standard IPA. Had a full white head that had good staying power for having been served in a growler. Citrus notes and some acidity are definitely noticeable in the beer. The balance seems off as well since the hops over power the malt to a great extent. Not a bad session beer as on a subsequent tasting had a pitcher during a game and noticed all the same things. Taste and mouthfeel carry the beer with the hops being the main focus.', 'user/profileName': 'jnezda', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Bruegel Amber Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1273809350, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.2, 'beer/beerId': '1645', 'beer/brewerId': '48', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 3, 'min': 55, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 134, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a clear golden orange color with golden mango colored hues when held to a light source and a thin white foam head that quickly settles into a thin ring. Not much in the way of lacing.\t\tSpicy aroma with hints of cinnamon and brown sugar along with hints of crisp light fruit, pepper, hops and caramel malt. This beer smells more like a marzen to me.\t\tSoftly carbonated up front with a strong spicy character that gives way to a malty center and long spicy dry finish. Hints of caramel malt, pepper, light fruit, cinnamon and brown sugar. It kind of tastes like a watered down Belgian interpretation of an Oktoberfest/Marzen.', 'user/profileName': 'corby112', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Dubbel', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Trappist Achel 8\xc2\xb0 Bruin', 'review/timeUnix': 1325987329, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '8045', 'beer/brewerId': '922', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 1, 'min': 48, 'sec': 49, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2012, 'yday': 8, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "This Trappist was not quite as dark as its Belgian Trappist counterparts. However, don't judge by that. It is a sweet, extremely smooth, and delicate beer. It gets better as is warms, and is a beer best drank after a meal, when you can just relax with it. The head was not anything to particularly write home about (I do own a goblet glass for these specialties). However, the caramel-coffee smell was very savory, and hard to put down after a drink. It is a strong beer, but the sweetness of it masks the alcohol content nicely. Personally, I think it is the best out of the Trappist Breweries, and is not overly expensive.", 'user/profileName': 'AMiz602', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': '1554 Enlightened Black Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1261648611, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 7, 1983', 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '1914', 'user/birthdayUnix': 423817200, 'beer/brewerId': '192', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 9, 'min': 56, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 358, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 994518248, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "This one pours a dark mahogany with ruby hints, and a light tan head.\t\tVery light on the smell, hints of chocolate and roasted malt.\t\tCreamy cocoa and coffee are at the front of the flavor. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Noire De Chambly / Chambly Noire', 'review/timeUnix': 1161655899, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.2, 'beer/beerId': '26072', 'beer/brewerId': '22', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 2, 'min': 11, 'sec': 39, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 297, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours nearly black, yeilding a murky brown to the light, with a very nice dull tan head. The smell is sour and earthy. The taste is hard to pinpoint, as it is complex, but it is not very bold. The mouthfeel is very smooth, but at the same time slightly watery. Drinkability is about medium, not at all effected by ABV, but this beer is most certainly filling. Overall, most certainly an enjoyable brew, but hard to pair with anything.', 'user/profileName': 'zjungleist', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Milk / Sweet Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'River Horse Oatmeal Milk Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1274698558, 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '45831', 'beer/brewerId': '877', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 10, 'min': 55, 'sec': 58, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 144, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Thanks to mday for opening this at a recent tasting.\t\tA: Pours near-black with a nice, thin tan head.\t\tS: Plenty of roasted malt characteristics alongside a nice blend of coffee and chocolate.\t\tT: Coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, hints of toffee, and a small but existent hop presence. \t\tM: Smooth, medium-body with good carbonation.\t\tD: Very nice. Fruity and banana dominated the tastes, but like Blue Moon this felt slightly watered down and subdued. Mouthfeel was crisp and smooth.\t\tOverall an average beer. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Vanilla Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1292461496, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '27800', 'beer/brewerId': '2137', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 1, 'min': 4, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 350, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '12oz bottle.\t\tPours cola-brown with a whisp on the surface and a few dots of lacing. \t\tAromatics lead off with roasted malts with hints of chocolate, vanilla and nougat. Traces of burnt sugar and char follow through.\t\tFinishes with light traces of vanilla and roast. \t\tPretty unimpressive. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Dubbel', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Allagash Dubbel Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1163732743, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '10', 'beer/brewerId': '4', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 3, 'min': 5, 'sec': 43, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 321, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Poured out dark, cloudy and brown with a creamy off-white head. {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Lambic - Fruit', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 1.0, 'beer/name': 'Cantillon Don Quijote', 'review/timeUnix': 1281974844, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '59144', 'beer/brewerId': '388', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 16, 'min': 7, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 228, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 1.0, 'review/text': 'Uber rarity, unfortunately the bottle I received was corked. From notes.\t\tAppearance: Pour is a red-orange amber, small white head.\t\tSmell: Off musty / rotten flavors that you expect from corked wine; I have sampled in the neighborhood of 30-50 bottles of Cantillon in my life and this is the first one that has been "bad", I knew almost instantly that something was amiss. \t\tTaste: The must / rotten flavors dominate on the first sip. Very much a TCA issue, there was no way to finish it or enjoy the bottle. This is not "good" funk, as I typically enjoy those sorts of flavors, from Cantillon in particular. Sourness was still there. It is one of those things some people don\'t pick up on, but once you know the taint you will always detect it.\t\tMouthfeel: Dry, thin, medium carbonation.\t\tDrinkability: As described above, this bottle clearly had some issues. I doubt I get to try it again and do not know where those issues came from, but as-is it was undrinkable. I noticed some people may have picked up on this from reading other reviews, to a lesser extent, while some may not have had an issue at all.', 'user/profileName': 'craytonic', 'review/aroma': 1.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Old Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Old Man (Winter Ale)', 'review/timeUnix': 1227881731, 'beer/ABV': 7.7, 'beer/beerId': '14368', 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 14, 'min': 15, 'sec': 31, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 333, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'A: Pours a burnt orangish red color. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'De Dolle Oerbier', 'review/timeUnix': 1283390616, 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '813', 'beer/brewerId': '201', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 1, 'min': 23, 'sec': 36, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 245, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Picked up at Gordon's in Watertown\tBottle 051/502781 Bottled 1/20/10\tPoured in to my Portsmouth tulip\t\tA: This beer pours a cloudy, ruddy, dark brown with some reddish highlights to it. A HUGE finger of creamy khaki color head caps this beer off. Head recedes at a moderate pace leaving chunks of sticky lacing on the glass. \t\tS: Nose is rather musty and musky, some yeast and wheats filter in, a sweet character comes through and a bit of earthiness.\t\tT: Taste is yeast, wheat, massive funk that basically fills out the middle. So musty and musky, but mingled with a crazy almost caramel malt sweetness. Hints of ... licorice??? A earthy, hay like quality in the finish.\t\tM: Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, light yet creamy body.\t\tD: Goes down alright, milder kick than the ABV would indicate, a decent beer but I would go with others of the style.", 'user/profileName': 'Jayli', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Elephino', 'review/timeUnix': 1282445481, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '61131', 'beer/brewerId': '1412', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 2, 'min': 51, 'sec': 21, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 234, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "A: The pour is an amber sort of color with a nice finger's worth of off-white head.\t\tS: A very pleasant citrus hop aroma of grapefruits and oranges along with a very nice pine note. A bit of sweet caramel malt underneath.\t\tT: There is a bit more malt sweetness than I generally prefer for an IPA, but the piney hops provide a really excellent bitterness to the beer. The citrus notes are more subtle, but quite pleasant.\t\tM: Medium both in terms of body and carbonation with a nice bitter finish.\t\tD: This was really nice and I always enjoy trying a beer from a (new to me) brewery. I would definitely give this one another go.", 'user/profileName': 'womencantsail', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Racer 5 India Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1287710284, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '2751', 'beer/brewerId': '610', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 1, 'min': 18, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 295, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "12 oz. bottle\t\tA- Orange tinged light amber, a nice head that doesn't quite fully dissipate, and leaves beautiful lacing down my mug.\t\tS-Piney/Grapefruit Hops. That's about it, the low spot of the beer.\t\tT- LOVE the flavor complexity of racer five. Initial Pine/Grapefruit hops, much like the nose, but then it smooths out to a biscuit malt flavor with that wonderful apricot sweetness. Ends with a bitterness/dryness that's just enough to make you want the next sip. \t\tM- feels thicker than it looks with just enough carbonation. Almost creamy initially in the mouth.\t\tD- Really, really nice change up from most IPA's. Highly drinkable.\t\tI really enjoy this as a change up to the normal Dogfish Head 60 min, Smuttynose, and Victory Hop Devil that are readily available in my area.", 'user/profileName': 'JWU', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Witbier', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Allagash White', 'review/timeUnix': 1150675760, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Dec 28, 1970', 'beer/ABV': 5.2, 'beer/beerId': '59', 'user/birthdayUnix': 31219200, 'beer/brewerId': '4', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 0, 'min': 9, 'sec': 20, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 170, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1387116247, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Served in a Hoegaarden glass at just over fridge temperature. \t\tAppearance- Pours a cloudy pale gold, the head cresting at about two fingers and settling to a fine mat. Looks like a good witbier, solid in appearance.\t\tSmell- Bold, no-holds-barred display of coriander spice and orange peel... fresh and spritzy, Allagash doesn't disappoint here. Really nice.\t\tTaste- Solid wheat notes, maybe more textural but definitely there... backed by the smooth coriander and beautifully floral hop character. The beer has terrific balance and runs its course so eloquently for this style.\t\tMouthfeel/Drinkability- Light and prickly in the beginning, it swells in such a smooth, easy way... emphasizing the spices and wheat character. Light but very distinctive and totally appropriate. What a great witbier, the best U.S. take on the style.", 'user/profileName': 'yelterdow', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Indian Brown Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1249444197, 'beer/ABV': 7.2, 'beer/beerId': '1161', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 3, 'min': 49, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 217, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Pours a deep brown color. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "N'Ice Chouffe", 'review/timeUnix': 1211238922, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '2269', 'beer/brewerId': '321', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 23, 'min': 15, 'sec': 22, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 140, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A cloudy amber mahogany beer with a light khaki head. There is a grainy solvent like smell that tips you off to the higher ABV.\t\tA medium body with a sweet malty flavor. Fine smooth (champagne like) carbonation that isn't over the top but a nice compliment to the tastes. There is a slight bitterness and a warm toasted toffee flavor that isn't too intense. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'El Diablo', 'review/timeUnix': 1313635902, 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '72193', 'beer/brewerId': '24026', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 2, 'min': 51, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 230, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "8/17/2011\t\tOn tap at The Beer Company.\t\tA: Yellow gold with a large white head, decent retention, and no lacing.\t\tS: Redolent of pear, apple, and banana. {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Rip Tide', 'review/timeUnix': 1274031293, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Sep 10, 1985', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '41635', 'user/birthdayUnix': 495183600, 'beer/brewerId': '16315', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 17, 'min': 34, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 136, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 923151847, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Short tan head with poor retention. \t\tSmell is similar to darkness with the sweeter fruit aromas coming through. There is a lot more roast which is a nice change of pace. There is also a bit of smokiness that comes from British roasted malts.\t\tMore bitterness as a result of the roasted malts, again a very slightly smoked flavor comes through which adds a nice layer to the taste.\t\tMedium bodied beer with perfect carbonation. \t\tOverall, I went in to this one expecting not to like it but it ended up being one of my favorites.
