{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Hennepin (Farmhouse Saison)', 'review/timeUnix': 1073439754, 'beer/ABV': 7.7, 'beer/beerId': '141', 'beer/brewerId': '42', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 1, 'min': 42, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 7, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Pours a very hazy yellow with a hint of orange. Smells very citrusy/hoppy and scared me originally when I sniffed it. Had all the makings of a pale ale nightmare. How happily wrong I was. Has a very active bubbly white head that just looks great receding down the tulip glass. Damn good looking beer.\t\tThe taste is interesting. Syrupy sweet with a hint of malt and a lot of lemon/grass/pepper up front. Quite a good sized body for a mild beer. Finishes sweet as it began with some nice carbonation tingling on the tounge. Another gem from Ommegang.', 'user/profileName': 'yankeeheel', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'White Gold', 'review/timeUnix': 1308573125, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '36476', 'beer/brewerId': '651', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 12, 'min': 32, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 171, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "This beer pours a full bodied dull golden in color with a two finger bright white head. This has got to be the thickest wheat beer I've ever seen. Imagine a gold imperial stout in appearance. The aromas are earthy, grassy, lemon, and feature a tart yeasty aspect which is quite interesting. The flavors took me by surprise. It's moderately tart and you can pick up the different yeasts. It's very grassy and again features a lemon like tartness. It drinks kind of dry and is full in body. The viscosity makes this wheat a little harder to get through than most. Drinking a glass makes you feel like you just consumed a loaf of bread. It's definitely an interesting beer and I'm glad it had so much complexity for the style. I'd recommend trying this one, but probably sharing it with a friend.", 'user/profileName': 'aasher', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Bass Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1162232360, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '811', 'beer/brewerId': '293', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 18, 'min': 19, 'sec': 20, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 303, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'This is the common generally available \'bitter\' beer on hand pull in many pubs in my home town area in UK. Unfortunately since Coors took over the Bass Brewery some years ago, the beer has changed its character somewhat to how it tasted 10 years ago. It can also be very variable in quality, and I am not sure if this is due to the way it is kept by the pub staff, or the fault of the brewery. When in good condition (and the best way to have it is straight from the barrel by gravity feed and no head, though thats rare to see!) it is a medium dark colour (for a \'pale\' ale) rich and inviting, with a more maltly aroma, but also a bit sulphury from the "burton water" that characterises this style and origin of the beer. The taste is smooth and malty, the hoppy bitterness well in the background, also hints of spicyness. Over the last few years it seems to be less flavourful, the general malty smooth taste can remain, but less depth of flavour and character, and sometimes a bit sour and appears to be \'off" In recent tastings of the beer, on more than one occasion we have had to take the beer back because it was obviously going off. This is a great shame, as it was a great traditional British Beer with lots of character and easy to drink. I have rated it disregarding the \'off\' samples had recently. \t\tJohnW\tB\'ham UK', 'user/profileName': 'JohnW', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Black Metal Imperial Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1309103636, 'beer/ABV': 10.4, 'beer/beerId': '64626', 'beer/brewerId': '24018', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 15, 'min': 53, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 177, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Poured from a 750ml bottle into three snifters. Huge notes of spicy hop bitterness. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Light Lager', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Lighting Bolt Gold', 'review/timeUnix': 1062922428, 'beer/ABV': 5.1, 'beer/beerId': '5042', 'beer/brewerId': '918', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 8, 'min': 13, 'sec': 48, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 250, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "A nicer color than a lot of light lagers I've seen. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Old Town Brown', 'review/timeUnix': 1250011226, 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '19182', 'beer/brewerId': '9792', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 17, 'min': 20, 'sec': 26, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 223, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Had this on tap at the First Street Draught House in town. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Oatmeal Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Shakespeare Oatmeal Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1296092210, 'beer/ABV': 6.1, 'beer/beerId': '56973', 'beer/brewerId': '132', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 1, 'min': 36, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 27, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Reviewed from notes 1/26/2011\t\tA: chocolate, coffee, and malts\t\tAp: dark brown to black with a 1 finger mocha colored head, nice lacing\t\tB/T: moderate carbonation, well balanced, thinner than expected\t\tAf: malty, sweet, chocolate, coffee\t\tO: a good reliable readily available standby\t\tCheers!\tThe CPJ', 'user/profileName': 'THECPJ', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Winter Warmer', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.0, 'beer/name': 'Harpoon Winter Warmer', 'review/timeUnix': 1167436430, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '310', 'beer/brewerId': '10097', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 23, 'min': 53, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 363, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 2.0, 'review/text': "It's winter time, my favorite time of year for seasonal beers, and this has caught my eye for a little while so I picked up a sixer.\t\tPours nicely without much head, but it's a nice dark copper color. Smell punches you in the face with nutmeg and cinnamon; not quite what I'm looking for, to be frank.\t\tThe taste of nutmeg and cinnamon are way too up-front as far as I'm concerned. Totally overwhelms any depth that might be had with this beer in a totally superficial sort of way. I understand that it's supposed to be a beer brewed with spices, but they really ought to be integrated with the beer, not the only thing it tastes like. It tastes a lot like Pumpkinhead Ale in this respect, actually, in that it's way too overwhelming and poor.\t\tMouthfeel is average.\t\tEasy to down, I guess, but the poor integration of the spices makes it difficult to stomach without holding your nose.\t\tFind a better winter warmer. There are lots.", 'user/profileName': 'Pharazon', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'The Oracle', 'review/timeUnix': 1253837577, 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '52361', 'beer/brewerId': '287', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 0, 'min': 12, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 268, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Pours bright orange with small white foam that quickly disappears.\t\tSmells heavy of grapefruit and citrus, little maltiness.\t\tTastes as though grapefruit has been added. {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Drake Tail India Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1281036999, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '33610', 'beer/brewerId': '14952', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 19, 'min': 36, 'sec': 39, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 217, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Bottle into a standard pint glass. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'De Dolle Stille Nacht', 'review/timeUnix': 1219380787, 'beer/ABV': 12.0, 'beer/beerId': '817', 'beer/brewerId': '201', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 22, 'hour': 4, 'min': 53, 'sec': 7, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 235, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A - Two fingers of sudsy white head, the body is hazy golden-brown.\t\tS - Strong fruity/ spicy aroma of plums, raisins, almonds, bananas, cloves, black pepper, anise, and a moderate level of wet, mossy, earthy funk. Spectacularly complex aroma.\t\tT - Bready banana flavor up front along with cloves, and nutmeg. Some raisins and caramel appear in the middle and are replaced by molasses and chocolate in the finish along with a lingering tobacco note.\t\tM - Medium-thick body, with very high carbonation, and a dry finish.\t\tD - Wow, an amazingly complex beer. There is a bit of a disconnect between the dark flavors in this beer and its relatively light color. The carbonation borders on being a bit too high and the alcohol is kind of hot, but these minor flaws are overshadowed by the complexity, especially of the aroma. Overall I am quite impressed with this beer and I can't wait to try some more of De Dolle's other offerings.", 'user/profileName': 'nickfl', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Baltic Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': "Puppy's Breath Porter", 'review/timeUnix': 1287326612, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '47732', 'beer/brewerId': '17981', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 14, 'min': 43, 'sec': 32, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 290, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "Pours a deep amber to black color with a light tan head. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Pumpkin Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Pumpkineater Imperial Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1288837771, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '53230', 'beer/brewerId': '11977', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 2, 'min': 29, 'sec': 31, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 308, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Thanks to H1N1 for this one. \tPoured from 1L swing top bottle in to Duvel tulip glass. \t\tA - Dark amber colour with one finger of bubbly white head that quickly disappeared. \t\tS - Pumpkin, cloves, cinnamon, nutmeg. Standard nose for a pumpkin ale but not overly spiced, which many are.\t\tT - Pumpkin, cloves & nutmeg are the predominant flavours. Some cinnamon is here as well but not as pronounced as it is in many pumpkin ales. I don't specifically taste the star anise but I am not sure I would know that taste if I found it anyway. A nice peppery taste is present in the finish. \t\tM - Medium body, nice chew, lightly carbonated. \t\tD - Nicely balanced pumpkin beer. Not overly spiced like many pumpkin beers tend to be. This was was very well balanced (pumpkin and spiced). One of the better pumpkin ales I have tried.", 'user/profileName': 'TheSevenDuffs', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Winter Warmer', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Nutcracker Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1279972545, 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '3322', 'beer/brewerId': '423', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 11, 'min': 55, 'sec': 45, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 205, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A-Pours a swarthy,reddish amber with a one-finger\tfluffy head of light-pinkish white.The head slowly recedes leaving thin strands of lacing.Mild to moderate carbonation is present.\t\tS-Piny hops,Gingerbread,mulling spice and toasty malt.This definitely smells like the holidays.Not overdone on the spice though.Hops are still a main player.\t\tT-Dry spice,orange peel,clove and toffee/malt nuttiness.Sweet citrus from the hops,deliberate spice and caramel.\t\tM-This beer is medium bodied with some active carbonation.It is relatively creamy with a dry finish and a lasting piny/spice aftertaste.\t\tD-I think if this beer is consumed when it is intended to be(It is a Winter Warmer,correct?)\tIt's drinkability is pretty high.", 'user/profileName': 'StlHopHead77', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Herbed / Spiced Beer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': "Frederick Miller's Classic Chocolate Lager", 'review/timeUnix': 1162878306, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '32809', 'beer/brewerId': '105', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 5, 'min': 45, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 311, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '*I am rating this for what it is...a specialty chocolate lager...I realize this may not be for everyone but for the style it is quite nice..\t---\tDark brown color....creamy texture in the mouth....medium bodied....huge sweet melted milk chocolate aroma....also some powdered hot cocoa mix..\t\tTaste is sweet and big on the milk chocolate....at first it seems almost a little too sweet but it finishes very clean...drinks like a lager...might be a bit much for some people but I think they did a nice job with this. I am amazed there is no "real" chocolate added. It tastes and smells like there is..also some wheat malt in this...\t\tTo me this is a souped up schwartzbeir on chocolate steroids...I think this is a nice effort by Miller and one that can serve as an after dinner beer for many...even non-beer drinkers...', 'user/profileName': 'ZAP', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'California Common / Steam Beer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Old Scratch Amber Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1205211557, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '204', 'beer/brewerId': '68', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 4, 'min': 59, 'sec': 17, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 71, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured from a 12 oz. brown bottle into a Sam Adams pint glass.\tA: Bright copper orange colored brew, plenty of visible carbonation. Somewhat thick off-white head that is quite bubbly and recedes quickly to a quarter inch thick layer atop the beer that slowly pops and bubbles over. Some tiny lacing down the sides.\tS: Warming hops fill the nose, mostly floral and a hint of citrus and maybe pine. A bit of sweet caramel malts, too. Balanced but tiny.\tT: Sweet malts and hops throughout. I'm pleased with the balancing flavors of this beer. The good parts of a pale ale and a lager combined.\tM: The crispness of a lager and the tiny hop bite of a pale ale. Pretty good.\tD: Quite nice. I liked this one and could have more.", 'user/profileName': 'LeftyBWS', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Munich Helles Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Bikini Blonde Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1256605605, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Mar 18, 1973', 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '43605', 'user/birthdayUnix': 101289600, 'beer/brewerId': '16057', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 1, 'min': 6, 'sec': 45, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 300, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1317045847, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "On tap in the Maui Brewing Co tasting room in Lahaina.\t\tA: pale, golden in color. a decent head with a fair amount of bubbles and good lacing.\t\tS: I pick up mostly banana bread and grapefruit, with a bit of hop aroma.\t\tT: malty, with some of the citrus noted in the aroma. pretty much what I was expecting given the style, though not overly exciting.\t\tM: refreshing and smooth with good carbonation.\t\tD: a refreshing brew for a hot day on Maui. it wouldn't be my first choice, but a satisfying beer under the right circumstances.", 'user/profileName': 'jhoban19', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Maibock / Helles Bock', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Harpoon Helles Blond Bock (100 Barrel Series # 27)', 'review/timeUnix': 1243649064, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.4, 'beer/beerId': '49845', 'beer/brewerId': '10097', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 2, 'min': 4, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 150, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': 'Poured from the bomber into two pint glasses. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Unearthly (Imperial India Pale Ale)', 'review/timeUnix': 1145845804, 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '28577', 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 2, 'min': 30, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 114, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Appearance  This was a glowing brown in color and very clear with a good, reputable head.\t\tSmell  The big, citrus hops did this bouquet proud. They didnt run away with the nose though, as this ale has a wonderful malty base and a good sense of alcohol.\t\tTaste  The malts are huge at the taste, and the alcohol lightens up a bit making this a nicely balanced brew. The citrus hops are large and in charge. This is a flavor explosion.\t\tMouthfeel  This is a solid medium-bodied with a slick, almost greasy mouthfeel. Its interesting, because the hops are huge but its not brutally bitter.\t\tDrinkability  This is a good-drinking bigger beer that was the life of the party.\t\tComments  Thanks to BeerGuy for donating this monster bomber to skyhands Broken Fridge party.', 'user/profileName': 'RoyalT', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Mac's Copperhop Pale Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1075926230, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '15751', 'beer/brewerId': '626', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 20, 'min': 23, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 35, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'This is Mac\'s interpretation of an India Pale Ale. I\'m more inclined to call it a uniquely-hopped Pale Ale, rather than an IPA, but who am I to argue with the brewer.\t\tLet me explain. This beer, according to McCashin\'s, is a \'late hopped pale ale.\' In practical terms--at least to my nose/tongue--that results in a very raw hoppiness. They use a combination of five different hops--all grown in Nelson, NZ--and they\'re not added until the end of the boil, which leaves a hoppy freshness right at the front of this beer. It\'s almost as if the hops are not IN this beer but ON it.\t\tPours a dark gold color with a slight amber hue. Good, sticky head retention.\t\tOverall, this is a very unique brew. How unique? Consider this: In 4.5 months of traveling in Europe (including Belgium & Germany) then New Zealand, this is the only one I felt compelled to take notes on! If you\'re ever down New Zealand, skip the Lion Red and Export Gold crap that floods the shelves and look for this beer. Mac\'s beers are made from "all natural ingredients" (a phrase that actually has some meaning in New Zealand).', 'user/profileName': 'Marty', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Old Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Hibernation Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1323741396, 'beer/ABV': 8.7, 'beer/beerId': '1446', 'beer/brewerId': '158', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 1, 'min': 56, 'sec': 36, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 347, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': '1 year old bottle-\t\tDark chestnut with slight head but excellent retention. Slight lacing.\t\tThe aroma has a bit of "off" scented hops. Not bad, but not the a pleasant hop variety in terms of aroma. A lot of malt comes through but it\'s well balanced.\t\tThe taste actually reminds me a little of old ruffian. Less aggresive on the hops though with a sweeter malt bill. There\'s a bit of spiciness and a good dose of peat. \t\tThe body is medium full and medium heavy. Carbonation is nice and light. The finish is dry and slightly sticky.\t\tOverall, this wasn\'t what I expected for a year old english style old ale but I was impressed nonetheless.', 'user/profileName': 'BBP', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Herbed / Spiced Beer', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'No\xc3\xabl Des G\xc3\xa9ants', 'review/timeUnix': 1277154295, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 19, 1988', 'beer/ABV': 8.5, 'beer/beerId': '40310', 'user/birthdayUnix': 593247600, 'beer/brewerId': '4261', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 21, 'min': 4, 'sec': 55, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 172, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 825087847, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "11.2oz bottle, Sam Adams glass, no freshness date. \t\tA shade darker and deeper than a hearty IPA, the head isn't large but consistent. There was yeast in the bottle, as there should be, and I poured some but not all. \t\tOther than classic Belgian yeast must, a nasally refreshing wintergreen lends almost physical coolness that can also be perceived as clean lemon. It could also even be clean pine, but not in a hoppy way. \t\tLemon grass, ginger, smaller wintergreen. Banana and clove via the yeast. This is a nice, complex, controlled beer of this style. Moderate Belgian biscuity malt, a little like its been sitting out in humidity. More cool lemon peel. \t\tThere is nothing special other than the flavors in the mouth and it's thin. \t\tI can't taste the alcohol, and because it adds nothing past intoxication potential I can't see why this beer needs to be 8.5% ABV.", 'user/profileName': 'brewerburgundy', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Ekstra Baltic Weisse Beer', 'review/timeUnix': 1141779402, 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '20000', 'beer/brewerId': '886', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 0, 'min': 56, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 67, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'I actually acquired this from another beer enthusiast of which whom I work with. He bought it from a grocery store that just opened up here in Hampton Roads and is known for their exotic foods at very low prices. I am known to drink a lot of wheat beers and he brought me a few to see what I thought.\t\tAlthough it is a very light wheat beer, the flavor was spot-on for a Hefeweizen. I was impressed with the aroma, and the affordability and taste made it a must have for my next dinner party.', 'user/profileName': 'Hefedrinker', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Light Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Miller High Life Light', 'review/timeUnix': 1150415800, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '2295', 'beer/brewerId': '105', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 23, 'min': 56, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 166, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'It\'s an old classic in the "light" version. The self-named champagne of beers. Now not so premium, but in the bottom of the cooler at albeit a bargain price. Mildly sweet corny smell and a consistant lager taste. Slight bitterness but consistent throughout from start to finish. Good carbonation. Not a unique beer for the demanding coniseur\'s taste, but ice cold is a great way to refresh a hot summer day. Brings back lots of memories of tall blondes. A summer sessioner without a doubt. I can drink this all day or all night long (or both). I see they\'ve even bumped up the AC a tad.', 'user/profileName': 'mooseisloose', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'BrewDog Paradox Longrow (Batch 018)', 'review/timeUnix': 1247355430, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 23, 1974', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '51061', 'user/birthdayUnix': 143794800, 'beer/brewerId': '16315', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 23, 'min': 37, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 192, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1274540647, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "The bottle I have is called Paradox Longrow, and has Japanese writing on half the label. Since the Springbank distillery produces the Longrow expressions, this may be the same thing as the Paradox Springbank Batch 17, but in the interest of simplifying things, let's make a Longrow entry, since Springbank does make other whiskys.\t\tThis beer pours an opaque black, with reddish-copper edges, and two fingers of soapy beige head, that leaves consistent webbed lacing as it recedes. It smells of bitter roasted coffee, and a little salty, peaty seaside essence. The taste is mildly bitter coffee, chocolate, butterscotch, vanilla, and a slight resinous herbal character. The alcohol is very well integrated, appearing only as a slight overall warming. The carbonation is quite low, the body fairly full, creamy, and a bit slick, and it finishes with a little more of those understated island seaside whiskey notes - salt, iodine, peat.\t\tThis is more tame, yet also more balanced, than the previous whiskey barrel RISs that I've had from BrewDog. It's quite enjoyable, a lovely sipper.", 'user/profileName': 'biboergosum', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Bock', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Uff-da', 'review/timeUnix': 1240083215, 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '2565', 'beer/brewerId': '590', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 19, 'min': 33, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 108, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Pours a dark brown that shows ruby highlights when held into the light. Thin off-white head that has decent retention and shows minimal lacing. Extremely clear.\t\tThe nose is very sweet and very malty. Roasted malts take over the nose at first, but chocolate and coffee notes battle it out. Not overly complex nose, but a solid one nonetheless.\t\tTaste is exactly what you would expect from the nose, no surprises here. Roasted malts dominate, coffee and chocolate come into play, but don't compete with the roasted malts dominance. There is a slight spicey character that was not noticed in the nose, but now that I taste it I can definitely see it being in the nose as well. 7.3% ABV is nowhere to be found.\t\tMedium body, very smooth and rich. Light carbonation. I find this very drinkable, and the 7.3% ABV is not noticeable at all. If this were available in my area, I would be getting this all the time.", 'user/profileName': 'Mistofminn', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Pumpkin Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Post Road Pumpkin Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1286672319, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 6, 1964', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '74', 'user/birthdayUnix': -173206800, 'beer/brewerId': '45', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 0, 'min': 58, 'sec': 39, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 283, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1591542247, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "appearance: appropriately orange with a full creamy head and lacing.\tsmell: more subdued than DFH Punkin or Weyerbacher Imperial in the nutmeg, cardamom space. a distinctive toffee in the nose.\ttaste: this one comes together well. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Hop Hearty Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1141625726, 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jan 1, 1900', 'beer/ABV': 6.1, 'beer/beerId': '1956', 'user/birthdayUnix': -2208960000, 'beer/brewerId': '590', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 6, 'min': 15, 'sec': 26, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 65, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 3627295447, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Pours a clear reddish amber with a couple scant bubbles rising hither and yon topped off with a thin khaki collar. \t\tBright citrus orange and tangerine hops with a good balance of malts and the hops. \t\tFirst swigs: Well balanced easy smooth hops and malt. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Wheat Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Unfiltered Wheat', 'review/timeUnix': 1145633479, 'beer/ABV': 4.6, 'beer/beerId': '1260', 'beer/brewerId': '423', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 15, 'min': 31, 'sec': 19, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 111, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Appearance - cloudy orange color with a little amount of head atop.\t\tSmell - light wheaty and orange/citrusy smell to it.\t\tTaste - very smooth and sweet. calming enough to have a few more.\t\tMouthfeel - little carbonation and smooth.\t\tDrinkability - decent try at a wheat.', 'user/profileName': 'DuqTroops', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'German Pilsener', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': "Beck's", 'review/timeUnix': 1251956164, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '2435', 'beer/brewerId': '32', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 5, 'min': 36, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 246, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Medium gold color with a big fluffy head, fades quckely\t\tlight hoppes and a sour skunky flavor\t\textremely one dimensional light malts slightly bitter hop finish\t\tlight and carbonated\t\tgoes down easy\t\ti'd say this beer is a few rungs above budweiser about the same level as heineken i would never buy this beer again unless i was at some sort of bar that only sold macros i'd rather save the money and buy an 18 of high life or buy an actual half way decent beer", 'user/profileName': 'HopBacchus', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Ode To Mercy', 'review/timeUnix': 1318883406, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.2, 'beer/beerId': '61835', 'beer/brewerId': '23651', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 20, 'min': 30, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 290, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'poured into a Mother Earth tulip.\t\tA - slightly less than a one-finger, tan head that faded to a patchy cap; a bit of spotty lacing; dark brown color with quite a bit of ruby-orange highlights\tS - rye, molasses\tT - very similar to aroma; sweet throughout with a pronounced malt bill that tastes similar to rye to me; some maple and hazelnut; does not dry out much at end \tM - light-med fine prickly carbonation that provides a bit of crispness to the otherwise sweet and somewhat heavy body\tD - i am not an expert on the style by any means but it seems like a cross between an American brown and an amber; still enjoyable none the less; just a bit too sweet and heavy to be extremely drinkable for me', 'user/profileName': 'cwguy5', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Coffee Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1257912758, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Dec 9, 1985', 'beer/ABV': 5.75, 'beer/beerId': '2810', 'user/birthdayUnix': 502963200, 'beer/brewerId': '590', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 4, 'min': 12, 'sec': 38, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 315, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 915372247, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured from a 12oz bottle into a snifter:\t\tAppearance and Smell:Poured a very dark brown, just about black and didn't allow much light through. Had a very minimal cream colored head which dissipated quickly and just sat at the edge of the glass. Smelled of roasty almost burned coffee, along with some sweet mocha chocolate notes. Nice strong smelling brew.\t\tTaste and Mouthfeel:Tasted of coffee, burned sugar and a hint of bitter sweet chocolate which resides with the sweet caramel malt presence. Was pretty light to medium bodied with a noticeable carbonation presence. Left a dry, earthy hop bitterness in the finish.\t\tDrinkability:Very drinkable, pretty light feel overall. Finished with a bit more bitterness than expected. I'd definitely drink more of this for sure, just probably wouldn't seek it out.", 'user/profileName': 'blackenmn', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 2.0, 'beer/style': 'German Pilsener', 'review/palate': 2.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': "Beck's", 'review/timeUnix': 1177112333, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 2, 1985', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '2435', 'user/birthdayUnix': 497084400, 'beer/brewerId': '32', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 23, 'min': 38, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 110, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 921251048, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': "A - Light golden straw with little to no head, even when intentionally poured with no decanting. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Abbaye De Forest', 'review/timeUnix': 1209195583, 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '42338', 'beer/brewerId': '804', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 7, 'min': 39, 'sec': 43, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 117, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'A bright, golden filtrated beer with a thick head.\t\tSmell is like a tripel, with solvent and fruity smells, but it also has a distinct dirty socks smell that is very disturbing.\t\tTaste is light malty with a nice yeast profile of exotic fruits and a little solvent and higher alohols. Again this strange taste comes up and develops from dirty socks into overcooked vegetables. Especially when swallowed this taste is at the end of my tongue.\tOne of the few drained beers I had.', 'user/profileName': 'Absumaster', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Odyssey Imperial IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1211347923, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 16, 1986', 'beer/ABV': 8.4, 'beer/beerId': '30470', 'user/birthdayUnix': 519289200, 'beer/brewerId': '10397', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 5, 'min': 32, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 142, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 899046247, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '22oz bottle acquired via trade with HopDerek\t\tAroma: Strong hop aroma coming out of the pour, citrus hops as is typical among American IPAs. A nice smelling IPA, it previews what its going to bring\t\tAppearance: Beautiful amber color with an inch or so of moderately fluffy white head, which produces fine lacing. A standard look for the style.\t\tTaste: Slick malt taste is the main component, but the hops still bite -- bitter hops are there to keep the taste in check, and to leave you wanting more\t\tFeel: This one was super balanced, as the malt really made this one smooth on the tongue. A nice medium body on the beer with a nice dose of carbonation too.\t\tDrinkability: I had to look up the ABV, as the alcohol did not come out very strong. 8.4% is hidden quite well, and without the harsh, mouthful of hops taste that other IPAs have, this one is quite pleasant to drink\t\tAll told, Odyssey is a pretty good double IPA, pretty easy to drink too, but there are still several others I would rather have. Definitely worth a try though!', 'user/profileName': 'jophish17', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Big Sound Scotch Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1313003339, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jul 9, 1985', 'beer/ABV': 8.5, 'beer/beerId': '46366', 'user/birthdayUnix': 489740400, 'beer/brewerId': '17981', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 10, 'hour': 19, 'min': 8, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 222, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 928595047, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Served from bottle into a Stone nonic. Poured a deep dark brown with a half finger light tan head that subsided to a minimal amount quickly. Maintained decent lacing throughout the glass. The aroma was comprised of sweet malt, maple syrup, and caramel. The flavor was of sweet malt, maple syrup, caramel, wood, and subtle tart. It had a medium feel with medium-high carbonation. Overall this was a decent brew. I really wasn't that impressed with this one if I am honest. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Irish Red Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Heavy Seas - Aarsh Imperial Red Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1304029743, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '66260', 'beer/brewerId': '898', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 22, 'min': 29, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 118, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Aromas of lightly roasted malts, some lighter toffee and a light earthy hoppiness. \tThe taste begins with a lot of the same; toasted and bready malty grains, caramels, toffee sweetness. As it warms there is some light earthy, almost metallic bitterness, which is rather unpleasant to be honest. The finish is pleasantly dry with some detection of mineral water flavors which adds a nice dryness. Overall this is nothing to write home about or seek out because of the generic flavors, especially because of the unnecessarily high ABV which inhibits further consumption. If I'm consuming something over 6 ABV it needs flavor, which this is lacking.", 'user/profileName': 'claspada', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Saison / Farmhouse Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Evil Twin Ron And The Beast Ryan', 'review/timeUnix': 1318905827, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '74273', 'beer/brewerId': '24300', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 2, 'min': 43, 'sec': 47, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 291, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'on tap at pope in philly\t\tPours a completely clouded golden color with some yellow hues. Thick, frothy white head retains well on top, fading into some layers of film with some rings of lacing on the glass. \t\tSpicy and citrusy on the nose. Some lemon peel and cracked pepper with a hint of orange sweetness. Barely any alcohol with some soft brett funk and yeast. \t\tSplash of floral hops up front with peppery spice. Some herbal notes followed by citrus juiciness and lemon peel. A little sweet in the middle from the fruit. Hints of bretty funk and Belgian yeast, but not quite tart. Finishes a little spicy. \t\tMedium body, higher carbonation, refreshing and tingly on the palate. A solid saison, although I was hoping for more brett presence.', 'user/profileName': 'xnicknj', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Gouden Carolus Hopsinjoor', 'review/timeUnix': 1244417328, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '42079', 'beer/brewerId': '1534', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 23, 'min': 28, 'sec': 48, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 158, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Got a small bottle for $7 at Tap and Table in Emmaus, PA. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Barleywine', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Olde GnarlyWine', 'review/timeUnix': 1248891747, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Mar 2, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 10.6, 'beer/beerId': '1579', 'user/birthdayUnix': 383904000, 'beer/brewerId': '220', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 18, 'min': 22, 'sec': 27, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 210, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1034431447, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Pours a nice light mahogany with a wispy beige head, and is, for all purposes, a nice looking barleywine. Good hoppy flavour, with a delightful splash of citrus and pine, and a lasting bitterness. This is balanced quite well by a brown sugar sweetness and a touch of sherry. Full-bodied, medium carbonation and warming. Lagunitas know how to use their hops to good effect. Recommended.", 'user/profileName': 'bobsy', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'English Barleywine', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Blithering Idiot', 'review/timeUnix': 1233440555, 'beer/ABV': 11.1, 'beer/beerId': '1566', 'beer/brewerId': '392', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 31, 'hour': 22, 'min': 22, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 31, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': 'a: pours a light brown/orange with very little head\t\ts: had a nice citrus smell with a ton of booze, and I mean a ton...\t\tt: the alcohol really overpowered the beer, specifically the after taste; had a good taste for a barley wine, but not as smooth as others\t\tm: went down smooth, more like an after dinner drink than a barley wine in my opinion\t\td: while overall I thought it was a good barley wine, the alcohol content was a little much. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Barleywine', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Owde Engwish Bahwey Whine', 'review/timeUnix': 1296957576, 'beer/ABV': 10.5, 'beer/beerId': '60796', 'beer/brewerId': '26', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 1, 'min': 59, 'sec': 36, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 37, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Served in a snifter at the brewpub.\t\tHad to dance with the cask brew during our Three Floyds Brewpub Experience today. It pours a hazed sunrise russet-amber topped by a finger of ecru micro-foam. The nose comprises orange zest, toffee, caramel, flowers, and light bright greens (you know, the part of the lettuce head that has the least amount of vitamins and whatnot). The taste brings in more of the same, along with some extra caramel and toffee, some red grapes, and a subtle leek character lurking devilishly in the background. The body is a strong medium, with a mild carbonation and a rather smooth feel. Overall, a very nice b-wine, the standout of the Experience.', 'user/profileName': 'TMoney2591', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Anchor Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1170375344, 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '61', 'beer/brewerId': '28', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 0, 'min': 15, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 33, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A - Very deep red body (black if not held near light) with a small pale head.\t\tS - Smokey with notes of Caramel. \t\tT - Toasted barley taste with smooth transition to light hop finish. \t\tM - Nicely carbonated with exceptionally smooth finish. \t\tD - A true porter, very drinkable. \t\tOverall - Another great beer from Anchor Brewing.', 'user/profileName': 'cmeyer45', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Bison Organic IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1158397983, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '24093', 'beer/brewerId': '609', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 9, 'min': 13, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 259, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Bison Organic IPA\tThe appearance of this beer is a cloudy amber hue. An unfiltered Orgainic beer is sort of "tree-hugger" sounding. I\'ve had one organic IPA beer before and it totally ruined my view of the word "organic" when refering to beer.\t\tThe nose on this beer is very nice. Fresh hops and a slight malt sweetness.\t\tAt first taste, I really like the beer. It has a bread-like flavor to it but still stays hoppy. The mouthfeel of the beer is crisp and direct. It definitely registers as a west coast IPA. I\'m not sure what type of hops are used but its not the typical cascade, simcoe, centennial combo. Maybe its the "organic" hops? As for drinkability, I could handle a couple of these but use it more as a stepping stone to a higher hopped IPA during a session.\tNice solid IPA; changed my view of "organic"', 'user/profileName': 'LongBeachHopHead', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 2.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Sierra Nevada Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1283140462, 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '279', 'beer/brewerId': '140', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 3, 'min': 54, 'sec': 22, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 242, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Pours black with ruby highlights and an off-white head.\tNose shows bold milk chocolate by the truckload along with cocoa and some soft roasted malt. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'English Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Double Barrel Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1162454842, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 16, 1984', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '5653', 'user/birthdayUnix': 466758000, 'beer/brewerId': '2210', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 8, 'min': 7, 'sec': 22, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 306, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 951577447, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A- pours a nice deep amber color with a thin white head that retains a little less well than was expected but did lace ok.\t\tS- somewhat light, a sweet toasty malty smell with a very light hop aroma\t\tT- nice clean malty sweetness at first then a nice citrusy hoppy bitterness that was mch more pronounced in taste as opposed to the smell\t\tM- clean, crisp, nice carboantion, medium/light body\t\tD- a nice and drinkable brew, goes down esily, low abv, smooth body, not too highly priced either as I recall, pretty good beer', 'user/profileName': 'gonzo138', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': '120 Minute IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1317607297, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 18.0, 'beer/beerId': '9086', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 2, 'min': 1, 'sec': 37, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 276, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A: Poured a dark golden amber/orange with a thin head. \t\tS: Very strong apricot and citrus aroma, gave way to a rather strong alcohol waft when swirled in the glass.\t\tT: Very smooth and full flavored, very sweet with a warming alcohol finish. A small sip went a long way to coat all of your taste buds.', 'user/profileName': 'biggied', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Chocolate Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1219635194, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '1118', 'beer/brewerId': '132', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 3, 'min': 33, 'sec': 14, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 238, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'An expansive gloomy head with great retention over an ebony vacuum. One bomber was not enough to satisfy. Need more. Many more. The bar has been raised. Hats way off to this one.', 'user/profileName': 'itcomesnpints', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Cuv\xc3\xa9e De Koninck', 'review/timeUnix': 1085347112, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '5046', 'beer/brewerId': '218', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 21, 'min': 18, 'sec': 32, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 144, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'I had this on tap at Eulogy. Poured a dark amber color with a tannish, long lasting head with good lacing throughout the drink. The aroma was one of malty sweetness and some fruitiness as well. The taste is a complex one with a carbonated malty sweetness with hints of raisins and currants. There is a nice bitter finish that is not strong enough to overshadow the sweetness but balances the taste nicely. It is smooth and creamy in the mouth and I was ready for a second one.', 'user/profileName': 'rdrummer', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Maudite', 'review/timeUnix': 1204857185, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '33', 'beer/brewerId': '22', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 2, 'min': 33, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 67, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Appearance: Poured a cloudy dark amber color. The effect of the swirling yeast is really cool! Head was about an inch and a half of off-white foam, but quickly went away to nothing.\t\tSmell: Pungent bouquet of fruit, mostly pear, and a wisp of alcohol. Very enticing.\t\tTaste: Sweet fruity esters and a touch of fusel alcohol. Typical Belgian flavors, but more robust than, say, Leffe.\t\tMouthfeel: Slightly creamy from the carbonation, with a warming alcohol effect. Overall a very smooth beer.\t\tDrinkability: Very tasty and very respectable Belgian for a special occasion, but the high ABV limits the drinkability of this brew. Personally, I think Belgians taste so much different from your average beer that I wouldn't want to drink more than one at a time.", 'user/profileName': 'nerual511', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Titan IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1200789552, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'May 27, 1981', 'beer/ABV': 7.1, 'beer/beerId': '11922', 'user/birthdayUnix': 359794800, 'beer/brewerId': '158', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 0, 'min': 39, 'sec': 12, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 20, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1058540647, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured into room temp pint glass. I let sit for 10 minutes before drinking.\t\tAppearance - A very light brownish color with a hint of orange. Light head, which settled into a thin layer, decent lacing.\t\tSmell - Definitely an IPA, by the good amount of floral aroma that hits your nose. Also has a piney scent. This is a very pleasant smelling beer.\t\tTaste - To steal a line from Old School 'Once it hits your Lips, it's so good'. Seriously though, very strong hop taste, but not entirely bitter. Earthy and Citrus notes as well. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Irish Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "St. Brendan's Irish Red Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1079906764, 'beer/ABV': 6.2, 'beer/beerId': '16699', 'beer/brewerId': '812', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 22, 'min': 6, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 81, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'St Patricks Day "once a year brew" according to the bottle. {'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'American Stout', 'review/palate': 2.0, 'review/taste': 1.5, 'beer/name': "Bell's Cherry Stout", 'review/timeUnix': 1197915933, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '2511', 'beer/brewerId': '287', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 18, 'min': 25, 'sec': 33, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 351, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 1.5, 'review/text': "Well, being a stout lover I was intrigued by this offering. Cherries seem like a natural pairing with a stout. After finishing it, I was more then a little bit disappointed.\t\tA: Poured as black as the remnants of an ink well (in my brand new tenth year anniversary Ommegang glass by the way). No head whatsoever and I was a bit aggressive with my pour.\t\tS: Curiously devoid of any real odors. As the beer warmed up, I did detect the faint hint of cherries.\t\tT: Not that I regularly partake in cold medicine, but this stuff reminded me of Nyquil and it only got worse as time passed (yes, it took a while to finish it off). Medicinal taste with a sour/bitter finish.\t\tM: Oily and viscous, it seemed to leave a thin coating on the palate for several minutes after each sip. Linked to the less then appealing taste and it was not a pleasant reminder.\t\tD: As stated above, this one took awhile to finish off. Very disapponted, as Bell's other offerings are pretty good. I would not recommend this stout to anyone (unless I was angry with them and wanted to see them suffer).", 'user/profileName': 'mfreire212', 'review/aroma': 1.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Maudite', 'review/timeUnix': 1200802100, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 4, 1984', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '33', 'user/birthdayUnix': 460450800, 'beer/brewerId': '22', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 4, 'min': 8, 'sec': 20, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 20, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 957884648, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Pours a dingy coper in color with an interesting head, and some good lacing. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Black Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Blue Point Toxic Sludge', 'review/timeUnix': 1306351076, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '60730', 'beer/brewerId': '764', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 19, 'min': 17, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 145, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '22 oz bottle into a couple of tulip glasses. \t\tPours black (ruby comes out along the edges) with a finger of foamy light-mocha head. This maintains some richness to the look, leaving back frothy sticky lace that clings to the sides of the glass. The aroma smells floral and citric, with a good bit of chocolate mixed in. Roast pushes up from underneath giving this a light crunchiness in the nostrils. \t\tThe taste has an assertive green citric bite, balanced across the back by sweet notes of chocolate and caramel malts. Dark roasted coffee character is mostly confined to the finish, where it hangs with some leftover bitter fruit. The mouthfeel is medium bodied and over sharp feeling in the mouth, the whole way through. That 7% feels about right on target here, giving the body some oomph but still keeping any alcohol warmth at a distance. \t\tThis was a decent take on the style from Blue Point with a well balanced and fairly easy drinking mix of flavors. I just wish that the overall profiles put a bit more out there for you to wrap your palate around. This seemed a bit muted. Im not sure if this was because of the age of the bottle or not. Id be willing to reinvestigate this one.', 'user/profileName': 'Kegatron', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': "Bell's Special Double Cream Stout", 'review/timeUnix': 1269481633, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.1, 'beer/beerId': '2403', 'beer/brewerId': '287', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 1, 'min': 47, 'sec': 13, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 84, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "A: Near black body with creamy tan head.\t\tS: Raisins, smoke and coffee primarily.\t\tT: The milk shows up strong, adding a sweeter dimension to the already oatmeal raisin chocolate cookie-like flavors. Some slight herbal hop along the way. Smoke also lingers on the finish.\t\tM: Creamy with a long finish.\t\tD: Great balance of sweet and smokey with a smooth body. It's an easy drinker, full of flavor without being too big at all. The sweet comes from both the fruit and the milk, balancing the acidity on that end as well. Really pleasant.", 'user/profileName': 'dudecandle', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Duck-Rabbit Wee Heavy Scotch Style Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1194649231, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '30521', 'beer/brewerId': '9790', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 23, 'min': 0, 'sec': 31, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 313, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "A: The pour reveals a burgundy-tinged hue that lets some light in, topped by a one-finger head that stays around briefly, but dissipates to a thin layer of bubbles on top.\t\tS: Malty aroma is large with the smell of toasted malt, toffee, figs, and sharp/sweet alcohol. The bouquet is fairly formidable, with all of these scents coming together nicely, reminiscent of an Old Ale in smell.\t\tT: Surprisingly, the malt flavor plays second-fiddle to the sweetness of this beer. While the introduction gives off a decent maltiness, the assault comes in the middle with a sweet, mildly hopped bitter and alcohol taste that pushes toward the finish. Aftertaste is of the initial malt and the sugar-like sweetness.\t\tM: Light-bodied and carbonated adequately for the style they're attempting. Slightly syrupy, as in almost like the cloying sweetness of cough syrup.\t\tD: Wee Heavys are tricky beasts, and this one is no different. Honestly, I wasn't overly impressed with this one, but still thought it was a valiant effort. The drinkability is not as high with the attack of sweet flavor and the aftertaste it leaves.", 'user/profileName': 'CharlieMopps', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Irish Red Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': "Smithwick's", 'review/timeUnix': 1193714687, 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '29602', 'beer/brewerId': '209', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 3, 'min': 24, 'sec': 47, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 303, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Had this on-tap at my local haunt. \t\tPours a dark reddish-brown color with a short fizzy head. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Bourbon County Brand Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1227765650, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 24, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 14.5, 'beer/beerId': '10672', 'user/birthdayUnix': 393750000, 'beer/brewerId': '1549', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 6, 'min': 0, 'sec': 50, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 332, 'wday': 3}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1024585447, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Pours out like motor oil. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Oatmeal Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Tr\xc3\xb6egs Oatmeal Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1170201540, 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '4094', 'beer/brewerId': '694', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 30, 'hour': 23, 'min': 59, 'sec': 0, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 30, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Thanks goes out to msubulldog25 for this one.\t\tPours a nice clear dark brown color, nice carbonation, nice small tan creamy head which leaves quickly, some lacing afterwards. {'review/appearance': 2.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Carolina Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1192913848, 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '3393', 'beer/brewerId': '1499', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 20, 'min': 57, 'sec': 28, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 293, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'A: What little head appeared was gone in less than a minute, leaving only the golden-amber liquid to speak for itself. \t\tS: Subdued hop aroma, some malty and grainy notes in the nose that remind me of a subtle English pale. \t\tT: Pale malt flavors come first, with the hops right on its heels, making for a marginally bitter middle and finish. Lots of grain throughout, with the hops taking on a kind of grassy character. This is especially noticed at the very end. \t\tM: Some hop oil texture, dry and bitter feel in the aftertaste that coats the palate all over. \t\tD: Enough flavor to be commendable, but as far as a great pale ale goes, this one doesn\'t quite cut it. Frankly, I think some of the styles many see as "basic" can be the hardest to perfect, and I\'m by no means deriding the brewery. I just feel that this one may need more work.', 'user/profileName': 'CharlieMopps', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Oatmeal Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'St-Ambroise Oatmeal Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1203461662, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 14, 1980', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '2704', 'user/birthdayUnix': 329814000, 'beer/brewerId': '194', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 22, 'min': 54, 'sec': 22, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 50, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1088521447, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': 'A- Pitch black color, non-transparent, half finger thick dark brown head that lowered to a thin cover\t\tS- Dark chocolate, creamy, sweet, oats, dark malts, hints of vanilla\t\tT- Roasted coffee beans, smokey, sweet chocolate, earthy, milky, caramel malts\t\tM- Medium/heavy body, medium carbonation, smooth, slight dry smokey fizz then turns to a faint oily finish\t\tD- Worth buying again (and again and again)\t\tThis is a nice full bodied oatmeal stout. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Sea Monster Imperial Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1324094044, 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '46188', 'beer/brewerId': '199', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 3, 'min': 54, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 351, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Pours a dense, opaque black body with a creamy, khaki colored head that is very slow to dissolve to a thin lacing.\t\tRobust aromas of roasted malt and chocolate float from the glass with dark fruits appearing as it warms. Chocolate aromas permeate at the close. \t\tThe flavor is quite good featuring a nice blend of roasted malt, milky chocolate and hints of dark fruit such as cherry or plum. As it warms the roasted aspects become more dominant. \t\tMedium carbonation with a full body and roasted finish.\t\tNice imperial stout, on the roasted side but lacking some of the hop traits I would expect in the American Double stout version.', 'user/profileName': 'CHADMC3', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Braggot', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Honey Moon', 'review/timeUnix': 1060013206, 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '3045', 'beer/brewerId': '683', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 16, 'min': 6, 'sec': 46, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 216, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Lightly greenish yellow clear appearance with some upwelling bubbles. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Double Bastard Ale Double Dry Hopped', 'review/timeUnix': 1267636259, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/beerId': '56544', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 17, 'min': 10, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 62, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Consumed Feb. 7th, 2010 at Stone World Bistro.\t\tFairly clear medium coppery hue with ruby highlights. Fine, nitro-esque tan head provides good lacing.\t\tAroma is comparable to a fresh Stone barleywine, meaning lots of wet herbal hop character and a smallish trace of bready, caramel malt.\t\tMalt flavors of bread and caramel again remind me of an Old Guardian, that is until the hops hit. They have no doubt faded a great deal, but there is still an earthy hop character, grassy and citric. Oh, and lots and lots of bitterness. \t\tMouthfeel is quite dry, bordering on parching. This is actually a good thing, considering the big flavors this beer packs.\t\tA sipper, to be sure, but this is so similar to a barleywine (to my palate, at least) that it makes me wonder where Stone is going with this one.', 'user/profileName': 'charlzm', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'English Barleywine', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Young's Old Nick Barley Wine Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1046548055, 'beer/ABV': 7.2, 'beer/beerId': '1441', 'beer/brewerId': '152', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 19, 'min': 47, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 60, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'Ah, a classic Barley-Wine. Even though there are certainly better, this was my first exposure to the world of Barley-Wines, so it has some sentimental value. Clear, ruby-amber in color with a dark beige head and a whipped-egg consistency after a vigorous pour. Head thins some-what but never disappears, perched atop medium-sized bubbles and medium-light carbonation. Lacing is sparse. Aroma is of a fruity fermentation, metals, sweet amber malts, butterscotch, and some phenolic alcohols. Mouthfeel is not as smooth as I prefer, and cloying with a firm, sticky body. Taste begins with initially harsh fermentation by-products, fades into a subtle metallic note, some tolerable alcohols, then gives way to the main attraction...lots of sticky malts with caramelized sugars, raisin and date characters, and ending in a smooth, well-balanced lingering sweetness. A good example of the style but not my favorite. The metals and harsh initial mouthfeel detract from the enjoyment. As the beer warms, the alcohols and mouthfeel simmer, and the malt livens up, making for a much more enjoyable drink. I highly recommend to pour it first, then let it warm up to 55F before drinking it.', 'user/profileName': 'Mitchster', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Bock', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Shiner Bock', 'review/timeUnix': 1073362121, 'beer/ABV': 4.4, 'beer/beerId': '1352', 'beer/brewerId': '143', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 6, 'hour': 4, 'min': 8, 'sec': 41, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 6, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "I've been hearing lots of good things about this beer, and it just came into town on the start of the new year. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Green Lakes Organic Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1206571789, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Nov 20, 1955', 'beer/ABV': 5.2, 'beer/beerId': '40291', 'user/birthdayUnix': -445449600, 'beer/brewerId': '63', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 22, 'min': 49, 'sec': 49, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 86, 'wday': 2}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1863785047, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'I was served this beer from the tap at the March 21, 2008 session of the Spring Beer Festival in Portland, Oregon.\t\tA: It poured a dirty yellow colored body with a robust two finger off white head that had decent retention and supported a balanced lacing. \t\tS: It had aromas of sweet lightly toasted malts, with hints of caramel and the smoll\t\tT: It began with sweet caramel malt flavors and creamy yeasty flavors. That was followed by minor citrusy flavors including lemons and oranges. It hid the alcohol well and was a bit thin on many flavors.\t\tM: It was a light bodied beer with modest carbonation and a sweet clean finish.\t\tD: Nice ale but does not stand out as an outstanding beer. Good session brew....but only one in a crowd.', 'user/profileName': 'dnichols', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Double Barrel Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1147308777, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '5653', 'beer/brewerId': '2210', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 0, 'min': 52, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 5, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 131, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'The first of many beers received from beerrun13 in a huge trade. {'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'P\xc3\xa9ch\xc3\xa9 Mortel (Imperial Stout Au Cafe)', 'review/timeUnix': 1264042485, 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '10325', 'beer/brewerId': '1141', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 2, 'min': 54, 'sec': 45, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 21, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "I picked this beer up on a whim as I was in the mood for a good coffee stout and the siren-like figure somehow told me this is the beer for you. A bit freaky, but I went with it. Wow. I was impressed from the very first pour. Like any stout, the color is a dark molasses black. But...the head was thick and dense with good retention. The coffee aroma was intense! The roasted goodness almost overwhelms my sense of smell. The roasted coffee flavors are the first things that I could taste along with hints of chocolate. However, I can tell there's more complexity here than my palette can decipher. The coffee flavors bring bitterness but it's not over powering as the sweetness of the malt cuts the bitterness quite nicely. \tThe beer has carbonation but once the bubbles have escaped the beer gives a creamy, velvety feel and finish.\tThe alcohol was very well hidden in this beer which is scary. This is an amazing coffee stout. It is a very drinkable beer as it does not leave your mouth feeling bitter and dry; it only leaves it wanting more.", 'user/profileName': 'BeerInReview', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Cohoho Imperial IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1254187031, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '3500', 'beer/brewerId': '385', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 1, 'min': 17, 'sec': 11, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 272, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Thanks grumpy for this extra. Bottled in Jan 09 and consumed 8 months past (too long I know, but this is probably the only time I'll ever try this beer). Pours very dark for the style with a 2 finger head. Smell is biscuity malts with caramel, dark fruits, orange, grass, belgian esters. Taste is more of a barleywine at this point than a DIPA, but I'm really digging it. It's not quite balanced considering how huge the malt backbone is compared to the subdued hops, but the flavor is excellent with pronounced caramel, melon, and orange. I would have loved to try this fresh, as it's a very good beer with some obvious age on it.", 'user/profileName': 'bmanning', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Celis Grand Cru', 'review/timeUnix': 1135304024, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '9584', 'beer/brewerId': '565', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 2, 'min': 13, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 357, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': 'This is a very clear golden colored ale with a one inch white head.\tIts aroma is mostly of yeast with a little spice and wheat.\tThe flavor does not match the aroma at all; this is much better than I expected judging by the smell. The Belgian yeast is apparent and there are slight tones of alcohol and dark fruit.\tMouth feel is light bodied and highly carbonated.\t\tNot too shabby.', 'user/profileName': 'Naes', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Tripel Karmeliet', 'review/timeUnix': 1068271894, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.4, 'beer/beerId': '656', 'beer/brewerId': '202', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 6, 'min': 11, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 312, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Poured with a wonderful fluffy white chiffon like head. \tSeemed as if whipped to a light dense sculptured form that hovered over the beers surface.\tBy the time I held my glass on high to gaze at the wondrous libation, that foamy fluffy froth active in the glass clung with a certain tenacity gracing the walls with a web, of lace and bubbles ..\t\tThe room light reflected with rays of clear golden yellow-straw color, all the while bubbles materialized and darted to the surface with abandon.\t\tI was greeted by a yeasty, sweet nose- undertones of lemon and assorted hints of sweet natural fruity citrus tunneled through the head all the while spreading notes of malted grains. A background of alcohol kept the doors of beer perception cleansed....\t\tThe flavor begins with a slightly sweet manner. After making its debut and receding into a bitter hint of a melodious compound of hops and malt-- I cant taste the oats, or the wheat or the barley, but their combination builds a wonderful flavor like a suspense novel that prods the reader to turning the pages.-In this case the beers flavor prods me to taking sip after sip after... \t\tThe finish lingers with a boisterous note of citrus once again- the flavor and character of the beer stayed put upon my palate \t\tWhen enjoying Karmeliet Tripel, I keep trying to draw the last molecules of this beer from my empty laced glass.\t\tYUMMY!', 'user/profileName': 'gueuzeonhigh', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1322022721, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.2, 'beer/beerId': '10433', 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 4, 'min': 32, 'sec': 1, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 327, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Appearance: Very deep brown (about a 37 SRM), finger and a half tan head, good lacing, \t\tSmell: Big coffee, cream, very dark chocolate, slight woody, slight dark fruit.\t\tTaste: Clean coffee, cream, chocolate, woody, earthy, coffee bitterness. I like simple and perfectly done, this is kind below that point. It's good, but theres better. {'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': '2XIPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1315512218, 'beer/ABV': 8.2, 'beer/beerId': '57908', 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 20, 'min': 3, 'sec': 38, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 251, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A- Pours a staw/gold macro color, nice foamy white head with decent lacing as slowly fades. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Imperial Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1102288640, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Feb 19, 1973', 'beer/ABV': 11.0, 'beer/beerId': '356', 'user/birthdayUnix': 98956800, 'beer/brewerId': '132', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 23, 'min': 17, 'sec': 20, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 340, 'wday': 6}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1319378647, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Had this in a small sniffer, which I found was absolutely perfect for the style... Aroma was roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, rather earthy like most Rogues I have tried. Taste was a dry bitterness, coffee, dark chocolate, ridiculously long finish, fantastic. {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Herbed / Spiced Beer', 'review/palate': 2.0, 'review/taste': 1.0, 'beer/name': 'Midas Touch Golden Elixir', 'review/timeUnix': 1307152505, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '1587', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 1, 'min': 55, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 155, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 2.0, 'review/text': "I love Dogfish beers, but I can't say I feel this one at all. In fact, out of all the DFH beers I've had, this one stands out as my least favorite. \t\tIt pours a pretty pale amber color and it smells really good. It's a very unique smell - lots of spice and a whole lot going on. However, this definitely does not translate to great taste. I thought this beer tastes like it has WAY too much going on. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier Naturtr\xc3\xbcb', 'review/timeUnix': 1169272857, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Aug 1, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '1256', 'user/birthdayUnix': 397033200, 'beer/brewerId': '124', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 6, 'min': 0, 'sec': 57, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 20, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1021302247, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Pours a hazy orange/yellow with a creamy white head, amazing retention and lacing.
