{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Wild Goose Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1153664500, 'beer/beerId': '1245', 'beer/brewerId': '69', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 14, 'min': 21, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 204, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "A bit of a disapointment in that this Porter tastes very similarly to their Brown Ale that I had earlier. The roasted malt character is greater in the Porter, but other than that, it's the same beer -- taste-wise. The beer is a bit thin and watery, thus lacks creaminess, boldness, and never becomes characterful. This was acceptable with the lighter Brown Ale, but I expect more from Porters. It looks like a brown-er cola with light carbonation and lacking head retention. Smells caramel malty and mildly roasty. Modesty chocolate / coffee notes pepper the beer slightly, but not enough to make a meaningful impact. Thin and weak in the body with a mild yeastiness. Finishes slight of grainy, but fairly clean.", 'user/profileName': 'BEERchitect', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Barleywine', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Old Boardhead Barleywine Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1217116900, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '21364', 'beer/brewerId': '5316', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 27, 'hour': 0, 'min': 1, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 209, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'I got this brew in a trade with Wasatch, Thanks John!\t\t22oz bottle served in a goblet.\t\tL - clear, red/orange color with a beige head that thinned after time.\t\tS - sweet caramel malt aroma.\t\tT - sweet toffee/caramel upfront with dark fruit bitterness coming through near the finish.\t\tF - medium bodied with mild carbonation.\t\tD - a decent sipper.', 'user/profileName': 'JoeyBeerBelly', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Indian Brown Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1105407884, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.2, 'beer/beerId': '1161', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 1, 'min': 44, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 11, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'This beer pours a dark brown, almost black, w/ light slightly permeating through to show an almost bronze color. One finger of cream white head and nice, sustaining lace.\tI can smell a blend of coffee and vanilla...smells sweet.\tThe taste is a rush of flavor w/ hops up front. This beer is not bitter at all and is extremely refreshing. I would prefer a bit less carbonation...would love to try this one on tap.\tI can taste roasted malts, coffee, caramel and fig with a slight alcohol taste.\tThe mouthfeel is real nice. Smooth, yet the flavors linger on the tastebuds. \tThis is one fairly complex brown ale...mild enough to please the masses, yet offering more to those who expect it...thanks Dogfish!', 'user/profileName': 'warriorsoul', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Barleywine', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'XS Old Crustacean', 'review/timeUnix': 1287851403, 'beer/ABV': 11.5, 'beer/beerId': '2965', 'beer/brewerId': '132', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 16, 'min': 30, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 296, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'A ceramic 750mL bottle of the 2008 vintage that was shared at an impromptu tasting. Poured into a tulip glass.\t\tThe pour is syrupy and thick. I can tell that this is going to be thick just from watching it pour. The body is garnet amber accentuated by ruby highlights in the light. There is ample head, and it leaves spotty lacing. Swirls produce wine-like legs that creep back into the beer.\t\tThe aroma is dominated by boozy warmth, caramel, nutty malts, and a hint of vanilla. The taste is similar, but more complex. Caramel, toffee, and some nuttiness is joined by piney hops. Cherry notes also make a quick appearance before they give way to vanilla in the finish.\t\tThick, sticky, and syrupy, this has a lot of potential, but I would hold onto another one for a couple more years before opening it, to give it more time to mellow.', 'user/profileName': 'NittanyBeerFan', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Bi\xc3\xa8re de Champagne / Bi\xc3\xa8re Brut', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'IPA V.S. Brut', 'review/timeUnix': 1197231197, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.5, 'beer/beerId': '28261', 'beer/brewerId': '2015', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 20, 'min': 13, 'sec': 17, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 343, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "A 750 mL corked and caged bottle with foil around the mouth. I bought this at Liquid Solutions over a year ago, so I am hoping that the hops have held up.\t\tA: The ale opened with a slight pop. A pour into my mug yielded a 2 finger swatch of foamy head that has clung precariously to the sides. The ale is a darker amber color, showing off hints of copper red. Haziness throughout the glass dulls the color a bit.\t\tS: The nose has a thick vinous aroma punctuated with some oily hops and an alcohol aroma that doesn't hide its strength.\t\tT: It seems that my fears have been realized. The hops have settled down significantly, casting a muted flavor in the mouth. The barrel aging has imparted a sweeter flavor to the IPA, adding some vanilla bean flavors and a sweet white grape flavor. Graininess overtakes the last half of the sip and, in conjunction with the chardonnay profile, creates a sweet mouthfeel that could pass for a Belgian IPA.\t\tM: The mouthfeel starts off promising, hits some Belgian IPA notes midway through but never really hits the hoppy notes that I was hoping to see. Interesting but not extraordinary.\t\tD: The abv is high but there is a large flavor profile that keeps the tastebuds interested. Worth a look for its uniqueness.", 'user/profileName': 'akorsak', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Harvest Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1318803086, 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '13637', 'beer/brewerId': '3818', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 22, 'min': 11, 'sec': 26, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 289, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Inviting copper color with a sticky, if thin, head. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Hacker-Pschorr Hefe Weisse Nat\xc3\xbcrtrub', 'review/timeUnix': 1076211591, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '772', 'beer/brewerId': '76', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 3, 'min': 39, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 39, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Pours a very cloudy yellow, you can pass light through it easily but you can't see through it.\t\tVery strongly smelling beer, smells of spices and a bit of banana.\t\tTastes mildly sweet and a bit tart. Prominent banana and spice taste. Many different levels of taste to this, has some malt and vanilla flavors too. Hops shows up for the party too. This is one of the quality beers with many complex flavors and every sip is different. It is closer to a 4.75 in taste.\t\tMouthfeel is very good.\t\tVery drinkable.", 'user/profileName': 'Zorro', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Brooklyn Fortitude', 'review/timeUnix': 1143387594, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.1, 'beer/beerId': '28328', 'beer/brewerId': '45', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 15, 'min': 39, 'sec': 54, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 85, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "On tap at the Sunset.\tPresented hazy, light gold, with a merange, white head.\tExceptional retention, ring-like lacing all the way to the bottom.\tAromatics are lively, zesty, and enticing.\tPhenols with spice and fruit.\tCoriander, orange peel, cardamon, and some slight cracked pepper accent the triple- type nose.\tSome slight tartness is in the background, a shadow behind the bubblegum and spice.\tNose finishes with warming zest and vanilla.\tLightish body, crisp and snappy, with creamy carbonation.\tPallet starts off with some wheat tartness and husky zest.\tAs the brew warms, it shows itself to closely resemble a double white, with triple-like character.\tWell integrated citrus, clove, and lemon zest, work well with a bannana accent.\tFinishes warming, crisp, and soft.\tExtremely well balanced and drinkable, possibly the best Brooklyn offering I've tried.", 'user/profileName': 'brewandbbq', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'American Black Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Juniper Black Ale (JBA) - Beer Camp #16', 'review/timeUnix': 1310136051, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '55397', 'beer/brewerId': '140', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 14, 'min': 40, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 189, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Sierra Nevada Juniper Black Ale is an opaque, pitch black ale with a huge, fluffy, lumpy, light brown head that has incredible longevity and leaves clumps of foam on the glass. The aroma is grassy and hoppy. It seems a little muted by the head, but it's still strong. There is a note of resiny sweetness. It's medium bodied and quite smooth. The finish is dry and leaves the tongue a little dusty. It tastes a little bit sweet and quite bitter. The juniper is really prominent and it's backed by resiny pine and ashy roast. This has a lot of flavor. This setting works really well for the juniper. The aftertaste is drier and has more dark roast. This is a bold beer in many ways. It looks, smells and tastes like a beer lover's beer. Outstanding brew!", 'user/profileName': 'yesyouam', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 2.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'ZIPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1040492436, 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 14, 1970', 'beer/beerId': '3594', 'user/birthdayUnix': 24735600, 'beer/brewerId': '228', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 17, 'min': 40, 'sec': 36, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2002, 'yday': 355, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1393599847, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': "Multiple attempts at a hard pour all fail to yield anything but a slight and still incomplete head on this rust-amber colored beer. I even tried, unsuccessfully, to produce a head by swirling the beer around and then pouring it from a first glass to a second one. No noticeable lacing. Initially the nose is mildly floral, with hints of lemon zest and bubblegum, but it becomes a bit sour as the beer warms. The taste of this brew was disappointing. An initial hoppy bitterness is familiar and appropriate for an IPA, but the dry finish is too sharp and astringent, with some lingering smokey and ash-like earthy notes that seem harsh and out of place. \t\tNote: Although it's possible that I've simply gotten ahold of a bad batch, I should note that this six-pack was purchased from the refridgerated section of a large and respectable store, in a well-populated area within an hour's drive from the brewery.", 'user/profileName': 'jward', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'Light Lager', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Gryphonbrau Light', 'review/timeUnix': 1166344877, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/beerId': '34346', 'beer/brewerId': '10266', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 8, 'min': 41, 'sec': 17, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 351, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "On-tap... a couple of (generous) samplers.\t\tIt now seems as if this is to be the replacement of the Downtown Honey Brown beer at Olde Main (since late spring 2006). Clear and light-straw in appearance, yet not entirely devoid of color. Smells like... not much -- maybe a hint of malts, hops, and/or grasses -- but at least it's not obnoxious. Taste-wise, it's something like a watered down Czech Pilsner. Light-bodied and relatively smooth. About as drinkable as water. Brewed with care... but not for discriminating customers.\t\tAccording to bar personnel, this is Olde Main's in-house alternative to Miller Lite, etc. Granted, it's much better than such swill, but that doesn't mean it's any good. Basically if you're reading beeradvocate.com, you'll have no interest in having a pint of this.", 'user/profileName': 'mithrascruor', 'review/aroma': 2.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Damnation', 'review/timeUnix': 1164257557, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.75, 'beer/beerId': '12770', 'beer/brewerId': '863', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 4, 'min': 52, 'sec': 37, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 327, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "I actually avoided this for a long time, because the label looks like album art from a bad 80's metal band. Once poured, it's beautiful. Golden color with a cascade of carbonation, and a thick pillowy head.\t\tThe smell is great, with a rich spiciness and some cedar and a trace of hops. The taste is also nicet, with a banana flavor stepping forward as it warms. Unfortunately, the taste score was affected by the fact the hops are too prevalent, especially for the style. A little more time in the bottle wouldn't hurt, but it's a fine tasting beer with a pleasant but unremarkable mouthfeel. Drinkable, certainly, but won't find it's way onto my desert island list.", 'user/profileName': 'jeffjfindley', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Bitter', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Brakspear Bitter', 'review/timeUnix': 1181334003, 'beer/ABV': 3.4, 'beer/beerId': '4064', 'beer/brewerId': '806', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 8, 'hour': 20, 'min': 20, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 159, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'A: Dark amber with an offwhite head.\tS: Phenols, red berries, malt, fudge, sweetness.\tT: Bitterness, malt, hops, metallic tone. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Brown Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': "Pete's Wicked Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1206487786, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '1397', 'beer/brewerId': '126', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 23, 'min': 29, 'sec': 46, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 85, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "I bought a single bottle of this at Capone's Restaurant in Norristown, Pa and poured it into a pint glass.\tAppearance: It poured a deep ruby colored body, almost brown, with a light tan head on top. The head was really tight and had great retention, but didn't leave much lace.\tSmell: The aroma was mostly malty, caramel, with a noticeable backbone of spicy hops.\tTaste: A bit watery but all and all dominated by the spicy hops.\tMouthfeel: Nice and crisp.\tDrinkability: Good, but not great.\tDon't drink and review.", 'user/profileName': 'treehugger02010', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Green Flash Le Freak', 'review/timeUnix': 1313562803, 'beer/ABV': 9.2, 'beer/beerId': '36727', 'beer/brewerId': '2743', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 6, 'min': 33, 'sec': 23, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 229, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "reviewed from notes\tpoured from a 22oz bomber, into highball glass...(sigh) should've brought my own glassware on vacation.\tpours a crystal clear yellow. big, fluffy head, recedes to a persistent layer of fuzz on top. smell is certainly a blend of the styles, but surprisingly to me, the belgian yeast overpowered the hop elements.\ttaste - i had initially hoped for 75% IPA, 25% belgian, i got the reverse and was still quite pleased. front end is very tripel-esque, but the back-end hops continue to creep in and keep the palate off balance. \toverall, nice mash-up, very glad i got to try it.", 'user/profileName': 'robbrandes', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Bi\xc3\xa8re de Garde', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Jenlain Blonde', 'review/timeUnix': 1080122104, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '6919', 'beer/brewerId': '309', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 9, 'min': 55, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 84, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': 'Presentation: Comes in a green, 50 cl can with the Jenlain logo, a description of the beer in a number of languages, and large text describing "pur malt." Poured into a pint glass.\t\tAppearance: Pours a solid, blonde/gold, a little bit more copper-colored than a typical American macro lager. Decent head with weak retention, but as the head disappears it leaves behind a good amount of lacing.\t\tSmell: Bready aroma with a slight hint of malt. Unfortunate vegetable smells, especially a strong corn presence.\t\tTaste: Cloyingly sweet nose with overpowering vegetable taste. A hint of hop bitterness follows but fails to salvage the beer. No real finish, and a horrible lingering aftertaste of sweet vegetable flavors. As the beer warms, a little bit more bitterness helps balance the sweetness, but again, it\'s not enough.\t\tMouthfeel: Slightly below average, very thin.\t\tDrinkability: I\'m glad I picked up a can of this instead of going for the 65 cl bottle. Far too sweet to handle in large, or even small quantities.\t\tA huge disappointment from Brasserie Duyck after the excellent Jenlain Bire de Garde. I\'m still interested in trying their bire du printemps, but I\'ll steer clear of the Blonde in the future.', 'user/profileName': 'jed', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Chile Beer', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Chipotle Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1118878916, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '354', 'beer/brewerId': '132', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 15, 'hour': 23, 'min': 41, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 166, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '1 PT. 6 FL. OZ.\t650 ML.\t\tHarrington, Klages & Maier Munich Malts; Cascade & Willamette hops; Chipotle Peppers; Free Range Coastal Waters; Top Fermenting Pacman Yeast\t\t13 PLATO 34 IBU\t77 AA 3.2 L\t\tSilver @ World Beer Championships\t\tAppearance  light cream colored, micronized, 1.5-inch thick (at pour) head; moderately opaque, light amber body; lace is reasonable\t\tSmell  not exciting on the nose; every note seems to be muted; spice initially then the chipotle weaves and blends with the spice\t\tTaste  again not a big sensory experience here but Id rather err on the side of mellow than overpowering when it comes to peppers based on my conservative taste in the category; a bit smokey and a bit chipotle; malty; pleasant light touch of chipotle and smoke remain in the aftertaste with chipotle and a bit of raw green vegetable winning out for the long haul \t\tMouthfeel  light/medium-bodied; a bit creamy to open then the desert dryness slams the door at the back of the tongue with the slightest dose of heat entering at the back of the throat in the aftertaste; a 4 would fit the category well if it wasnt for the parch\t\tDrinkability  easy drinking if the close wasnt like the dunes of the Sahara \t\tFirst, let me state that Im not a hot pepper fan but the chipotles light involvement is just about right for my taste. I cant say that Ill return to this category of beers based on my general respect for my taste buds but it certainly was worth a look.', 'user/profileName': 'Wonka', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'ApriHop', 'review/timeUnix': 1300234785, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '3951', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 0, 'min': 19, 'sec': 45, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 75, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Fresh 12oz bottle of the 2011 vintage poured into a DFH Pint Glass.\t\tA - Pours a clear, dark copper with a huge creamy head of slightly off-white foam that hangs around for some time, leaving soapy lacing as it eventually dissipates.\tS - Sweet caramel malt and fresh, pungent hops with just the slightest whiff of apricots. You can tell this is a fresh bottle, the hop aromas are unbelievable!\tT - Very similar to the nose, fairly typical DFH IPA flavors of pungent hops and sweet caramel malt, but with a nice amount of apricot flavoring that really comes out in the finish. Let's be honest, this is more or less 60 Minute with some apricots added, but it's a darn tasty Spring brew.\tM - Slightly creamy, with a medium mouthfeel and moderate carbonation.\tD - Like I said, this is a great Spring-day beer, and I can see myself having many before it disappears from the shelves.", 'user/profileName': 'jsanford', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Munich Dunkel Lager', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': "Beck's Dark", 'review/timeUnix': 1078196396, 'beer/ABV': 4.8, 'beer/beerId': '1165', 'beer/brewerId': '32', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 2, 'hour': 2, 'min': 59, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 62, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Pours a clear dark brown brew.\t\tSmell is malty with a fruity smell, also has a grassy grainy scent.\t\tTaste is malty and a bit buttery and bitter. {'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'German Pilsener', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': '60 Winks', 'review/timeUnix': 1170600419, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.8, 'beer/beerId': '34967', 'beer/brewerId': '96', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 14, 'min': 46, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 35, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Plain gold in color with little head.\t\tSmells like someone dropped a piece of birthday cake frosting in some Stroh\'s.\t\tTaste is a bit bland. To confuse matters more, the bottle\'s label claims this is an ale. Mouthfeel is light, and all I really get here is a brew slightly better than the average macrolager.\t\t"Grave", since they ask.', 'user/profileName': 'shirfan', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Herbed / Spiced Beer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Poor Richard's Tavern Spruce Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1137979922, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '26892', 'beer/brewerId': '450', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 1, 'min': 32, 'sec': 2, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 23, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'On tap at the Grey Lodge. {'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'American Blonde Ale', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': "McNeill's Big Nose Blond (aka Blond Bombshell)", 'review/timeUnix': 1285801345, 'beer/ABV': 5.2, 'beer/beerId': '12911', 'beer/brewerId': '100', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 23, 'min': 2, 'sec': 25, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 272, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': "I at first thought I had a bad bottle, but I have tried a couple of others to be sure and I think this is just the way the beer is.\t\tAnd it's not good.\t\tPours a slightly hazy straw with a torrent of carbonation that leaves a fizzy, weird head. \t\tThe aroma is thin and sour, yeasty and lemony - way lemony.\t\tThe flavor is super sour, like a fresh lemonade, which is great in lemonade but no so great in a beer. The flavor is cidery, leomony and sour and not pleasant. There is no hop bitterness on the finish.\t\tJust not a good thing.", 'user/profileName': 'Seanibus', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Allagash Hugh Malone', 'review/timeUnix': 1184989390, 'beer/ABV': 8.5, 'beer/beerId': '36527', 'beer/brewerId': '4', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 3, 'min': 43, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 202, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Hazy amber/orange with beige foam composed of medium sized bubbles. Very good head retention and lots of longlasting, clumpy lacing. Nice aroma, particularly as it warmed - hoppy, malty, and spicy. Some earthiness, citrusy grapefruit skin, pine, grassy with a doughy, yeasty sweetness and a bit of pineapple. Solid, drying bitterness, some tannins, fruity apple with muted hop notes (pine and citrus). Some caramel sweetness. Quick finish with some lingering bitterness. Medium/full bodied with above average carbonation, very creamy texture and mild warmth. A very pleasant beer with well hidden alcohol and a unique mix of flavours. Good stuff!', 'user/profileName': 'DrJay', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Chimay Tripel (White)', 'review/timeUnix': 1044812800, 'beer/ABV': 8.0, 'beer/beerId': '1346', 'beer/brewerId': '215', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 17, 'min': 46, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 40, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Hazy dark brownish-orange pour with fine bubbles cutting through considerable yeast sediment. Topped with a monstrous bubbly head that lasts several minutes with good lacing. Clean, mildly fruity smell understates the amazing taste of this beer. Clean, crisp mouthfeel and strong drinkability, though this one is to be deconstructed and savored slowly.', 'user/profileName': 'BitteBier', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Quadrupel (Quad)', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Three Philosophers Belgian Style Blend (Quadrupel)', 'review/timeUnix': 1171694219, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Apr 8, 1980', 'beer/ABV': 9.8, 'beer/beerId': '3457', 'user/birthdayUnix': 324028800, 'beer/brewerId': '42', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 6, 'min': 36, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 48, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1094306647, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "Poured into a goblet a rich dark amber almost brown with ruby highlights when held up to the light. There was a beautiful two-finger head that was slow diminish and left great lacing on the glass. The aroma was very strong of cherries and carbon-dioxide, almost like Cheerwine! Taste was absolutely wonderful. The vibrant cherry flavor was accented with a complex malt flavor and very subtle hops that were almost unnoticeable, but they did their job. This beer was vibrantly carbonated, once again, almost feels like Cheerwine in the mouth. It is very hard to tell that this is 9.8% alcohol. I'd have to say, this is almost certainly my favorite beer made with fruit. Very enjoyable any time of year.", 'user/profileName': 'atsprings', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Oatmeal Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Caywood Station Oatmeal Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1187571296, 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '4939', 'beer/brewerId': '611', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 0, 'min': 54, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 232, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': '12 oz. bottle poured into a nonic.\t\tPours a complete midnight black with a nice tan two finger head that quickly dies down to a thin layer. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': '120 Minute IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1203405836, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jan 30, 1987', 'beer/ABV': 18.0, 'beer/beerId': '9086', 'user/birthdayUnix': 538992000, 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 7, 'min': 23, 'sec': 56, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 50, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 879343447, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Pours a decent head (about a finger and a half) considering the alcohol percentage. Body is fairly opaque and is orange to amber. Smells lightly of hops, plus some alcohol and malt. Flavor starts off really sweet, then finishes with hoppy notes and a bit of a wine-like quality. Definitely not as hoppy as I was expecting, but that's OK here; the flavors work together pretty well. It seems really smooth, especially given the amount of alcohol in it (there's definitely a nice warming note). Overall, it's not something I'd be likely to get again soon, especially given the price, but it's still decently tasty (though it verges on being too sweet at times).", 'user/profileName': 'essie', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Rare Vos (Amber Ale)', 'review/timeUnix': 1098382294, 'beer/ABV': 6.5, 'beer/beerId': '593', 'beer/brewerId': '42', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 18, 'min': 11, 'sec': 34, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 295, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Lightly murky butterscotch. The massive head is ecru in color with a yellowish tint and looks to have the consistency of an excellent lace maker. Fooled again; an underwhelming number of smallish chunks end up on the glass while a stiff mesa of foam sits defiantly in the center of the glass, refusing to fall lower than a few fingers.\t\tClove is the first aroma that I notice, but there are others present as well, including fermented apples and pears with an underlying mustiness, hay and a hint of white pepper. The beer has a pleasant flavor with a mild sourness and a clove-like yeastiness that marks it as a Belgian. Or in this case, a Belgian-style ale. \t\tThe spicy fruitiness lasts the longest, but isn't as supported as it could be due to the light body. For that reason, Rare Vos is more subtle than many of its style brethren. It fades from modestly sweet early to modestly dry late and leaves the palate clean. The light, airy, well-carbonated mouthfeel makes drinking easy and burping frequent.\t\tI like Rare Vos marginally more than I liked 'Ommegang squared', but it isn't great beer in my mind. It isn't overly complex and the flavor profile doesn't push my buttons all that hard. I'm still glad that I gave it a try.", 'user/profileName': 'BuckeyeNation', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Barleywine', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Bourbon O.E. Barrel Aged Barleywine', 'review/timeUnix': 1281746844, 'beer/beerId': '60926', 'beer/brewerId': '4555', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 14, 'hour': 0, 'min': 47, 'sec': 24, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 226, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "On-tap at Tustin\t\tA: The pour is a dark amber color, bordering on mahogany with a finger's worth of slightly off-white head.\t\tS: Wow, the nose on this beer is phenomenal. Tons of vanilla, bourbon, maple syrup, brown sugar, caramel, and toffee provide a wonderful sweetness. Some miscellaneous dark fruit notes and chocolate fill in the background of the aroma.\t\tT: The flavor is similarly impressive. Lots of sweet, rich vanilla, bourbon, and oak accompanied by toffee, caramel, brown sugar, and maple syrup. The finish is all that prevents this from a perfect score as there is a bit of alcohol and heat, but there are some nice hints of chocolate.\t\tM: The mouthfeel is smooth, creamy, rich, and full bodied. A light but nearly perfect level of carbonation.\t\tD: I was told this beer was good, but I had to see for myself. This is one of, if not the, best barrel aged barleywines I've come across. I might go back again soon to have some more.", 'user/profileName': 'womencantsail', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Russian Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Nils Oscar Imperial Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1258007066, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.0, 'beer/beerId': '3016', 'beer/brewerId': '894', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 6, 'min': 24, 'sec': 26, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 316, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'From notes. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Tr\xc3\xb6egs Hopback Amber Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1318534100, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '6322', 'beer/brewerId': '694', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 19, 'min': 28, 'sec': 20, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 286, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'My first brew from Tregs sent as an extra from mdfb79, thanks Dan.\tPours a nice dark honey orange with a nice frothy off-white head.\tThe nose is nice and hoppy, floral and citrus notes are pretty prevalent. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Doppelbock', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Samichlaus Bier', 'review/timeUnix': 1324922740, 'beer/ABV': 14.0, 'beer/beerId': '776', 'beer/brewerId': '285', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 26, 'hour': 18, 'min': 5, 'sec': 40, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 360, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "I know I committed a faux pas, but poured this from a 11.2 oz bottle into a pint glass; however, I don't think it overly affected my impression of it. Anyway, the beer poured a light caramel color and had NO head and virtually no lacing. It looked kind of thin too.\t\tThe smell was amazing- dark fruit, caramel, malty but a bit boozy too. Of course with 14% alcohol you probably should expect that.\t\tThe beer was crazy sweet with caramel and figs coming through to me. Despite it appearing to be thin the beer had a nice thick coating mouthfeel and a bit of carbonation, so it wasn't totally like drinking syrup.\t\tI don't think I could do more than one of these in a sitting, but definitely worth a try if you're into big sweet, malty, beers!", 'user/profileName': 'BuzzLitebier', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'AleSmith Wee Heavy', 'review/timeUnix': 1198522682, 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '16400', 'beer/brewerId': '396', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 24, 'hour': 18, 'min': 58, 'sec': 2, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 358, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'bought this from south bay drugs and liquor. served cold, probably too cold, which one should take into consideration while reading this...\t\ta. poured a murky, lake-mud brown, caramel edges when held to the light, slowly forming head with a short-lived but impressive cascade resulting in a finger of tan foam\t\tb. not too much here, serving temp might have something to do with it, the usual caramel and raisin of a wee heavy, sweet wine scent\t\tt. overwhelming chewy raisin flavor, if concentrate really hard, capped with a scotch ale smokiness \t\tmf. some nice chewy body that finishes closer to watery\t\td. it was difficult to finish this one, a little to sweet, probably my last one', 'user/profileName': 'lifebeer', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Stone IPA (India Pale Ale)', 'review/timeUnix': 1286315105, 'beer/ABV': 6.9, 'beer/beerId': '88', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 5, 'hour': 21, 'min': 45, 'sec': 5, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 278, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "BEER Review 100!\t\tA - Pours a light somewhat hazy gold color into my pint glass with about one finger of head moderate retention and very nice lacing.\t\tS - Strong aroma of hops, pine and grapefruit citrus notes as well as sweet malts.\t\tT - To me, this is a great tasting IPA. Sweet malts, followed by a very nice pine and citrus hop fusion that finishes with just the right amount of bitterness. \t\tM - Medium in body, crisp and refreshing.\t\tD - This drinks great as an IPA, and all you hopheads out there like myself remember this is an IPA, not a double or imperial, and for the category it's in it is an awesome beer!", 'user/profileName': 'StoneBrewFanatic', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Quadrupel (Quad)', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Southampton Abbot 12', 'review/timeUnix': 1186449941, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 16, 1961', 'beer/ABV': 10.5, 'beer/beerId': '4575', 'user/birthdayUnix': -259084800, 'beer/brewerId': '1628', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 1, 'min': 25, 'sec': 41, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 219, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1677420247, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Had this at Bocktown with WVbeergeek and Jasonm, came in a 750ml caged and corked the corked banged out of sight as soon as the cage was undone. Off white head hard to pour without a glass full of fluffy everlasting head. Left lot of thick webbing all over the inside of the glass,sticky looking.\t\tGreat aroma can't seem to keep it away from the nose. Sweet,dark,tart fruit notes,some sour cherry,earthy,spicy, with hints of currants,clove,allspice also nutty, with some Belgium yeast.\t\tLots of sweet booziness from the start,vinious,dark fruityness with plum notes. The fruittyness was remisent of dried fruit.Lots of spicyness lots of clove.Also nutty and earthy. Finished clean,spicy and very sugary. Syrupy,big full mouthfeel,smooth and very creamy with lots of juicyness.\t\tA beer to sip,but very enjoyable, wish I had the whole bottle to drink would be no problem. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Barleywine', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Smuttynose Barleywine Style Ale (Big Beer Series)', 'review/timeUnix': 1127153549, 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '181', 'beer/brewerId': '141', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 18, 'min': 12, 'sec': 29, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 262, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Sampled: 8.26.05\t\tPours a slightly hazy dark ruby tinted copper. Thick 1.5 inch eggnog head hangs out and fades gracefully.\t\tThe aroma is hardcore barley malts, sweet and rich with caramel. Hints of the alcohol level sneak in as well.\t\tThe taste is lower in the barley flavor than the nose indicates. A tanginess followed by a bitter and oily mouth coating of hops finishes of the flavors. Medium carbonation sits decently in your mouth. Hop oils hang out after each sip.\t\tThis is a slow goer, made to sip and savor. It wasnt my favorite Barleywine style ale I've had to date, but that doesn't make it bad by any means. And its definitely a good local offering. (to me in MA) Id like to see what some time would do with this. I think some sweet maltiness could really come through.", 'user/profileName': 'GolgiIPAratus', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Doppelbock', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Smoked Goosinator Doppelbock', 'review/timeUnix': 1220408479, 'beer/ABV': 7.7, 'beer/beerId': '37990', 'beer/brewerId': '418', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 2, 'min': 21, 'sec': 19, 'mon': 9, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 247, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': '750 ml. bottle, corked and caged. "2007 Bottle Conditioned". \t\tPours a slightly hazy dark chestnut body with copper highlights and an orange glint. The frothy tan head holds remarkably well and leaves craggy rings of lace with each sip. \t\tThe nose is clearly smoky, expressing beechwood, amidst a sweet, bready, toasty, and caramelish maltiness.\t\tIn the mouth it\'s medium-full and lightly creamy with a very fine-bubbled, natural, median carbonation that leaves it smooth and easy to drink.\t\tThe flavor is as the nose suggests, with a good amount of smokiness, but not soo much that it\'s overdone. It works well to complement the maltiness, and lends an overall depth to the beer that would otherwise not be possible as it enhances the complexity of the malt. Some floral and spicy hops make an appearance at the swallow, and it finishes dry. Surprisingly, the smokiness doesn\'t build on the palate in a negative way. It lingers, but very nicely.\t\tReally nicely done. Quite enticing in its balance and complexity. Certainly worth seeking out for fans of beechwood smoked malt - one of the best I\'ve had!!!', 'user/profileName': 'NeroFiddled', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Irish Dry Stout', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Old #38 Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1137475411, 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '408', 'beer/brewerId': '112', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 5, 'min': 23, 'sec': 31, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2006, 'yday': 17, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Anytime I see an offering from North Coast I haven't sampled its a no brainer to put it into the stable. This reminds me to make a point of planning a trip north for some great breweries soon. \t\tPour is easily manageable, Forms a big brown head that is meaty, chunky and clings to the glass, dries and forms crispies...damn nice, near perfect.\t\tLots of coffee, burnt aroma. Comes across with a nice woody burnt flavor that has a counterpunch of bitter hops. Bitterness is on the high end of the scale for a stout and it works well. charred taste lingers a bit and gives it a dry finish. Some chalkiness but nothing to hold back a fine brew. \t\tAnother winner from a fine brewery.", 'user/profileName': 'DogFood11', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Strong Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'John Henry 3 Lick Spiker Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1292545324, 'beer/ABV': 9.1, 'beer/beerId': '46984', 'beer/brewerId': '892', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 0, 'min': 22, 'sec': 4, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 351, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'A: Dark pour, pretty much black with a light brown head that looks pretty nice for being higher abv.\t\tS: Oak is very evident. Bourbon, Chocolate, molasses, vanilla and dark malts. Smells pretty good.\t\tT: Oaky, chocolatey and bourbon are the main flavors. A bit of roasted malt, vanilla and molasses too. A touch of hops can be found near the finish. Bourbon flavor shows itself more in the finish. A bit rough around the edges, but still good.\t\tM: Body is a bit light for being a big beer. A tad creamy. Lower carbonation\t\tD: Pretty good for being a barrel aged high abv ale. Not sure what the age is on this one, but it seems fairly fresh since the bourbon flavors are still very evident and a bit powerful.\t\tBy far, this is gotta be the best offering from Cold Spring Brewery.', 'user/profileName': 'herman77', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Stone IPA (India Pale Ale)', 'review/timeUnix': 1303014543, 'beer/ABV': 6.9, 'beer/beerId': '88', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 4, 'min': 29, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 107, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'A: pours a somewhat hazy golden orange hue with a little bit off white head which recedes to a small pool that sticks around for awhile\tS: A lot of citrus with this one, mostly some grapefruit, a hint of pine and just a dash of herbal spicyness. Lingering grapefruit aftertaste\tM: smooth mouthfeel with good carbonation. Not watery at all and not excessively thick. A bit drying initially after the swallow but quickly turns juicy.\tO: A top tier IPA from Stone Brewing Co. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Fruit / Vegetable Beer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams Cherry Wheat', 'review/timeUnix': 1215199061, 'beer/ABV': 5.3, 'beer/beerId': '108', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 19, 'min': 17, 'sec': 41, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 186, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured into my Sam Adams Perfect Pint glass.\t\t A Was a clear orange staw color with a 1 finger white head.\t S This smelled like a cherry pie coming out of the oven, with the strong tart cherry filling and wheat crust, no wonder my wife calls this a cherry pop tart.\t T&M The cherries blended very well with the wheat malt making it lightly tart yet very refreshing. The beer held it carbonation well which also gave this beer more of the souring effect you would want in a fruit beer that I never realized before.\t D This is a good summertime beer for those who enjoy fruit beers with a sourness to them, but don't want to spend the extra money on the richer Belgian fruit beers. I enjoyed it. After reading some of the other reviews, I really believe you have to drink this beer out of the Perfect Pint glass from Sam Adams to really appreciate this beer.", 'user/profileName': 'BRoss242', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'Irish Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Smithwick's", 'review/timeUnix': 1233261316, 'beer/ABV': 4.5, 'beer/beerId': '29602', 'beer/brewerId': '209', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 20, 'min': 35, 'sec': 16, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 29, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Appearance: It's not as red as some other red ale's, It's more of a dark amber.\t\tSmell: smells a little bitter, any hoppy.\t\tTaste: Initially have a nice sweet flavor, followed up with a mildly bitter aftertaste.\t\tFeel: Very smooth.\t\tDrinkability: It's a great session beer especially when out at a pub with friends.", 'user/profileName': 'BKZer0', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Witbier', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Samuel Adams White Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1112347286, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.2, 'beer/beerId': '8297', 'beer/brewerId': '35', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 9, 'min': 21, 'sec': 26, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 91, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'The first time I tried this beer out of the bottle i was suppised at it. The pour definatly doesnt look like a traditional white ale but that is where the discrepincy stops. The smell has the traditional spice to it. Corriander comes to the top, something familiar but yet not able to nail it down. It feels like an old friend. The mouth feel is just about right, effervecent as a wheat should be but not too over the top. And drinkable, you bet. Refreshing but not heavy as some wheats can be. It is almost a summer beer but at the same time would be nice on a cold winters nite by the fireside. \tNot that I would remember what that is like living in Hawail for the past 11 years.', 'user/profileName': 'scratchchance', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Hefeweizen', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Hefe Weizen', 'review/timeUnix': 1055144778, 'beer/beerId': '10264', 'beer/brewerId': '1178', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 7, 'min': 46, 'sec': 18, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 160, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "On tap at the brewpub (ackk, fish out the lemon slice)...\t\tCloudy, hazy pineapple color (not as thick as some), decent 1/4 inch pale white head of two primary bubble sizes. Sheet laces with some traction. Fresh grassy ester aromas, not too cloying or artificial. Lots of apple accompanies the expected banana flavors, fresh but there's a lack of the spiciness of some. Finishes slightly lemony with the requisite loads of aftertaste. As usual, the profile suffers from Great Water's tendency to serve its pushed beers too friggin' cold (surprising for a brewpub with four cask beers on tap year round) -- but this is a serviceable Hefe in most characteristics.", 'user/profileName': 'ADR', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': "Jackman's American Pale Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1228093719, 'beer/ABV': 5.2, 'beer/beerId': '1675', 'beer/brewerId': '418', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 1, 'hour': 1, 'min': 8, 'sec': 39, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 336, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Jackman's American Pale Ale...\t\tAppearance-thick orange color, little bit of gold, thin carbonation and barely any bubbles.\t\tSmell-sweet hop and malt aroma that is well balanced, alcohol well hidden.\t\tTaste/Mouthfeel-more malty than hoppy but still fairly light, somewhat sweet but fairly balanced, alcohol is well hidden once again.\t\tDrinkability-your normal pale ale, quite drinkable.\t\tOverall-an ok APA, I'm not going to take it out on this one, but I do find myself tiring of the style. Still, this beer is fine and well-made, it just doesn't separate from the pack.", 'user/profileName': 'TheDeuce', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': '120 Minute IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1323273241, 'beer/ABV': 18.0, 'beer/beerId': '9086', 'beer/brewerId': '10099', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 15, 'min': 54, 'sec': 1, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 341, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': 'Poured from a 12oz. bottle into a tasting glass.\t\tThe color is a clear orange/gold with a finger of foamy white head and some slight lacing left on the glass.\t\tThe smell is a bit hoppy but with malty sweetness that was a bit surprising. There is even a slight spicy flavor that gives a bit of a zing to the nose.\t\tThe taste is big bitter hop flavor with a good sized alcohol flavor. There is some fruit flavor there that is a little piney flavor mixed in. It is hard to draw on much since there is such a large bitterness there is also some sweet malt flavor that comes out when your able to get past the hops and alcohol.\t\tThe feel of this beer is big all around. The force of this beer as it mahandles your pallet is something else. I had to take my time with this one. I had a small glass but it still took me a while to get through the little I had. This must be the bitterest beer I have had even though I never did check the IBUs.', 'user/profileName': 'Duhast500', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Wild Ale', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Sanctification', 'review/timeUnix': 1314500099, 'beer/ABV': 6.75, 'beer/beerId': '20518', 'beer/brewerId': '863', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 2, 'min': 54, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 240, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Batch 005\t\tA: A hazy yellow pear color, the head is a nice white color. There is almost a light citrus thing going on that is nice. \t\tT: A tart punch hits right away, after the sour fades, there is a slight touch of some funkiness, the finish has a very nice floral note with hints of lemon. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Lager', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': 'Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1071638826, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '44', 'beer/brewerId': '155', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 17, 'hour': 5, 'min': 27, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 351, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Got this at Massey Hall after seeing the Trans-Syberian Orchestra. Came a dark gold, autumn leaf colour with a sliver of a head. But the bartender poured it improperly. With the glass being a small size, I doubt she could have poured a decent head on it without it overflowing. Barley grain smell. A little sweet, a little weak. Kinda bland tasting. Sweet, chewy malt, odd aftertaste. It wasn't bitter, it was sour(?). Sour is the best word I could use to describe, and that isn't very close. Thin mouthfeel. The chewy malt adds a little texture to the brew. OVerall, it's okay. I've had better, I've also had worse. But next time I'm at Massey Hall, I'll order a Guinness, or maybe a Beck's if I haven't had it already.", 'user/profileName': 'slitherySOB', 'review/aroma': 2.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Schwarzbier', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Session Black Lager', 'review/timeUnix': 1266699186, 'beer/ABV': 5.4, 'beer/beerId': '50740', 'beer/brewerId': '5316', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 20, 'min': 53, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 51, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Served in a Budweiser pokal.\t\tPours a clear dark amber brown with a pale oatmeal head that leaves a good amount of lacing behind. The taste brings back those roasted malts, starting off light and becoming increasingly roasted as the taste floods across the tongue. {'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'Scottish Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.5, 'beer/name': "Bert Grant's Scottish Ale", 'review/timeUnix': 1029236505, 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Feb 2, 1980', 'beer/ABV': 4.7, 'beer/beerId': '11', 'user/birthdayUnix': 318326400, 'beer/brewerId': '5', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 11, 'min': 1, 'sec': 45, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2002, 'yday': 225, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1100009047, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Pours with a cola-fizzy head and it dissipated almost as fast. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'M\xc3\xa4rzen / Oktoberfest', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 2.0, 'beer/name': 'Hofbr\xc3\xa4u Oktoberfestbier', 'review/timeUnix': 1318451335, 'beer/ABV': 6.3, 'beer/beerId': '2011', 'beer/brewerId': '4686', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 20, 'min': 28, 'sec': 55, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 285, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': "Octoberfest: Say the word and you probably think of lederhosen, big parties with communal tables, beer girls dressed in traditional garb, and a brew like this. I sure did so when I saw this available via the single bottle, I figured that this would be a great brew to enjoy the season with, even if I couldn't get to a real event like those in Germany attend every year. Like so many others on here, I was let down by this beer from the moment I poured it out. I know that Marzens aren't the highest rated brews on here, but I do expect an imported offering like this to have some taste, body, and drinkability to it!\t\tLight pour to this was a good head and lacing that was better than expected. Those were the best aspects of this beer as the aroma was practically nonexistent and the head faded fairly quickly. Marzen's tend to be a bit thin in the mouthfeel for me but even this didn't match up to my less-than-lofty expectations. There was straw, grass, and floral notes to this beer but I couldn't wonder how much of the taste had to do with the green bottle. Sure enough, this tasted skunked as soon as I took a sip and because this hadn't been on the shelf that long, I think that spoke more about the beer than the presentation of it. Further tasting of this led me to wonder what style it was, since it reminded me of an Adjunct Lager in every aspect. The filler seemed less than up to standards and the aftertaste was sour enough to beg for a chaser - any type that would alleviate the lingering and uneasy bitterness. \t\tI have no idea how something this bad could be so strong in the alcohol department. This is not the kind of beer I would want to get drunk on and even though the carbonation didn't detract from the taste, this wasn't something that I could down very quickly. Maybe I'm not up to snuff on my appreciation of this style but after seeing how low this was rated on here, I'm thinking that this beer is about a big a letdown as they get.", 'user/profileName': 'JerzDevl2000', 'review/aroma': 2.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Munich Helles Lager', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Augustiner Br\xc3\xa4u Edelstoff', 'review/timeUnix': 1271197895, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.6, 'beer/beerId': '4139', 'beer/brewerId': '820', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 22, 'min': 31, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 103, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "12 oz silver foiled bottle. 5.7% alc.\t\tPours god's gold, an incredibly clear, bright color that looks alot like a piece of gold when in the dimpled mug. The head is large, white, and foamy and sticks for awhile.\t\tIt smells very clean but robust for the style. It is very bready with not much sign of hops.\t\tIt is quite sweet with a subtle fruitiness, the grains are sweet as well. Not much in the way of hops, just a minuscule amount of bitterness. If you want a lesson in non bitter but still refreshing beer this is it. If it didn't have so much flavor it would be a rousing success in the US.\t\tThe drinkability is at high levels", 'user/profileName': 'crossovert', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Gueuze', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Oude Gueuze', 'review/timeUnix': 1300408696, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '1710', 'beer/brewerId': '636', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 18, 'hour': 0, 'min': 38, 'sec': 16, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 77, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': 'A: crystal clear amber, rim of bubbles, minimal lace.\t\tS: strong musty funk, very chemical like nail polish, paint thinner, motor oil, granny smith apples, hard cider.\t\tT: like biting into a lemon...that\'s full of stomach acid. Waves of funk and sourness, first on the tongue, then the rest of your palate and throat catches up and you get a second shock on the swallow and aftertaste. My initial unconscious reaction is to spit it out, like my mouth is saying "you shouldn\'t be drinking this!" By the time I\'m able to right myself and convince my throat to swallow I\'m already regretting it. But like vegetables, anchovies and many other things I\'ve grown--and learned--to like (or even love), I can already feel this one growing on me. Still, it is like what I imagine the acid blood of the Alien alien would taste like before it melted you face off.\t\tM: light body and carbonation, very sharp and crisp with a bone dry finish.\t\tD: not my favorite Gueze experience so far, and though I\'ve definitely had more drinkable Guezes, or at least ones I prefer, I\'m also new to this style I feel it\'s important to hold off passing judgement until I\'ve accustomed my palate to these beers. What I will say though is that this beer gave me heartburn.', 'user/profileName': 'nickhiller', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'K\xc3\xb6lsch', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Curve Ball Blonde Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1027292038, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '51959', 'beer/brewerId': '403', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 22, 'min': 53, 'sec': 58, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2002, 'yday': 202, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Throws a chill-hazed golden. Hops reappearing to mop up at the finish. leaving some tea-like notes and some lemon twang.\tFairly light bodied.  Very drinkable and refreshing.\tLeaps and bounds better than their hefeweizen. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 3.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Bass Pale Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1266284322, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '811', 'beer/brewerId': '293', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 1, 'min': 38, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 47, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "A - Amber/orangish with a decent sized off-white head.\t\tS - Malty and caramel/toffee with very slight hints of fruit. The normal British flavors of caramel/toffee/bready but a little lackluster and watery.\t\tM - Fairly light and thin but also quite smooth.\t\tD - Easy to drink and nothing offensive, A lot like a lot of British beers in terms of sessionability (however the flavor doesn't quite match some of those great British session beers).\t\tNotes: This is one of those beers that is a good stepping stone and introduction. {'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Amber / Red Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Tr\xc3\xb6egs Hopback Amber Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1303269137, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '6322', 'beer/brewerId': '694', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 20, 'hour': 3, 'min': 12, 'sec': 17, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 110, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.\t\tA: Pours a ruby amber color with 1/4' thin head and some lacing. This is a good looking beer.\t\tS: Floral hops and citrus burst into the nostrils. Some slight malt and pine aromas also present.\t\tT: Sweet citrus flavors dominate the initial sip followed by a significant hop presence in the middle to finish. Some slightly unappealing bitter aftertaste in the finish.\t\tM: This beer has the feel of a good spring beer. It is light and thin on the tongue with the presence of prickly carbonation.\t\tOverall this is a good beer. It is very similar in flavor to Nugget Nectar, but the flavors and character are not as prominent as in its Imperial Amber Ale cousin. Aside from the slightly bitter aftertaste, the beer is well balanced and one of the tastier amber ales that I have had.", 'user/profileName': 'jgreenearrow', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': '\xc3\x89dition 2005', 'review/timeUnix': 1230942704, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 10.0, 'beer/beerId': '20600', 'beer/brewerId': '22', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 3, 'hour': 0, 'min': 31, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 3, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Jan 29, 2007 \tPours a very dark brown with a thin, off-white, mostly diminishing head. The aroma is that of raisin, plum, clove, cinnamon, nutmeg, and brown sugar. There may be a hint of spruce and earth. It has a nice, full mouth feel with small, soft bubbles. The flavor is moderately sweet with lingering alcohol and prunes. This is very much like Trois Pistoles but a bit more refined, a bit sweeter, a thicker texture and more focused flavor. It has the dark sweet flavor of prunes and raisins but the flavor doesn't explode the way Trois Pistoles does. It kept me warm on a snowy night.", 'user/profileName': 'yesyouam', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Thunderhead IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1229458499, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Mar 2, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '1544', 'user/birthdayUnix': 383904000, 'beer/brewerId': '403', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 20, 'min': 14, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 351, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1034431447, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Tangerine pour with a small white head that clings to the edge of the glass. The aroma is comprise mostly of soapy, resiny hops - far from a punch in the face of west coast bitterness, and not all that impressive compared to others within the style. Malty flavour and not all that hop-oriented. The hopping is smooth and mild, but the bitterness does gradually build, although it reminded me more of an english bitter instead of an American IPA. The malts come out as fruity with some honey. Medium-light body with decent carbonation.\t\tI can't give it a glowing review because its not a great beer. Pyramid seems to be very hit and miss, and this is a miss. Inspite of this, it still makes a damn drinkable beer and beats the living crap out of the major brands. Thanks Mark!", 'user/profileName': 'bobsy', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'AleSmith X', 'review/timeUnix': 1310075624, 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '1370', 'beer/brewerId': '396', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 7, 'hour': 21, 'min': 53, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 188, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': 'Had this on tap at Instant replay, review from notes. \t\tA: Served in a standard pint glass, the beer pours a clear straw yellow color with slight golden hue. The white head rose about a good inch in a half, but quickly settled, leaving minimal lacing. \t\tS: Scents of hops, a bit of lemon zest, grass, some mild wheat and malt in the background too. \t\tT: Initial flavor impression is a crisp, medium bitter bite, followed by a mild wheat malt backbone. Some citrus, light herbs and hops, but overall just simple and refreshing. \t \tM: Medium body, crisp, with medium to high carbonation. \t\tO: Session beer for me. Decent flavor, not to high in alcohol, refreshing, and goes down very easy, and fast on a hot day. However, being an American pale ale, it is light in flavors too, and not something, personally, that I would seek out per se when craving an Alesmith beer, as so much of their other offerings offer a lot more complexity as well as flavor in my opinion. Prefer Speedway stout, or Nautical Nut brown when given their options. As for the this beer in style, good, but only above average for me.', 'user/profileName': 'Retsinis', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Sierra Nevada Celebration Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1321134044, 'beer/ABV': 6.8, 'beer/beerId': '1904', 'beer/brewerId': '140', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 21, 'min': 40, 'sec': 44, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 316, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Celebration was poured into a tulip glass.\t\tAppearance- The head is almost silky and is about one and a half fingers of off-white with a yellow tinge. This one leaves great sheets of pillowy lace. The body is the color of orange rind with amber highlights.\t\tSmell- The hop notes are estery and have a touch of floral to them. There is some slight citrus backed up by a sweet caramel malt. It smells great, but it is a little too subdued.\t\tTaste- The hop bitterness is really great on this one and lasts throughout the drink. There is some sweeter biscuit malt accompanied with citrus and grassy hop flavors. It is a refreshing IPA.\t\tMouth feel- This one borders on a light and medium body. It certainly is not the creamiest IPA out there by any stretch of the imagination. \t\tOverall- This is a good IPA that I would recommend to anyone. The main thing to adjust would be the mouth feel by fixing the carbonation up, also get those great hop notes to really show up on the palate.\t\tThe malt character is nice, but getting more of that floral hop in the flavor, for instance, would only help this IPA's score.", 'user/profileName': 'Pintofbrown', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Tripel', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Watou Tripel', 'review/timeUnix': 1100158919, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 7.5, 'beer/beerId': '1854', 'beer/brewerId': '259', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 11, 'hour': 7, 'min': 41, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 316, 'wday': 3}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "POP!!!\tA fierce sound, clearly heralding something good, or at least, we hope...\tHazy golden hue, fervent carbonation, with a huge, creamy white head atop, very attractive.\tCitrus and spice in the nose, very bold and bright and uplifting with flavor...pepper and clove, coriander, lemon zest...like a witbier with a bit more cojones...\ttaste is fully flavored, juicy, zesty, spicy, brisk, bristling, brilliant...with a certain sugary kick...a little candy-ish, treacly, sticky-sweet...but I can't help but like it..medium-bodied, a trifle thin, actually,..but still good....a very nice tripel, if un-trancesdental.\tAwully tasty, zesty, sweet...and a little bit strong, ...this lands in the good category, and that's very fine.", 'user/profileName': 'feloniousmonk', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

No lacing either.\t\tS - Smelled like cofffee, actually not just coffee but fresh ground coffee beans.\t\tT - Obviously it tasted like coffee. \t\tM - It was soft on the tongue and medium-bodied.\t\tD - I really am not a huge fan of coffee (mostly because I don't like hot drinks). {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Strong Dark Ale', 'review/palate': 5.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Chimay Grande R\xc3\xa9serve (Blue)', 'review/timeUnix': 1263328052, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Oct 3, 1988', 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '2512', 'user/birthdayUnix': 591865200, 'beer/brewerId': '215', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 12, 'hour': 20, 'min': 27, 'sec': 32, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 12, 'wday': 1}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 826470247, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Poured from a 11.2 oz bottle into a Chimay chalice.\t\tAppearance: Pours a hazy dark brown color with reddish hues around the laces. {'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Tumbleweed IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1108514887, 'beer/ABV': 6.6, 'beer/beerId': '5577', 'beer/brewerId': '914', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 0, 'min': 48, 'sec': 7, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 47, 'wday': 2}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '2/13/05- On Tap at a pub in Bozeman, MT.\t\tPresentation- From the tap into a TumbleWeed IPA glass.\t\tAppearance- Amber pour with a nice 3/4 inch thick creamy head, and nice lacing.\t\tSmell- Nice typical IPA scent. Fairly heavy pine and grapefruit scents.\t\tTaste- Nice flavor balance between the hops and the malt. More grapefruit flavor than pine. Not to bitter.\t\tMouthfeel- Good carbonation level.\t\tDrinkability- A very drinkable IPA. Not the best, but definitely above average. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Porter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Stone Smoked Porter', 'review/timeUnix': 1058828382, 'beer/ABV': 5.9, 'beer/beerId': '90', 'beer/brewerId': '147', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 22, 'min': 59, 'sec': 42, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2003, 'yday': 202, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "Another Stone on tap..this one has proven to not be as uneven as some of the other styles.\t\tLovely dark shade, very dark...you can pick up some reddish/brown when held to the light. Very nice head when poured, plus it left lots of lovely lacing through-out the glass. Light smokey aroma.\t\tNice chewey, medium bodied beer. This is one of their more balanced beers in my opinion, and it shows, the malt and hops blend well together, neither overshadowing the other. There's some roasted flavor present in the malt as well. It leaves a smooth smokey aftertaste that is pleasurable.\t\tPretty good brew. Not as smokey as some German smoke beers, so might be a way to introduce this flavor to someone. pat", 'user/profileName': 'PatandDavid', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Pale Ale (APA)', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Armory XPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1282387750, 'beer/ABV': 6.0, 'beer/beerId': '42716', 'beer/brewerId': '16862', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 10, 'min': 49, 'sec': 10, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 233, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Poured this one from a growler filled at Deschutes early evening based upon the suggestion of a pub server. I wouldn't have grabbed this otherwise -- I'm glad he took the time to push me towards a good choice. \t\tArmory XPA is a predominantly reddish amber brew with a moderate head and minimum lacing. The scent on this one is fantastic, ranging from ripe banana, fresh cut grasses, and sweet toffee. It's definitely treading towards an IPA with the citrus and pine profile, though the bitter hops are SLIGHTLY more subdued in this one compared many of the PacNW IPA's, softened by a tangerine-like sweetness. This is a great summer drinking option, light going down, with substantial carbonation. Overall, I'm definitely glad to have tried Armory XPA, though I should caveat that if someone is looking for a profile that strays far at all from a PacNW IPA, they had best look elsewhere.", 'user/profileName': 'sdawson', 'review/aroma': 5.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'Altbier', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Altbier', 'review/timeUnix': 1130510049, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 2, 1976', 'beer/beerId': '18513', 'user/birthdayUnix': 202546800, 'beer/brewerId': '1548', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 14, 'min': 34, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 301, 'wday': 4}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1215788647, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "The '05 GABF Winner...\tAppears a copper toned amber with a lush ivory white head that sticks around. Tons of lacing cling to the interior of the glass.\tSmell is of a rich malt with toffee, hard candy, bitter hops, along with a sugary sweetness.\tTaste is about the same of the aroma with a nice hop addition.\tMouthfeel is chewy, bitter, sweet, and semi-dry.\tThis is a great rendition. One of the best American versions Ive had.", 'user/profileName': 'weeare138', 'review/aroma': 4.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Orval Trappist Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1104009713, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Feb 19, 1982', 'beer/ABV': 6.9, 'beer/beerId': '129', 'user/birthdayUnix': 382953600, 'beer/brewerId': '37', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 21, 'min': 21, 'sec': 53, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2004, 'yday': 360, 'wday': 5}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1035381847, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "pours a tarnished amber, large carbonation bubbles, and a giant rocky offwhite head.\t\tsmells like bubblegum, cherries, and bread. there is also a wine smell, like what you would smell if you left a red wine bottle open for a few weeks with just a little bit in the bottom, kind of like wine yeast, i guess. \t\twow, that taste is all about that weird wine flavour. sweet, lingering aftertaste of double-bubble bubblegum. wow, that upfront wacky flavour is really right there. it reminds me of the weird flavour in three floyds gumballhead. \t\tmouthfeel is alright, a bit overcarbonated for my liking, but it does well to reinforce the wine/champagne aspects of this beer.\t\tthis beer speaks for itself, if you like this style, you are going to get it, as it's a bit of a classic.", 'user/profileName': 'trancefishy', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)', 'review/timeUnix': 1302959403, 'beer/ABV': 11.2, 'beer/beerId': '19960', 'beer/brewerId': '1199', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 13, 'min': 10, 'sec': 3, 'mon': 4, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 106, 'wday': 5}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A: Jet black, with red hues trying to peek through, but hard to capture, unless directly in the light. Thick, creamy, dark tan head, good lacing.\t\tS: Coffee up front, then one has to search for the bourbon, kind of disappointing, but still great scents. Some nice chocolaty hints, along with vanilla.\t\tT: Huge roasted malts, but matched with a fudge-chocolate sweetness. Strong coffee presence, as the nose would lead on, then comes the delicious woody notes; hints of vanilla. The bourbon is very much in the background, but the rest of the flavors are excellent.\t\tM: Medium body, not too thick, but pretty smooth and almost creamy. No sign of alcohol in this beer.\t\tO/D: It's a beer I wish I could have more of, but at the same time...it did not live up to the hype. It's delicious, but where's the bourbon?", 'user/profileName': 'mostpoetsdo', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'English Bitter', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'Hardys&Hansons "Olde Trip" Premium Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1321846386, 'beer/ABV': 4.3, 'beer/beerId': '48906', 'beer/brewerId': '203', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 3, 'min': 33, 'sec': 6, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 325, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "This has a beautiful, big, foamy white head and lots of lace.
