{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Midnight Howler Coffee Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1184559129, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'user/birthdayRaw': 'Jun 13, 1979', 'beer/ABV': 5.5, 'beer/beerId': '23026', 'user/birthdayUnix': 298105200, 'beer/brewerId': '1177', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 16, 'hour': 4, 'min': 12, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 7, 'year': 2007, 'yday': 197, 'wday': 0}, 'user/ageInSeconds': 1120230248, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': "Into a pint glass, poured a solid black, not so much head but enough, tannish in color, decent lacing down the glass. As for aroma, if you love coffee and beer, its the best of both worlds, a very fresh strong full roast coffee blended with (and almost overtaking) a solid, classic stout nose, with the toasty, chocolate malts. With the taste, its even more coffee, and while its my dream come true, so delicious, what with its nice chocolate and burnt malt tones again, but I almost say it overtakes any stoutiness, and takes away from the beeriness of this beer. Which isn't to say it isn't delicious, because it is, just seems a bit unbalanced. Oh well!! The mouth is pretty solid, a bit light but not all that unexpected with a coffee blend. Its fairly smooth, not quite creamy, well carbonated, thoroughly, exceptionally drinkable.", 'user/profileName': 'objectivemonkey', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'American Stout', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 5.0, 'beer/name': 'Obsidian Stout', 'review/timeUnix': 1133657331, 'beer/ABV': 6.4, 'beer/beerId': '197', 'beer/brewerId': '63', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 0, 'min': 48, 'sec': 51, 'mon': 12, 'year': 2005, 'yday': 338, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "Simply the best dark beer I've found -- for my taste. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Winter Warmer', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 2.0, 'beer/name': 'Snowbound Winter Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1246316454, 'beer/ABV': 8.6, 'beer/beerId': '33933', 'beer/brewerId': '418', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 23, 'min': 0, 'sec': 54, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 180, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 2.0, 'review/text': "Spending my day off catching up on some old reviews. The stack is pretty massive, just now getting around to Winter beers.\t\tFree sample from my LH rep. Wish I could remember his name, but this was at least 6 months ago and I haven't seen the guy since.\t\tDark brown body. The aroma is all spice: nutmeg and coriander, not a good start. On the palate malt and hops take a back seat to spices. Nutmeg forcefully controls this beer. No balance, just the baking spices that have unfortunately come to define too many Winter offerings. The body was smooth and creamy, but this spice bomb was a drain pour for me. Maybe its just my personal preferences, but this seemed completely out of balance and was not enjoyable.", 'user/profileName': 'BradLikesBrew', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Witbier', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Vuuve', 'review/timeUnix': 1201624898, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 5.0, 'beer/beerId': '874', 'beer/brewerId': '322', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 29, 'hour': 16, 'min': 41, 'sec': 38, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2008, 'yday': 29, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Ver clear golden straw color, foamy head dissapates quickly. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': "Drake's Denogginizer", 'review/timeUnix': 1301273274, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 9.75, 'beer/beerId': '22273', 'beer/brewerId': '3835', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 28, 'hour': 0, 'min': 47, 'sec': 54, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 87, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Received in a trade with MrTopher. Thanks Chris!\t\tA - Pours a hazy amber color with thin off-white head. The head dissipates relatively quickly, but a few bubbles remain on top of the beer and a fair amount of lacing is left on the glass.\t\tS - Intense citrus hop aroma balanced with some sweet caramel maltiness.\t\tT - Starts with some pineapple along with some other citrus fruits. A very slight pine bitterness is noticeable for a brief second before some bready malts take over. Excellent tasting DIPA that is very easy to drink.\t\tM - Slightly about average body with a perfect amount of carbonation. Exactly what I would expect from a DIPA.\t\tOverall, a solid DIPA. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'English India Pale Ale (IPA)', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': "Lilja's Argosy IPA", 'review/timeUnix': 1320369048, 'beer/ABV': 6.3, 'beer/beerId': '32718', 'beer/brewerId': '789', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 1, 'min': 10, 'sec': 48, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 308, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': 'Served from the bottle into a becker glass\t\tA-Poured a semi-hazy orange color with a one finger soapy head\t\tS- Very sweet floral, slightly citrusy aroma. Smells like a clean pale ale \t\tT- Very sweet floral taste, come citrus and herbal notes. Finishes with a strong bitterness (a non-nondescript bitterness). Kind of faint in flavor.\t\tM- Medium body, pretty high carbonation, pretty clean\t\tO- A clean IPA that reminds me more of a pale ale. The strong nondescript bitterness brings this beer down for me some, just not very flavorful either. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Lagunitas Sucks Holiday Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1321842001, 'beer/ABV': 7.85, 'beer/beerId': '74986', 'beer/brewerId': '220', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 21, 'hour': 2, 'min': 20, 'sec': 1, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 325, 'wday': 0}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "A: Poured into a Sierra Nevada Anniversary Ale pint glass. Body is clear golden with a 1-finger ivory-white head. Very little in the way of visible carbonation, and what bubbles there are are slow to rise. Leaves good splotchy lace. \t\tS: Very nice - tropical fruit, apricot and a touch of pine. May be a hint of cat pee too, so I knocked it down to 4, ultimatley; at first I thought 4.5 - 5. \t\tT: Follows the nose, pretty much: tropical fruit (pineapple), citrus (grapefruit peel and lemon) and apricot. Reminds me at first blush of Sculpin, but there's a bit of spice at the finish, and some heat on the way down (not terribly surprising given the 7.85% ABV), that distinguishes this one from Sculpin. Finishes with lingering spice, pine resin and tropical fruit. \t\tM: Given the light color, this one's heavier in heft than anticipated - call it medium in weight (also another area of difference with Sculpin, which I keep coming back to due to that apricot taste and light coloring). Slight slickness to the feel.\t\tO: Good stuff. Ventures away from the usual piney/citrusy hop bitterness and towards the apricot/tropical fruit taste (and smell). Nice surprise from Lagunitas on that front.", 'user/profileName': 'Kendo', 'review/aroma': 4.0}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Belgian Pale Ale', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Leffe Blonde', 'review/timeUnix': 1317768239, 'user/gender': 'Male', 'beer/ABV': 6.6, 'beer/beerId': '2137', 'beer/brewerId': '470', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 4, 'hour': 22, 'min': 43, 'sec': 59, 'mon': 10, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 277, 'wday': 1}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': '11.2oz bottle poured into a Tulip glass. Best by 22/08/12.\t\tAppearance: Clear golden yellow with lots of bubbles moving up through the beer. Initial rocky white head (1/8" thick) with some thin strands of lacing here and there, but the head is almost all gone by the end of the glass and so is the lacing, but I\'m really enjoying the color. \t\tSmell: Yeast and fresh orange peel, but as the beer warms up the smell really diminishes. \t\tTaste: Bready malt, yeast again, and a citric orange mild bitter finish. The finish starts to take on some more herbal and spicy notes as the beer warms up but the citric orange still dominates. \t\tMouthfeel: Good carbonation - cleanses the palate but doesn\'t scour it. Just a bit thick, but smooth. \t\tOverall / Drinkability: Nice and tasty. Simple and straightforward, and a great looking beer to stare at while savoring. A solid good beer and I could easily see myself having another one.', 'user/profileName': 'damndirtyape', 'review/aroma': 3.5}

{'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'Doppelbock', 'review/palate': 2.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Wild Dog Collaborator Doppelbock', 'review/timeUnix': 1232691575, 'beer/ABV': 8.3, 'beer/beerId': '39422', 'beer/brewerId': '68', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 23, 'hour': 6, 'min': 19, 'sec': 35, 'mon': 1, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 23, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 5.0, 'review/text': "pours a light-ish golden brown, with a nice cream colored head. fair retention, lacing.\tsmells good, but doesn't quite smell like a doppelbock. faint malt with black tea, nondescript sweet fruits, alcohol tingle on a very deep whiff.\ttaste is again good, but not what you expect in a bottle labeled doppelbock. a nice sweet maltiness up front, but with a strong piney and earthy hop presence. a little breadiness and green apple in the middle, a bit of alcohol tingle and a dry finish.\trelatively light body, but a lively feeling carbonation.\tI am torn, I really like this brew, but as a doppelbock it is a disappointment. without the style in mind I would rate this much higher.\tI will give drinkability a 5, because it is good, just dont expect a doppelbock like you have experienced before.", 'user/profileName': 'JoshuaCain', 'review/aroma': 2.5}

{'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'Schwarzbier', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.5, 'beer/name': 'K\xc3\xb6stritzer Schwarzbier', 'review/timeUnix': 1269013214, 'beer/ABV': 4.8, 'beer/beerId': '1774', 'beer/brewerId': '648', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 19, 'hour': 15, 'min': 40, 'sec': 14, 'mon': 3, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 78, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 3.5, 'review/text': "This poured a nearly opaque dark mahogany with a little light tan head. It was watery with moderate carbonation, and had a bitter aftertaste. Overall this wasn't very clean or tasty, with a weak scent and mediocre body. That all adds up to a disappointing beer that I wouldn't recommend unless you're desperate to try another schwarzbier.", 'user/profileName': 'Pencible', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 2.5, 'beer/style': 'American Adjunct Lager', 'review/palate': 2.0, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Rolling Rock Extra Pale', 'review/timeUnix': 1298604540, 'beer/ABV': 4.6, 'beer/beerId': '567', 'beer/brewerId': '174', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 25, 'hour': 3, 'min': 29, 'sec': 0, 'mon': 2, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 56, 'wday': 4}, 'review/overall': 2.5, 'review/text': "Pours a white one finger head that dissipates moderately quickly. {'review/appearance': 4.0, 'beer/style': 'American IPA', 'review/palate': 4.5, 'review/taste': 4.5, 'beer/name': 'Sierra Nevada Southern Hemisphere Harvest Fresh Hop Ale', 'review/timeUnix': 1321152800, 'beer/ABV': 6.7, 'beer/beerId': '42533', 'beer/brewerId': '140', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 2, 'min': 53, 'sec': 20, 'mon': 11, 'year': 2011, 'yday': 317, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.5, 'review/text': 'Semi opaque burnt orange pour in a tulip. Thick, lump head dissipated pretty quickly. Looks like a classic SN...beautiful for about 30 seconds, then well, messy. Spicy and very bright and floral in the nose (high grade marijuana buds) with malts present in the background. Dried fruits and spices...Big fruity hops are abundant. Earthy and grainy, the barley malts add a depth that surround the huge amount of hops beautifully. Pine nuts and a tangy finish. Dense, oily feel foamy on the tongue. This beer is really good. It really has the depth and hops of a double IPA. This is a well named brew. Tastes and feels like a harvest. Pairs nicely with turkey and cranberry salad. {'review/appearance': 3.5, 'beer/style': 'Cream Ale', 'review/palate': 3.5, 'review/taste': 3.0, 'beer/name': 'Spotted Cow', 'review/timeUnix': 1276387569, 'user/gender': 'Female', 'beer/ABV': 4.8, 'beer/beerId': '1963', 'beer/brewerId': '590', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 13, 'hour': 0, 'min': 6, 'sec': 9, 'mon': 6, 'year': 2010, 'yday': 164, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 4.0, 'review/text': "Thanks to Blake (kickinthechalice) for this beer!\t\tAppearance: Pours a golden yellowish-orange color - almost like the Stone Soup beer (which I just drank and reviewed) except that it seems less dense and more translucent. The head is fizzy and maybe half a finger's worth... it dissipates quickly but the bubbles keep streaming up from the bottom\t\tAroma: Smells like malts and wheat, maybe a little fruitiness in the background. Between the pour and the aroma, this is shaping up to be a lot like Stone Soup, which I hope it isn't, because I didn't love that. This is a cream ale though, while Stone Soup is a Belgian Pale... not sure why they appear so similar so far\t\tTaste/Mouthfeel: Feels creamy in the mouth. Thank God, unlike Stone Soup, I'm not getting any strong lingering after taste - that's totally not my thing. Spotted Cow feels very light and thin, which here isn't bad.... To be honest, the flavor isn't very full, so I'm having a difficult time rating it. I guess I mostly taste pale malts with a little hops. \t\tNotes: This beer is light and crisp and the drinkability is high. It's nothing too special though, just a nice drinking beer, maybe best on a hot afternoon.", 'user/profileName': 'seh410', 'review/aroma': 3.0}

{'review/appearance': 5.0, 'beer/style': 'American Double / Imperial IPA', 'review/palate': 4.0, 'review/taste': 4.0, 'beer/name': 'Double Simcoe IPA', 'review/timeUnix': 1249787127, 'beer/ABV': 9.0, 'beer/beerId': '30288', 'beer/brewerId': '392', 'review/timeStruct': {'isdst': 0, 'mday': 9, 'hour': 3, 'min': 5, 'sec': 27, 'mon': 8, 'year': 2009, 'yday': 221, 'wday': 6}, 'review/overall': 3.0, 'review/text': '12 ounce bottle poured into my Stone tulip.\t\tPours a deep reddish brown, very pretty.
